text: Disappointing! Having flown with Singapore Airlines previously and been happy I was extremely disappointed this time. Flying economy, the seating and legroom was as expected. The cabin service could not be faulted. The food however was extremely disappointing(to put it mildly) on the Adelaide-Singapore leg, and even worse on the Singapore-Milan leg. And the return flights worse again! : dry rubbery fish- sauce only half covered it, flavourless, watery, overcooked vegetables, flavourless pasta entree( no sauce or topping?) followed with what looked to be same pasta in main course(?) ; dry, stale rolls......Whilst I do not have high expectations for in flight food, I do expect edible food and don't expect to describe it as DISGUSTING. I cannot help compering it with the surprisingly excellent meal we had with Air Maroq flying Casablanca to Rome ( which also had amazingly good leg room.) The only good thing with dinner was the tea, which was excellent. My advice, take some substantial snacks, and if time permits, eat at Changi Airport. Mmmm.....Most disappointing.  Gone from good to poor rating.
label: negative

text: Excellent flight -shame about the food. The only thing that stopped me rating this airline as excellent was the quality of the food. We had booked in as vegetarians and we got vegetarian food, but much of it was almost inedible. Service was excellent. In flight entertainment was varied  with a great choice and the flight itself was comfortable and relaxed.
label: positive

text: Great service, great food Pleasant daytime flight in economy. Seats comfortable. Had order bland meals for dietary reasons and the breakfast,lunch and dinner were all very tasty. Checkin at Sydney airport was quick and baggage readily available in Hanoi when we arrived. Plenty of water and juice available throughout flight. Staff friendly.
label: positive

text:
Luggage I arrived on June 12, 2023.
I got my luggage the next day June 13, 2023 around 6:30 pm.
Also my luggage was in bad condition: the handle was broken, can not push up&down all the way, and can not use anymore. The Singapore Airlines isn't responsible anything.
label: negative

text: 3 hours of delay  The outbound flight to Osaka was on time but the inbound back to Singapore there was a delay of 3 hours. Reason given was late arrival of aircraft which I thought wasn’t good enough as the flight time between the 2 destinations is only 6 hours or so? We were informed of an hour delay by sms and only learned of a further 2 hours when we arrived at the airport. Though they provided a refreshment coupon, it was still tiring for a red eye flight. This is not a common experience though when taking SQ in the past.
label: neutral

text: Flying High There is a reason Singapore has won airline of the year or have been in the top 10. Their service is absolutely first class, from the captain giving us updates to the cabin crew that really and truly look after you for the duration of the flight. Flew on the A380 on the way to Singapore and it's still a marvelous aircraft to travel on. The cabin crew are extremely friendly and are more than accommodating to meet any needs required. The IFE (In Flight Entertainment) is fantastic, you're not going to run short of options here, you can watch TV, films, listen to music to your hearts content. All in all it is a great airline to fly on and hopefully I'll be flying with them again soon.
label: positive

text: Long Haul Comfort It is a long haul, 14 hrs, so an upgrade to premium economy seemed worthwhile, cost about £300 each extra. Plane was a brand new Airbus 350 900, nice. Premium economy is a 2 4 2 seating plan with only 3 /4 rows available in premium economy. Plenty of room and seat recline on this plane and seat class is a slider so that rather than a back rest hinging back towards you the seat in front slides so that the seat in front only intrudes 2 inches. Food and drink a notch up from economy and usual Singapore quality. Noise cancelling headphones supplied and very good quality. In flight entertainment very good. Plenty of overhead locker space here. A sleeping mask would have been nice as it is not included in the pack. I did get one on a previous flight by asking for one so carry it with me now.
label: positive

text: First Time Flying with Singapore Airlines It was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines from Kul to Dubai transit in Changi and vice versa..Based on this experience, i would say it's nice airlines with friendly cabin crew but just i did not satisfied with only earphone, pillow and blanket for economy class passenger. Unlike other airlines i have traveled with, (i.e. E), there were many complimentary provided even for economy class passenger which amazed me so much till now!! That's the comparison and you can say i am a BS! Regarding the food, it was acceptable, heated except for snacks i.e. sandwiches and the buns in main meal which were served cold! Regarding on flight entertainment, the selection of movies also very limited and some Chinese / Korean movies were shown without English subtitles. No free WiFi on board except you have to purchase and pay them. Anyway, Singapore Airlines can be improved more and i hope can fly again with you someday... Thanks!
label: neutral

text:
Travelled with family of 10 We travelled with a group of 10 and were able to find places next to each other.
Overall they all enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: I like to use this airline In economy on this flight, it was still very comfortable.  Economy is a little better that other airlines, you didn't feel too close to the seat in front and get that "claustrophobic" feeling.  A choice of meals served by friendly hostesses/stewards. Good choice of In-flight entertainment, something for everyone.
label: positive

text:
Sydney to London via Singapore My flight was in mid August. The flight to Singapore seemed to be in a newer aircraft but not being an expert on these things, I don't really know.

The crew were absolutely delightful.

The food seemed a bit ordinary and I am not sure whether this is because I ordered vegetarian oriental for the Sydney-Singapore flight. From Singapore to London, I had Indian vegetarian - again a bit bland. Not what you'd expect for Asian food on aircraft, it usually fares better than Western.

I noticed during the service that they only serve water or drinks in the plastic cups e.g. if you have a can of coke, they pour the coke into the plastic cup and retain the can. Also the same with water. I much prefer it if they hand out small bottles of water or large bottles of water. I like to drink a lot of water on flights, so it a problem having to ask for plastic cups of water all the time. I learnt from this on the return flight and retained an empty water bottle that I could fill at the fountain. I've got no idea why they are so stingy with the drinks.

The wine is awful too. Why don't they serve some decent Australian or New Zealand wines - when buying in bulk they are not that expensive to buy. instead they've got this Chilean rubbish which gives you a headache.

The aircraft from Singapore to London seemed an older aircraft and the entertainment equipment was not so easy to use.

Overall I don't think it's as good as British Airways (that did surprise me!) or Qantas.

I noticed passengers getting on with very large cabin bags. One couple had enormous bags which would not have fitted in the overhead cabins and they put them under their feet. There's no way they would fit under the seat in front. I pitied the passenger sitting next to them. The woman had her bag sort of stored on the window sill which meant she had hardly any room left in her seat. There's no way Qantas would allow that!
label: positive

text: Mrs Service is good compared to other airlines. Economy class is unfortunately always cramped. But with a long flight it helps to have good service. Friendly and attentive staff members. Changi airport is also an excellent few hour stop over. Lovely outdoor gardens and relaxation spots.
label: neutral

text:
A Standard Above As a regular traveller to Bali and wider Indonesia I have become well accustomed to the Low Cost (read tight arse airways) offering.  I wear cheap air flights like a badge of honour and frankly would sit on a milk crate from Perth at the right price.  

When it came to visiting Sri Lanka however I was looking for a higher level of comfort and service.  8 plus hours airtime and stopover for connection made comfort a priority.

What a fantastic experience we had.  The aircraft was a cut above anything the Low Cost carriers provide.  Cleanliness, comfort and smell were all fantastic.  Plus add the constant flow of service and hospitality, we were really well treated.  My travelling partner was intrigued by the entertainment system and the wide range of content for viewing and listening.  At 67 years old he wasn’t interested in the games console.

On the return trip in particular we enjoyed one of the new wide body airliners that was just amazing.  Comfort and quiet were the hallmarks of this experience.  There were plenty of spare seats and very soon after take off a cabin steward invited me to the row behind to give our crowded 3 row more room.  As a broad shouldered rugby player, this gesture was warmly received by me and those travelling next to me.  Again the hospitality and service flowed throughout.

In closing what a great ride.  It’s not often that the flight itself is ever much of a trip highlight.  On this occasion just like the Test Match victory over Sri Lanka, it certainly was.
label: positive

text: lots of room in Business class seats Flew actually several SQ flights in Aug/Sept 2018 in Singapore Air Business(LAX-SIN-Jakarta; Bali - Singapore to LAX:  Great service. roomy seats -- very much so;  miserable way for lie flat seats -- at 45 degree angle.  Who sleeps at home at a 45 degree angle.    Also, food quality has deteriorated over the also 3 years.  My steak was tough and tasteless.  For the price Singapore air charges, they could give high quality, tasty food.  SQ saves money since we really can't send food back to the kitchen while on board.   Row 15, bulkhead is-great lie flat seat IF a person is less than 6 feet tall; otherwise a tall person has to fold his/her legs to fit in the seat.  My wife, being shorter than I found it very comfortable; I changed seats b/c I could not fit in comfortably.
label: neutral

text:
Service as promised! We took a chance to travel by this airlines as much were written by the media.

Well, no regrets as the departure and arrival on time.  The plus points - good service throughout the journey! The stewardesses were smiley, ever ready to serve despite it was an overnight flight.

The toilets were refreshed and dried with the usual amenities.

Keep up the good service and will definitely travel with Singapore Airlines again in the near future.
label: positive

text: Supposed to be a pleasant flight Was on my usual SQ380 9.55am flight to Hong Kong for my business trip. All was fine till the plane took off. The aircon vent started leaking & dripped all over my t-shirt. After trying to avoid the leakage, & the seat belt sign is off. I pressed the service button but no crew responded. In the end I need to inform the chief stewardess & she told me it sometimes happens on A380. But I've took A380 quite often but this is the first time I encountered such incident. In the end, I got a seat switch to a front row which is supposed to be more premium (but it's right in front of the toilets :-( However, I still appreciate the effort of the chief stewardess..
label: neutral

text: Slight let down I’ve travelled with Singapore airlines previously and it was great, with flight and service.  Unfortunately this time their standard has dropped, not in service but quality of meals.   You would think I’d be served with Singapore cuisine but instead served with Turkish food.   Wasn’t good food.   I was also slightly concerned with the landing as it was slightly rougher than normal considering weather conditions were ideal.   I’m hoping it was a one off situation but overall it’s a good airline.
label: positive

text:
Loosing its Charm Previous experiences on Singapore Airlines were excellent. This time was disappointing as all standards have come down. 
Our anniversary celebrations were spoilt maybe because we were having more expectations. Condition of my seat in picture attached.
label: neutral

text:
if you have to travel 8/9 hours in a plane , then this is as good as it gets! good food, in house,baggage pick up,all worked well!

cabin crew
 did a good job as well.
every thing worked well from start to finish..........
label: positive

text: Leder Singapore Airlines are absolutely the best. The best service ever. I will tell others to ise this company. Og was a plesure to fly with this big airplane. We had seats on the second floor. See forward to out next time with Singapore Airlines. Thanks to the crew who works on this plane.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Flight Singapore Airlines are my favourite Airlines. They have the nicest cabin crew. They are very welcoming and cannot do enough for you. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text:
Perfect My first trip on A380 was perfect. Got upper deck seats. Upper deck is quieter as compared to lower deck(travelled in Lower deck on return). You have a personal storage space right next to window seat which can hold upto 10 kgs. 

Smooth checkin. Good and clean aircraft with good ambient lighting. Crew immediately handed hot towels, blankets & ear phones. Drinks were offered after take off. Meal was equally good. Crew was attentive throughout the flight.

Decent leg room and timely arrival were other highlights. 

Overall a very nice experience. Recommended to travel upper deck if flying A380.
label: positive

text: Amazing airline It was an absolute delight to fly SingaporeAir to Singapore and then onwards to Cambodia. Although I flew economy the air stewardesses were attentive to my needs, caring and accommodating. The film menu was great with a good size screen and kept me entertained for the 14+ hours and the leg room was adequate. I wish they would fly to more destinations. I have given this a “Very good” rating only because I flew  economy as I’m sure business and first class would be amazing. I would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: Great service and on time Good service as usual on this airline,friendly and helpfull staff nice food all good  would recommend to all
label: positive

text: Great service Love flying with Singapore Airlines they have Great staff who are very helpful making is a comfortable trip.
label: positive

text:
Best World airline company I flew many airlines in my life, but Singapore Airlines is the best ever: Unlike other airlines (i/e: Air France ) and for a long haul flight:With Air France, all starts at the aircraft entrance, the attendants hardly smile and stare at your ticket instead of smiling at you right in your eyes. Then vaguely show you the direction with a poor English.  The worst is when the cabin crew starts to speak in English..? In English? really, my Australian partner does not understand half of it ! And that goes on, lunches or snacks are being served at full speed, and if by bad luck you have been served among the last… Not only your main course choice is limited , but the attendants collect your tray and garbage at full speed also! … Then they disappear for hours without seeing them for half of he flight time… If you have a chance to stand up, walk along the corridors and fetch a bottle of water at the rear, you must apologise to disturb the crew having their dinner or stopping a good chat of theirs.. etc..  No need to say that with Singapore Airlines, it is totally the opposite !

I also greatly appreciate the “Stop over” package deal they propose  once in Singapore so you can have a good shower, dinner out and a good sleep before flying for an additional 8 x hours to Sydney.   What else?
label: positive

text: One of the best SQ is always an excellent airline with nice staff, good service both at check-in and on board. I was also able to get into their lounge in Singapore which is nice when waiting to the flight
label: positive

text:
Best airline -Singapore Airline Flew from Singapore Frankfurt. Some time transit then flew to Newyork. It was lovely flight in my life.Fantastic service of aircrew. Pretty nice space to seat in.Good food, nice drinks. All the aircrew hospitable attentive and very clean.Most of the time aircrew attention in service.
I will fly again with Singapore airline with premium economy set.

Its Great, 

Excellent.
label: positive

text: Europe trip Highly recommend to travel via SQ flight for long haul flight. Feels comfy and good service on board. No 2nd thoughts of other flight.
label: positive

text:
Extraordinary! Great experience on the flight with Singapore Airlines SQ281 from Singapore to Auckland regarding the food, the stuff and the seating.
First of all: the inflight service has been excellent, friendly and helpful. Food and beverages surpassed the expectations - we had ordered the "Book the Cook"-food and it was hot, perfect seasoned and extremely tasty! Together with the Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc - wow!
The inflight entertainment is absolutely great reagrding th newest movies etc.
We slept like babies and arrived at AKL in a perfect condition!
label: positive

text:
First Class service in Business Class My flight on Singapore Airlines was the best!  18 hours in a comfortable business class seat with full reclining seat.  I slept so well and I usually do not.  The food was so tasty and we were able to order ahead.  The flight crew was friendly and helpful.  
I just can't say enough about this flight.  I had just flown to South Africa on a long flight and this was so much better- no comparison.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable seating and excellent customer service Comfortable seating and excellent customer service. 
Willing to assist with complicated sleeping arrangements.
label: positive

text: The best airline in the world  I travelled with my group in the month of September 2018 from Del to Singapore and back ... every thing great about the flight ... what made it exceptional was the hostess deepali Kapoor ji ... she done an excellent and extraordinarily service ... god bless her ... because of employees like her singapore airline is worlds best airline
label: positive

text:
Amazing flight with exceptional service - our favourite airline! Flight on Friday 13th March Singapore - Copenhagen. Efficient boarding, new plane (A350) and a drink offering prior to take off and  another order for once airborne- plus warm nuts. The service was amazing and the crew worked fantastically.
I don't normally sleep on planes but managed 6 hours in a comfortable position on the lie flat bed. Breakfast had freshly squeezed orange juice plus breakfast tea by TWG an hour prior, full breakfast service and again, faultless service.
Can't wait for the next flight!
label: positive

text: A short relaxing flight I booked my family of four (2 adults, 2 kids) on SQ using KF miles. So in the end I only had to pay $200+ in cash. It would have cost me $300+ if I did book us on low cost carriers so it wouldn't have made sense to do that. I won't talk about my self-service check in experience as that always irritates me so I'll jump straight to the flight. Boarding was a breeze as it was an A350-900 which was <50% full. So the kids were happy with the space and so was I. The plane was new and clean and all the equipment was in working order. The highlight for me was when we were about to land in KUL, the steward not only asked us politely to lower the arm rest but also took the trouble to explain why we had to do it. I was appreciative of his patience as most of the time we are just ordered to lower the arm rests in the tone of a prison warden telling his inmates to do it. So thank you SQ. You have certainly hired the right steward for this job.
label: positive

text: Always reliable Flew back to HK during CNY for a quick visit to the family. Inflight service was still decent despite the whole crew being in masks. This was still the initial stage of Covid so the atmosphere was tense, but we got there...
label: positive

text:
Comfort in the air Singapore Airlines rightly are classed as one of the top airlines. Service is first class, with attentive stewards/ stewardesses. In-flight entertainment, drinks and meals are good.The stop over time in Singapore is minimum. 
We travelled economy class which was absolutely fine, with enough space for the two of us.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Premium Economy -  Disappointment I was not particularly impressed with our seating had more comfortable seats with extra leg room but I did manage to sleep for a few hours.  However I was quite shocked at the quality of food served on this flight.  Would have to be some of the worst experienced & Singapore Airlines have always been 1st choice for us & of course have always had brilliant reputation not any more it would seem.  The young flight attendant was perfect but the male attendant certainly was not.  What has happened!!!
label: negative

text:
Excellent flight with Singapore Airlines The flight with Singapore Airlines was perfect, the cabin staff were so helpful and there was no shortage of food and drinks.....really a little too much for a midnight flight. We arrived ahead of schedule and disembark was swift.
Will definatley will fly with them again.
label: positive

text:
Great flights Can highly recommend Singapore airlines Heathrow - Changi and silk-air.  Changi- Penang..
Crew very helpful and attentive.. Food excellent on all flights.
All flights on time..
label: positive

text:
Very good Super early 7.00 am flight . Fairly full flight ..we had a window and middle seat. 
We got a breakfast once on board. Being vegetarian, I got my meal WAY before others. Usual meal. Egg based that was pretty tasty. Staff worked well. Not hassles. Movies , for the first time, didn’t really interest me ...always squashy on these flights but what can you do?
label: positive

text: Awesome Inflight Service Cabin crew were courteous and served drinks/snacks quite regularly.  Food & drinks were good.  Flight experience was pleasant.
label: positive

text: Great food, great crew and spacious aircraft So far the best airline I've flown with. Great food, cabin crews really taking well of the passengers and the seats are not tight - it has more leg room compared to other airlines I have flown with.
label: positive

text:
Very good flying experience, however, food could be better Pro:
1. New aircraft Boeing 787-10
2. Great attitude and service by cabin crews
3. Very good touchscreen LCD display and in-flight entertainment options
4. Both departing and arriving airports are of top quality, therefore, check-in, boarding, immigration (at both ends) and baggage collection service are excellent
5. Excellent beverage options
6. Comfortable (more than average) leg space
7. Personal kit bag even ~6 hr flight (which is very rare for other airlines with this duration)

Con:
1. Food quality, quantity and no of items in the plates are less than other Singapore airlines route (as per my experience)
2. Special meal quality could be better
label: positive

text: Return trip to Oz. We left from T2 Heathrow which is much Improved with good facilities. Excellent economy flights with Singapore Airlines, very pleasant helpful staff and good food. Reasonable room in the seats with good inflight entertainment.Overall a good experience with economy flight.
label: positive

text:
Sydney to Barcelona and return 1 Going" upgraded by a bidding process to Business Class from Singapore to BCN. Heavenly stretch-out sleep.
2 Returning: on-time on both legs.
3 The service quality of SA staff is superb, attentive, patient over the whole 23 hour journey..
label: positive

text:
Excellent service Cannot fault this airline, thoroughly professional service, lovely staff. Even though our flight was delayed,  we were well looked after.  We travelled with our 10 year old granddaughter who was not feeling well on the plane, the staff could not of been better with her they  looked after her Wonderfully, the staff were very brilliant.
The food was reasonable and drinks plentiful. Would definitely use them again
label: positive

text: Winter holiday From checkin to staff and staff on aircraft all was of a very high standard. The airline staff aboard both flights gave us excellent service and the food that they served us was of a high quality for economy class. Would certainly use them again for any flights in the future.
label: positive

text: Worst meals ever I would not recommend premium economy as the extra cost is not that much better than economy. The meals were the worst and we have been flying for the last seven years.  When I sent an email on arriving back in Australia I was pushed aside with vague excuses.
label: negative

text: Preferred Airline We have changed to using Singapore - where possible - because of the better experience.  The seating is more comfortable, the luggage allowance is generous and is included in the fare, not to mention really good  meals.
label: positive

text: Great flight From the booking into our flight at Perth terminal to arriving at our final destination everything went very smooth. The flight attendants were very pleasant and helpful, the food was good choice and tasty and the onboard entertainment was suited to any age on the flight. Would recommend Singapore airlines highly.
label: positive

text:
First time and definitely not last time. I’ve only heard good things about Singapore Airlines and now I know why.

They are the perfect company to fly with.

Nothing is too much trouble, the staff are so accommodating and look after all your needs.

The flight was very king but extremely comfortable. The inflight menu is extremely vast and full of choice for everyone. The food choice was good and refreshing to see. 

I could go in forever but I don’t need to as quite simply they were amazing to fly with and won’t hesitate to book with them again.
label: positive

text: Oh Dear, Singapore Airlines - whatever was going on here??? Having had 2 fabulous SA flights on my Maldives holiday, I was quite happy at the prospect of the last (and longest) leg however the plane was clearly aging.  I'd paid for a legroom seat.  There were 3 of us on the front row.  Everything felt just a bit jaded and not very comfortable.  What really irked me was that we took off at 9am (i.e daylight) and flew through the day to land at 3.30 pm however the stewards had all the blinds down the entire time which just made the 14 hour experience dispiriting and depressing.  I don't know why they did this and the next bit forward in the cabin didn't have this.  One of the lavatories was not working so there were pretty much constant queues, and the food was not great.  A real shame as I am a fan of Singapore but this plane should clearly be put out to grass.
label: negative

text:
Creative workforce or cost cutting ?  This is the latest fruit platter meal from Singapore / Silkair company . 

The flight details is SQ181 Bwn Sin 05dec18

Either the chef / crew were seriously creative &/or the airline company is on severe cost cutting ! 

Got double same fruits portions served taken from normal meal . Hope normal meal recipient was not out of its fruit dessert portion . 

Need to lower down high expectation  on this airline company . Can’t expect getting same thing order during booking time .
label: negative

text: Airport Assistance I required assistance through the airport and onto the plane, also off the plane to collect our luggage and get to our prior arranged transfer car. The staff of Singapore airlines and their partners were extremely helpful, polite and could not have done better.They gave us every consideration on the whole journey.Our final destination was Townsville,  Australia. On each leg of the journey we were given every consideration.
label: positive

text:
Had to cancel our vacation due to airline overbooking We booked a flight and was told our flight home was overbooked and we would have to pay an additional $600 to get a seat. We booked this flight almost a year ago and paid extra to select our seats in advance. We were on our way to the airport and had to cancel our vacation that we've been planning for over a year. Thank goodness we didn't get stuck halfway around the world. We are still fighting to get a refund. Airline is refusing to refund the cost of the tickets. I don't yet know if we can get the hotel refunded. (We had travel insurance so we have now referred this to them.) Never fly with an airline you can't trust will get you home. Telling everyone I know about this experience. We are experienced world travelers and  this is the worst customer service I have ever seen. Would give 0 stars if I could.

Date of experience: February 17, 2023
label: negative

text:
Good customer service Yes we know it’s economy class (cattle class) but better options and quality of food is needed on long haul flights
Airport staff and cabin crew were very attentive and helpful. Brought round soft drinks regularly to keep us hydrated.
Typically on all long haul flights there is insufficient room in economy and as for getting up and moving round.....forget it!
Flew via Singapore and no problems in transit changes.
Would have given higher rating but long haul flights in economy class do not have enough room or adequate toilet facilities no matter which airline you choose. Oh to have the money to fly business class,
label: positive

text:
Great options SSH If you fly Singapore airlines and want to have a short break on the way home, check the SSH. Singapore Short Holiday. It’s great value, there’s a wide range of hotels to choose from, with varying prices and the extras offered are great value. We really enjoyed our stopover. 
The flights are good too with great service and ample food and drinks. 
Will travel with them anytime.
label: positive

text:
Don’t fly with Singapore Air especially in business class Wish I could give them 0 star! I’ve flown with different airlines in business class, but Singapore air is by far the worst. 

I traveled from JFK to Frankfurt in business class on September 10. The seat was narrow and terribly uncomfortable. When it’s flat bed, there’s a tiny room for your legs/feet. You need to position your body diagonally in order to lay flat. The food was burned and cold. The flight attendants were so clumsy and unorganized. It’s waste of money and I’d never fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Always an experience flying via Singapore airlines In terms of comfort , service and quality. Always with a standard. Not my 1st time flying by Singapore airlines, but it surely my 1st time asking for a  cup of “Singapore Sling” . Having this cocktails on flight definitely enhance the flying experiences by SQ even more. It’s a great way to start off a vacation!  Thou, we had a bad landing, But overall are good. However, at times one might still  have a not so good experience. My flight services coming back to Singapore wasn’t that good.  Hence, I hope Singapore airlines still have to constantly keep up with the standard in order to remain one of the best airlines in the competitive market.
label: positive

text: Wow, choose your flight carefully. Excellent outbound flight on an Airbus 380 excellent service and easy journey. Return flight such a different experience. We flew on a Boeing 777-300 it was the worst most uncomfortable trip I have ever had in a Business Class seat. Terrible configuration you have to sit almost sideways and screw your neck around to watch tv. Goodness Singapore Airlines  don’t use this configuration you are loosing customers. One guy on the flight said to look around Business Class as it was half empty and the awful discomfort you have to endure for 13 hours was the reason why. Will never fly this plane again, sorry Singapore Airlines, your staff are wonderful, the plane was rubbish!
label: negative

text: Travelling Premium Economy with Singapore Usually an Economy passenger, I was impressed with the difference to Premium Economy. More seating room, better entertainment facilities (touch screen), Champagne on the drink menu and excellent made for an excellent long-haul experience!!
label: positive

text:
Fly Sydney to Ho Chi Minh in comfort Excellent service, food very good considering where it is. Good variety and plenty of it.
Flat beds with good room.
label: positive

text: Excellent The cabin crew are charm personified and always want to please.  The pods are comfortable and everything is at one's fingertips.  The choice of food is very good and the quality of the wines exceptional.  My only somewhat negative comment is that the second meal was served while we were still around 5 hours from LHR and appeared, at least to me, to be very close to the first meal.  I would have thought that the meal could have been served between 2 and 3 hours before arriving at our destination.
label: positive

text: Recommended Traveling business class on Singapore Airlines is good.......but not great. The main reason for awarding 4* is the lounge experience - in London, the lounge is spoiled mainly by the huge building site in view of the lounge.......otherwise OK. In Singapore, I had a shower in the lounge - quite a trial.......I waited half an hour for the shower room, & then had a hot sweaty experience in a poorly lit space.......perhaps the execs in Singapore Airlines should try having a shower in the Emirates lounge in Dubai?    Apart from this, it was really nice - particularly liked ordering my meal in advance, which worked really well.......was quite nervous about ordering lobster thermidor but it was really good & the appetisers & starters from the cabin menu were very good. Cabin crew were best ever - I called for service a couple of times & a member of staff was at my seat instantly - BA take note! Entertain system was great with lots of choice; BC seat OK but the off-set leg room space isn't ideal. Would definitely use again, but if Emirates were in competition for the same route there wouldn't be much choice.
label: positive

text: Refusal of Singapore Airlines to Refund Cancelled flights Flights cancelled by Singapore Airlines in May 2020 - requested refund and still waiting, more than 3 months later.  Lots of emails, asking me to be patient - if Qatar, Cathay Pacific and Qantas can refund within 3 wees, why am I still waiting 3 months for  Singapore Airlines.  They are in breach of Australian consumer law and are happy to hold on to the nearly $14,000 I paid them last year.  Beware if booking, no refunds if they cancel flights.
label: negative

text: Food Tastes Horrible I am a regular traveler on Singapore Airlines and a PPS member. Over the years I have witnessed the deterioration of food quality on SQ flights. Took SQ 256 back from Brisbane yesterday and the food was simply atrocious! Both the main course and the refreshment before landing. The seafood noodle smelled bad and my son would only eat one bite of the seared lamb because it tasted like wood. Since SQ is charging such extraordinary rates for business class I hope that they can at least serve more decent food, like many years ago. Recently I’ve flown on Japan Airlines, Eva and Cathay and honestly the food served was pampering and comforting. Staff service on SQ was still excellent and in flight entertainment were good but the food is simply unacceptable. Recently tried to book a flight to on line to HK and a cpu glitch made me come back to rebook the same flight. All of a sudden the price jumped by 15 percent. That upset me as I think they are doing pricing changes based on my previous booking so I decided to take Cathay Pacific instead for my upcoming trip. Please stop upsetting and losing your customers Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text:
Bed Bugs need I say anymore We recently had a flight from Hanoi to Singapore. When we got to our seat on the plane and we noticed a few bugs on our seat. These turned out to be bed bugs as the plane was full, we could not be changed seats. My partner gotten bitten by these bugs. We left the staff on the plane know and apparently they field a report. We decided to file our own report with Singapore airlines and they have been trying to hide the issue by giving  us a voucher which we have not accepted. They do not care about their customers at all. Our advice would be to book with the Middle Eastern airlines as they provide better service, clean planes and nice food. They provide first class service to economy passengers. Unfortunately as we had a round the world ticket we could not change to thaws airlines. 

We had a connection flight to Amsterdam from Singapore. We had another flight from Amsterdam to Ireland. We landed and we only had 1 hour to make our flight to Ireland. We asked the air host if she could give us the details of our gate and she was like no, figure it out yourself. We told her we had a very tight deadline to make our flight. Luckily we had data on our phone to find our gate when we landed. Other airlines usually provide you with details of your flights before you land if you have a short connection.

I cannot understand how they are the best airline in the world.
label: negative

text: Good flight Good, routine flight.  Check in etc - no problems. Small delay in departure but time made up whilst in the air.  Crew friendly and efficient, food okay.  The cabin was clean and tidy. Asian airlines, we think, are on the whole better than European and American airlines regarding Economy passenger facilities.
label: positive

text: Best Airline  I usually fly to India to see my family and I always like to go with Singapore Airlines..they are the best in service and staff is very helpful....Thanks Singapore Airline to make my trip easy
label: positive

text: Change to different airline My wife and I were fortunate enough to get a good price to fly First Class to Singapore enroute to Osaka. We were fed up with Emirates poor service so wanted to try something different. We definitely struck excellent attentive service the food suited our western tastes and the comfort was exceptional. The staff were not intrusive but did try and go the extra mile to see we received great value for money. We very much agree the extra cost in this instance was well worth it and would recommend this airline to anybody tossing up whether to fly business or first class. Joe
label: positive

text:
Wonderful service Recently I took two flights with Singapore airlines, one in economic class and one in premium economic class.
The services in both flights were perfect, they reminded me of how were the flights with Swissair and Lufthansa 30 years ago.
I felt that the flight attendants were there to serve me, always smiling , always running to fulfill my requests, never tired.
I can say that for the short and medium time ( 5 hours) flights, the service at economic class of Singapore airlines  is better than that at business class with Lufthansa.
I received all the newspapers I required. The meals were good, starting with a cocktail at economy class ( and I chose a complicated one ) and champagne at premium economic, with written menus with two choices.
Very good entertainment program with a good selection of films and classic music.
I am a M@M Lufthansa Senator member, so I fly a lot and I can compare services.
label: positive

text: Excellent Smooth journey from start to finish. As a nervous passenger I felt quite at ease. Takeoff and Landing relaxation music and safety video are really nice touches to put nervous passengers at ease. Thanks Singapore will be sure to fly again with this company.
label: positive

text: Family holiday  First time I have used Singapore Airlines, I can honestly say I have never flown with a better airline. The timing, the service, the facilities on board are all A1. Will definitely be using them again
label: positive

text: It is Average,2  people (Gentlemam and a Lady from the crew),Had the Customer oriented attitude. I traveled in Singapore Airlines after 2 Years. I found the Level of Service has dropped. They used to be one of the best in the Asia Pacific region. I prefer Quarter Airlines than Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: The Airport let them down  The airline was as always first class as per normal ,sadly Dusseldorf airport was a disarray.  The flight was delayed and my bags were lost. Next time I will fly Direct from Manchester . Where you can depend on good service
label: negative

text: Will be flying with Singapore again The flight was on time and the customer service was great, we bid to upgrade from Economy to Premium Economy it was well worth the additional cost, food and drinks were perfect, i would recommend Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: No issues Left and arrived on time. Food ok as was the service. Plenty of attention on this12 hr flight. Water and juices being offered at regular intervals. Good entertainment choices. Nice new plane. Great price point for fares.
label: positive

text: best airline in the world. they are not only high tech maintaining latest trends/techniques for airlines, they beat anyone in terms of hospitality, care and positive behavior overall. this is so typical singapoean's nature...warmth with a big smile. that makes them different.
label: positive

text: Best airline for long haul All round good service, Friendly organised staff, airport services good in Singapore, plenty of help from ground staff if walking is difficult.
label: positive

text:
World's best airline... sometimes, depending on where you are going! It really depends on where you're going. No complaints on the European sectors of our trip - the planes were new and clean and everything was great, definitely a great experience. The Australian sectors however seemed neglected. The planes were old with a grubby, tired interior, uncomfortable seats, outdated IFE technology (no touch screens... on the world's best airline... in 2019!?), and even the food was noticeably worse on these sectors. It's also the only full-service airline I've flown that doesn't serve dinner at the beginning of an overnight flight to Australia - there was only a small greasy pizza snack, making it seem very "budget airline".

Boarding was efficient except in Sydney. The staff were great on all flights, always friendly and helpful. The drinks services between meals were few and far between however and some flights didn't have them at all, which is another thing many other airlines handle much better.
label: neutral

text:
Boeing 777-300(ER) Premium Economy Extraordinary! Amazing service and very comfortable seat, the lavatories were clean and young/disabled passengers are well taken care of with special amenities.
Although there was a slight delay in Sydney due to slot times, the crew was very informative about the situation.  
I strongly recommend SQ's Premium Economy on the Boeing 777-300(ER)!
label: positive

text: No doubt the best airline in operation First time to Asia and went with Singapore due to its reputation.  It did not disappoint.  Very clean and efficient.  Service and meal quality was outstanding.
label: positive

text: Multi city stop, each leg of the flight great! Flew sydney - tokyo (stopover in changi airport) - hong kong - singapore - sydney with singapore airlines the whole way in business, loved all of it, the staff on each leg of the trip was really helpful, especially on the sydney to singapore and singapore to sydney flights, with the flight attendants assisting with luggage without being requested too, chatting to not just me but other passengers in the cabin asking about their day, talking about the movies they love that are on the inflight entertainment ect. The food was really good, from the starters to desert i ate all of it. The seat was very comfortable even seated upright, the leather was comfy and felt nice to the touch. I had no issues with my baggage, or any of their staff at check in or boarding. Even the safety video for this airline is one of my favourite to watch, as it shows the great sights around singapore. I would love to fly with them again soon.
label: positive

text:
Longest Scheduled Flight in the World We took this flight last December. I must admit, I was slightly concerned about the length of the flight, which averages 18.5 hours. But as both a pilot and seasoned traveler, I also was well-familiar with the cabin of the A350, and knew that even in Premium Economy, I was likely to be reasonably comfortable. (On this flight, SIA only offers Business and PE.) 

The hard product was solid, just as I knew it would be. The pitch and width of the seats, coupled with the generous recline, made the flight mostly pain-free. The “book the cook” option, amenity kit, and generally solicitous service made the trip as pleasant as possible. The crew are not only professionals, but also clearly proud of their five-star reputation—and it showed. 

I would recommend this flight; though I’d also point out that there is no other choice for a nonstop NYC-Singapore flight. Although it isn’t too difficult to get up, walk around, and stretch from time to time, I would suggest business class if you can afford it. The ability to lie down, stretch, and sleep horizontally would have been even better.
label: positive

text:
Side Seats are more preferable on A380 I had a wonderful time flying with Singapore Airlines (PVG-SIN) SQ 833 on 9th September 2023.

The craft of service was Airbus 380, on my previous review i had mentioned that the middle seats are a little uncomfortable since one has to pull out the foot rest and cannot enjoy it while taxing takeoff and landing. In the side seats there is a natural cushioned footrest on the side crease which is comforting throughout the flight. (It is fixed and needs not to be pulled or pushed).

The F&B service and the crew is very polite and caring. The F&B selection is was good on this flight, but sometimes its really not upto the mark.

One can even try and book the front row seats which have a very comfortable and wide front den for foot rest.

Much thanks to: 
Chief: Jamie
Leading Steward: Leslie
Steward: Sean, Jeanette, Stella, Yi Jie and Isabel.
label: positive

text: Singapore Air - Bravo!  Singapore Air now has direct flights so there’s no need for layover but is appx. 17 hours so if you need to be in air that long you need to be comfortable and boy did they hit ALL the right marks. The Staff are so gracious, In-flight entertainment awesome & OMG! the FOOD!!!!! Wow!! Only downside-Fold out bed was comfortable for me (but I’m just a smidge over 5ft) anyone taller (Um  everybody) might not be as comfy. Otherwise Bravo!
label: positive

text: Airline cancelled flight then still no refund 8 weeks later More than 8 weeks ago, on Christmas Eve, YOU cancelled my flights with less than 48 hours notice, and promised a refund in 6 weeks. In this day and age with electronic transactions 6 weeks is already too long. But now it is 8 weeks+ and you still have my money. You refuse to accept telephone enquiries and now an online request, with a supposed 15-business day turnaround time, has also been ignored and exceeded. Time for some action please!
label: negative

text:
Terrible flight, food and drink The service was poor, the food not edible,   I like a beer on a flight, first time I’ve ever been given a ⅓ can of warm beer in a plastic cup, yum.

This is a budget flight at regular prices.

Flown Singapore Airline several times but I cannot explain the drop in quality on this and the return flight.

Cairns people your getting ripped off.
label: negative

text: Premium Economy Class like a regular Economy Class This flight has no regular economy. So, they call the class behind Business Class Premium Economy. Other than slightly more leg room, the seats are narrow. Meals are served as economy class with only two choices of entree. It comes with half a cloth napkin. Quality of food is equal to domestic US flights when they were providing hot meals. When compared to ANA and British Airways, Singapore's food is ranked the third. There were two meals served on this 15 hours flight. The second meal which was also a dinner was served without a dessert. Flight attendants are friendly and efficient. Always have a smile on their faces. The plane (A350-900) is new. We arrive Changi Airport 6+ hours before flight time and we were checked in so that we don't have to drag our luggage for hours. Boarding in Singapore is odd. Each gate has its own security screening for carry-on. Once you are in, there is no restroom facility inside the gate. Boarding was smooth and departure was right on time.
label: positive

text: Poor customer service I had to call multiple times just to select seats. I called them whatever time they asked me to call. Singapore Airlines simply did not allow online seat selection. The representatives told me they have to call back to Singapore to get permission for seat assignments which I found ridiculous. STOP doing business in USA if you need permission from Singapore just for assigning seats. After so many phone calls, they gave us seats at the rear end. I do not recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Loved my flight. Singapore really does take care of their passengers. This trip was the first time I have ever flown overseas and thus the first time to travel on Singapore Airlines.  Hands down the best service I have ever had!  Even on a 2 hour flight, they provided us with a full lunch and all the wine I wanted, let alone the 14 plus hour flight, of course, I didn't drink on the longer ones, didn't want to be dehydrated.  But the flight attendants were so professional and so amazing. If I ever get the opportunity to fly overseas again, I will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Seat location is important Singapore Airlines provide a really nice service but you will need to check where you are sitting before the flight. If you need to go to the toilet a lot, then an aisle seat is easier. Try not to sit right at the back as the seats don't seem to lay back enough and the attendants were out of some food items by the time we were served. Our flight to Singapore was great on a newer plane but the trip home was on an older plane that was not as spacious. We also found the overhead luggage compartments were full where we were sitting for the trip home and needed to place our carry on luggage down the aisle further which made getting off an issue to stop mid way down the aisle. For the trip over, we boarded in order of seating which was great but on the way back, they boarded everybody. (Could have been where the lack of storage came from). I expect that most of the passengers on the way back to Adelaide may have had more things such as gifts and souvenirs). Overall, the flight was OK.
label: positive

text: A380 is a comfortable flight However with 400 or so passengers it is important that toilets are kept clean and properly supplied.   We were surprised to find that on this flight this was not the case in contrast to previous flights with this airline.  A pity.
label: neutral

text: Excellent cabin and service levels in SQ Premium Economy to San Francisco The new Singapore Airlines Premium Economy service direct to San Francisco is excellent. The Premium Economy seat on their new Airbus A350 is by far the best premium economy comfort I've yet experienced. Although it's not up to business class standards, it's a massive step up from regular economy and worth the extra if you can afford it. The cabin service from the crew was also very good. The only "black mark" is the food which was pretty terrible and not to my taste at all.
label: positive

text: Excellent trip and service Wasnt feeling well with a cough and migraine but 2 staff members went above and beyond to help me try to relax and sleep on my trip back to Perth. Their names were Song and Saddiq and were both responsible for helping to rest and get through the flight from Singapore to Perth. Nothing was too much for these gentelmen and its great to see customer service is not dead, thank you guys.
label: positive

text: Great friendly cabin crew Flew from perth to london via singapore with singapore airlines. Food and service was great. Aircraft was a little older and was a little cramped. Will definitely fly again. Great value for money.
label: positive

text:
Making a trial bearable It's a l-o-n-g way! After doing the trip on Emirates economy last year, I thought that there had to be a better way. SAL economy plus was a great improvement. Even with the occupants in front  trampolining on full recline for most of the trip my (6'1") knees had some space. Baggage drop off and boarding were so much better, too. Food was varied, hot and ample, whilst Catherine looked after us in a personal way and made excellent Singapore Slings. The other cabin staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly the manager.
The seats, unsurprisingly, became harder by the hour, whilst the economy plus cabin was remarkably quiet, though full. The Airbus on the second leg was much more pleasant than the Boeing 777 of the first leg. On that, all that could be seen out if the window was the wing and, being located near the engine exhausts, the noise was bad. The Airbus seating was in front of the wings and engines.
I don't dread the return trip like I did last year.
label: positive

text: Best airline for me I always fly with SingaporeAir whenever i go home for a holographic. On time flights, friendly crew, good food, lots of choices for movies/shows to watch, spacious legroom
label: positive

text:
Service slipping Maybe they standards are slipping, no overnight little bag issued on long haul flight.
Other than that overlook still very good service from Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Assured quality service Addressed all my concerns before travel and during travel. Food served was hot and tasty. Indian aloo parantha were the best I had till date.
label: positive

text: Another wonderful flight Flew SQ288 and was instantly impressed. This is the first time I am in the 2013 J seat which can be flipped over to be a fully proper flat bed and this is now my favorite seat as it's a lot more spacious than the new 2017 J seats. High quality headphones was provided with he IFE. The crew was phenomenal but the Seafood Thermidor was really overcooked (I actually was hoping to order Lobster Thermidor but it wasn't available on BTC Selection from SYD-SIN which is strange) I almost felt sad when I realised the flight is landing an hour earlier. Looking forward to my next flight with Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text:
Service wonderful......food, disappointing We had flown from Delhi business class on Singapore Airlines and I was travelling with my 90yo mother and the attendants were just wonderful. My mother required wheelchair assistance so we were taken to the lounge with just 30 minutes before we were to picked up again to catch our 6am flight to Sydney. So I got her a cup of tea and said we wouldn't worry about eating because Breakfast would be served on the plane. Breakfast on the plane was very disappointing. No hot food just some airline buns and croissants. And this is business class for a 6am flight?
Inflight entertainment was ordinary as well.
label: positive

text: Not good if tall Barely any room to move, woke up to getting my knee crushed from the passenger in front of me reclining there seat back and was told it’s within their right to do so. Would not recommend flying economy with them if you are 6ft or taller.
label: negative

text:
the long long flight Flight took off at 2330 hours and as passengers in the packed plane settled for some sleep about 2 hours later, the pilot announced that the plane was heading back to Singapore because of  technical issue. Eager queries were made to the cabin crew about connecting flights, reason for turning back, and delay in appointments. Only after sometime was it revealed that the flight team has found the oxygen mask not in operation mode, and after deliberation it was decided that the best option was to fly back to Singapore, where the airline will try to get another plane to replace this.

Only when we reached Singapore we were informed that a replacement was arranged to fly us to Spain a few hours later. The SIN to BCN trip is about 12 hours, add in another 9 hours, it was 21 hours flight!

Our holiday was almost ruined. It was salvaged by a planned easy first day in Barcelona.
label: positive

text:
SIA Economy Class - Good but not special Typical SIA economy class flight - everything works as it should with good service on board but the whole experience is not what SIA used to be. These days, in economy, SIA is just another full service operator and not worth the premium price that needs to be paid if you don't manage to book at just the right time and get a promotional price (which we did for this flight).
I'd have rated the flight "good" if that choice were available in the overall rating.
label: positive

text: perth to ahmedabad was a good flight The flight from Perth to Ahmedabad was an ok flight. would have enjoyed it more if there was more legroom for such a long flight as its quite a journey.
label: positive

text:
Usually Singpore airlines very good we ware happy with them but this time very disapointedd 24th July 2022 our flight SQ6535 from Townsville to Brisbane has cancelled and didn't inform to us Also 21st August Flight from Colombo To Singapore has changed by Singapore airlines  to 20th August and didn't provide any accommodation because our connecting flight was on 22nd August.
Service not good at all. From Singapore to Brisbane they provide only one meal. That meal also horrible. Vegetarian  meals only left. At least they didn't provide  refreshments.
label: neutral

text: The Best service My 4 month old baby was flying for the first time and we are glad we chose Singapore ailrlines. From the start of the flight the cabin crew were very helpful and tended to all our needs. I would like to specially thank Cabin Crew: Chief Stewardess Ms Chan Soo Eng and Flight Stewardess Nisha Nikita for their excellent and friendly service throughout our recent flight.
label: positive

text: Very pleasant experience What a nice experience.  The flight attendants were very nice and professional.  I have never seen a flight crew check the bathrooms for cleanliness as much as this crew did.  They were all over it and never rested during our flight.  I am actually looking forward to my next flight with this airline.
label: positive

text:
Mr Stephen Rose I can't praise the airline enough my first long haul flight. The cabin crew were fantastic, polite courteous and informative, I'm hard of hearing they were quite empathetic. Helped me a great deal. 
The meals were excellent so we're the drinks. 
The captain explained many things during the flight too. 
The aircraft was a 787 it was spotless.
I will fly with them again when I visit my son.
Thank you everyone for a truly memorable flight and great memories.
label: positive

text: Want Customer Service or Have Heavy Bags? run away NOW Flying into Singapore that is complex enough under covid without travel issues.  I had 2 bags that were over 50 ponds and Singapore Airlines would not allow me to go over or add an extra bag.  I was willing to pay any fee they asked but no.  I couldn't go and buy another suitcase.  Only 2 suitcases at 50 pounds.  So I had to pay for a different flight on a different airline that day and change all my plans.   Singapore Airlines then said that flight was non-refundable. I booked with Amex, thank god and got my money back.   I was never able to actually speak with  Customer Service only email over days.
label: negative

text:
Is it worth flying Premium Economy? I had major surgery about 18 months ago, and I was worried how I would feel on this flight, so decided to upgrade to Premium Economy instead of our usual Economy seats.  This more than doubled the cost.
Our flights were from London Heathrow to Singapore and back.  The flight to Singapore was on an Airbus 380, and we returned on a Boeing 777.
Service by the stewardesses was very good.  We were 15 minutes late arriving at Singapore (stacked for 30 minutes), and about 30 minutes early arriving at London.
Check in was very quick, and staff were helpful when they saw I was disabled.  At Heathrow we were directed to the first class check in because he was free.  His first question to us was ‘Can you climb the steps?’  We asked what steps, he replied with gestures to indicate that I needed to climb stairs.  We couldn’t get him to explain what he meant, so we said I could climb a few steps (true), and this satisfied him.  I have no idea what he was talking about, I didn’t see any stairs until we had been in Singapore for some hours!  I would have hoped first class check in would use staff fluent in English in England.
Online check is clumsy compared to other airlines, time-consuming and difficult (updates were very slow, we had to repeatedly wait for the Airline to update the page). The URL given in the e-mail is incorrect, I used Google to find the correct page.
So what were the benefits of Premium Economy?  The seats on the 2 planes were identical, but I preferred the remote control of the entertainment system on the Boeing.  The extra legroom was very welcome.  Seat width was better than I expected.  Although the seat itself is only slightly wider than in Economy, the gap between the seats is much wider, so you are a lot further from your neighbour.  The large video screen made watching films very enjoyable, and the headphones were high quality, cutting out most of the cabin noise.
You leave the plane before the Economy class passengers, and your luggage comes off the plane first, so you may get out of the airport more quickly.
Meals are served on the same type of tray used in Economy.  We tried book the cook menu.  First problem was the website, took ages before I worked out where to go.  We weren’t impressed on our flight to Singapore.  We were served before anybody else, and I had eaten a lot of the meal before I was finally able to get a glass of wine.  Both meals had too much meat, and almost no vegetables.  I decided to cancel our return meals, but the problem with the website…
This time I did get wine quickly, but the meals were disappointing.  I ordered nasi lemak, and chicken rice.  We had nasi lemak the previous evening, a simple cheap meal from a van in Gardens by the Bay, it was a much better meal.  The chicken rice was very basic, a typical SGD4 meal!  I got better in Singapore.  We won’t use book the cook again.
So what are the disadvantages?  First the Premium area is very small, and demand is high.  So we had to accept poor flight times both ways.  Our return from Singapore was awful.  We left Singapore about 1pm, and reached London at about 2am Singapore time!  I couldn’t get any better times without paying a lot more.  
A minor irritation for me is that all the Premium seats are over the wing.  I find it relaxing to watch the world go by, but that’s out if you fly Premium.
Finally the toilets.  I always find this an unpleasant problem, coping with standing in a queue (I find that difficult).  In Economy I tend to sit near the back toilets, which often have a small queue (most use the ones further forward).  But this problem is much worse with the Premium seats.  You are a long way from the toilets.  On the 380 you can only use the 2 toilets on your side of the plane, a good laugh when 2 people in front of you take over 10 minutes!  Yes for better toilet access, fly Economy.
So there you have it.  The extra space and better entertainment are great, but in all other ways I’d say save your money and fly Economy.
label: positive

text: Disappointment with a Top Marquee Airline Having travelled from London to Sydney via Singapore with Singapore Airlines which was excellent our return journey was very disappointing. The class of aircraft had been changed and we flew on both legs on much older aircraft . The booking staff at SingaporeAir were excellent in accommodating our seating arrangements and the crew were helpful but the plane was just old and tired compared to our outward journey. We were sat at the back of the plane with young children and the turbulence was quite unsettling, this wasn’t the fault of the airline but was uncomfortable in this older plane. An additional point is the skywards scheme run by Singapore Airlines is ridiculous and we had our previous air miles taken away within two years not that they could have been used for much . We have now flown to Australia twice with this carrier and should have enough miles to at least be offered something worthwhile but now we have one trip removed, I tried speaking to the customer service dept but they were just not interested. Will definitely give another carrier a chance for our next trip I am afraid to say .
label: neutral

text: Wonderful crew The first thing that stood out is the hospitality of the crew who start of with warm towels. There was ample leg space with more space towards the back of the chair
label: positive

text:
Thank you cabin, crew - 22nd June 2022 I would like to say a BIG THANK YOU to the crew who served me during my flight,
Jenny Teo
Joan Tham
Jamie Leong 
David Teng
Xue LI
They are amazing, attentive and provide excellent service.

Appreciate you can relay the message to them.
label: positive

text: Rrturning from holiday Staff excellent; food mediocre--too asian oriented--legroom,just about but not for tall people--inflight entertainment; adequate but dated: aeroplane; worn looking in parts;would I recommend? We would all like business class but price prohitive :Suggest one reserve seats.
label: positive

text: Overrated airline and service Heard a lot about singapore airport and singapore airlines. i feel they are simply overrated. This was my first SIA flight and unfortunately got middle seats only,. the seats are pathetic, cramped with very less comfort. Emirates economy is much better. Food was also not great. Feat were paining in Singapore SFO flight which was almost 16 hours. Didn't like this.
label: negative

text: Declining returns Having flown with SQ for a couple of decades my last trip confirmed what has been a trend for quite some time. Although SQ is no doubt a very good airline technically speaking, it does not quite live up to the image it built up during the 70s and 80s. On most flights cabin staff are absolutely competent but the personal touch has been lost. Maybe it is simply due to the size of the airline but I have a feeling it is rather a combination of a lower affinity to service oriented jobs in general and the failing of training to address this. The fact of the matter is that there are airlines, even from even richer countries than Singapore, that do a better job at motivating staff to proactively make the travel experiences better rather than to simply tick boxes.
label: positive

text:
Traveled in style with Singapore Airlines - You'll feel like royalty. I flew with Singapore Airlines for a business trip to India. The whole trip was seamless from check in to when I got my baggage. I was on Business Class so I definitely got to experience great service. Food was great and I was well taken cared of. 

I'd love to fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: 1st Rate Service and Comfort Singapore airlines is one of the top airlines in terms of customer service in the world and they show this from Premium classes to economy class.  I travelled with a friend and we can talk about both business and economy.  Business of course has its advantages but in terms of the friendly and customer 1st focus of service for flyers, Singapore Air is tops.  They make the flight as pleasant as possible regardless of where you sit on the plane.
label: positive

text:
The never placed my bags on my flights and now they are lost. Singapore Airlines failed to place my 2 bags on my flight from Rome to Penang and now claim they cannot find them.  I have airtags in both bags and can see where they are and yet I am continually told they cannot be found.  I am now in Malaysia wearing only the clothes I traveled in because they left my bags behind and refuse to find them and return them - despite my providing the location of both bags!  
They have absolutely ruined my travel.  I have lost everything in those bags.
label: negative

text: A bit below expectations Singapore Airlines has an excellent reputation, and I have had good experience flying it in the past.  On my flights to Bali from HK with stopover in Singapore, overall experience was a bit below my lofty expectations.  Sure enough, service is prompt and courteous, and always efficient.  Flights were generally on time.  However they seemed to like the cabins to be very cold, the entertainment selections were rather bland, and on my return flight from Bali to HK, the gentleman at the check-in counter checked my baggage all the way to HK, not realizing that I have a 1 day stopover in Singapore - he made the very elementary mistake of not asking me what my destination for the day is.  Fortunately I caught the mistake, but one of the bags had already gone down the conveyor belt - they had to track down the bag and reroute it (which to their credit was done correctly).  The food ranges from mediocre to very bad - one of the meal included the worst tasting mashed potato I have ever had as well as very tough meatballs.  But then I realized that they were serving a full meal for a 2 hour flight from Bali to Singapore: many airlines would have served something  simpler or even nothing at all.  And on the flight from Singapore to Hong Kong we were served moon cakes: a nice touch since it was the day before Mid-Autumn Festival in HK, but the moon cakes tasted pretty bad.  So not for lack of trying, but the food left much to be desired.  Legroom was good, and overall board experience generally good.  Not five stars unfortunately.
label: positive

text: Great service en flight! This airline has eveything you want on a long flight. A lot of extra´s for comfort and a very nice and clean plane. The best airline!
label: positive

text:
asian hospitality A lot of airline should take example to Singapore airline for customer service and reliability.
I like this airline because i have plenty of legroom and i am a big person, and the air hostess are beautiful with their uniform. I think their are the nicest uniform maybe not easy to work with.
The food is really good and plenty of it.
label: positive

text: Premium economy no different to economy (except in price) We had flown Premium Economy with AirNZ and expected something similar from their Star Alliance partner. However, we were very disappointed. Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines is just an expensive version of economy; the food is the same, there are no separate bathrooms, and there is barely any more room available. The service was not great either and we would avoid flying with Singapore Airlines again unless we had no other option.
label: negative

text: Living on Past Reputation Flight to Singapore was good could not fault whatsoever, cabin crew excellent, however to food was appalling  not only on the Heathrow to Singapore leg but Singapore to Auckland must do better!
label: neutral

text: Visiting my in-law in Hong Kong Food and service is excellence.Flight time is on schedule and they're very informative about the weather and arrival time.Attentive to your needs especially if you have order a special meals.
label: positive

text: I Wish They Flew EVERYWHERE I am now spoiled or simply basking in the memory of what air travel used to be.  Check-in was a breeze and the entire crew treated everyone with the utmost courtesy and caring.  We were provided a pillow, blanket, socks, toothbrush/toothpaste, two meals, and snacks, all at no extra cost. We were given ear buds/wire to connect to the screen on the back of the seat in front of us to watch a dizzying array of movies, TV shows, games, interactive games, flight information, or to listen to a multitude of music choices, again at no extra cost.  I felt there was more leg room and seats reclined further.  All this for an Economy fare. This was the FIRST time I've been able to sleep on a plane.  The plane was a Boeing 777 and even the bathroom was a bit larger with a baby changing table that folded down from the wall.  I have taken long flights in the past and none has compared to this one.  As my Title Review states, I wish Singapore Airlines flew everywhere.
label: positive

text: Still a great airline 3 segments on SQ: ZRH-SIN-DPS and SIN-LHR (B777, B787 and A380). Very comfortable seats, friendly crew, great entertainment system, I've ordered vege-meals tasty and they were tasty and sufficient. Transit at SIN surprisingly a bit chaotic but the crowds were overwhelming. 9/10.
label: positive

text: Never let me down! Have always flew SQ, excellent service by the crew.  Friendly and always smiling. Great in-flight entertainment with lots of choices.  Keep it up!
label: positive

text: Always a Great Flight We have flown Singapore Airlines for years and have never had a bad flight.  Service is wonderful, planes are clean and run on time.  Food is pretty good and seating is good compared to other airlines.  Highly recommend Singapore - we very rarely travel on any other airline and when we have we've been very disappointed.
label: positive

text: Good flight We had to book this flight last minute after the airline we had originally booked with changed their flight times which would mean we would miss our connection home. Everything was great with this flight. Good luggage allowance, clean aircraft, good legroom, nice service and food with pleasant staff. Couldn't see the television but had a book.
label: positive

text: Comfortable and friendly  Is always good to enjoy home class service, where the stewardess and stewards are all very professional and friendly as well as helpful. Witness an old lady was frantically searching for her bag as she could not remember which compartment she placed her bag in and the steward helped her to search the compartment 1 by 1 to put her at ease. Food in board is good. Entertainment on flight is world class.
label: positive

text: Every flight is a pleasant one This is one airline in the world that goes to any extent to maintain its leadership in global commercial aviation arena. Except for certain older A330 aircrafts flying a very few sectors, SQ has the best mix of latest aircrafts with flyer-friendly livery in every class. Keep up this standards, SQ!
label: positive

text: Great service poor food We have been flying Singapore Airlines very regularly for the past 10 years but sadly the past two journies i have to report that the standard of the food especially the vegetarian (western) has declined dramatically. The crew made every effort to ensure that i did not go hungry and are to be commended for their concern. A formal complaint to customer services was lacking in a decent response. Booked to go again in April to use Kriss Flyer points so will see how we go.
label: neutral

text:
Trip to Oz Great service on the planes (we stayed in Singapore on route for 2 nights). The in flight food and entertainment were good and the lay flat seats were one of the best. Good that you can choose and book your meals in advance.
Singapore lounge was overly busy and not easy to get a seat. Showers and washrooms were good, but the choice of food was poor.
label: positive

text:
Another great return flight with Singapore Airlines Another trouble free flight with Singapore Airlines flying Melbourne - Bangkok - Singapore - Melbourne. Takeoff and arrival of all flight was spot on, comfort of seats was fine for economy, and the meals were tasty. 

Paid the small extra for emergency row seats for the additiona llegroom which was well worth it. Yes, you're closer to the gallery and toilets, but neither caused an issue. No smells from th toilets, nor people milling around in your legroom space whislt waiting. Minimal noise from the gallery, which is elminated anyway wehn wearing noise cancelling headphones.
label: positive

text:
Always a winner What is there more to describe a winner?

Whenever I accept a work assignment in Indonesia, I only travel with Singapore Air. 

I have now upgraded to Premium Economy and it is absolutely great. 

The check in, boarding, onboard reception, in-flight service, meals, snacks, drinks and beverages are tops.

But most of all is the neatness and apearance, of the staff and of course the friendly faces.

Even under pressure of serving a meal between Singapore and Jakarta, there was not one serious face.

Encouraging is how the senior cabin staff helps out and give support.

Billiant, brilliant.
label: positive

text: Another great flight experience with SIA My favourite airline. Every flight I have made on Singapore Airlines over the last 10 years was a very good to excellent experience. All I can say to SIA keep up the good work.
label: positive

text:
Good and Bad_my experience with SQ Economy I availed SQ for the whole trip :  BOM-SIN, SIN-DPS, DPS-SIN, and SIN-MAA
First the Pros: Good in-flight hospitality, Helpful and cheerful crew,Good food, Comfortable seats, Unexpected discount @ Singapore Zoo entry tickets, On-time departures and arrivals

Cons: Long and very poorly managed check-in queue at BOM and DPS. Domestic LCAs do manage much better. In flight entertainment was awful with worn out remote buttons and audio jacks.
label: positive

text: Enjoying our flight It's been a pleasant flight. First because I can go from Bandung my hometown, doesn't need to go to Jakarta which means another add hours. So convenience, the flight is on time from Bandung to Singapore (by Silk Air) then transit in Singapore before continue the flight to Sydney. Honestly I loved airport life, coz this is the only time that I can do my fave things, reading, listening music, watch movies and just enjoying the moment. Also my fave is Singapore Sling drink, you should try it.
label: positive

text: Holiday Flight Good flight although aircraft was really chilly. Food was mediocre. Flight attendants really charming and attentive. Quite a few very vocal babies on the flight who only slept just before we arrived in Singapore so sleep was difficult, however this was not the Airlines fault
label: positive

text: Great service to and from Canberra via Sydney Left Canberra around 2300 and arrived in Singapore around 0530 Singapore time and had a stopover of about 3 hours. This was very relaxing and stress free. Arrived in London at about 1530 UK time refreshed and able to access accomadation without any hassles. The return trip via Singapore left Singapore morning to Sydney with about a 1 hour stopover then to Canberra arriving about 2030. For anyone and any class of travel I highly recommend this route (especially if heading to UK). As per usual service and attention to passenger comfort was first class.
label: positive

text:
Great service and efficiency Experienced very good service from attendants. Flights were punctual and baggage booked to end destinations. Good size tv screens. Would have liked a bit more leg room, but considering return costs Adelaide return Da Nang, overall, Singapore airlines provided great service and a good price.
