Would have liked to have choice of having extra leg space seating after airline changed plane from initial booking.
Changi airport is excellent. 
Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text:
Worst Service,Staff and 0 customer service Booked a flight from COK-SIN and SIN-LAX both under Singapore airline.COK-SIN flight got delayed by 20-30 minutes and still I reached before boarding time for next flight SIN-LAX.But baggage handling of SIN airline was so pathetic that they refused to shift my luggage to next flight due to insufficient time.I was not allowed to shift/hand carry it myself as well.These idiots gave me a flight after 14 hours later to SIN-LAX.Tried contacting customer care but no to response.Lost my whole day and never flying again on this piece of s—t.
Pathetic service and hospitality.
label: negative

text: first class experience i flew economy, i was treated first class, i got alot of perks and freebies + great customer service from the crew, just the remote was not that hightech.. but furthermore, still the best airline byfar
label: positive

text:
On the way To Sri Lanka A bit of a wait for connecting flights. Launceston to Melbourne. Singapore to Colombo. 
 We travelled nearly twenty four hours door to door. 
The flight had good food and entertainment. It is hard to stretch your legs as you are told to stay in your seat. It is not good to sit in the one position for eight hours. The staff were generally friendly and polite.
label: positive

text: Best airline I've ever used Highly attentive and hospitable staff made our trip to Malaysia a memorable experience. I've never been on an airline where the food and service have been of such high quality for such a reasonable price. Thank you for making our flights a pleasant experience
label: positive

text:
Excellent from start to finish....wonderful service and attention. This was a very new plane....Singapore airline is always good and if flying in ASIA THEY ARE THE ONLY LINE I WOULD USE.
I can't fault their service from Saigon to Singapore to Perth.
label: positive

text: Great Service! The service in the cabin was excellent and the crew is very concerned about the well-being of the passengers.
label: positive

text: Number One as always As always 2 fights first from Dubai to Singapore Second Singapore to Sydney, both flights as good as normal good old fashioned customer is King service. Nothing is to much trouble from check in to arrival such a good airline 5 star all the way. Give them a try and see the difference, you will not be disappointed.
label: positive

text: Don’t book A flight to Bali with Singapore Airlines. How this airline wins any awards for ANY aspect of its service is beyond me. Flights delayed, bags lost, completely incompetent customer service. I can track my pizza delivery down to the last km, but Singapore Airlines cannot tract a bag, if you have a choice, don’t book this airline. Emirates are so far ahead of these guys in every single aspect, it’s hard to believe how they survive. Nice friendly cabin crew, that’s where it ends. Let’s see if our bags turn up today ??
label: negative

text:
Poor customer service all over - downfall of an airline It seems that Singapore Airlines is focusing on business and first class clients only. Economy clients do not play a role in their service strategy at all. Anymore. Once a very service oriented and reliable airline it seems to fall behind average.

Service Center – a nightmare
For some reason our paid for seats were changed by the system and there was nobody who was able to help in a reasonable manner and within a reasonable amount of time. It took hours of multiple  dialing in and waiting. The service centers in Europe and Australia are not reachable for hours. Very long holding patterns in Europe. The dial in options are limited. You need to very patient.
Unfortunately, the service representatives are way over their heads. They are not able to change anything without the consent of their bosses. Promised return calls were not made. 
At the end we had to accept a worse seating solution than what we paid for. A better solution was never offered. A return of pay was not offered.

On board service - average
The post C19 rules have been dropped. Boarding is as you please. Very chaotic at times. Boarding takes forever.
None of our 4 flights from Europe to Australia and back was on time – none!
Food quality has suffered tremendously. The taste, the texture and the temperature of food is average – best case.
The A350 is a very loud and poorly climatized plane. Cabin temps were extremely low even though multiple passengers were complaining. The on-board entertainment system had to be rebooted. The choice of inflight entertainment is limited and obsolete.

Staff – friendly
Staff is friendly. They have very limited options to make up for mistakes but do it with a smile.
label: negative

text:
Trip to Singapore from Sydney travelling Singapore Airlines is normally a breeze. No real queues at Sydney airport and a well organised boarding process. Aircraft was clean, seats had a little riggle room and everything worked.

Staff were courteous and worked hard to deliver warm service over the near 8 hour flight.

Meals were plentiful and tasty, maybe some other sirlines could learn from SQ. Good range of music and didn't bother looking for a movie. Power and computer acces and wifi available for a fee.

Immigration seemed slower than normal  on arrival and the 20 minute wait meant our bags were availalbe at the baggage belt when we finally got there.
label: positive

text: First Class Cabin Staff beyond compare This is my 4th time using Singapore's Suites Class and it just gets better every time.  It would be hard to improve on the quality of the seating, food/drink or service. Our last flight was on Sunday, January 27th and the crew were.even better than what i previously thought was the best i could find. This is my go to airline for destinations anywhere close to Frankfurt when traveling from the US to Europe.
label: positive

text:
Great service Cabin crew was super friendly, food was amazing, they do not like serving wine though lol, latest movies and series kept me entertained. Provided, blankets pillows and cute little freshening up kits.
awesome experience overall
label: positive

text:
The best! Our first flights on Singapore Airlines and we found out why they are the worlds best rated airline. From the lounge in Perth right up until they got our luggage to us (it didn’t make the connection in Singapore) the people were fantastic. 

The Perth to Singapore flight was a delight with friendly helpful staff. The 55 minute layover in Singapore was always going to be risky as we needed to get to another terminal by train. We made it reasonably comfortably but unfortunately out suitcases didn’t. We were met at the luggage carousel in Milan by a very helpful man who helped us find where to go and also assisted in getting the claim paperwork done. The airline compensated us in cash which was very welcome as we needed clothes. They successfully had our suitcases delivered to our hotel in Venice the following day. It’s funny how, in most cases I would have been upset, but their terrific staff were a pleasure to deal with and we are left with only positive memories of Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Choose any other airline Honestly the worst airline I’ve ever flown with. The plane was dirty and there was rubbish under the seat in front of me when we boarded. The hygiene is so bad I was bitten by flees on all my legs. When I complained and asked for proof the plane was cleaned properly before I boarded they refused to give to me and I’ve had nothing but awful conversation and lies from the representatives. If you’re going to lie about how often your plane is cleaned at least be able to back it up. Honestly etihad was so much better and there staff were just so kind. Singapore airlines is shocking
label: negative

text:
Travelled tourist class, everthing is as it should be. AAA+++ Travelled tourist class, everthing is as it should be. AAA+++
SIA used very new planes, so had latest onboard entertainment consoles.
Food was indifferent but average, nothing to complain of - its tourist class after all
label: positive

text: Deserted us Travelled out to New Zealand with this airline, however they cancelled our return flight and did not offer to help us find an  alternative return flight.  We are still doing battle to get a refund for unused return  flight.  The cabin crew were very helpful, food ok,
label: neutral

text:
Vacation break to Japan, osaka & tokyo We travelled by our national carrier to Japan few months ago- Singapore Airlines.

As per usual expectations, SQ met all our expectations and we enjoyed our trip.

The flight check-in (self check-in) was fuss free, and queue did not take too much time. Service was impeccable on flight.
label: positive

text: Horrible or better no customer service! I do get the point that because of Corona virus Singapore airlines get more customer requests then normal. But calling 5 times being for an hour each in the waiting line to change my flight because Singapore changed flight times of my flight is not acceptable. Also on internet not possible to change my flight tried different offices etc never Singapore airlines again!
label: negative

text: Fly from London A good clean aircraft with good entertainment, but try for an aisle seat if you  need to get to the toilet as waking your fellow passengers can be a trial. The European menu choice was gone by the time the 50's seats were reached but the service was very good.
label: positive

text: Horrible Baggage Drop at Changi Airport I had to scan multiple times for it to read properly. When I contacted for help, the personnel told me to try a few times and his excuse was to make sure I am the correct person dropping the luggage. This just shows that the system is not up to industry standard. Giving such excuses shows incompetency of the system implemented. Such a lame excuse and worst thing he did not even bother to apologize and started making stupid excuses. I expected much more from Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: the new seats in economy are slimmer and less confortable New economy cabin, refreshed entertainment service. The new SilverKris is great. The new seats, not as comfortable as the old ones
label: positive

text: Best airliner As usual, I had a comfortable flight on the best airliner.  The staffs made me feel comfortable and welcome with their ever ready smile and great attitude.
label: positive

text: Puts Qantas to shane Being a lifetime gold QFF I have taken my fair share of flights with Qantas both up the back and down the front and whilst safety is extremely important which Qantas prides itself on, their customer service compared to Singapore is third rate. Singapore’s service is outstanding, their crew are professional and their aircraft facilities are great. I fly to Japan regularly and I am considering adding an additional 5 hours to my flight time to go through Singapore because of their service (and the food is awesome in Singapore!)
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight & great service Great service by attentive crew. The cabin crew was very attentive, and constantly checking to see that we were comfortable and keeping us hydrated with drinks, and endless flow of snacks between the main meals.
label: positive

text:
As always, SQ Flights Are the BEST! I have no complains, only pure compliments for all the excellence that Singapore Airlines is offering its flights! Seats are very comfortable, food was top notch, and the entertainment options that you can watch is just absolutely incredible. 

I was a bit worried at first, because I was visiting a lesser popular destination in China, but surprisingly, the trip was way beyond my expectation! 

Kudos to the team! Will definitely take more SQ flights, if it is in the given options.

TIP: If you are visiting YUNAN, CHINA --- As a travel blogger, I am very keen on getting that experiential adventure of a place. I decided to reach out to ZOMYA.CO Cultural Tours to help me undergo an off-the-beaten path kind of Yunnan Province. Highly recommended, especially if you do not speak any Chinese language, but want to get that less touristy kind of China travel.
label: positive

text: Cramped flight to Mumbai and return Usually a Qantas frequent flier, I booked my trip to Mumbai with Virgin Australia which in turn placed me and my partner on a partner airline, Singapore airlines. My first issue was trying to book a preferred seat which involved a great deal of time online with Singapore airlines. Our preferences lodged, we relaxed only to find our preferences had been ignored and we were placed in the middle two seats of the centre row! Service was spasmodic and the row of seats in front immediately reclined their seats upon take off, even before meals were served. As a Velocity frequent flier, we were not treated well and I am now reluctant to fly Singapore airlines again. Check in at Mumbai for our return trip was unbelievably poor with huge queues and little assistance.
label: negative

text: Save your money Ordinary is the word to describe the new premium economy on A380 SIN-LHR. Seats are just about the same as economy class. Other airlines are offering better comfort, food and service on this class. Save your money and shop elsewhere.
label: negative

text: Flight from Johannesburg to Singapore Glad we managed to upgrade from Economy to Premium Economy. The seats were wider and could recline to approx. 45 degrees. Foot space was ample and the food was good. The 10.5 hour flight was tolerable under these spacious conditions so sleep was possible. The service was good and the flight attendants were attentive and caring. The wait in Singapore was short before our connection to Phuket so we didn't have time to explore the Butterfly or Orchid rooms. Changing terminals from 2 to 3 in Singapore necessitates a wheelchair for anyone with a mobility problem. Singapore Airport is beautiful.
label: positive

text: Would d definitely book again Great flight on the A350 from Manchester to Singapore, friendly crew good food and plenty of snacks available and drinks if you asked the crew. The second flight from Singapore to Melbourne was ok the A380 very dated now and the leg room was quite tight. However as the flight was only 6 and half hours, Singapore would still my preference when flying to Australia and I hope to book with them again next year.
label: positive

text:
The best business class  flight Plane was Boeing 787-10 apparently relatively new plane.  Was seated in the last row away from the toilets. In the aisle seat. Very comfy seat with touch screen panel for reclining seats which is great compared with he Airbus business class seat which needed crew to set up bed, a great hassle. There was a storage compartment to the right of the seat where the noise cancelling headphones and in-flight menu were kept, and a pull out mirror. On the left side of the seat, there were a few buttons to turn on/off the lights. At the front of the seat at the bottom, there were 2 compartments. I could stretch out my legs and rest my feet on them. 

I ordered food via book the cook and had grilled soya beef Jap style. Not bad. 

All in all, I didn't feel like I was on a plane. The take off/ landing was so smooth and the seat so comfortable. The 6-hour flight felt shorter as I occupied myself with movies and music.

Of course I have to mention the great service provided by the air stewardess. 

Looking forward to travelling on the B787-10 again.
label: positive

text:
Very cramped with 'average' service Da Wandering Wabbits' flight from Auckland (NZ) - Changi (Singapore) was aboard a Singapore Airlines 777-300 aircraft (9V-SWP). It was our first flight with this airline.  

Admittedly, Mr Wabbit is 6ft 8", so most planes are tight for me...but this nearly-12-yr-old jet was the most cramped flight I've experienced in 40 years of global travel. I was twisted in my seat to angle my legs to one side, while my knees were up to the level of the tray. It was the longest 10.5 hours of my life, and my lower back was in pain for several days afterwards. Even 5ft 7" Mrs Wabbit felt squeezed!  
At Check-in, I had asked for some consideration due to my height. Without any engagement, I was told all seats had been allocated. When I boarded and realised my predicament, I noticed some empty seats...as well as "normal"-length passengers in the "extra leg room seats". But no crew members would allow me to move...even though most of them banged my knees each time they breezed out of the galley area.  
Reviewing the seat configuration post-flight, I saw the plane had only six seats marked as "extra room". If Singapore Air wants Western passengers, its seating needs to reflect this. Those "extra room" seats should be held until the last minute, for people who really need them, and the leg space in ALL seats should be increased!
 
Singapore Airlines has been lauded for years as having great service, so da Wabbits expected something very good indeed. I did not expect my size plight to be ignored by all crew. Perhaps...PERHAPS...it was because they always seemed to be rushing hither and yon...perhaps...not... The hot face towels were refreshing, but not a unique difference these days. Food was very nice and well-proportioned, with an Asian spin to the menu; refreshments flowed freely. Screen entertainment was somewhat restricted for Western eyes, but plenty for Asian palates.  

As da Wabbits exited the plane, all of the crew without exception laughed and commented on my height - I'm glad to have brought some humour to their day, however I wasn't smiling at all after that flight! 

Da Wandering Wabbits' over-all assessment: average service (not world-beating at all) with very cramped seating. I doubt we will fly Singapore Airlines again...
label: negative

text: Disappointed My mum & I flew on Singapore Airlines on Tuesday night from Bangkok to Brisbane in Business Class, I was really looking forward to flying with SQ, but unfortunately I have to say I was quite disappointed, firstly there was amenity bag with lip cream etc that you normally get with other airlines in Business Class, we asked about it the cabin steward they don't have them, may not seem like much but the lip balm, toothbrush, toothpaste & body or hand cream is actually very good to have, they did have socks, slippers & eye shades on your seat, the crew we're friendly, food was good only 1 meal is served from Singapore to Brisbane either just after take off or just before landing.  It was the new A350 nice aircraft, the seats goes flat but a bit hard.  Would I fly them again possibly not
label: neutral

text:
It's the best way to fly Airbus Industrie A380-800
I was travelling with my partner and we sat on the upper deck. It was spacious and very comfortable. The best seats I have ever had the pleasure to travel overseas in. The service was excellent we felt very well looked after (e.g. all through the night, the people who were awake were offered water). The food was restaurant quality. You do pay a little bit extra to buy Singapore air tickets but it is well worth it specially for travelling long hours.
label: positive

text: First leg travelling home to Australia Flew the A380 and was disapointed with the comfort of seats which were a major step backwards from what is available in their "lesser" aircraft.
label: neutral

text:
Great service Clean, comfortable plane. Best of all, drinks, food and movies included. 
Service was given with a smile even when busy. It was a pleasure to travel with them
label: positive

text:
Great leg space and lot of entertainment options to choose I travelled with my 5 year old and handling him alone over flight was very difficulty, was fully prepared for the nightmarish trip but it turned out to be less than that (cannot blame airlines for his tantrums). My worry point was strong ac during nights as my kid is prone to congestion thankfully they provided socks and blanket and food was good.

The staff was very warm and smiling.Thanks you singapore airlines for taking care of us.
label: positive

text: Very disappointed ! Singapore Airlines (SQ), may be one of the largest airlines in the world but its customer service is appaling. Our flight was canceled and instead of 4 hours of stopover in Singapore, we now have 16 hours to wait! And nothing ! No excuse, no compensation! What company treats its customers like this ? I called customer service several times and the third time I found a person who was very rude, like "4 p.m., you have time to visit the city, what are you complaining about?" . We will arrive before midnight, we leave after 3 p.m. We will have to take a hotel and the company won't even compensate us. one of the best airlines in the world? Really ?
label: negative

text:
Great on Board. Disappointing Lounges. The SA cabin crew are exceptional. The food was delicious, we'd pre-ordered the chef's choice. The interior felt near new and was very clean. The toilets were kept spotless the entire trip. The seats are a little too firm.
However, the dedicated Business Class lounges in Perth and Singapore are really third-rate and let down what would otherwise be an excellent experience.  SA uses the Swiss Air lounge in Zurich which was pleasant.  Considering passengers can spend hours in the lounges I think SA could lift its' game in this area. If not for this criticism I would not hesitate to give SA near full marks.
label: positive

text: Service has changed since covid, but still good The last time I flew with Singapore Airlines (economy) was pre covid in March 2020.  The service has changed quite a bit since the last time I flew with Singapore.  No amenity pack on your chair with your pillow and blanket, no printed menu, no snacks throughout the flight, limited water, is a shame as it is the little touches that give an airline the edge over others.  That said Singapore is still the best value for the route I was taking.  As we all know flying economy is not the most comfortable but the seats on the plane were pretty comfy and have a good incline when sleeping. I bought a foot hammock for the flight to Singapore and I have to say an absolute game changer, well worth taking next time you do long haul. The staff on the plane where friendly and helpful on all four of my flights and the food that I did have was good.  I had a 50 minute turn around in Singapore to and from Bali and whilst that does not sound a lot it is plenty of time. I booked forward seats for my turnaround flights to ensure I got off the plane quickly.   All in all a different experience from last time but still good.
label: positive

text:
Amazing Service, puts other Airlines to Shame Took Singapore Airlines for the first time roundtrip from JFK-FRA and loved it! You can get free beer, wine, headphones, blankets and pillows. You are given a menu to choose your dinner and breakfast. Plus we have Hagen Daz ice cream, yum!

All employees are super friendly and so professional. Would definitely fly Singapore again.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable with awesome Indian vegiterian food Very comfortable flight with lot of movies to watch in the inbuilt screen with excellent Indian vegiterian food..
Best flight experience till date..
label: positive

text: Depends on configuration We had a great flight on the 777 from Istanbul to Singapore (SQ391 January 27) as the plane was te latest version. This flight was painful. It was an older version of the 777 with the entertainment unit in the armrest and the seats seemed narrower. We are of a certain girth and the seats were too narrow for comfort. Also, the aisle seat (40H) had a box under the seat ahead meaning there was very limited legroom. The cabin crew were pleasant enough as was the food, but our row had an inexperienced team and we waited with our trays after the meal service for about an hour.. As a very frequent flyer, I will choose Turkish Airlines for this route unless the planes on Singapore are all updated on this 11 hour route..
label: neutral

text: Super bad service from SIA Super bad service by SIA took business class and my luggage was damaged no during my holiday no compensation at all. Business class service was poorer than normal service and the crews were not very professional made me uncomfortable during the flight and woke me during my sleep twice.
label: negative

text: Best airline of the year The staff is very welcoming and nice . Food in this airlines is very tasty . Comfortable seat and entertainment have a lot new movies, songs . I will fly with Singapore Airlines next time .
label: positive

text: Service Travelling yesterday to Australia to visit my daughter and new grandson, went economy class via Singapore,long first leg (13.5 hrs), but comfortable seats,very good entertainment, very good service from friendly cabin staff. Singapore airport big,friendly,with excellent facilities.
label: positive

text:
Great service and Perfect flight I have been traveling with Singapore Airlines from last 5 or 6 years and never regret for booking with Singapore.
I used to travel with Malaysian Airlines before as they offer free accommodation in transit but Singapore doesn't.  Now that Malaysian airlines stopped that and Price is not much different, I thought to give a try with Singapore. From that time onward I am with Singapore Airlines. There is so much difference in service, maintenance of air craft, and in cabin clean. Not going back to any other airlines even if Singapore increase their price.
label: positive

text: Amazing SQ The travel with SQ is always amazing. Be it the in flight entertainment or leg space, seats, food. All very good.
label: positive

text: Absolutely lovely airline and flight Upgraded from premium economy to business class (1st time ever). My partner and I loved it from beginning to the end. The food was amazing and the cabin crew were unbelievably friendly and welcoming. We usually fly premium and always enjoy that experience,  but this was definitely a step up with the lovely spacious seats. Will definitely go business class again....need to start saving
label: positive

text:
Ample leg room, friendly staff, great meal selections This was the first time we flew Singapore Airlines and we were particularly impressed with the attentive staff.
Throughout the night staff came up and down the aisles with water, juice or any other beverages one might request.
Nothing was too much trouble for them.
We felt there was more leg room than on other airlines we have used and the meals were especially tasty.
label: positive

text:
Best airline experience Unfortunately this year, due to family illness issues, we could not travel.
But normally ONLY with Singapore Airlines, most friendly crew of any airline, Singapore terminals fantastic (and the food court).
Usually June to end August, return from Jhb to KL, but transfer in Singapore.
Usually drive back down for a few days from KL, Holiday Inn Atrium fantastic hotel close to shops, bars and Orchard Road.
label: positive

text:
Smooth experience, as usual. My wife and I were travelling to Sri Lanka but had a Sri Lankan airlines ticket from Singapore to Colombo. We had return tickets from Sydney to Singapore with Singapore airlines. Since Sri Lankan airlines and Singapore airlines don't do code share and are in different alliances, I didn't even bother asking the check in agent if our baggage can be interlined all the way to Colombo. However, he asked what our destination is and when we explained our situation, checked with his supervisor and checked in our baggage all they way to Colombo voluntarily. Talk about customer service! Bravo!
The SYD->SIN cabin service was a little below their usual standards. The flight attendants seem to be a bit impatient. I think that they were doing back to back shifts, overworked and tired. If anyone from the management is reading this, it's flight SQ242 on 24th Dec. 
In flight entertainment, meals and leg space in economy were among the best (as usual). 
Cheers!
label: positive

text:
Service great, food dismal Premium economy was ok-ish but still think BA is better. 
DON’T bother with the ‘Book the Cook’ option. The food was dreadful. I’m not that fussy, especially when bored on a long trip, but two of the meals were truly inedible. Congealed tasteless chicken sitting on top of a mound of overcooked fused rice. 
A soggy lump of what was laughingly described as a buckwheat pancake flopping over the edge of the dish. Plastic cups of wine - one leg the wine was finally delivered after I had finished my cardboard dinner in spite of several requests. And please forget the ‘vegetarian sandwich’ -a soggy lump of bread with a little grated carrot hiding in its centre.
Pretty shameful for the price or
take a Tupperware of your own food as one of my neighbours had sensibly packed in her luggage.
label: neutral

text: Excellent service Second time to fly Singapore Air - and I can not brag enough on the service you receive on their airlines. The staff is very professional, extremely attentive. We have thourghy enjoyed our trips on their planes.
label: positive

text: Great First time with Singapore Airlines and they impressed me! Great services from cabin crews, which some are out of my expectations and not the usual standard that I got from other airlines when in Economy Class. Good job Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: A 15 hour flight that was a breeze. This 15 hour flight was made so easy to do. A meal is served shortly after take-off, there are many, many choices of movies to watch, the flight attendant makes up your pod for bed and you sleep for 7 hours.  Wake up and breakfast is served, more movies to watch, and you are there before you know it.
label: positive

text:
Rightfully one of the best airlines Traveling with family on the SQ airbus 380 is an experience by itself.the seats are old and sleeping is somewhat uncomfortable but the service was a class in itself. The staff were excellent, food was fresh ,the wines were excellent and most importantly the jet lag was minimal if at all.they could do better with their amenities and no sleepwear was provided which prompted us to use other airline sleepwear.these minor differences is what makes their competitors an edge better.
I would travel on SingaporeAir again.
label: positive

text: Disappointing flight Cabin crew friendly but food was extremely disappointing. Most passengers near us returned their main course..as did we. Also really bad was the removal of all pillows and blankets on the Melbourne to Wellington leg! After the long previous leg from Singapore with little sleep we felt it was an unnecessary act. Won't fly with them again on a long flight. Air conditioning was very noisy.
label: neutral

text: Short flight on SIA A350 The original flight is A330 but it's a pleasant surprise when A350 turned up instead at the gate. First time flying SIA on A350. Surely it is a nice experience, good list of inflight entertainment with cosy seat. Pity that it's just a short flight.
label: positive

text: Long daylight flight Exit row seat, so plenty of leg room. 13 hours full day light flight, so no sleep. Food was OK and the cabin crew were great as usual.
label: positive

text: One of the best ways to travel Best airline I've been on. The service is good and the food is actually not bad( defiantly better than BA). I would defiantly recommend it.
label: positive

text: Indeed world's best airlines From (1) cabin comfort and amenities, (2) food and drinks variety and services, (3) in-flight entertainment, (4) crew's attentiveness and helpfulness to (5) flight punctuality, I'd score them 10/10. In spite of the extreme long 18 hours flight, it was truly a pleasant experience, both ways! Undoubtedly!
label: positive

text:
Fabulous flight  Best service we have experienced in all our travels. 

Singapore Airline staff are very professional and friendly. 
The food was delicious with a good selection and generous portions. 
The seats were so comfortable and spacious, I was happy just to be reclined whereas my husband took advantage of the fold out bed. 
I asked for a blanket and got a quilt which was so warm. 
We have travelled with Singapore airlines a few times but business class is worth it if you can afford to splurge. 
Highly recommend you travel with Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: Simply the best Have used many airlines  but this one is by far the best, flight attendants were very good very pleased to help and remembered what had been requested, most forget.  Food  was excellent, it's more often than not most unappetising.  We left on time, seats comfortable and good selection of films etc.
label: positive

text: SQ319 CREW 14/12/2022 My wife an I had a brilliant first leg of our trip to Christchurch New Zealand, via Singapore. We were extremely well looked after by Tricia and her colleagues, Jessie, Jun Hoo, Vincent, Cheau Li, Rishika, and Hui Qi. All of the crew were, without doubt, why we choose to fly with Singapore Airlines. We used to fly with what was a main UK airline, but service is what we pay for and we got exactly that, plus smiles and polite responses to our every wish. Thank team from SQ319. See you in 2024. Mike M
label: positive

text:
Exceeding expectations After a stressful period it was time for some vacation. Rocking up at the airport eager to get on my way I found, much to my embarrassment, that I was a day too early. More as a joke than anything else, I asked if they couldn't change me to the flight that was about to leave instead of coming back again the day after. To my surprise the woman at the checkin referred me on to the service desk where they actually re-booked my flight, at no extra cost. Resulting in me getting to enjoy a day in Singapore before continuing my journey. On top of that they gave me a seat with extra legroom which I, being 2m tall, greatly appreciated.

In short, they went beyond what I could expect and accommodated me in a fantastic way. The rest of my trip with them was also very good, with great service and friendly crew.
label: positive

text:
Also the best airline of the world can have mechanical problems... Flight SQ 972, seat 50 H.June 27th, 2018.
Flight delayed by one hour, then flight delayed and delayed. Mechanical problems. Ingeneers working on it. 
After a couple of hours: stewards litterally ran with boxes of snacks and drinks. The Singapore Airlines responsable made an announcement: safety is and will always be our first duty.
Then we all were sent to the second floor for a meal...Yum, yum...
Finally another plane came to bring us to BKK, we had to change gate. All under the supervision of Sing.Airlines staff.  Big surprise: all passengers were given a leather wallet (empty, huhu) with the logo of the airline. I will cherish the wallet for the rest of my life.
When the plane took off, the first thing we had to do was eat again.
I thought about the famous poem of Kipling : "if you can keep your head, when all around you are loosing theirs..." Singapore AIrlines did.
label: positive

text:
Excellent  Our second flight on Singapore airlines to actually holiday in Singapore.

This was also our first flight on the Airbus A350 and it’s very impressive. Flight was very smooth and comfortable.

The service was very impressive as were the meals and the entire crew.

The economy seats are quite comfortable with good leg room and the entertainment selection on Krisworld was again excellent.

If flying the SQ A350 I would avoid the forward economy section. While the smaller cabin may sound appealing you are also close to row 41 with the baby cots. On an overnight flight it’s not pleasant with constantly crying babies. 

I highly recommend Singapore airlines and would certainly fly them again if they fly to my destination.
label: positive

text: Excellent service! Friendly helpful staff made my travel comfortable. I chose a gluten free meal option, it was pretty good.The next time I will travel,I am very likely to travel with this airline again. Attached is my sketch of the A380 I flew in. I
label: positive

text: Liked it a lot! My first time on Airbus 320-800 and Singapore airlines turned our a very good experiance for both! The plane is great and the staff is perfect. Will fly back in few months!
label: positive

text: great staff We recently flew from London to NZ and back. Over all it was a good service with attentive staff who did their best to make 14 hour flights bearable. It was quite funny that we had to walk through business class (here is what you could have had) to get to the economy seats. One point we would like to make is the amount of packaging and plastic on the food trays. Maybe there is a way to reduce the waste. Also when we had all dropped off to sleep the crew gave out packets of nuts in very shiny and noisy packets to the few who were still awake, guaranteed to wake us up as people attempted to open them.  Great selection of movies available. Very impressed that the toilets were kept clean throughout the flight.
label: positive

text: Wonderful airlines but lots of newly inducted staff need training ! I have flown this airline before and hence along with my family of 4 we chose to fly Singapore Airlines Business Class ! While the senior staff were good, and the facilities world class, there were few newly inducted staff that were lethargic and forgetful ! One particular staff just kept forgetting when I asked for some water and then some nuts to accompany the drinks ! A senior staff (who I complained to, after waiting patiently) more than made up by apologising profusely and offering a bagful of nuts !
label: neutral

text: longest flight in the world Splurged on business class on one of the inaugural flights of this ultra long range flight.  The aircraft was spanking new and immaculate.  It was easily the quietest aircraft I've even flown in .  Food and service rivaled anything in the air.  Even after 18 hours in the air, I was sad to disembark.
label: positive

text:
Very good Flight and Service! Singapore Airlines is my preferred airline. 
Very competitive pricing, airline safety, friendly and professional cabin crews.
The food is always at it's best with a variety and quality on the menu! 
I can only recommend the Airline and its staff!
label: positive

text: Lost luggae twice in a journey My luggage was delivered late twice on the trip. The first delay was of 2 days and delay on the return journey was of a week and no compensation was provided for the return journey. Overall a terrible experience. They don't seem to know how to handle baggage transfers in transits.
label: negative

text: It's been worth the long wait I'm surely not the only one who's had to put travel on hiatus due to the ongoing pandemic but it's a good feeling knowing that it's finally more practical to travel again.  Taking a short trip to Bangkok to begin with, the feeling of finally getting back on a plane was refreshing.  Check-in and luggage submission for this mid-morning flight was fairly easy with lots of ground staff around to provide assistance.  I also got to board in an earlier group which was useful for getting settled into my window seat.  As usual, the Krisflyer system was superb with hours and hours of movies, TV shows, music and games to keep any traveller entertained,  Singapore Airlines has changed the way their meals are presented - the new boxes (as opposed to trays) is a nice change and is likely to also help keep the heat in longer.  I've rarely enjoyed the airline's economy class breakfasts but the century egg congree I had was wonderful - hot, tasty, and more satisfying than the noodles or omelette that's usually offered.  We also had the benefit of a clear day that made views out the window interesting.  Here's to more flying in the coming months ahead!
label: positive

text:
Outstanding Without  a doubt, an exceptional airline. The service is outstanding as is the choice of food, all served with such grace and charm.The aircraft are so new and modern and very comfortable (A350) lots of leg room and an amazing in flight entertainment programme. 
The cabin crew are without a doubt the most polite and helpful one could meet anywhere, nothing is too much trouble, and they are all so elegant and smart, it gives a real feeling of travelling with someone special who cares about the passenger. All in all an excellent flight (as was the return) so if ever I need to go to Houston again it'll be with Singapore Airlines from Manchester which also avoids that awful place called Heathrow.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Style  We have flown with Singapore Airlines a few times before on this flight but in recent years we had chosen to use a couple of low cost carriers to ‘save’ money. When planning this trip we compared all the add ons needed on the cheap airlines (bags, food and seats) and found that the costs were not too different for the way we travel. 

It was a joy to return to Singapore Airlines, with their attentive and top notch service. On check in I found myself with a window seat but preference for an aisle. It was no problem for the staff to see if my request could be accommodated, which it was. 

I will definitely rebook with Singapore due to the great service.
label: positive

text: Never again We had four flights with Singapore Airlines in our itinerary, what a disappointment. Having flown previously with Singapore standards have certainly dropped. Food just awful, bread frozen, fruit frozen, meals were inedible. How they have earned the status of best airline is beyond me. Squashed up against seats like sardines, no wonder some in our party needed to visit a doctor after the flight.
label: negative

text: High quality service A cut above the other airlines. Small things such as a hot towel when you board make a massive difference. The staff look very smart and are extremely willing to help. Food was excellent and the onboard entertainment was also high quality.
label: positive

text: Relaxing We couldn't fault the flight, the service, the whole experience.  The flight crew did everything possible to make sure each and every passenger got an excellent level of service. We would definitely recommend this Airline if flying long haul.
label: positive

text:
When you get included flights, you get the basics. My wife had a fractured foot when we left Sydney, Singapore Staff were excellent providing a wheelchair and getting us through the airport and onto the plane. Can't say the same for the Singapore Staff, stood around waiting at the arrival gate, finally got a golf buggy to the train, no wheelchair or staff to assist. Had to get ourselves through security. Despite paying over AU$1,030 for an upgrade to Premium economy and boarding pass being stickered for wheelchair support still had to line up and hobble to the plane, staff were rude and told us to sit down and wait.
Paris staff were excellent, wheelchaired us all the way through the airport to the taxi rank. Shame Changi Staff, Being a Kris Flyer obviously doesn't count for anything either.
label: positive

text: Unacceptable service My seat was No 1 but time come for me to put in my ‘order’ for a bowl of noodles for my dinner, I was informed they were out. Being first class I find that totally unacceptable and though I’ve emailed them twice since July 2022, nobody has bothered to reply me. Their system have acknowledged receiving my email but no further actions. I’ve recently flown business from Sydney to Athens on Qatar airways n I highly recommend them. Excellent service!! Much better than 1st class on SIA!!
label: negative

text: Upgrade not worth it Received  an upgrade from economy to premium economy. While we had a little more leg room we were disappointed with service and food.  Decided it was not worth the extra and will travel in economy in future. The service in economy is great so there is no need to have an upgrade.
label: positive

text:
Short Trip to Munich We managed to book the front row due to the changes of our booking which cost lot more for the original booking.  
Overall the flight is good and they are efficient and helpful.
label: neutral

text:
The best airline company Aircraft : A350 economy class 
Route : Singapore to Amsterdam 
I used almost all airline companies operating between Australia and Europe (incl. British, Qantas, Air France, Eva air, Thai, Etihad, Emirates 5x) and, if I compare them all, the Singapore Airlines is in my opinion the best.
Flight was great, service and food was great 
Very professional staff 10/10
label: positive

text: Great Airline, Great Service My first long haul flight to Japan. My friends and I spent week in Tokyo. Ten hour flight but with the IFE and meal service, it didn't seem to take that long. The flight attendants were awesome. Very friendly. The food was excellent. Almost too much to eat. Snacks were available the whole flight. Actually took the sister flight back to LAX. An experience I'll never forget. Thank you Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Business Class should allow for bigger people Just travelled Business Class on Singapore Airlines (Bne –Sing- Bkk return, out early March, back late April), sorry NOT good.  The hype about Singapore Airlines Business class is a lie. The worst business class service I have ever experience. SQ 246 / 235 & SQ 709 / 706 on A350-900 aircraft.  On 3 of the fights I had the nasty small business class seats and only 1 flight the bigger long haul seat, which is what all business class seat should be like.  All the seats are poorly designed. So frustrating as small changes could make a huge difference.  On the small nasty seats you cannot stretch your legs out straight (must be angled) and on all flights everything (controls and the like) are behind you, very difficult to reach. I am big guy (fat) which is why I pay 4 times the cost of economy, to get more room (and bitter service).  None of the tray tables had adjustment, so I could not use them or had to force it into my stomach for my premium economy quality meal service. They used a drink cart like in economy !  No hot / cold towel or drink prefight.  I was not greeted by name. No lay flat seat, no night turn down service. All very ordinary.  Out bound (Bne-Sing-Bkk) 3/10 rating.  Now 7 weeks later I had many of the same issues, but was lucky enough to get seats near the galley i.e. no seat Infront of me so the arrangement was different.   The long haul plane (Bkk-Sing 2.5 hours) had a much wider seat that was nice but the same stupid issue with the tray table that folds out from the armrest and no slide adjustment, I ended up putting the meal on the foot rest/shelf in front and holding the dishes as I ate. At least in this seat I did not need a belt extension. On the next flight (Sing- Bne, 6.5 hours) back to the nasty small seats and the tray table pulled out from the cabinet in front and not out from the arm rest as the other 3 flights were configured and although I could not extend it into its locked position I could at least eat from it.  However, to give Sing Air due credit, the service and food was much improved. Home bound (Bkk-Sing) 3/10 rating, (Sing-Bne) 6/10.

I have previously flown international business class on:  Qantas, Qatar (the best), Malaysia, Thai and now Singapore.
label: negative

text: Wow. Amazing Experience and Staff First time flying with Singapore and will again given the chance. Business class as good or better than most long haul first class products. I had a special milestone birthday mid-air over the pacific at the international date line and the staff got word of it. They prepared and presented a custom card and cake with lights. I think every flight attendant and officer from the plane stopped by to wish me well. Amazing and unexpected. Kudos!
label: positive

text: Brilliant service all round Really good service throughout flight, we did book extra leg room which was really good by emergency exit, cannot fault the staff or service...well done
label: positive

text: Simply the best This is the third time I have done this journey with Singapore airlines.The service is without doubt the best in the sky. Staff are the happiest workforce I have seen. Everybody puts in maximum effort to look after you, thanks once again . Flying back to Brisbane next Tuesday morning and even this marathon distance seems shorter with Singapore.
label: positive

text:
World best airline?? Not likely! Having traveled to the UK a few times before on other airlines I was expecting to be surprised with Singapore Airlines service....and I was! 

Poor, poor, poor....never again. Running out of food at a meal service is unforgivable! And the response from the airline when contacted was feeble and only came after repeated prompting.

Plenty of other airlines flying to Europe. I will use one of them next time!
label: negative

text: Fantastic Trip My wife and I are not great airplane travelers, especially on such long distances from Sydney to Frankfurt and then on to Dublin (different airline because Singapore Airlines does not fly to Dublin, however as the other airline was also part of Star Alliance, our luggage was checked through to Dublin, saving us a great deal of trouble in collecting and rechecking our luggage). From the moment we were checked in by cheery and helpful (and laughing) staff, we felt comfortable. The Sydney lounge was excellent and we boarded on time. The new seats are bigger than those I have flown in 1st Class on Thai Airways. The seats converted to full beds and were most comfortable. The staff were amazing, satisfying our individual requests with charm and enthusiasm. We arrived in Singapore on time (a two hour stopover) and departed on time. There were plenty of seats in the Business Lounge and the food was delightful. Once again we took off on time and landed in Frankfurt on time. Different crew but equally pleasant and always smiling. You felt like you were truly being pampered. Luggage was at Dublin airport as promised. A delightful journey!
label: positive

text: My wife got a good service being a wheel chair passenger My early bird search gave a very attractive online ticket fare to Melbourne for our visit.  My wife had a deep wound on lower part of her left  leg. Got wheel chair assistance and  leg free space seat from Singapore Airline. Our sincere appreciation for the courtesies and concerns given to my wife, by the ground staff and flight attendants for the journey. At transit in Singapore  she was given wheel chair in interchange at Terminals and took her  to special reserved  area until our on carrying flight. She and I been oldies, were quite happy on the services ..... thanks so much.
label: positive

text:
Going Down the Gurgler! I originally booked this return flight as being a 777, but they changed it to 350-900.  Not so nice. SQ238 outbound, then the two short flights to HCMC, return SQ227. 
Used to get breakfast pre pandemic with this flight. Not any more.  SQ needs to realise the last memory of the flight is starving passengers who have to nick to Maccas on landing.  Not good enough. Not for a flight that cost thousands.  SQ was in the red now is in the black so it is time to bring back the service that SQ was famous for.  I think everyone on my flight was as bitterly disappointed as I was. I guess they are No 1 in first class, and have given up even trying to compete with business.  Maybe it is time to move on. I will look for the cheaper option next time as the best is no longer the best.
label: negative

text: Only one is the best I have 3 lifetime airline memberships 1+ mil on 1 2 mil+ on the second and Singapore Air is the third. But I don’t work any more so these miles only taught me what to expect, I only fly about 60,000 miles per year, so my business isn’t interesting any more. I have flown to Singapore possibly 60 times on more than 7 air lines only one was the same the first time and every time Singapore what ever you expect they will exceed it every time. Simply the best at what they do.
label: positive

text:
Great way to fly indeed Great flying experience. SQ is truly one of the best airlines to fly with, especially for long haul flights! Well-fed with snacks and drinks available at all times during cruising and the extensive movie selection will keep you entertained if sleep is not forthcoming. 
Special mention to Kimi at Krisflyer hotline. I had some ticketing and boarding pass issues for my children and being 1 day away from departure, realized that their names printed on the boarding passes are not quite right. I called the KF hotline(on 5 Nov at about 9am) to explain my situation, and Kimi promptly gave me assurance and followed up to fix my booking problems within 2 hours! I hope SQ management is reading this post and share my kudos with Kimi. He's a great shining example of what SQ is all about and brings about a positive spin to the SQ brand.
label: positive

text:
Very professional and well trained Whilst on this flight, I had a syncopal episode and luckily I had a fellow traveller with me who is an emergency nurse.
The stewardesses were very quick to spring to action when this event took place. They were experienced and well trained.
I think that Singapore Airlines are one of the best.
label: positive

text:
Business Class The Pro's
The width of the lie flat beds
The service (except for last time)
The showers in SG

The Con's
The price
Rebooking a flight is always a nightmare.
The Business fares come in Lite, Std and Flexi. If you want to rebook on Lite it is virtually impossible. I checked for 3 weeks (no flights fot Lite, and only 1 for std!) I regard it as a con. $4k pp to change!

We have flown with SG Air for 15 years, but are trying someone new, and will never fly again with them.
label: negative

text:
A good experience, everything smooth, but at the price so it should have been My wife and I flew to Singapore in September. It was a special occasion and we treated ourselves to Business class. Expensive, but as is it a 13 hour flight, we decided it was worth it. The plus bits. Both flights were morning take off, so it meant we could forego breakfast before leaving for the airport and eat in the business lounges, and at both airports the buffet breakfast were OK. The lounge at Singapore definitely the better of the two, but no real complaints about either.
Check-in, boarding, welcome aboard all fine. Stewards on the flight were attentive and friendlly. Food and refreshments were good and nicely distributed over the flight. As we were in Business class we had the seat/ bed cubicles, which I have to say are a real treat.
There is also Wi-Fi on the plane, which is free in a Business. Be wary though of getting caught with Data roaming charges from mobile data as your devices may not be in Airplane mode, 

The annoying bits, which are not so much The airlines fault as annoyances with the seats/cubicles. First it is almost impossible to have a conversation with the person next to you. If you are travelling alone, you may consider that a real bonus. If you are travelling with someone, may be less so.
The cubicles also make it difficult to walk around on the flight. There is less need as the cubicles are very comfortable, at least for someone of my average size, but you cannot easily just walk around the plane.
Finally, Singapore Airline’s web site is not the best. It is slow and not very reliable.

Overall, did enjoy the experience, and nothing to complain about, but at the price, It was what it should have been.
label: positive

text:
Don’t use this airline This was a terrible flight.  A tiny business class bed, no sheets/covers, horrible pillow, terrible covers Zthat were crumpled and shabby.  We left at midnight and we’re offered food.  We were woken at about 5.00 and offered food but I couldn’t get a cup of coffee and when I did it was cold…really cold.  Hey friend in coach couldn’t get a bottle of water, food was ok, just… and a sweet white wine…
This plane should have been burned straight after COVID.  The service is NOT what we would expect from Singapore airlines !  Take this tip… avoid SG airlines
label: negative

text:
Best Airline during Covid Due to very sad reasons I had to fly to the Netherlands/ other side of the world unexpectedly during Corona. On booking I called Singapore Airlines and this guy helped me patiently to get to all the info I needed for flying during these times. Everything went smoothly flying there and coming back with a stop over in Singapore. I never felt at risk of getting Corona and am very grateful for their help. 
I felt very safe with flying Singapore Airlines and would definitely recommend it to any one who has to travel during these uncertain times.
label: positive

text: Excellent service and attention to detail I took a once-in-a-lifetiime round-the-world trip February/March 2018, using five different airlines.  I could not fault the in-flight service I received on the Heathrow to Changi Singapore Airlines flight.  The stewards/stewardesses were all very smartly dressed, extremely attentive, instantly available if called and could not do enough for the passengers in their care.  The economy class food was excellent, with choices displayed on individual menus.  We were supplied with warm flannels to freshen up before our meals, a small attention to detail that was really appreciated. When selecting an airline for future travel, I will always go to Singapore Airlines in the first instance.
label: positive

text: A long flight Paid the extra and got the legroom, that made the trip nearly bearable.  The only concern was the long flight from NZ to Singapore and then on to Barcelona.  All in all 24 hours flying but I have to say Singapore Airlines treated us very well. I would (and probably will) fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Amazing customer service The most comfortable flight with exceptional customer service,flight attendants were amazing.Smooth flight great entertainment would recommend and will fly with them again.
label: positive

text:
Ein Wohlfühlug 
It has been several years that we had a long-distance flight with singapore airlines. Because of the strikes and the distance to Frankfurt( we live 100 km from Amsterdam and 90 km from Düsseldorf) . So we used for flying to Asia:, KLM, Lufthansa  and Malaysian Airlines. 
But now, from Düsseldorf we tried flying Singapore airlines again and it was a very good experience. 
It was the 1. time in an airbus 350 and we think that it was ( comparing to 380 and 747 and 777) the best comfort we had with our seats. 
AND  the service of the crew was really excellent! They tried to fulfill every wish. They make you feel like a friend. They remember your face and your wishes( like drinking more tee, or having the cheese-sandwich at midnight rather than the turkey-sandwich. They were always available if someone had a need. 
We were very impressed. Because our experience with the other airlines 
Is different. They disappear as soon as dinner or lunch is done. That feels not good. 
This crew was very good! They made us wishing to fly with singapore airlines every
label: positive

text: Great flight Excellent Airline, staff friendly and most helpful, nothing was too much trouble.The food is good and keep coming round with plenty of water to keep you hydrated.
label: positive

text:
Great service Staffs are friendly and ready to assist on spot. Aircraft is up-to-date and in perfect condition. Seats are wide and comfortable. TV has different options to watch (latest movies, music, games, ...) 
Multilingual staffs are available.
label: positive

text:
Cleanliness of cabin Took a flight from SIN to PVG. The cleanliness condition looks good on boarding. However when I open the service tray, it was dirty and this was the same for my wife and child's seat as well. Feedback to crew and had that taken cared. Great!

Halfway through visited the toilet but the condition was messed up. Quite astonished for a 5 hr flight. Guess it problem is more with the passengers then the crew. But certainly worth looking into maintain the toilets more frequent.
label: neutral

text:
Luxurious Business Cabin The SilverKris Lounge at Changi Airport is very spacious, clean and comfortable. There is a wide range of snacks available, including noodle, salad, bread, wings, fruits, chips, etc., but don’t expect too much on the quality.  There is a good selection of tea, coffee, soda and alcoholic drinks.  

Singapore Airlines flight SQ2 is a 4-hour flight that flies from Singapore to Hong Kong. The business class cabin of the B777-300ER aircraft is clean and well equipped.  Seats are spacious, comfortable and with much privacy.  There is free Wi-Fi access.  The entertainment system is great because of the good screen and sound quality, as well as the wide selection of shows and movies.  Flight attendants are very friendly, helpful and accommodating.  Dinner is average.
label: positive

text: Great service and product Good service. Friendly crew. Delicious food. Great hard product. These are my expectations when it comes to SQ.  And my expectations were met on this flight.
label: positive

text:
Not value for money This review covers four business class flights with SIA and they don't come close to either Etihad or Emirates. The lounge at Heathrow has a great view with floor to ceiling windows, or it would have if they were clean. Obviously there'd been children wiping their hands and faces all over the glass, a little off putting to put it mildly, and the lounge itself was very busy. The food was awful, I've had better breakfasts at Wetherspoons!
The flight to Singapore was ok apart from the seat configuration meaning that if the seat was in lie flat mode you had to lie at an angle with only a small recess to put your feet. The inflight entertainment offered a very poor selection right across the board, very little on there to interest me which is something I've not encountered on any other airline.
The positives were the food and the crew, both very good.
Flying from Changi on different flight, the lounge was packed and had hardly any western food, not great when my only real choice was crisps. The flight to Adelaide was ok but, given that it was a night flight, it was obvious that the crew just wanted to get us fed and turn the lights down as quickly as possible, a real dip in service there.
Our flight from Cairns to Singapore was a beauty, upon check in we were told there was no Business Class lounge and we were given a voucher each for twenty Australian dollars as compensation. Some compensation this was as it wasn't even enough to cover a drink and a sandwich but surely it would get better on the flight? No, the starter advertised as smoked duck somehow morphed into smoked salmon, ah well, they both live in water so I suppose that was near enough. My wife asked for a glass of Shiraz as advertised in the in flight menu, none available so she settles for the Chianti. Upon asking for a refill we were told they'd run out so it was on to whatever they could find! The choice of five deserts shrank to just ice cream or cheese and biscuits but by this stage we were no longer surprised although when they told us that they didn't have any brandy we were really taken aback. It should be noted that there was only ten business class seats on this flight and they couldn't even service that small number efficiently, not a criticism on the crew, just shocking planning.
Our flight back to Heathrow was again marred by the seat configuration, when you've paid such a premium for business class only to find that you can't get comfortable on a fourteen hour flight is simply not acceptable.
In my opinion, SIA are now a long way behind their competitors and, reading other reviews, it seems they don't care. I have communicated my thoughts to their customer service but I'm not holding my breath waiting for any response or resolution. There are alternatives to this airline and I would suggest that people should explore them
label: negative

text: Worst Eco ever flown Only One Drink for dinner and breakfast. Did Not pay attention to guest on seat number A, only B and C. Never had such a Bad experience on Board in economy class. After departing ZRH, inflight entertainment after a commercial break (never had a commercial break during a Film, only at singapore airlines) Shows only audio-screen was black until departure in singapore-nobody could help me, so i entertained me by myself. Reaktion time from customers Service center:more than 3, up to 4 weeks. Sorry, But this is neither a 5 Star Airline nor the Worlds best Airline. This Was my worst economy flight ever!! Never again, singapore airlines.
label: negative

text:
Broken pram and terrible customer service! Having flown with Singapore before I was sure that they would be helpful and accomodating as we flew with our 5 month old to visit family at Christmas. 

We checked in the pram and car seat after paying to have them wrapped at the airport and had arranged to have a bassinet seat for the flight. 
This was all arranged with no problems. 
However, around an hour into the flight I was very aware that my baby needed to be changed. I went to queue for the toilets and there was 6 people ahead of me in the queue. My baby began to scream, I’m sure to the discomfort of the other passengers. I was very aware of this and decided to try and find another bathroom with a smaller queue. The only one with no queue and a change table was in business class. As I approached, one of the cabin staff asked where I was going. I said “sorry, my baby is screaming I just need to change her” she said “you can’t use these toilets you have to go back” I explained the queue situation but she wouldn’t budge so I had to go and queue with my child screaming and all the other passengers glaring at me. 
When we arrived at Perth airport we were extremely annoyed to find that out pram was broken. Despite having it wrapped, it had been broken through the wrapping and the footrest was basically hanging off despite the fact we had only had it for 5 months. I checked the airline policies which stated we were covered up to a certain amount so I emailed them within 48 hours with the relevant forms, photos of damage, boarding passes and purchase receipts.
They responded after a few days with a very unprofessional email basically requesting the same information I had already sent. I sent it again. Twice. They sent another badly worded email asking me to drop it off somewhere for assessment. By this point we had been back with our taped up pram for about two weeks. I responded explaining that it’s the only pram we have and we couldn’t drop it off. We had done everything they had asked. I never heard anything back. 
We were very disappointed and annoyed with the way we were treated both on the flight and the way our complaint was dealt with. I would NEVER fly with Singapore airlines again which is a shame because I had flown with them twice previously (without an infant) and had a very positive experience.
label: negative

text:
Good hospitality and food I took SQ a year ago and not much has changed. The seats have been reupholstered, the cabin has been redecorated, but besides that, it's fundamentally the same.

Flight was slightly delayed (1h) but crew were apologetic so all's good. As always, I enjoyed the warm hospitality by the flight crew. I had a problem with my audio but one flight attendant gladly helped me rectify it by resetting the in-flight entertainment system (more on that later).

Seats were fairly comfortable; decent legroom for me (a 170cm tall lad).

Meals took quite a while to be served after we had reached cruising altitude, though. Could see crew pushing trolleys up and down the aisle but never served us until around 20-30 min after children were served.

The wait was worth it though. The pan-seared chicken was first-class even though I was in Economy class. So juicy and tender and delectable - made me feel as if I was on the ground and not eating a pre-catered flight meal. Top-notch.

However, the IFE left much to be desired. Very dated with the screens on some planes being so pixelated. At least you can find the latest movies and music albums there.

Overall, an average journey; the best part about it is the hospitality. Cheerios, keep it up!
label: positive

text:
Worthwhile Premium economy was a nice upgrade from Economy class, but I must admit that I had expected a bit more. This probably had to do with the fact that SIA economy class is already a great way to travel, even longhaul! 
Priority check-in and boarding is quick and easy. 
The seats are comfortable and spacious. The book the cook option is nice but not necessarily a must. I loved the noise cancelling earphones provided by SIA, but other than that there’s not much difference compared to economy.
You will need to make your way down the isle through economy to use the toilet facilities. 
I would’ve liked to have had the option for bubbles before departure (a few years ago they even offered that in economy class...) and the toiletries weren’t different either.
label: positive

text:
World Class Airline!!! This was my first trip with singapore airlines but for long flights in the future i would always prefer to fly with Singapore airlines.

Service, flight attendants, food, drinks, entertainment, cleaniness, and check in are absolutely outstanding. 

I have been using American Airlines and United Airlines for my business and personal trips but in comparison to Singapore Airlines the total experience that Singapore Airlines provides to customers is outstanding. Other airlines should learn from Singapore airlines as a role model airline.
label: positive

text: Great overall package Negotiating Changi Airport is not one of my favourite things to do.  However, it does seem to get easier as one becomes more familiar with the layout.  From landing to getting into the next departure area is on average a 45 minute hike.  As is always the case with Singapore Airlines, service and standards are excellent.  The business lounge could not be faulted for variety of food and quality.  The flight was excellent, service exceptional - nice to have staff who listen - and the flight crew should be congratulated on the landing.  From touchdown to engines stopped at the bay in Melbourne precisely 5 minutes.  I understand it depends on a lot of factors, being ex-aircrew myself, but this was truly exceptional and did not involve massive amounts of reverse thrust either.  Well done all round!
label: positive

text: Premium service even in economy From check-in to boarding, everything was stress free because of the pleasant and very efficicient Singapore Aurlines staff. Upon boarding our aircraft, nothing changed. Staff welcomed us with a smile and ensured all,our comfort needs were attended. We didn’t have to ask for service - they pre-empted our needs. We received regular food and drink service and when they knew our liking of a Singapore Sling, another was offered without us asking. The meals were the best quality we have experienced on all airlines we have used. We will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Luxury and comfort Omg! Never flown business class before but what an experience!!!! Was fantastic to be able to sleep in a bed, food ordered from book the chef was fresh and delicious,  service was excellent, staff all friendly and helpful. Was looked after like royalty. Will definitely fly again!
label: positive

text:
Business Class to Christchurch was substandard From Bangalore, we got a SilkAir flight, which was average. Their iPad entertainment system was novel for me and very good. From Singapore we got onto a Singapore Airlines Airbus 350, i think. The business class was definitely substandard.  Given SQ's reputation, this was extremely unacceptable. In fact, we paid 25% more in fares over Malaysian just because of the SQ image. The seat was the most pathetic business class seat I have experienced since flat beds came into vogue, about 20 years ago.
While seated you couldn't stretch your legs out as there was not enough place in front of you...And I am just  5 ft 8 in tall. Neither could you lie flat on the fully flat bed.!!! The only way , one could stretch out one's legs , when seated or lying down, is if one stretched it out diagonally; at an angle. A most uncomfortable position, leading to muscle catches and aches on getting up. And in the prone position the seat belt came tight under your armpit and buckled in bElow your waist...a very, very uncomfortable and terribly restricted experience.
Having flown Business, on Emirates, Etihad, Qatar and British,this was not even comparable.
I can tell you that I NEVER WANT TO HAVE THAT EXPERIENCE AGAIN. In fact, I think Singapore Airlines, should refund the premium they charged on the grounds that they were giving me and my wife , privileged business class seats!! The seats were actually a punishment.
I am flying back from Sydney on 16th MAY, business Class on an A 380 aircraft. I sincerely hope that will be a better experience
label: negative

text: Singapore airlines are fantastic We had a great flight all the way. From checking until arrival we could not have asked for better service highly recommend
label: positive

text: Kris FLYER miles cant be used to  offset ticket. Ive always flied with singapore, i recently chose to fly to australia from europe. I had allot of built up miles which where expiring. I had no option to use them when purchasing the ticket. Whats the point of giving "Miles" if i cant use them. Its a scam, and i hate companies that scam people.. Next time im going with emirates..
label: negative

text: Top notch airline Have nothing but kudos for this airline and its staff, aircraft and level of service.  The only glitch we had in the whole process was food selection which wasn’t their fault.  They were quick to accommodate us with vegetarian options. I love how professional the flight attendants were - they all looked and acted so elegant and professional.  It made me feel like I was in good hands.
label: positive

text: Exceptional! it has to be the world's number one, service, attention to detail and overall warm greetings and out of way service an example to the rest. I no longer travel with Middle Eastern / Arab Airlines, Singapore is the only way to go!!!
label: positive

text: Disappointing Premium Economy This was the last of 4 flights with Singapore Airlines done over a 7 week period all in Premium Economy. The flight was satisfactory but I don’t think I would fly this category with this airline again - not really worth the extra money. You do have a cabin section for only Premium Economy travelers but no assigned toilet - you need to use the toilet available in the Economy section and there are often queues. I have traveled another airline in Premium Economy and the toilets were located in the PE cabin area. The good aspect is that you do have comfortable large seats and extra leg room and plenty of overhead baggage space. The meals are ok but are just the same as Economy - you are served before the rest of the Economy section. We were offered champagne on takeoffs with Singapore but I think this is a standard process in all PE cabins. We were comfortable in our seats but I think future flights with Singapore would just be in Economy class. At checkin there is a dedicated Premium Economy counter which is great - no queues and you are able to board the plane before Economy travelers- again great but you do need to print your own baggage tags and boarding passes as has been adopted by most airlines. Bring back the option of having a staff member check you in and print your relevant documents and see to your baggage.
label: neutral

text: Is Premium Economy value for money? I chose SQ premium economy as it gives me the priority boarding, extra baggage allowance, slightly spacious seats, and more food options.  Often I was asked if premium economy is worth the money? I would say SQ offer a good product and I'm willing to pay extra in exchange of better seat.
label: positive

text: Excellent service - even if it was in economy! We recently flew from Sydney to Singapore on our way to Cambodia in economy.  The flight stewards were excellent.  They were attentive, friendly and nothing was too much trouble.  We could have easily been in Business Class the way they treated us.  The meals were also of a very high standard - hot and flavoursome. Very much appreciated.
label: positive

text: Not a pleasant flight. My wife and I had just got off a pretty unpleasant Silk Air transfer from Cairns and were looking forward to a huge improvement in service, food and entertainment similar to the service we'd enjoyed on the way out to Australia. What a disappointment. Having worked in air engineering for a few decades I was surprised at the condition of the B777 we flew home in. It was dirty, both our seats wouldn't return to the upright without pushing them up manually and both our meal trays were broken. As the aircraft powered up and made it's way down the runway I seriously thought it would fall to bits. The internal cabin furniture was shaking around very badly. The crew weren't particularly friendly and we both got missed continuously for refreshment. They ran out of some food and had to make up a breakfast for my wife. I should have taken down the aircraft's MSN.
label: neutral

text:
Flight to Singapore Always a good experience with Singapore airlines.
Pleasant staff and pleasant food. Good choice of entertainment.
label: positive

text: New A380 Business Class Excellent flight on the new A380 Business Class fit-out.  Plenty of space for personal items and cabin bags can be stored under the seat in front instead of overhead lockers (which are available if needed).  Seat is firm but comfortable and deploying the bed is simple.  I had quite a few hours' sleep which is rare for me on a flight.  No problems with sleeping position - some people think they won't like the angle - but there is ample space to stretch out or curl up.  Singapore Airlines service and meals are always excellent and attendants always very obliging.
label: positive

text:
Non stop Very comfortable and extremely well catered for. Flight crew were fantastic and helpful.
Best long haul flight ever experienced. More than happy to travel with them again ,
special dietary requirements were not an issue and were well catered for with normal 
advanced notice.
label: positive

text:
Average Service and simple meals offered I have flown with SIN air 30 years ago and their flights were great services and good food. After that I didn't have a chance to fly with SIN for several reasons and this year I decided to fly with SIN again and boy it was so disappointed with their services and meals that they provided during the trip from SGN-SIN and SIN-LAX.
The flight attendances were so cold and not friendly, their choices for drink were limited only coke, Sprite for soda, water, Orange and apple juices, Lipton tea and coffee. I asked for soda with ice and they said they don't have it until later but later never came. Their drinks weren't cold.
The meals were so basic with bread, butter, 1 simple dessert and plain main course while other airlines offered extra like salad, fruits and more choices for main course.
The only thing it was good that they were pretty much on time on both legs
