The seats for my first leg were Premium Economy so I have no complain, the seats for  2nd leg I got an empty seat in between so I didn't feel the pain of small seat for 15+ hour flight time
Entertainment selections were not the latest and not whole lot of choices
If I have a choice to chose airline in the future compare for pricing, time and services, I wouldn't go with SIN airline if the price is not much cheaper than other airlines
label: negative

text:
Busy flight attendants Singapore airline is busiest airline. Always full in every flights.

But i think because of that the flight attendants seem too busy. I had my dinner and asked only water for drink. I didnt get water until i finished my dinner and press 2 times for assistance. only for water. i was so extremely thirsty. i got answer sorry many times in SQ flights I took in most of my trips. I fly with SQ many times. 

Service from flight attendants are not that good.
label: negative

text: Most comfortable flight Morning flight to Hanoi, and it was very comfortable in this A330-300 aircraft (2-4-2 configuration).  We got the double seating by the windows.  As I prebooked standard seats, upon online check-in, I could select the forward zone FOC!  Seat was so comfortable, I slept the entire flight.  Flight timing was perfect, arrived before noon.
label: positive

text:
A little disappointing This flight was overall pretty good. I like flying with Singapore Airlines.  I have to say there were a couple of disappointments.  The food was the biggest. I was really surprised at the meal.  The presentation was as always top notch, but I found the food bland, did not enjoy the dessert either.  I also find it peculiar that SQ does not give business class passengers an amenity kit.  On this flight we got a leather pouch with fabric treatment and hand sanitizer. This is not what I expected.  The seats are great when upright, wide and comfortable.  When set up for bed, if you are a tall person, you have to sleep in a position that is askew. I was in seat 19 A which apparently has a little more room as there is no seat in front of me.
Service on the flight is of course top notch.  
Overall the flight was good, we left on time and got to Singapore ahead of schedule. I used to think of Singapore Airlines as the best business class in the Star Alliance, but I think that title now goes to EVA Air. The difference is the food, including the fact that EVA Air gives you a mid-flight meal great cheese burger available on demand. EVA also gives pajamas to business class
label: positive

text: A really enjoyable trip The staff was extremely willing to help and continiously offered refreshments etc. Their menu delivered what it promised. Overall a very satifying experience for both my wife and myself. To be recommended.
label: positive

text:
First time I was lucky to secure a really good price for return airfares from Napier/Wellington/Melbourne. 
The staff were friendly, menu was good and a nice touch with the hot towels to refresh once on board. 
Only criticism was terrible inflight entertainment system. On the way over we couldn’t hear any announcements and could not operate the controls. Took nearly half the trip to get anything on the screen. The return trip was good it was a different system. I would use this airline again and hope I’m lucky enough to secure another very reasonable airfare.
label: positive

text: First Time Flying with Singapore Air This was our first time flying with Singapore Air. We had a very comfortable flight. More than normal leg room / seat size. They supplied us with socks and tooth brushes/tooth paste, nice pillows and a decent size blanket. It felt like they fed us the whole way - though some of the food options we struggled with. Watched some good movies during our flight too. The staff were all very friendly and observant. I fell asleep for a few hours and the flight attendant came and asked my Mum if I was ok. I would recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Airline Coffin Although previously I have experienced excellent travel with this airline this trip was not so. My flight was booked through a travel agency at the last moment. Traveling for ten plus hours from Johannesburg in a middle seat was horrendous to say the least. I would not wish this type of travel arrangement for anyone at any cost. I have no expectation of Singapore Air you get whats available
label: negative

text:
Frankfurt to Singapore Singapore Airlines planes and staff are exceptional. 
We can’t recommend them highly enough. Nothing is too much trouble. The food and service is outstanding.
label: positive

text: Comfortable and convenient Our experience with Singapore Airlines was as always very satisfying, punctual, convenient, comfortable with superb service, well designed seats and tasty food, clubbed with service with a smile.
label: positive

text: Awesome experience Most amazing flying experience .On time.. fantastic, professional service...Great food.The best air line...
label: positive

text:
Long but Pleasant Flight Best of the best flights as this was a new aircraft A350 and for a couple traveling on  the new Business Class seats was a welcome experience. We were actually able to talk to each other without me (smaller one of us) climbing on my knees to speak to my partner. The wall between us was lower than the old version of the plane and during the night we were able to sleep next to each other as if at home. Yes, we loved that.
Service was excellent and food so so, but the comfort next to none. Amenities were clean at all times, thank you. Boarding always seamless with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
very bad customer service flown with them to houston from manchester, flight there was correct, good food, plenty of entertainment and staff on board were very helpfull. 
on the way back, we spent 8 hours sat in the place before they decided to cancel it, by that time there was no hotel left and it was amost 4am, we should even have landed by the time they decided to cancel the flight, no hot food nor hot drinks offered. we slept on chairs in the airport without anything to warm ourselves up. when we managed to come back i opened a claim to be told they didnt have to refund me and pay me any compensations because they were not a european airline .... cheap !!!!! disrespectful !!!!!! unappologetic !!!!! I am appauled, an airline of this standing that think they are above the law and that their customers do not deserve compensations when they land 24 hours late .... never again !!!!
label: negative

text: Friendliest crew, great service We live in Singapore and whenever possible, we choose Singapore Airlines. The friendliness of their crew and the level of service are second to none. My only pet peeve is the inflight entertainment, which is just average.
label: positive

text: Book Specially Prepared Local Food Before You Check In Online. This is still the best way to get to New York from Singapore. No hassle, no rush, in flight food of your choosing, good headphones for the latest movies on seat wide monitors but best of all clean and dry toilets throughout the flight. Same for the flight back from New York except that there's no choosing of local food. However your choice must be made at least 24 hours before the flight ETD. The champagne and comfortable seat helps one to forget that the flight is 18 hours long.The well mannered young stewards on both flights made the journey much more enjoyable.
label: positive

text: What a Let Down! We were expecting big things from Singapore Airlines as we'd heard they'd just won the Best Airline in the World Award.  We were really disappointed in every aspect of this airline.  At Check In, we were told that the Premium Economy was totally full and we couldn't change our seats (which were the worsts seats in the cabin - the E and F seats).  When we got on the plane, there were three vacant bulkhead row seats.  We flew three sectors with them, and each flight was at least an hour late.  The service, which we expected to be excellent, was pretty much non existent, with the cabin crew disappearing the minute the meal had been served, and not reappearing until the next meal service.  Despite being awake all night, I was never offered anything outside the meal service, not even water.  I am not sure why Singapore Airlines has such a good reputation - we will definitely never fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Very good experience, but need to improve to be No 1, again. Overall experience was very good. Covid has played hell with the airlines and people's expectations. The Standard of this airline may have slipped a bit.
label: positive

text: The most uncomfortable business class seat The service on board Singapore Airlines is excellent and the catering is of a high standard.  Unfortunately, the business class seat was one of the most uncomfortable seats I have ever flown in.  To put the seat into the flat bed position it is necessary to summon the cabin crew for their assistance. The same thing applies when trying to put the seat into the recline position.  The surface of the bed is like sleeping on a board, we were not provided with mattresses,One has to sleep almost diagonally to stretch out your legs, as the place provided for your feet is a small space situated  to one side, not directly in front of you!  It was a very uncomfortable space to try to sleep in.
label: positive

text: Tokyo Tohoku Trip Timely, luxurious and lots of pampering trip for my family to Tokyo. Services were prompt and foods were delicious and plentiful. Luggage were promptly discharged at the belt without delay for us to catch the Narita Express train ( a big plus).
label: positive

text:
Passionate team! The flight was surprisingly very full considering the Covid-19 scare! I was tucked at the last seats right in front of the galley.

I am impressed with the service excellence of the crew. The passengers were pretty annoying, littering repeatedly, while the stewards continue to pick up the mess.

I can see the effort they’ve put in, and the patience they have!! Is unwavering. Thumbs up to the crew.
label: positive

text:
Excellent Airline Singapore Airlines would be one of the best airline that we have flown with. The cabin crew were very polite and very friendly. The aircraft was clean and enough room for us. Unlike other airlines, Singapore Airlines leave the exit seats for the tall people and offer them the seat at now additional charge. 
The food onboard was also excellent. 
Singapore Airlines have always been one of my first choice airlines.
label: positive

text: A great way ti fly Good cabin crew who were very attentive despite it being a long haul and full flight. Food was OK and entertainment varied and more than sufficient for the flight.
label: positive

text:
Nice but slightly overrated I travelled business class from Singapore to Kansai Osaka and frankly was expecting a great service. Even though cabin crew were polite and service was good I didn’t receive any travel kit which is usually provided in business class.
I have mostly flown American airlines and Delta and they provide great travel kit. 
Next time I’ll choose a flight which provides this.
label: positive

text:
Terrible travel experience My first time flying with Singapore Airlines and it was by far the worst experience I've had with any airline. 

When I first tried to book the ticket, I got all the way to payment, only to get an error message saying they couldn't process the request and to please start over with the booking. When I started over, the price suddenly increased by over $500. Seemed like a classic bait and switch. That should have been my first clue to look elsewhere, but unfortunately I decided to go ahead with the booking at the new increased price.

For a 16 hour flight from San Francisco to Singapore, there was no toiletry kit provided. I've flown many premium economy and business class flights and toiletry kits have always been provided (plus slippers), but apparently Singapore Airlines offers nothing of this kind. I've become so used to having the toiletry kits provided that I no longer pack a toothbrush and toothpaste in my carry-on. So, for this flight I was out of luck with no way to brush my teeth. 

The flight left around 10 pm pacific time, and dinner was served about an hour later. Dinner service was alright, though unusually slow compared to what I've experienced with other airlines. And the food was pretty good. But then nothing else except water was offered until almost 11 am pacific time the next day. So almost 12 hours with only water offered and no food at all. Despite the late dinner, I was starving by the time they finally got around to serving breakfast. I really cannot understand how they expect passengers to go 12 hours without at least a small snack being offered, especially when they are serving breakfast closer to lunch time relative to the departure time zone. 

When I originally booked the ticket, there was prominent language saying that you could change the booking without any additional fee. I did need to change the booking, but conveniently they claimed they didn't have tickets in my class on the date I wanted to change to. I can understand how tickets might not be available on a particular day, but they couldn't even offer a ticket within 5 days of my desired date. I suspect they had availability, but were just up-selling me. The best they could do was to "upgrade" my premium economy ticket to a "flexi" premium economy ticket for $900 more. It would still just be a premium economy seat, so the "flexi" option didn't really provide much added benefit. So, in effect, they wanted to charge me an additional $900 just to change the booking. 

Although I wasn't happy about it, I decided to go ahead with the upgrade and change the flight date. The agent explained that they would have to confirm the booking and call me back to arrange the additional payment. It took the agent a while to call back, so I went to SA's website to check the booking myself. The booking had been changed, but I was downgraded to regular economy, and on top of that had more than a 20 hour layover in Singapore added into the itinerary (original booking only had a few hours layover). So, on top of the $900 additional charge, I was now apparently downgraded to regular economy, plus now needed to get a hotel in Singapore for the layover. Oh, and when they finally did call me back about the booking, they hung up on me immediately and I never heard from them again.

I'm sure I could have straightened out the mess with the new booking, but at this point I'd had enough. I just booked another premium economy ticket with another airline and canceled the flight with SA. 

The final insult from Singapore Airlines is that they're only refunding about $300 of a $2500 round trip ticket. So I'm canceling half the flight, but getting much less than a fifth of my money back. But even with the pathetic refund amount, I think I actually saved a little bit by booking with another airline. SA is very expensive, but you apparently don't get upgraded service for the extra money. An absolutely terrible experience, I will avoid this airline at all costs in the future.
label: negative

text: First time to US on a world longest flight Finally decided to visit the US after Singapore Airlines re-introduce the non-stop direct flight to Newark and at that promotion price for premium economy it was hard to resist. Total flight time was about 17hrs 30mins and it was worth the experience especially on one of the solo seats at the back of the aircraft. Food, entertainment, service of the crew were great and it was plus point when the aircraft is completely new. Based on the aircraft registration it seemed to be its first operational flight after delivery from the factory. Flight was smooth and landed in Newark on schedule.
label: positive

text:
The worst flight experience ever Boarded in Brisbane Australia traveling to Phuket Thailand with a stopover in Singapore for 50 minutes
The seat's were so cramped together unfortunately I was stuck in the middle seat I was literary shoulder to shoulder with the other passengers (also they complained of room) we had no leg room  what's so ever my most uncomfortable flight I've ever experienced. When we touch down in Singapore there was no announcement or anyone of the Singapore staff to direct you to your next flight gate for a connecting flight to Phuket we were supposed to have 50 minutes layover time I checked the transfer board as soon as we landed it read boarding now the gate was b10 literally 1 km away I had to run the whole way and just made the flight many people around me running to connect with the same flight the most unorganised and uncomfortable flight I've ever been on I would never consider flying again with Singapore Airlines 
If only I have read reviews on this airline I would have never purchased a ticket
I am dreading frying back to Australia in 3 weeks. With this airline
label: negative

text: World No.1 Airline I hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines for some years but I was very impressed from boarding the aircraft to reluctantly explaining meals etc  leaving the flight in Singapore.The cabin crew were always on hand to assist if needed.I also was fortunate to have a Seabass  for lunch and it has to be the best fish meal I have had in many long year in flight or on the ground. It was delicate very moist and beautifully cooked and presented as you would encounter in a fine dining restaurant. We were blow away by this meal
label: positive

text: They have had my money since August 15 2019 and wont return it !!!! Singapore Airlines have been absolutely horrible with communicating and dealing with customers over the refund of money for flights during COVID 19 . We are still waiting for money we paid in August 2019 and are sent emails saying they have paid us and that the money will take 12-16 weeks to clear through the bank .The customer service people are just saying we are sorry but we are dealing with returning monies but nothing ever happens .Then they send an email saying they have sent the money and nothing comes . Its a nightmare and I will never travel with them again .Our flights were early June and its now mid October . they have had our money for 16 months !!!!!!
label: negative

text: tiny seats noisy plane inedible food every time you leave aust. you have to fly the only direct flight from adel. to singapore is with SIA. Knowing this the plane is full most of the time & so the service, food,seating is not very good. Snearing Singapore Girls would rather be posing than doing their jobs seating is uncomfortable & food a dog could not eat of coarse all specially picked by experts.Thankfully we are only in the air for 6-7 hrs.
label: negative

text: Flight of a lifetime My wife and I flew to Singapore in October 2018 .From the second we boarded the new a 380 we were waited on hand and foot by the ever smiling staff . I cannot really put into words how it felt but I would recommend to any one if they are going to try this airline they will not be disappointed . The legroom was amazing and the seats were very comfortable .. The aircrew were always there to see to our every need . Thank you Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Comfortable flying Staff were friendly and alert to passengers needs. Airplane was comfortable and pilot was pleasant with updates.
label: positive

text:
Great Airline and great Airport. First leg of travel from Adelaide to Singapore in the new plane is not as good as the previous plane as we liked the 2-4-2 seats better, and it seems a little less leg room but the service is great and Changi Airport is fantastic to wait for the connection flight. 
If you are flying back Singapore Airlines don’t forget to claim S$40 voucher either. on the way out or on the way back Upon presentation of your boarding passes and passports. We claimed it on the way into Singapore but will spend the voucher on the way back.
label: positive

text:
Attentive staff and comfortable Great service, meals great and comfortable seats, great entertainment selection
And reliable.i like the ice cream and chocolate they gave us after the main meal.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Unfortunately mine and my neighbours headphones did not work. Also the seat pocket was broken. 
Service was unremarkable; why oh why do they take so long to come round and clear away after a meal (this applies I think to all airlines).
Food unremarkable.

I'll be returning to QANTAS next time.
label: positive

text:
Mr Grahamme McDougall  The plane ride was excellent, new plane what a difference.
The lay down beds were excellent.
The selection of movies great.
The staff well deep and very very courteous.
The food again excellent.
The airline unlike others don’t scrimp and save like other airlines especially in Oz.

It’s a pity a few other airlines are not the same?
label: positive

text: Lived up to expectation We were looking forward to our long flight to Singapore having decided against BA and opting for the more expensive airline based on their reputation.  Singapore Airlines did not disappoint and every part of the service from choosing the flight, checking in and disembarking was carried out smoothly, on time and with a genuine smile.  The quality of food, drinks and choice available via the entertainment system was amazing.  We had told the airline in advance that it was my wife's birthday the day we flew out and they made the flight extra special with a couple of glasses of fizz, a lovely cake, gifts and a handwritten note from the crew. Our experience supported why they are the award winning number 1 airline.
label: positive

text:
Use of tired old plans to Perth We were returning from  Zurich and took the connecting flight from Singapore to Perth. We were supposed to travel on a 777 but instead they used an old Airbus which was very tired, and had grubby and frayed seats. SIA need to lift their game if they are concerned about their image and either clean up their old Airbuses, or decommission them! It’s not as if we were given a cheap fare deal as we paid a high price for 2 return tickets from Perth to Europe. 

The customer service onboard is always good but the crew on the day took a very long time to get organised before we eventually got our meals, due to a mixup over the special meals they had to serve first to other  passengers. What a shambles!!
The meals were not their usual standard on this flight.

I am now considering other airlines for our next overseas flight.
label: neutral

text: Was ok Plane wasnt as nice as i expected. Leg room was a joke. staff nice but didnt see any diffrence than flying any other airline.
label: neutral

text: The flight Check in was very quick.  I had an aisle seat in the middle row which was very comfortable and easy when I wanted to get up.  The attendants were very pleasant and helpful.  The food was delicious and plentiful.  It was quick to get through customs and didn't have to wait long for baggage.
label: positive

text:
Good long flight I flew on A350 aircraft operated by Singapore Airlines. It was somewhat older plane. This is very long flight over 16 hours. Service on plane is good, and I do not have any complaints on staff. Food was good but not the best. I had better experiences with other airlines in regards to food. I was surprised that toilet kit was not offered in business class (other airlines offer this).
In regards to plane seat was comfortable but not fully automatic. If you wanted to put it in bed position you had to stand up and use latch to bring it down. In laying position you have to go diagonally since opening for legs is on side(strange configuration).
But over all flight is ok and no complaints. I did have better experiences with other companies.
label: positive

text: Awesome, possibly the best airline I have been on. The customer service was amazing and so attentive The attendants did everything they could to make the flight more comfortable.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable but Nothing Special We went Premium as it was a long haul. Having heard so much about this airline we were both, I am afraid to say just a little disappointed. Perhaps we were expecting too much.

I really don't think this class was worth the extra we paid over economy. To be brutally honest and to make a sort of comparison,  the Emirates  economy Dubai/London flight on the Airbus A380 has always been a better experience. 

All I can suggest is that when going long haul then do the research , especially aircraft type used.
label: neutral

text:
Smooth ride, needs improvement on water served with meals It's my first time to ride this airline because I'm a budget traveler and this one happens to be one of the expensive yet known for comfort and service.  

The reason I took it because of the 16hour flight to Johannesburg compared to 22hours in other airline but the price is double.  Compared to my option airline who just had a crash that's why it's so cheap I decided to take Singapore Airline.  I immediately felt like the plane is not overused compared to other airlines that I'm used to taking.

When food was served, I ate and drank the water that came with the food (not the one served). It tasted like tap water or worse than that I thought it might be the food I ate but I tried it again and informed the crew and sent a complain letter (they were apologetic, no I didn't get anything) just to be sure I also sent a letter to Singapore airline because that water came from turkey and it may have traveled far or whatever it just tasted bad and very bad for their brand.  I'd still travel using Singapore airline because their business is primarily taking people to their destination and food is just part of this service.
label: neutral

text:
Technical difficulties on a A-380 Flight should have departed at 21.45 and we boarded at 9 pm and sat on the tarmac with a computer related problem until 3 am.  Finally the captain decided to deplane the passengers who were really hungry by then.  We had been offered water and a small packet of peas after 2 hours and a packet of potato chips after 4 hours, but no substantial food of any kind.

I’ve been in this situation before and usually a round of drinks is offered after a couple of hours delay and snacks but no such luck this time.

We then waited at the airport lounge for two hours to get taken to a hotel where we checked in at 6 am and were told to get some refreshments from the breakfast buffet (which wasn’t really open until 6.30).  By the time our luggage was in and we could hit the sack it was 7 am and we were told to be downstairs ready to go back to the airport at 11 am.  That meant a maximum of 4 hours sleep!  As it turned out we had 3 hours, then gathered at the lobby at 10.45 only to be told we would be picked up at 1.30 after lunch!

Coordination was not good.  Refreshments on board could have been served much quicker.  It took ages to sort out transportation to the hotel and then we were misinformed about onward arrangements.  Eventually the flight was scheduled to leave 20 hours later at 5.30 but was further delayed an hour to 6.30 pm, so why we needed to be up and ready at 11 am was unclear.  

Once onboard things were smoother and although many had missed their connecting flights, we were taken care of much more efficiently in Singapore airport:  we were met with hotel vouchers, and allowed to take individual taxis to the hotel, which minimised the waiting time and reduced frustration levels. We were also given a $100 voucher to use against a flight or duty free shopping.

Not a great experience but managed fairly well overall.  Flight safety is what we need and a fresh flight ensured that !
label: positive

text: Premium Economy sadly lacking Paid for Prem Econ as these were very long flights.   Had left NZ on AirNZ Pem Econ and really enjoyed the experiences.  However, Singapore Airlines Prem econ was basically economy with a larger seat.  Sadly lacking in a number of areas that Air NZ provided - separate toilets from Econ, nicer food, better service with dedicated stewards, hot towels, plenty of snacks.  Definitely wouldn't book Prem Econ with Singapore again unless they improve their offering.
label: neutral

text: First return flight to Europe We flew from Sydney to Paris on 13 October 2018 with a 2.5 hour layover in Singapore.  We chose Singapore airlines on the basis of reviews and we weren't disappointed.  The food, service and entertainment were very good.  The seat pitch and width were also very good and overall in terms of cost the flight was great value for money.
label: positive

text:
No Sweat flight by Singapore Airlines The check-in process in Changi was DIY, and I find it more convenient than the usual. Our flight was at around 750pm bound to MNL and our boarding time was on-time. On board, the safety instructions were in AVP format that is not a typical demo of an in plane safety guidelines. It exhibited the various must-see sights in Singapore that you might want to visit.

The duration of the flight was almost 4 hours due to the bad weather condition and air traffic. We experience slight turbulence but the whole flight was smooth. You can also choose latest movies, series, music and games to pass the time. The cabin crew were accommodating and warm when I requested for extra blankets. The in-flight meals they served were delicious. We were also offered ice cream for dessert! 

It was my first time to fly via Singapore Airlines and I would definitely recommend them for those who will travel soon.
label: positive

text: The Boy From Forres Absolutely 1st class service even in the Economy section of the plane, We flew London London -  Singapore then onto Tokyo and the same on the way back. Food, Snacks, Drinks and Entertainment were superb and with proper cutlery. Staff on all flights were fantastic and couldn't do enough for you. We had a 5 hour stopover in Singapore on our way home and best Airport I have ever been in with loads to do. All in all Singapore airlines in my opinion would take some something special to beat them for service.
label: positive

text:
Airline cancelled my fight, still no refund after 5 months Booked a flight from Vancouver to Tokyo October 2022 through a travel agent. After 2 weeks of being asked to accept changes to the flight Singapore Airlines cancelled my ticket with no explanation. Was offered a refund but told it would take 12-14 weeks to receive despite being Airline being required to refund within 30 days by law. Still no refund and customer service just respond with generic "we've passed your information on to the relevant team".

Avoid booking with them if travel time and money are important to you
label: negative

text:
Always a joy to fly SQ Took Singapore Airlines to Seoul with family.  As usual, greeted warmly at the gate to the plane by the staff/s.  Service is top notch..from hot towel to drinks..to food...in flight entertainment.to my destination; everything is worth paying for a smooth, timely and comfortable journey.  The crew/s are a delight to watch as they worked with swift and efficiency; always there to offer their beautiful warm smiles plus great service.

Singapore Airlines has always and will be my chosen airline to fly with.  Timely and smooth flight is one of my criteria when choosing an airline to fly with; together with excellent in flight service by the crew/s.  Keep up the good work..all crew/s of Singapore Airlines!!
label: positive

text: Best Airlines Excellent Airlines with very good on board food and infotainment. You can watch letest movies and shows. Paid Wi-fi facility available. You can get $20 vouchers if you have return tickets.
label: positive

text: Very poor service Flew Frankfurt to Adelaide with transit in Singapore. We are frequent flyers with another airline and were absolutely shocked at the poor service by Singapore Airlines. Our flight tickets cost $5,500 each for economy! On our first leg (12.5 hours) we were offered 1 meal within the first hour after takeoff then absolutely nothing, not even a beverage for the next 8 hours! I went down to the cabin crew to ask for food and was only offered a fun pack size chips and snack size Kitkat! We were then served an extremely small breakfast meal just before landing. Couldn’t believe the cost cutting! Four times the price and no food nor service. In the second leg (6.5 hours) we weren’t offered a single thing, not even a beverage until 1 hour before landing when we were hurriedly served a tiny breakfast. Absolute shame on Singapore Airlines taking advantage of Aussie citizens trying to return home. Stealing money and starving their passengers who are spending days travelling just to get back!
label: negative
negative

text: Most comfortable seats we have tried in a long time This was an economy flight with excellent service and very comfortable seats. We were able to sleep for 7 hours on a 13 hour flight which is just what we needed. It is unusual to experience such comfort and service in economy class these days. The flight attendants were very helpful and responsive to your needs; all in all this was an enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text:
Great inflight Staff First time I have flown with Singapore for years actually..  The inflight staff were wonderful very attentive..  I class myself as an easy passenger nit always getting them to my seat..  The only thing is that unlike other lie flat beds you have to pull the seat manually to get the mattress down..  I couldn't do it but the staff came straight to help me..  On the next flight I actually didn't bother and just put the seat as low as it would go..  I am not a large person so was fine for me..  The food I love and you can order your food before you travel..  
On the way back from the UK I was left for ages in a holding area because I needed assistance if it was a looong walk which apparently it was..  
On my last leg to Brisbane the plane was sooo old a lot of the buttons didn't  work or got stuck..  The poor flight crew were apologising and it held them up tremendously fixing stuff that wouldn't work..  I did complain for them really and I know others did as well..
The crew made my flight..  

A word of warning..
 ## I am a Kris Flyer member but for some reason it was not on my booking so I did not get my ff points..  I did ring them but they wanted information that I had not kept even though I checked in online they could not trace it..  I have booked again for Sept 2019 and would you believe it my ff number was still missing..!  I was disappointed that I lost over 20000 points and would have again.. ##
label: neutral

text: Best airline in the world The Buissnes class is the most wonderful traveling experience I have ever had. The service from the staff is absolutely amazing and they are the friendliest stewards and stewardesses that I have ever flown with. If you are planning on hopping on a plane then I strongly urge you to fly Singapore. The economy class is also exceptional and the stewardesses are still very friendly.
label: positive

text:
Economy meal in Business Class. I have had very unpleasant experience on flight from Singapore to Melbourne recently. Was expecting very high meal standards from a Singapore Airlines Business class. 
This was morning flight from Singapore. After breakfast was served, flight attendant took the order for dinner service. I was first person to be served and order taken as my seat was 11a on airbus 350-900. This was several hours before the meal which was fine. 
I have ordered chicken. When meal service started at dinner time I was told that they are out of chicken and can offer me lamb or vegetarian meal. I was surprised why I wasn’t notified earlier and especially when I was first person to be taken order. 
After that I opted for the lamb. I have obeserved that there was a several chicken meals distributed to peoples seating behind me which was strange.
When I tasted the lamb I was not satisfied with this meal as it was very tough ( chewy), had strong smell and taste. Similar as you put raw lamb meat to cook in microwave without any seasoning.!  This meal made me unwell and I rejected it.
I told flight attendant that this meal is unbeatable. She then suggested for last option to have a meal from economy class.
I couldn’t accept anything as my appetite was gone.
This gave me a lesson to pre book a meal before the flight or eat at the lounge where meals are prepared by proper chef and full kitchen. Not a microwave.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines are not what they were We had a comfortable flight from Melbourne to Singapore . Coming back from Tokyo to Singapore  and Singapore to Melbourne was extremely uncomfortable for me.Tokyo was quite cool when we embarked  so had layered clothing on. We we seated in economy directly behind the front row where there is paid leg room. I am average size and sat in the middle of three seats. The person in front of me reclined all the time an my seat reclined only a little bit. Consequently my knees were touching the back of the front seat all the time an could barely move my arms either and was very hot and uncomfortable.  On the next flight form Singapore to Melbourne I thought I would feel better having removed a couple of layers of clothing expecting the flight to be warm. We were seated in the row in front of the back row where the air conditioned air for the whole plane came in (not overhead of individual seats). The whole row shivered in blankets the whole flight. It was not healthy and far too cold. The food was good and adequate.
label: negative

text:
Missing luggage My trip with Singapore Airlines-SQ (business class) from Jakarta transit 1 hour in Singapore to Pudong, when check in i already make sure that luggage will directly transfer to Pudong. Arrived Pudong, i couldn’t found my luggage, then i came to Information desk and staff said that my luggage was left in Singapore, and they would bring it with the last SQ flight tonight, but because i was staying at hotel around 3,5 hour from Shanghai, my luggage would be received within 2 days..... can not believe that! very disappointing. How come such a big airlines had bad service ?!. 

I really helped by the hotel staff and driver where i stay with their quick response and coordination they could deliver my luggage from Pudong Airport to my room hotel early morning. 

I hope case like this become lessons learned for SQ to improve their service in future.
label: negative

text: Service and more- whether you are flying coach, premium economy, Business or First Class Singapore airlines has consistently ranked as one of the worlds best airlines, and there is good reasons for it no matter what cabin class you are in (I have been in all of them~).  If you have a choice for Asia, there is no better airline to choose
label: positive

text:
Disappointed All crews didn't help at all even I had 1 year old baby 
The worst experience for his first flight 
Not welcome at all
label: negative

text:
The very best airline the world has to offer by far Travelled out with my family from LHR on a 777-300er in economy which was incredibly enjoyable all the way. Literally managed to sleep like a baby as the seats were so comfortable the leg room brilliant with firm footrests the recline was like that of premium on most other airlines and the width at 19” is as good as you will find in the industry anywhere due to the generous 3-3-3 config where as most other airlines operating 777’s will squeeze in an extra seat to make a 3-4-3 configuration (try emirates for example!).Food and incredible choice of beverages fantastic help yourself snacks of various kinds whenever you want them the cabin crew were as always so professional friendly efficient and helpful. IFE is superb with a great range of movies and all manner of entertainment both new recent and old and a screen monitor which is massive for economy with a separate touch screen remote. Also excellent quality in ear headphones for you to keep!
Blankets pillows eye shades socks combs tooth paste/brush razors shave cream and vavrious other amenities all provided. Toilets spotless as was the cabin and it’s lovely calming ambinence.
Then onwards on a 3 week old 787-10 journey to Bali/1 year old A350 Jakarta - Singapore and brand new one month old A380 back to London with its equally and superb new cabin design.Again all these other sectors were also absolutely fantastic and replicated the initial outbound journey form LHR.Singapore Airlines fleet is incredibly new when compared to many other airlines they just keep getting better and better and never rest on their laurels for a moment.
Service levels are top notch both in the air and on the ground. CS team are always spot on and will do everything to help within there means I cannot fault it.
This airline has never once in my 25 years of flying with them disappointed or let me down in any way and you will not find a better airline in the skies today hence their number 1 status in skytrax and TA amongst others.

You would have to really be one of life’s miserable moaners to find much if any fault with SIA but unfortunately as we all know some people will complain about anything for various ‘motives’ no matter how good the product or service.

I highly recommend anyone to fly with this airline you won’t be disappointed and you will have a fantastic time on board.
label: positive

text: Service on Singapore Airlines is always good Prefer Singapore Airlines to any other.  Their planes are clean, the seating is mostly comfortable (unless seated next to someone large), the food is of a good standard and their service seems to be better than on other airlines.
label: positive

text:
All excellent The flight was very nice. The seat was very comfortable and there was space to leave my bag in front of the seat. The flight attendants paid extra attention. I had lobster thermidor on the flight and my glass was always filled. I was offered all the desserts they have instead of only 1 choice. 
But, one thing that I would suggest, the check in process is not that smooth and the staff looks like she had a very bad day. Please place someone professional as he/she will be the 1st person we meet.
Overall, my choice will always be Singapore Airlines if possible!
label: positive

text:
Great seats. Great Service. This is an early morning Airbus 330 taking passengers from Changi to Perth. We left from a small enclave in Terminal B that houses gates B1-B4 behind an additional security check. Leave time for that. Once you are inside the enclave there is only a very limited cafe for food.
Flight was delayed due to weather.
Seats have lots of storage areas.
They offered a wide selection of magazine and newspapers to read.
Breakfast was served.
label: positive

text: SQ staffs on TURBO mode the whole time! I just don't know how you did it....your SQ girls are always on TURBO mode. I must comment that Ms Yan Ting Lam was all smiles the whole time and eager to go the extra mile tirelessly for all her passengers. Her service was such a stark contrast after 3 weeks of the French's zero service. She just spoiled us! In addition, Ms Chiang Cheng-Pei and Ms Tay Yi Ling also evidently showed enormous passion for their work, which is hard to come by in today's society. Despite the limited resources available in the air, Ms Chiang Cheng-Pei even decorated the tray of mints very beautifully for us. Please find attached photo. Another pleasurable surprise! Even if they switch off that Turbo mode for a while, we wouldn't mind!!
label: positive

text: New and better A350-900 aircraft Compared to SQ's refreshed 777-300ER aircraft, the new A350-900 aircraft was much  more comfortable!  We sat in 3-3-3 economy class, for a 14hr flight from Singapore SIN to Stockholm ARN, with a short easy 1 hr transit in Moscow airport DME.  The flight was very quiet, even when someone walked by. We also felt a major difference in the air quality.  The smell of food was quickly dispersed and air was fresh throughout the flight.  Services was friendly as usual, and they paid attention to transit/returned passengers. Very pleasant flight journey, with delicious food selections including Russian pancake served on the 2nd leg between DME & ARN.  Hope SQ will deploy more new 787-10 and A350 aircrafts soon.
label: positive

text: Always Good I have been a regular flyer on Singapore Airlines for more than 30 years, mostly for long haul flights. The airline is consistently very good, providing one of the best levels of service in the industry.
label: positive

text: Awesome Best flight ever, attendants were friendly and helpfu but the best thing was the food. Flight was smooth and even though it was long it was comfortable.
label: positive

text: Four flights but service very different on each one The first flight from Heathrow was by far the best of the four flights. This was partly down to the stewardess. She was very efficient and the food service had everything we wanted to order. Between meals there was a selection of snacks and chocolate.  Second flight from Singapore to Auckland smaller plane and the stewardess seemed so much slower, or maybe she had more passengers to look after, I am not sure. Anyway the choice of meals when she got to us was very limited. I have a mild nut allergy so there was nothing I could eat. The snacks between meals were limited too, no chocolate as on the first flight. The third and fourth flight were back to to a bigger plane, but again the snacks were limited and the ice cream they brought round was almond based with no alternative, so I could not have one. Drinks between the meal service were served on a request basis. The seats on all flights seemed very small for a long haul flight, I am only 5’ 3” and fairly slim, but I did not have enough room to be comfortable for such long flights. All in all not all bad but could have been better.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline We have travelled before with this airline and yet again an excellent flight. From the booking to flight service the staff are very good, food for an airline is also good. Would travel with them again and recommend you to try them.
label: negative

text: Disappointed For an airline supposedly No 1  I have to say my wife and I expected more. Cramped leg room , 2 meals for a 12.5 hr flight , the first within an hour of takeoff and no drinks trolleys. We were given 2 beakers of water/juice for this long haul flight. Only after seeing a person on the seat in front having a beer I enquired if alcohol was available. I was told it was but you have to ask for it. The flight costed nearly £2000 for the pair of us and it appears we have been spoilt by Emirates in the past. Maybe other classes have a better experience than ours .If you want best value this Airline is not the one for you I'm sorry to say.
label: neutral

text:
Excellent service unparalleled from saleha I was on April 12 7am flight from sin to bkk and the service was beyond excellent esp from saleha or saleya (sorry I can’t recall) 
She could anticipate what I wanted 
Like a mind reader ! 
Super service unparalleled! 
And I travel alot on many airlines in j class 
Thanks so much 
Pls keep up the great service and that’s what makes sq the world’s TOP airline 
I’m proud to be a singaporean :)
label: positive

text:
Top 5 Best of the Best Beautiful Clean New spacious planes. A 350-900...Friendly helpful courteous flight attendants..
Easy courteous check in counter.
Seats and individual space is very good.. Blankets and pillows are very nice quality.
Good entertainment system with excellent 12 inch touch screen and noise canceling 
headphones... Overall selection for content good...not the best.
Nice amount of food choices. Snacks were just ok.
Bathrooms need additional amenities.. As the personal kit does too.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Pleasant flight no problems usual excellent service and very clean modern A380 have used this air line many times and normal high standard.
label: positive

text:
I expected a lot better Business Class

The lounge in Charles De Gaulle - Horrible,  cheap wine and food that even the servers didn't want to eat.  I complained about the food and was told "the boss makes the food decisions and I bring my own in"

The flight:-

My wife filled in our food choices before we left home,  the attendants didn't have ours requests
The food we did get was served after the people who had pre-booked the choices
My wife sat next to me and got her food 15 minutes after me and 40 minutes after the passengers who hadn't had the pre-orders lost
The food was BLAND
I got my cutlery after my first dish was served and taken away
We had a passenger with a terribly loud cough,  he coughed for the duration of the flight - horrible, impossible to sleep

The return flight they forgot to take all the packaging off my burger,  I ate half a piece of paper,  is this really good service?
label: negative

text: Good Flight to Davao A good direct flight from Singapore to Davao.   However, the return flight to Singapore is via Cebu, so it is a five hour plus duration flight.   That said, the flight service is what one expects for Singapore Airlines Silk Air.   Through no fault of my own, I missed my original connecting flight and had to re-book.   This process was painless but when I checked in for my new onward flight, I was told that there was no note of me on the system.   Despite me having a receipt for the new booking charge.   The Check in Agent sorted the problem out for me but there was a bit of a wait to get this done.   I will use this Airline, for this journey again.
label: positive

text:
experience varied on different flights Seating excellent in business class.
Seats were comfortable and very roomy. Flat bed was excellent and there was plenty of space.
T.V screen was large so made viewing movies very enjoyable.
Downside.
staff -this varied on different legs of my trip Melbourne to singapore they couldn't care less mimimun service.
Singapore to frankfurt excellent. staff attentive food service prompt.
return trip also varied although food on morning flight sparce. Singapore to melbourne food service very slow. Took nearly two hours from asking what you wanted to food being served.
If you want comforatble seats and a good bed then I cannot fault them. It was excellent. They just need to improve their business class service .
I did note that my flights had a very big business class section so maybe they need to increase the staffing
label: positive

text: Superb airline The whole flight from start to end was wonderful. The cabin crew were very attentive and the food was great. The lounge in Sydney was great too.
label: positive

text:
Wonderful International Experience It was my first flight experience with Singapore airlines on this non stop flight from USA to Japan.  I had always used other airlines for my international flights.  This was better than I expected. Economy seats are still relatively roomy. Meals and drinks were really good.  I'd fly with them again if I can find a good price.
Their hub on West coast seems to be at LAX so I would have to connect there to utilize them more.  Hope they will expand their stops.
label: positive

text:
Good prices but service was pretty poor Good prices for flights but the service was pretty poor. Ran out of meal choice for entire economy class for dinner. Everyone was left with a disgusting fish pasta goop. Most were left barely touched. Never offered drinks on flight except with meals.
Return journey the food was much better, but after supper cabin crew disappeared.  Not once were drinks offered except with meals. Standard practice to keep passengers hydrated but not withthis airline. Paid extra for exit row seats for extended legroom. Seats are narrow. Customer service was awful. We booked 6 months ahead. But found out day before travel we were seated opposite sides of the plane. They were unwilling to remedy this. No upgrade or rejig seating . It took 5 phone calls and 4 hours to change flight for the following day
label: neutral

text:
New A350 - 900 short haul  Again seats comfortable but configured differently to the long haul version. I would guess slightly less leg room but again not a problem. Food and service as expected from Singapore - excellent.
Minor dislike - seat belt for take off and landing lap strap plus shoulder to lap strap - a little uncomfortable but not in use for normal flying.
label: positive

text:
Almost perfect We enjoy Singapore Airlines and prefer to pay a premium to get reasonable flights time travelling during daylight hours. For the travel from Perth to Phuket S.A. worked well, despite being twice the cost of low budget cariers that would take many more hours. Our less than perfect score related to a few glitches on the way home.Our deprture from Phuket was delayed by 45 minutes. 

This combined with a 65 minute connection in Singapore (a need to change terminals) and that we had been seated in different rows on the leg, saw the stress levels rising by the minute. 

An email to Singapore Airlines as soon as we found out we were travelling in diffrent rows was eventually answered theday after we travelled. However at the check in the customer service rep, raised an eyebrow as to why we weren't travelling together and quickly sorted it out. 

On arrival at Singapore the staf pulled out all the stops to transfer a dozen passengers to the connecting flight. To their credit we not only made the flight we arrived at the schduled time. Duty free shopping and a chance to stretch the legs at Singapore a long forgotten option.

The audio/visual equipment on the Singapore/ Perth leg didn't fully work on my wife's seat. Not a big problem and the dozen movies she could access satified her requirements.

Singapore Airlines, a great carrier, will continue to be a fan and fly again. This most recent flight was one of the few times we had less than a perfect experience.
label: positive

text: business class was great but not the best I have flown I am a Krisflyer and I upgraded to Business class.The flight was comfortable but found the service not as good as with other Airlines. Struggled to open my bed and only standing waiting and with irritation did someone show me how. Not many offers of coffee or something to drink. No mini bar available for the flight.  With other flights they put your mattress down, and make sure you are comfortable. I felt I was ignored.
label: neutral

text:
Poor experience Hi, I booked flight with Singapore airlines for my family (return ticket from (Sydney to Bangalore 24th December) for my family. 
I was told by Singapore airlines that my flight from Sydney to Singapore section is changed from SQ8517 to SQ8669 (same date, same time).

My ticketing agent is has sent several messages to Singapore airlines for alternative travel options for the last 1 week. Now Singapore airlines is saying we can pay you the money back as all the seats are full. This  is unacceptable. How can the seats be full when we have the tickets and we have the confirmation email directly from Singapore airlines.
We called Singapore airlines and one person agreed to provide us seats in the new flight. (Ref No: 03735724).

We booked this ticket 2 months in advance and booked my mothers surgery based on this itinerary. 
We are having an extremely bad experience with Singapore airlines.

Please honor your commitment and provide us the same tickets on your alternate flight.

Best regards
Vivek Gupta
label: negative

text:
Long haul - no seat recline or entertainment! I had done the late evening flight from Perth to Singapore, so looking forward to relaxing and sleeping the next 10 - 11 hours to Johannesburg.  I was lucky to have selected a bulk head row, so my leg space was ideal, the entertainment on the wall in front (slightly larger screen) was perfect set up for my plan of a movie with dinner and sleep.

Unfortunately the hand controls for the 3 seats in my row did not function, so a lift out of the seat to touch the screen in front was the only way to manipulate your choice of entertainment. I then discovered my chair would not recline.  The flight attendants tried very hard to fix my seat - the plane was a full flight so there was no other seating option for me.  As mentioned earlier I was lucky I did have extra leg room, so the sleep position was not too bad.  In these cases, I would not hesitate to draft feedback emails to the airlines - I paid for entertainment from the ease of my chair and I also expected a reclining chair on my long haul flight.  To my absolute surprise, nearing the end of our flight as we were getting ready to land in Johannesburg, the senior flight attendant presented all 3 of us with a voucher and apologised profusely about the entertainment issue - he then cam round to me and presented me with another voucher for the inconvenience of my non-reclining chair.  The vouchers were to the value of $175.  Very impressed with the service Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Perfect as usual Perfect going over. I was dissappointed coming home as had booked and paid for an economy seat but was waitlisted for a business upgrade usoing my extensive Krisflyer points. On check in, I was told that there were business seats available for the Male to Singapore section but because I was only a Silver Kriscard holder, I was not able to use my points to obtain a business seat upgrade!! Very very annoying as it would have been a great way to have used up some of my over 200,000 krisflyer points. What's the use of them if they won't let you use them when the opportunity arises?
label: positive

text: Food quality Always fly by singapore airline, normally is good service and excellent food but this time was disappointed about the food that served. Quite tasteless and not attractive to kids , adult . Need improvement at this area so that the traveller will be more happy when eating.
label: positive

text: Long haul from Australia First time I have flown with Singapore Airlines I was very impressed with the quality of service the attentiveness of the stewards/stewardesses.  The food was okay for airline food and the staff constantly offering drinks to keep you hydrated.
label: positive

text:
Amazing A wonderful experience, as always!
I fly between Europe and Bali twice every year and it is a long rout which doesn´t feel so when flying with Singapore airlines. Everything is excellent , comfortable and pleasant, especially the Cabin crew,
label: positive

text: Good food, good in flight entertainment. Can’t ask for much more when you’re stuck in a tube for 12 hours! Long haul is usually unpleasant no matter how you do it so the practicalities that you CAN change are done well by SG.  If you travel with kids (we do) their food options are good and their kids movies and entertainment has kept my guys happy for hours and hours on end.  The staff always happy to help and all of the above is more than you can say these days about my home based HK airline....
label: positive

text: Memorable journey warm and polite staff.service excellent.makes even the economy passengers feel as if they are traveling business class.very comfortable flight
label: positive

text: WOAH. FLY WITH SQ This was a fascinating experience. As I sat into my seat, the stewardess offered me a warm towel and I felt very very welcomed. They treat you too well haha. The seats were comfortable. They even gave me a teddy bear haha idk why.
label: positive

text: Easily the best airline we'd been on. A fantastic experience on both legs. On the return to Bangkok, I believe the aircraft was the 787 Dreamliner - super nice. Lots of space for seating, luggage and large, gel windows. The entertainment system , had an excellent choice - one or two compulsory ads but fair considering what you get in return. The food was great - Chicken and potatoes, caramel ice-cream, noodle salad - a generous portion of everything including the service: absolutely on point. The staff were dedicated, service minded and even found time to be charming. You win Singapore Airlines - when we fly again on this route - It's you and only you.
label: positive

text: Amazing service Superb service, comfortable seating and very good on board entertainment. Even in economy one was able to sleep as the headrests were a godsend.
label: positive

text:
Relaxed friendliness Great flight with really happy aircrew who just wanted to make sure everything was spot on.
From getting on board to the gate in Houston they could not do enough. Thanks it was fun!
label: positive

text:
OLDER SQ SUITES STILL A CHARM Recent trip to Tokyo
A trip worth a millions smile and waris the heart when you see you family utterly enjoy the trip Which was made more worth with us Flying on SQ suites.
SQ was and is the trend seterusnya in airline industry.
All services was exceptional right from airport checkin to boarding.
Needless all onboard services is epitome of SQ “ A Great Way To Fly”
Cant wait to experience More of SQ charm on our next few SQ flights
label: positive

text:
“A Great Way to Fly” I always using SQ for every long flights (ex : going to South Korea & Hongkong) and their service was very superb! One thing that very memorable for me was the Bibimbap for dinner when flying to Seoul last year. It super delicious! But, unfortunately they change the menu for my second time flight this year. I missed the Bibimbap 🥺

But, I always have a pleasant time flying with SQ. Oh, and their wifi is super fast! 👍🏻👍🏻
label: positive

text: Outstanding Flew the Dreamliner from SG to Ho Chi Minh City.  Superb service.  Although I didn't book a vegetarian meal, when asked the FA was so courteous, she actually found a veg pasta for me.  Full of appreciation for her consideration.  I don't know her name but she was serving in the AFT section and I was seated in 71A.   Truly a good flying experience.
label: positive

text: A Comfortable and Stress-free Flight Although full, the cabin crew dealt with everyone in a calm and orderly fashion and helped the time to pass quickly and comfortably with the minimum of fuss.
label: positive

text: still as good, but avoid the fish meal has been flying SQ for more than 30 yrs, still as good, but recent trips, the fish meals onboard were not good at all. Shd hv order chicken instead.
label: positive

text:
Slightly Above Average I heard people said that Singapore Airlines is good and decided to try out for myself. Overall service is better than average, food is OK, in flight channels are quite limited,
maybe  because its only a 7 hour flight.
label: neutral

text:
Excellent even in Business Class Singapore airline doesn't have First Class on SIN-SFO route. Flying on Mar 31, the business class only has one sit available at the front section, the crew team was outstanding, compared to the first class, I have to say the business class team was extraordinary, they can take care every guest for everything and every requested with a timely manner.

I would like to special thanks to the on-duty captain, sadly I forgot his name, he is such a nice and gentle guy with his smile and personality, is hard for you to not like him, I guess his crew must be very enjoyable to work with him, thanks for your honey tea and some snack. And a very beautiful female crew who work at the front business class section too, she was so helpful and efficient, my Choya on the rock so tasty, thank you. Sorry, I couldn't remember everyone's name, there a still one gentleman was really nice. However, I couldn't remember. Many thanks for everyone's hard work, will definitely fly Singapore airline again.

P.S. To Singapore airline chef, Please improve the Soto Ayam, Sorry but I have to say that's the worst Soto Ayam I ever had. Thank you!
label: positive

text:
Undisputed No.1 airline in the world Whilst I am a top tier frequent flyer with SIA and have flown 100s of flights with them, I realised I had not reviewed them here.

I will not fly any other airline if I can help it.  They are simply exceptional.  Whilst I am lucky to fly First Class mostly, it is the warmth of the service from the crew that you will experience in any cabin.  They really serve from the heart, nothing is too much trouble and they are so intuitive.

I get a buzz of excitement whenever I am about to board an SQ flight - it's one of the best parts of the trip and sometimes you just wish the flight was longer!

Keep up the good work SQ.  You soar ahead of the next best and you hand down beat the competition on product and service alike.
label: positive

text: Adelaide to Colombo Singapore airlines offers the best route from Adelaide to Colombo, Sri Lanka in a day. On line check in and a 30kg luggage allowance provides hassle free worries. Seat selection upon booking is an additional cost but worth it. Seating is very comfortable and great friendly service. Worth considering this airline for  a continuous flight to your destination if available.
label: positive

text: Very let down Travelled with my partner and our two children to visit family in Ireland with a stopovers both ways. There was trouble from before we even flew when we weren't given the seats promised. My partner then had to spend several hours on the phone to try and get it all resolved only for it to be changed back anyway. The crux of the issue appeared to be that they left out youngest (<1) off our booking. She had a ticket but it wasn't connected to the rest of us. We ended up with 3 long haul flights with no kids meals. Even had one flight where the seat they had allocated for our 3 year old had her sitting by herself. We spent another 2 hours while on our holiday trying to sort it all out for our return leg but no one would take ownership. The call centre people wouldn't put us on to a supervisor and on more than one occasion even tried to end calls with us simply because they couldn't fix this issue. It was in the 'too hard' basket. We were promised call backs that never happened. We couldn't do online check in because of the issue which meant standing in queues for an age. When I tried to explain it all to the service desk in Singapore on our way home the best they could do was put us to the front of the queue after we'd already been waiting 45 mins. No apologies or even willingness to understand the issue. We paid a lot of money for these flights on the basis that Singapore Airlines is supposed to be good. They definately were not. We have flown with Emirates previously with our first child and the service we got from them was out of this world. Perhaps Singapore Airlines could learn a thing or two.
label: negative

text:
Generally good experience All flights were on time so no problems with connections.Space verwezen chairs was ok for me(i m not that big), food was not that great,was expecting more.Crew was friendly.
Luggage didn’t arrive on time,they brought it the next day but had to wait till 3pm @our appartement to get it,altough got 150$pp cash for delayed luggage.
label: positive

text: It was as expected  I would have probably liked a bit more fruit available through the long flight. The food was tasty but something fresh during the flight which you can help yourself like qantas would be good. The flat beds are good but limited space for feet. Entertainment system is excellent with a good range of movies. It’s clean and they try to make it quiet for you.
label: positive

text:
Wrong and Misleading Representation Hi 
I booked ticket and my Booking Reference Number is : 6EEAYL. 4 People 16th December 2022 to 02 February 2023 with free Change of Date Policy offered by Singapore Airlines.

I booked this ticket because they offered free Change of date policy with payment of additional fare or refund lower fare.

Now when I wants to change date they offering me $ 1531 to escape refund situation on the other side same ticket they offering @ $ 1284 each to others or new customers.
( proof attached)

I think this is violation of their offer and cheating and misleading with existing customer.
label: negative

text: Great company Excellent service. Confortable aircraft. Food was amazing. Crew allways looking to serve you and provide a great experience.
label: positive

text:
Friendly Cabin Crew, Great Service, Unrivalled Inflight Entertainment, and Yummy Food I was able to experience the new Business Class seats, which I thought looked smaller but was surprisingly comfortable.

There were more places to keep your items as the placement of storage areas were well thought of. 

For example, the many newspapers one would normally grab before boarding, could now be slotted neatly where the inflight magazine and menu is kept.

There is also a storage area, just below the pop-up table/tray, where you can comfortably place a water bottle.

USB port & headphone jack are within reach with a conveniently located side table top (above the pop-up table/tray).  Oh, it's quite cool to just push a button to "eject" the tray - easy and no effort required!

Space below? Lots of it! You can store your back-pack, notebook and still have space to stretch your feet. Sweet!

The inflight entertainment? It's really good.

My only complaint is the poor wifi connectivity and the difficulty to link my phone to the inflight system via the SQ mobile app....mmmm (btw, it was fine on the SQ flight from SG to Beijing though and in my previous SQ flights).  

And the cabin crew on this flight? Very friendly and it's always nice when they remember your name when you disembark - top marks!

As the tagline says, "a great way to fly" :)
label: positive

text: Attention by cabin crew is courteous and good. Check-in was expeditious and helpful with a wheel chair for my wife. Most helpful in particular to my wife who needed disability attention. All requests were attended to promptly. However, seats were not comfortable; perhaps due to age of the aircraft. Meals were ordinary and not palatable. Baggage claim was uneventful as bagge was slow to appear on the carousel. Attention of cabin staff was professional.
label: positive

text: The service is impeccable. The crew are not obtrusive but are always willing to help. The flight from from Zurich was delayed by a 4 hours. However, the staff made sure that a voucher for USD 50= was provided and the inflight service was faultless.
label: positive

text:
Absolutely fantastic, extremely friendly and professional As a major treat to myself, and to make visiting my sister in Australia bearable, I decided to fly business class.  My routing was LHR - SIN - PER - then Virgin Australia on code share to BNE, then BNE - SIN - LHR.  Singapore Airlines are consistently ranked in the top airlines in the world, and for good reason.
Every aspect of my interaction with them was outstanding.  The seat on the A380 was fantastic and very private, the food and service outstanding, the crew professional, and friendly - learning your name and addressing you by name throughout the flight, with nothing too much trouble.  I flew on the A380, A350 and 777.  For sleeping I found the 777 had the most space and was most comfortable, then the A380,  The A350 is more of a regional rather than long haul offering, and the seat was less comfortable and spacious as a result.  But all in all, I loved every minute of flying Business Class with SQ - the lounges, the pre boarding and first off / priority luggage off, as well as the pre departure champagne on board.  Worth every penny!
label: positive

text: Since few years ago, had very bad experience, I won't get this flight again. I have a carry on baggage(standard size) hope to put in some where I can see, but I could not find any compartment what is empty, because they all put blanket. I request flight attendant put no so far with my seat, after few mins I see a flight attendant get my case all the way to the end of the cabin, then I ask where is my case but no one want to answer me, then I request the attendant name who get my case, no one want to tell me, so I press service button and ask cabin crew, the crew ask me don't compliant otherwise his pension will reduce 70%, is it interesting?  PS: The flight experience is 10 years ago, I don't have real date, need to check my previous flight schedule.
label: negative

text:
Nice long distance flight We always choose to travel by Singapore Airline. This year December holiday we took Singapore Airline to Barcelona. It was a full flight, maybe 5 to 10 seats not occupied. There are some babies and toddlers on the flight. Generally the flight was comfortable with some mild turbulence. The crew worked tirelessly to serve the passengers. During the 14hours flight they give out water regularly, almost every hour. Plenty of snacks (sandwiches, crackers, peanuts, fruits) available at any time.
The meal was a supper and breakfast and both are pretty good, although unfortunately most passengers prefer the noodle dish rather than the sausage dish for breakfast, buy most of them do get their 1st choice.

Plenty of toilets available and if you go before meal service and arrival, you don't really have to queue for it.
The entertainment system is superb with large screen and plenty of movies, music and games to choose from, including for the kids.
There is plenty of space at the overhead compartments with many compartments not full.
Definitely the best way to fly to Spain.
label: positive

text: Improved service We have an opportunity to fly Singapore Airlines again . This trip was much better than last time . The day time flight service is much better than the midnight flight .However Changi Airport legendary reputation let us down this time . As the flight from SIN to BKK was delayed by bad weather preventing the loading of baggage , the communication was very poor especially the premium passengers were not informed so we waited on the floor of the waiting pen for more than 1 hour . Not good enough Changi Airport
label: positive

text: Highest standards This review is for a return journey.  We flew the Brisbane Singapore route on the A350 900 regional aircraft and the A380 on the Singapore London route.  The regional aircraft is very comfortable in both sitting and lying.  We were not as comfortable in the A380.  Sitting up straight and lying down was okay but lounging was very uncomfortable with a seam in the seat that ground into one's coccyx. We had window seats mostly and they  felt very private.  The staff were exceptional as always on all flights and the bathrooms were kept clean and tidy.  The choice of food was best from Book the Cook and there was an excellent wine choice.  Speciality coffees are welcome.  We unfortunately heard criticism from other passengers when we were delayed boarding on one flight.  I do think we need to be more generous and understand the world is still getting back on its feet since COVID-19.  Thank you Singapore Airlines.  You made our trip memorable and nothing was too much trouble.
label: positive

text:
Best company for economic Hi,
I travelling with different companies around the world but this one is really good !! 
The crew Is very very Professional !! Is not just a Job !
Is listening , helping and giving all the time during the trip.
Close your eyes and travelling with them !!
label: positive

text: Not worth the extra money The first flight was quite good but the return flight was cramps and not much different from economy. I was also a bit put put when I had to go to the loo in economy. Not that I mind that but there was less pressure on the first class and it seemed to make more sense as I was nearer. The crew were good on both flight s but better on the first. The second was the middle of the night and was redeemed as not full.
label: neutral

text: Standards have fallen I used to think that SQ was the best, my how standards have fallen. I waited for over 2 hours in Melbourne Air while they figured out how to un-jam my seat (wheelchair).  I suspect this happened at SQ Air loading and instead of delivering my repaired chair  to the club, I waited in the check in area.  The flight itself was poor, I have experienced better flights in economy.  QF your many minor faults are forgiven!!!
label: negative

text: Good flight great service! Singapore Airlines is my airline of choice for long-haul flights to Asia. The service is unbeatable and is worth the occasional extra $$ when compared with other airlines. The stewards and stewardess are always friendly and accommodating. I have never had to ask anyone for help to put my bags up on the overhead compartment on SQ, but on an occasion have had to bear through grimace with some unnamed American airlines. Inflight entertainment is awesome but meals on this flight can be improved as I have had better quality food on long hauls from SF or LA to Asia. Must agree, a little expensive compared to other airlines I've tried, but I rather pay more for a little more comfort through a long journey.
label: positive

text: Delhi to Singapore seemed too short a flight... The check in was easy, and the Silver Kris lounge at Delhi was very relaxing and provided just the right amount of refreshments and food items. All the ground staff were friendly and efficient (don't get me started on the airport officials though... but that is another story), and the inflight crew looked like they stepped out of a fashion magazine and just had their hair and makeup professionally done, but we all know they were just like us, rushing to the airport from their hotels... The food served during the flight was surprisingly good, and my wife who always sleeps through what she says are boring meals, surprised me by eating most of her supper. Amazing. The movies on board were another pleasant diversion that made me regret (sort of) the "short" flight because I calculated that I could only watch 2 movies out of the hundreds available. Oh well, we can always look forward to the next time.
label: positive

text:
Flying Business Class I have flown with Singapore airlines many times and cannot fault their service. Business class adds a new dimension in service and comfort with their lie flat beds a real treat on long haul flights. The seats are extremely comfortable and the crew really do try to make your journey as pleasant and trouble free as possible.
Now you would assume that this would guarantee 5/5 but unfortunately there is one serious fault. The toilets are too small and there are not enough of them. This is a major flaw in an otherwise terrific service. 
This will not stop me using Singapore Airlines as the cabin crew are warm, friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text: Best to oz along with the mid east airlines I have flown 10 times back and forth from the uk to australia with singapore airlines and they are always the no 1 choice to go economy with. Especially on their newer A380 where the legroom in economy is good even for me at 186cm. Second choice is qatar or etihad via mid east. Prefer singapore airport though as so spacious and lots to do. Food and service always great with singapore too.
label: positive

text:
First time flying with Singapore Airlines My return trip to Bangkok meant I flew on Singapore Airlines for part of my trip.

I hadn't flown on Singapore Airlines before but heard good things about it.

The first thing I did was download the Singapore Airlines mobile app. I'm able to use it for international check in for the Singapore Airlines flights.

Boarding was pretty easy and the seat was a good size. It had plenty of leg room and an entertainment system with a lot of movies/music.
