The cabin crew were efficient and polite.

I experienced the complimentary hot towels at the beginning of the flight. That was a nice way to start the flight.

The inflighy meals are were tasty and perfect for the flights.

The one thing I was amazed by were the complimentary toothbrush/tooth paste and combs in the bathroom. That was pretty nice as it meant I didn't have to grab my own one out of my bag.

Overall it was a good experience and one that I would like to experience again.
label: positive

text: Best flight! This was the greatest flight I have every been on. The service is above and beyond amazing. The flight attendants are super friendly and offer warm towels at the beginning of the flight. It feels clean and roomy and I landed safe and on time. I can’t wait to fly this airline again!
label: positive

text:
Great service and staff Our family of 4 greatly enjoyed our flight with a stopover in Singapore.

The service and flight was so good, the crew were helpful and friendly and we all loved the food. It was delicious.

The boys were given a kids game each and the inflight entertainment was great.

We will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.

I also had to call customer service from Sri Lanka to book the flights I had found online, for some reason my card wouldn't work so the customer service call line was brilliant, the lady booked the seats and organised my payment. I have had this issue twice before with other airlines that were unable to help so I am very grateful for the service that Singapore Airlines provides.
label: positive

text: Birthday + Holiday Trip Silkair for our journey to Male & SIA for our journey home.. Even though we board 2 different airlines but customer service of the cabin crew was nice...
label: positive

text: Fly in comfort Great flight as always! Great in-flight entertainment, great food, great service and comfortable seats. SIA our preferred airline!
label: positive

text: Beware if you book Premium Economy  I booked a premium economy seat in November 2022 for my flight in October 2023. When I arrived at the airport I was informed I was in economy class. I could not get a seat in Premium Economy on that flight. I am now in dispute with Singapore airlines as they say I never booked Premium Economy but I know from the price I paid I did. The flight was okay, definitely not the same as when I’ve travelled with them before, very disappointing
label: negative

text:
Exceptional, but not without Issues Our direct flight going to Singapore (18hrs) was everything I had hoped for from “the best airline in the world”, but not without issues. My seat pod had some issues with the movie/audio system. The flight attendants were immediately apologetic, attentive and helpful in trying to reset my individual seat’s system. After multiple tries, they couldn’t get it fixed, but were able to move my wife and I (traveling together, seated side by side) to different seats. It was a mechanical error and they handled it pleasantly and quickly, enough said. However, an hour later, the flight attendant manager came back and apologized for our issue and gave me a sizable airline voucher, that I could also use to shop in their in-air Kriss magazine. Now that’s over and above.
Our return direct flight (14hrs - tail wind) had some issues as well, but those were flight attendant related. Again, my wife and I are seated side by side. The flight attendant handling my side of the plane was having some issues. It was easily apparent by their  demeanor and the consoling of the other attendants. As a result, they were less attentive and somewhat absent the entire flight. I know, because I saw the attendant on my wife’s side come numerous times asking if there was anything they needed.
To sum it up, our first flight was a 5+ star service flight and the second was a 4. So, I can’t truely give them a 5-star rating, but I don’t want to hold an airline accountable for one flight attendant having a bad day...we all have them. However, I can give them a 4-star with an explanation and recommendation of it being a 4+ star.
label: positive

text:
Unanswered Complaint I made a complaint nearly a year ago and had no response.  

trying to book ag fight the ticket agent had said he did not get my email which later was found to be a lie as his colleague acted upon it.

This meant I had to fly a week later.  This cost me and my company time and money as I noted in the complaint to them.  Not even an apology!

The ground staff and head office could learn from their onboard staff as the service is very good.  Just so disappointing that gan airline of their reputation lets themselves down on the ground.
label: negative

text:
Great Service - Terrible Aircraft Everything about our trip was amazing other than the plane on the longest part of our journey.

Our first flight was from Phuket > Singapore …… the service and staff were excellent and went over the top for a short haul flight. Very pleasantly surprised.

Our second flight was from Singapore > London Heathrow. 

The staff were beyond perfect.
The service was by far the best I’ve ever experienced from an airline.

The only disappointment throughout our entire trip was the plane. 
Singapore Airlines decided that for this 14hr 25min flight it would be  acceptable to put us in an out dated and run down 777 that really looked and felt its age. Im pretty sure it was nearly 20 years old and it really showed. 

Damaged upholstery, old toilets, out dated accessories, very loud and noisey  ect…..

I had been looking forward to flying with “the best airline in the world” but unfortunately we experienced that in service but not the facilities.

Come on SA ……. Surely this isn’t right?
label: positive

text:
New plane This was the new Singapore Airlines plane from London to Singapore. I have to say I was quite worried as the picture of ecconomy class were few and far between. 
On the way out from London we got a row of 4 seats in the middle, they were supprisingly spacious and the arms lifted up, this was a benefit to us as we were a family and this created more space. It also aloud children to lean on you when they slept. The head rests also bend which make things a little more comfortable. The only problem was how cold the plane is kept, not sure if this is for a specific reason but wrap up before boarding.

The service was good, which is what they are famous for, the staff are super friendly and seem genuinely kind. 

In the return journey we paid for seat in the seat forward section expecting to board first etc but this is not the case you board last? 
We also opted for the 42 k seat ? which has the extra leg room however when you choose these seats there is no overhead storage as all the emergency equipment is there. So your bags are put at the back in random places. This makes getting off the plane impossible as no one will let you through to retrieve your bags and then they will not let you back to you seat again as they want to get off the plane before you even though the plane is not allowing anyone off yet!!
The other down side to this seat aswell is the screen is folded down not on the back of a chair, which is fine but if you want to sit to eat your food you have your knees at 90 degrees and there is no leg room as the casing for the screen digs in to your legs. So you have to spend the whole flight with your legs stretched out! The seat also feels narrower and the arm rest is fixed.

In the end we would recommend just opting for the middle seats and leave these well alone.
label: positive

text: A little squashy A little squashy, food was lovely, but they had run out of chicken so most people had to have fish, service was excellent and the flight was great.
label: positive

text:
Customer service rep. commended Flight booked for travel in May.
Usually cautious, I advertently called a scam travel agency disguised as SA inquiring on how to complete the name fields on their website.
By the time I realized I was being scammed, they had already gotten my booking reference number and last name.
Lesson learned.
The scammer did not have my credit card details but had access to my reservation and could change or cancel my reservation at any time.
I pleaded with several SA agents to protect my booking reference by adding a password or change my number to no avail.
Finally, I was lucky to have this amazing SA agent take my call. 
He was very cordial.  When I explained what happend, he  submitted a request to a change my booking reference number.  He called the next day to confirm approval of a new number and patiently went through my reservation to be sure the information was accurate.
Wow!  I'm so grateful this kind agent went out of his way to help!
label: positive

text: Another happy flight Plenty of legroom in economy. food good as usual. crew attentive and friendly. luggage allowance very good 30kg
label: positive

text: Outstanding in all aspects. Singapore Airlines are the best we have ever flown with! From checking in baggage to boarding, excellent. However it was the level of care from staff during the almost 14 hour flight that tipped the scales towards Singapore Airlines. Our seats were comfortable and the in flight entertain was quality.
label: positive

text:
Brilliant Staff Give Brilliant Service In July 2019 we had 4 connecting flights in total; Manila - Singapore - London then 2 weeks later the return trip London - Singapore - Manila. The cabin crew on all flights were 100% brilliant. Honestly they could not have been better. My wife is disabled and can only walk a little with assistance and received willing hands to guide her on and off the plane. During the flights the food and service was the best I have had for economy class. Polite, courteous, cheerful teams. Very pleased with Singapore Airlines - definitely the best.   However the airport ground staff left a lot to be desired at Singapore and London Heathrow. On the outward trip at Singapore they lost our own wheel chair for more than 10 minutes. Confusion abounded while they used an airport wheelchair to put my wife into the special assistance buggy and despite our protests about the whereabouts of my wife's chair they were about to drive off to the next terminal.when someone arrived with the chair.  Then the assistant helped us to the next terminal and took us to a special lounge for  passengers who needed assistance, where we had to leave my wife's boarding card. We had no intention of staying in there for 2 hours, hidden away from 3 other family members, so we moved out, found the others and made our way through the shops towards the gate for the London flight. But then I needed to let the assistance people know we were at the gate and didn't need their service. A very surly response at the lounge while the lady shuffled some papers and tapped her terminal, "You can't cancel now I have all these to deal with." "I just want to take her boarding card and I will be on my way" "No you will have to wait." 5 minutes later, " Have you got her passport?" - So i had to walk back to the gate and get the passport then return to the lounge. Eventually received the boarding pass but to this day I cannot understand why they needed it behind the desk. In the gate, we had a helpful assistant and onto the plane with no problem. 
Return Journey from London and what a farce Heathrow check-in is. I had already completed on-line check-in but we have to join hundreds of confused people milling around the various check-in terminals where it's supposed to print our boarding cards but didn't print for all the party. Then we have to attach our own bag tags before moving to another queue to hand over the bags. What they achieve by this self service check-in is unknown to me. Instead of 1 orderly queue we used to have we now have 1 chaotic queue to use the self service check in (having paid the same amount of money that we used to pay someone else to do it ) then join a second queue to check-in the bags. Then just as we were to board the plane we, a party of 5 were stopped because they thought we had checked in 7 bags. We had only checked in 5 bags plus wheelchair. This guy was insisting we have to find the one additional bag - which we knew nothing about. Then a senior person arrived and allowed us through. London Airport = Total inefficiency. Arrival at Singapore and told there is no wheelchair. by the ground crew. I told him I saw it handed over at the plane's door when we entered at London. "No, it's not on my memo, so we don't have it." A 5 minute argument then took pace when we were even told "She will have to walk."  Eventually the correct wheelchair appeared at the doorway, so off we went. Arrival in the Philippines could not have been more different. Wheelchair built for the plane aisle used inside, our own wheelchair ready and waiting at the doorway and escorted all the way through the baggage claim, border check and customs, no problem at all.
Summary: Flight crew 100% perfect. Ground staff at Singapore need training in all aspects.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines First Class A-380 Suite I was Fortunate to get a Points upgrade from Business on the Second leg from Adelaide to Shanghai.
Wow I thought Emirates First Class was good. This is better Suite wise but with Less Bling Bling.
   Suite is enormous almost like a Study or Office Space.  2 x Plasma Screens. Booked ahead online and Got pre Booked Lobster Thermadore ! yum

   Seat is a full 360 Degrees seat plus the added comfort of a pullout full size bed which is not the same seat so 2 different seating zones great if you want a nap and then food comes you don't have to put seat up and start allover again. Very Private and there is ability to book 2 Suites which can be turned into a double Suite providing a Full Size Double bed for your Partner. (which Have booked for April next year so will write again.

Flew over in First on old 777 was like chalk and Cheese really 777 First is not worth the extra over business but certainly on A380 a Huge Jump. Invitation to the First Lounge and Private room at Singapore was also a Nice Touch were I was greeted by Concierge who Seemed to know my name and greeted me by my name without even seeing my boarding pass which was a shock However upon entry to lounge which was enormous and could easily seat 100 people (not private room) I notice there was only 3 other people there so lacked any ambience and was almost Library Quite I then realised how she knew my name as was the only person they were expecting!. Me and my guest actually turned around and went in Business Lounge!! 

Only upper hand that Emirates has is the Full Bar in Business class Singapore has no Bar on Plane nor does it have the Fantastic Shower that Emirates operate in First. However all in All a much bigger Suite than Emirates. Have also flown Qantas First and British Airways before and they are simply miles behind in all aspects.
label: positive

text: smooth flight smooth flight from singapore to dusseldorf; timely takeoff, warm reception by the crew, and friendly professional service throughout the flight. point to note is that you can book the chef and order ahead for business class meals
label: positive

text: Poor attention and sloppy service at Singapore Airlines Economy Class During SQ flight BKK- SIN I requested hot tea with lemon and coke. Flight attendant did not pay attention then gave me a salad sauce instead of coke and tea lemon. I was speechless and shocked with salad sauce...I repeated my request for hot tea with lemon and coke. Flight attendant politely smiled and skipped my request. I flew 2 1/2 hours and did not get any hot tea and coke. I think there was poor attention and poor sloppy service. I was thristy for 2 1/2 hours on the flight then bought a water bottle at SIN airport after arrival for next connecting flight. Bad experience.
label: negative

text:
Good travel From the check in the staff were friendly and efficient and the flight was a little delayed.
Lucky to have an exit seat with some extra room.
On board the staff were some of the best I had encountered. Loved their job and happy to assist in any way, they just made it that much for enjoyable.
If this is a sample of the standard of hostess they select then Singapore Airlines is a great way to fly.
label: positive

text: Great airline! Very efficient . Friendly air hostesses. Toilets were clean. I loved that they switched off lights so we could sleep the entire flight. Did not feel the flight time. We ordered Muslim meals. One ws great the other ie fish and rice was not so great. I would definitely fly this airline again
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - The Only Way to fly To Singapore. We had seats 51J & 51K, to be honest, I would buy Premium Economy when next we fly.  Food was good & although they ran out of one meal that I preferred, they gave me one from another area which was appreciated. Staff were great & the entertainment of variety of movies, music etc. was very good.  We have flown Singapore Airlines to Singapore a number of times & like their service plus on long haul flights a stop-over especially to not get jet-lag on the way back to Sydney staying in Singapore for us for 4-5 days is ideal.  If you find nothing to see in Singapore, then you are not looking, so stay a while & enjoy such a lovely country to visit.
label: positive

text: Quality service Starting with a  nice check-in, with agents plenty of smiles. When in the fly, there's un excellent service from the crew, always checking for your comfort.
label: positive

text:
Love flying Singapore Airlines This flight was served by SQ's new regional 787-10, as a result in 2018 I have now flown on all the 787 variants.
The flight itself was great we left on time and food on board was great. Surprisingly I enjoyed the food on this flight more than on my flight from Munich in business class. The aircraft is comfortable adequate leg room for a six footer
label: positive

text:
Perfect match Great trip with perfect match for you how travels and need to work hard arriving in Sweden and in Singapore.
Morning flight from ARN and your off to Moscow in two hours flight.  Perfect if you run off the plane in Moscow you have time for visiting shopping and buy Beluga vodka and caviar, then back to the plane again and you have 10 hours to eat and whatch a move then sleep, arriwing in Singapore 06,40 with frech and strong soul.
I always take the train in to city, you can by a turist card 3,5 or 7 days for like 70 SGD.
The way back home to Sweden starts 00.05 in the night so you have the hole day in Singapore. Then you wake up in Moscow, get some great breakfast, have more time to buy Beluga products ;0) The of to Sweden and only two hours left in the plane.  Great work Singapore airlines and Star aliance
label: positive

text:
A350 experience An excellent flight aboard a near new A350 with very good inflight movies. 
Flight was 100% full and despite having an oversized passenger alongside I was not inconvenienced due to adequate seat width and pitch + he was very polite and contained limbs within his own space.
Meal service was very slow as cabin crew repeatedly attended to minor pax requests.  The chicken dish was very ordinary thigh meat in an indiscernible sauce of dubious origins.  
Drink service was similarly affected although crew did offer pre-poured beer and juices.  The Spanish red wine offered was the roughest el-cheapo stuff ever ... Chilean sauv blanc excellent by comparison.  Why do they serve rubbish like that when Aussie reds are so plentiful and inexpensive?
label: neutral

text:
This rating is solely given for the crew's immaculate service & excellent skills of the pilot's on both to & fro trips We travelled on Suite class on SQ A380 both ways to & fro Sin Ldn about 2 weeks ago. 

We have also done First Class from Singapore and returned from London in 777 suite pre-COVID before.

This review is a comparison for these 2 trips both Sin-Ldn and back.

Cons:  

1)   Pre-Covid FOOD served on Board --- We were extremely impressed with our first class trip from Sin - Ldn.  I am a foodie.  The food served on this leg was very memorable.  We always order the lobster from book the cook because my partner loves to eat seafood and for me I was never once impressed with their lobtser served on their business class normaly. 

This pre-COVID first class trip meal was the best I ever had on SQ. The lobster was done very well and prepared more extravagantly than what we were normally offered on normal business class. U could tell it's first class with a big difference.  Pre-COVID, SQ also offer delicious Japanese Kaiseki Meal on First class which we paired with sake.  Really felt like having a Michelin star meal. 

- Recent trip on A380 suite from Sin to Ldn. Food in the Private Room was good. We had lobster in laksa gravy. The lobster was fresh and laksa gravy was good.  We did not eat much because we have ordered our meal on board from book the cook.
It was a mistake; we should have had our full meal in the private room before boarding the plane because after that all the main courses quality went downhill.  

We ordered the lobster and beef from Book the Cook.  There is no difference in terms of taste, quality or presentation from the Business Class we flew to France 2 months prior.  Very ordinary and was not tasty at all.  The beef was overly salted. In fact I prefered the beef cheek I have ordered for our business class to France. Didn't expect the Food on Suite can be so disappointing. Total letdown. 

The only saving grace was a delicious chinese clear soup served from Sin to Ldn.  The same  soup was served on our returned flight and was not tasty at all.  

Food on both return flights from London to Sin was not palatable.  The mains were bad and the dessert was even worse.  i even commented to a flight stewardess that some economy class box meals on regional flights tasted much better.  

2)  In my opinion the seat for Suite class is not as comfortable as the business or first class seat.  The only plus point is you get an extra double bed if you travel with a partner. To be honest I much prefer a business / First Class seat.

3) Business class 2 months ago-  Passenger will not be provided with amenity kit if one does not request.  Unlike in the past the stewardess will ask if you would like to have one.

4) Suite class Feb 2023 - There is no lip gross in the amenity bag.  Luckily I brought one along myself.  SQ used to include little crystal fishes' ornament in the past for your collection but now not anymore. There are not many items provided.  So please bring your own.

Pro:

1) It's spacious.  You will have the feeling that you're staying in a small hotel room rather than on an airplane.

2) Service. 
    i)  Pre-Covid service on First Sin- London was excellent + excellent
        returned trip on SQ 777 suite was forgettable

   ii)  Recent trip to & fro Sin - London on A380 suite, all the crews were very attentive and prefessional.  

I flew with my partner.  SQ has sent an email to my partner requesting for a review but I didn't received one.   Hence this review.
label: neutral

text: South Africa to Australia Singapore airlines has the best economy meals, with the flight an free day tour of Singapore was included. entertainment on board was good. Service was great.
label: positive

text: No More the Gold Standard! Returning from Norway we flew Singapore Airlines on two long haul flights, Heathrow to Singapore and then Singapore to Melbourne on their Boeing 777-300ER. Although we were in Premium Economy, there was nothing premium about the service. For starters there were no complimentary amenity bags despite these being long haul flights. When requested, it took the crew member a long time to return to us with an old looking amenities bag which had obviously seen better days. All it had was a cheap pair of orange socks and a toothbrush/toothpaste. The food was nothing to shout about and the service was inattentive. The seats were uncomfortable and trying to find a comfortable position to sleep even with having taken a sleeping tablet proved difficult. What was truly disappointing was the fact that the toilets had to be shared with Economy. It meant a walk to the back of the plane to join the always long queue! Definitely not a premium service and not worth the money spent. Standards have fallen due to complacency! Won’t fly this airline or recommend to anyone else. Another airline now wears the crown; we’ll definitely consider the other airline.
label: negative

text:
Delayed Baggage I have been in contact with the airlines but they never replied. I want a refund for the delay of my baggage. I had to buy clothes for my two kids because all of our clothes were in the luggage. We arrived Friday and got the baggage next Wednesday!

Also upon booking the flight I already had troubles. So frustrating!
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines to Australia My wife and I flew with Singapore Airlines to our eldest daughter's wedding in March. I was impressed by the attention to detail and friendliness of all cabin crew on all of our flights.
The cabin crew actively kept the main public areas of the aircraft clean, also this airlines toilets were the cleanest and best maintained of any airline that I have flown with.
label: positive

text:
The overall experience with this airline was good Whilst the plane was a bit on the old side the service was excellent.
Check in was relatively easy and the staff friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text:
Experience wasn't nearly as good as the reviews. This airline consistently rates as one of the best in the world, but this route seems to be a red headed stepchild because there wasn't much to cheer about.  

--The food was fairly poor by Business standards.  (better artisan breads would have saved a mediocre take-off meal)  

--The furniture is outdated and needs a re-do.  The cabin's lie-flat beds seemed like they were from the first generation of true lie flats. You have to manually turn the back down and the average person would have a hard time putting it back up.  I saw flight attendants put their full body weight on the bed to release the lock.  They were actually pretty good for sleeping, but there was no opening for leg room directly in front of you to stretch your legs while sitting upright.  You have to turn cock-eyed diagonal in your seat to put your feet up and twist forward to face the tv screen.  

--Check-in and customer service is very good and I could see here how they really shine in other "more important" locations.  The business class lounge in Changi airport is really, really good.  Really.  It should be the standard for most of the other big airline lounges.

Hope they fix it.
label: neutral

text: Very Comforting The flight from Brisbane to Jakarta via Singapore was very comfortable even though I was in Economy. I had a window seat. The only unfortunate part about having a window seat that if you need to go to the toilet or stretch our legs you have to ask the 2 passengers to move! So, when they got up to go to the toilet I did too!! The crew were very courteous and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble! The plane was clean and tidy and smelt fresh. The meals were very nice - lunch and a snack. (It was a midmorning flight.)  We landed in Singapore and had to change planes at Singapore and had to rush from Terminal 3 to Terminal 4. There was  45 minutes between flights. If anyone knows Singapore airport, sometimes there can be delays and trying to get from one terminal to another can be very rushed. I managed to get to the right terminal and boarding gate in time. The flight from Singapore to Jakarta was very good too. I had a seat with plenty of leg room. Shame the flight was only about 1.5 hrs.  Again the crew were very courteous and friendly. Because of the Corona Virus, all the crew wore masks throughout both flights. Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines I have travelled on!!
label: positive

text: Good but not the same as a few years ago I have made this trip a few times on different airlines but on this occasion SIN made sense due to price on Business Class.  I used to fly with them all the time and always gave them a 5 star rating and couldn't fault them for service or facilities.  This time I was disappointed on a couple of things when compared to other airlines.  First of all the business class on the B777 is not to the same standard as on their A380 and was only comparable to Premium Economy on other airlines. Surprisingly there were no amenities bags as on all other airlines Business Class.  Even economy class pax get an amenities bag when travelling at night.  I had two 12/13 hour flights so expected something.  I didn't find the entertainment system as good as others.  On other airlines they have had the latest films but these were older so little to watch on my long journeys.  The food was good but choice not as wide with lots of chicken and not much else.  Only different from economy in that it was served on plates. As usual service from staff was good but even that was hit and miss.  For an airline that made you feel very special the attitude of staff was not quite the same.  Overall a good, safe airline but given a choice i wouldn't fly with them again.
label: neutral

text: Excellent from start to finish Always an excellent experience to travel with Singapore airlines. Service is extremely professional, food and beverage is in a class of its own and in flight entertainment has something for everyone.
label: positive

text: Second trip on this great airline Another great flight with Singapore Airlines, nothing too much trouble for the staff. Drinks and food aplenty, comfy and roomy in economy. Planned this trip around flying with them
label: positive

text: Very uncomfortable flight both ways , unusual for Singapore airlines ! We have flown Singapore airlines a number of times now , but our experience this trip was disappointing . I swear the seats are even more narrower ! And the food frankly was horrible ! I do not want a curry early in the morning with all other choices gone ! I had a cup of Luke warm tea ! & a bread roll ! However the plane was very clean & the staff very pleasant . May well use a different carrier next trip .
label: neutral

text:
A pleasant flight & great service. I was very impressed with the cabin crew who were very attentive and professional.
The aircraft presumably has seen a lot of service but that was overcome with the excellent service.
label: positive

text:
Poor arrangement and ground services when on a delayed flight Due to closure of Changi runway, the KL-SPORE flight was delayed and as such, we missed our connecting flight to Christchurch on SQ297. The overall experience was extremely disappointing and VERY POORLY managed for the onwards journey.
We are travelling in a group of 3 including my elderly mother aged 75 yo. Upon arrival at Changi, SIA provided alternative arrangements on 2 different flights. I told the ground staff that we have an EXCEPTION case here (and expect an exception handling case). I am travelling with my elderly mother which is dependent on me. We need to travel on the same flight and NOT on 2 different flights. 
I was told to liaise with Krisflyer directly as mine was on redemption ticket and my mum on a paid ticket. Despite me being in Changi i.e Singapore and that we missed the connecting flight due to reasons beyond our control, I was seeking some kind assistance to help with the rebooking of flights with some urgency as the next flight of which my mother was on will depart just under 2 hours for Melbourne and then onwards journey to Christchurch. I was just offered a phone and I have to spend more than an hour or more in a stressful situation to convince both Krisflyer on the PHONE and ground staff to help me on this exception request. Many calls and discussions between SIA, Krisflyer, SATS and myself follow through. With much regret, SIA reputation did not live up to its name and my expectation, having very good experience in the past. Rightfully, in a situation like this someone within SIA should take charge of the entire situation without having passengers kept in the waiting and pursue/manage/deal with different teams. At the very last, SIA allowed me on the flight to Melbourne  45 mins before departure, thanks to a gentleman by the name of Mr. LIM.
Apart from incurring extra expenses and a lost baggage (upon arrival), I wish to raise this to SIA that you have caused unnecessary stress among us – not that I am claiming any damages whatsoever but please look into this with utmost importance so that this does not repeat if similar case were to happen in the future for your passengers. TQ
label: negative

text: Singapore sling Really enjoyed the attention to detail that Singapore airlines offers. From check to arrival everything went really smoothly. On board food and drinks (especially the Singapore slings) were enjoyable. In flight entertainment was a little limited compared to some other airlines but more than adequate. Would definitely fly again with them. New attractions at the Singapore airport well worth seeing.
label: positive

text: Cancelled flight and would not rebook Singapore Airlines cancelled the flight and was placed on a waitlist for a new flight, blocking all the website functions from cancelling or changing flights. After contacting them three times (email twice and chat function once) h and waiting two weeks for a response, I have still not received a call or new flights. As the last straw, I bought a local sim card and tried calling the helpline. I was on hold for an hour, and then the line disconnected. I understand things might be difficult if I want to change my flights, but I am shocked at the response from Singapore when they cancelled the flights. I will never fly with this carrier again.
label: negative

text: Soaking (I mean soaking!) wet bags upon arrival! Used to be great, gone waaay downhill! After arriving in SFO we got home and opened our bags to find them drenched with water. Lots of damage to our gifts that we had purchased. Contacted them and they said they need to review our case. It took a week and then we were told “oh yes our customers bags got wet but we tried to keep them dry” so here is a coupon for $75 Singapore dollars that you can use in our shop!!!! How disrespectful. Also make sure you pay extra for you seats because they did not want to give us seats together (my husband and myself) . I finally convinced them that we should have seats together and I was told they were making an exception and we were lucky. Got onboard to find a nearly empty plane!!!! Horrible customer service, disrespectful compensation . Never again after flying this airline for over 20 years I am done ! If I want low quality service then I will fly any number of the competing airlines for 1/2 the price! 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼
label: negative

text:
Very dissapointed by business seat configuration Had huge expectations from this flight considering SAI amazing reputation.
Starting with the good:
Food service as absolutely great.
Attendants service was wonderful
Drink & alcohol selection was good
I was extremely disappointed by the seat configuration, which while in the layflat position, actually forces you to try and sleep diagonally (for me, legs to the left).
I was not able to get 1 minute of sleep due to this
for comparison, flight back was with Swiss - Normal business seat - Slept 8 hours like a baby...
Another small thing: I was very surprised that they don't give away amenity kits to business class passengers, not to mention Pajamas (which are very common with other Asian airlines on long haul flights)
label: neutral

text: Flight Delay Notification I took flight SQ406 from Delhi to Singapore on 1st December.the flight was delayed by 6hours however I got the notification way in advance so that I don't have to wait at the airport.Also it was a nice gesture by SQ that they provided food coupons of 500 INR for all passengers and a nice big chocolate as well.would love to fly SQ again.Thanks Singapore Airlines for your nice gesture and value your customers.
label: positive

text:
A long haul journey Bangalore- SFO BLR-SFO being one of the longest usually covered within 22 hrs if direct, was split into BLR-SIN, SIN-HKG, HKG-SFO with the same itinerary for return by the airline, for obvious reasons being an economy ticket, to cover the sistance in almost 35 hours including the breaks of layover. The online booking of tickets does take time with intricate details and mistakes, if one does not have a family name/surname ! 
It was long but tedious journey and the only saving grace being the excellent service in the aircraft. Food was good but the drinks were rationed. The attitude of the staff was excellent and welcoming. The security and immigration at Hongkong was boring and caused tension, though the number of security checks and immigration checks were indeed disgusting.
label: positive

text:
Worst service ever, not sure why people speak so highly about this airline Terrible experience.

I booked a window seat but they put me just in the middle which it is completely opposite of what I wanted. I complained on the plane but nobody wanted to help me, then I complained when I landed in London and according to them, I selected a middle seat (the customer service in London was quite rude). Why would I select a middle seat prior to my flight if this is not what I wanted? Anyway, they said in the end that because they are right, there is no way they can help me.

15hours of flight in a seat that you do not want to be at is not the best experience. 

In general, I would say and after flying with other airlines in economy to Singapore that the service for most of them is pretty much the same. I paid a plus of 350£ for this airline for the good things I heard about them but it is not worth the money. Also, I never had this issue. Hence my struggle to understand why this airline is so good.
label: negative

text:
Damaged Luggage Policy - APPALLING Singapore Airlines' damaged luggage policy is appalling - it excludes damage to wheels, handles and even cuts to your baggage - see copy of policy below.  It appears that SA doesn't actually cover any damage to your suitcases.       I just returned from a trip to China and found that the handle on my expensive Samsonite suitcase had been damaged.  I have traveled a lot (mostly with Qantas) so knew that I had to immediately report the damage at the airport.  However, at the baggage counter for Singapore Airlines, the exclusions were pointed out to me. The exclusions are extensive - see below. I couldn't believe that Singapore Airlines will not cover damage that they have done to your suitcases.  Seriously?  However, I would like to note that the lady at the Counter was very empathetic and nice to me - which took a bit of the sting out of SA's horrible policy.

SA Damaged Baggage Policy
Except as the applicable Conventions or other law or regulations may otherwise require, we do not assume liability for normal wear and tear to baggage. This includes:
  Cuts, scratches, scuffs, dents and marks that may occur despite careful handling
  Damage to, or loss of, protruding parts of the baggage including, straps, pockets, pull 
  handles, hanger hooks, wheels, external locks, security straps, zipper tabs or other 
  parts attached to the baggage
  Unsuitably-packed luggage (e.g. over-packed)
  Baggage accepted under the conditions of the Limited Release tag – this includes 
  items retrieved or confiscated by the airport authorities or security personnel
label: negative

text: Premium Economy Singapore to Amsterdam - Not Value for Money. Our first experience flying this class with Singapore was booked as part of an Air NZ flight from Auckland to Amsterdam so we boarded this flight after first having traveled premium with Air NZ (which was far superior). We liked the Singapore premium check in service, as this was separate from economy so it was fast with no queues, and boarding the plane was also better as premium boarded separately from economy. After that, things were not so great. Seats were leather and looked really nice but width and leg room were almost no different from economy, toilets were shared with economy, and there was no separation from economy area either so the economy rows just continued after the last designated premium row, with economy  seats sticking out into the aisle. We also found this same layout on Lufthansa and it was just weird.This also meant you were still sharing the same space as economy so got no respite from the usual noise, slow food service, toilet queues and other disruptions of economy. We were lucky and had bulkhead seats on the return flight  so we had good leg room and could easily get out of the seats, but on the first flight we were in the second row and my husband could not get out of his seat without asking the person beside him to get up as there simply was not enough room between the seat rows. Air NZ is much roomier in both width and leg room, and in recline. Food was average, there was a menu to choose from. We have flown in economy for this same trip on several other occasions, and in our opinion for the extra cost of premium seats, we don't think it was worth it. Basically we paid extra for a faster check in and that is about it. Singapore  is overall still one of our favorite airlines but they need to re-think their premium economy offering.
label: neutral

text: Not a pleasant trip For a flight such as this one, the flight attendant in my section seemed to lack proper training which is very strange for SQ. She was unsure of everything and was constantly being scolded by the superior in our section. I grimaced with how horrible she was. She was playing with a baby during take off and landing when she should be focused. She didn’t know our class couldn’t use business class bathrooms. She also gave the wrong food when we told her what was wanted. Basically, she failed miserably in her job performance. This made air Asia and other budget carriers look so much more competent. The flight was fine but for such a Long flight it would be nice to have a children section in both classes as babies were screaming for the duration of the flight making me wish I took a different flight.
label: neutral

text:
Amazing trip best staff in the sky you won’t find better TRAVELLING with 2 babies Cabin - stunning puts its rivals to bed & keeps Singapore miles ahead. 

First class new suite. 

Stunning
label: positive

text: The airline take great care if you are feeling ill Amazing staff, amazing service, the food was way too much and so delicious, the on board entertainment was great.  I would recommend this airline to anyone traveling abroad.  I felt incredibly safe and secure, I slept most of the way and I never sleep on an aircraft.
label: positive

text: Best service I have flown many airlines and I have to say that this airline goes above and beyond to make your flight comfortable.   Friendly flight attendants.  Extremely polite and helpful.  Clean and even on a short 3 hour flight we had a meal.  I booked this flight on points with star alliance but didn’t realize my preferences were not transferred and I  am vegan.  The staff went out of their way to get me something I could eat.  Other airlines should take note. This is how it should be done.  Well done SQ.  I will definitely fly with you again.
label: positive

text: Refund I had 13 days left for my passport to expire so I should have not even been able to go on the flight. On top of that they didn't even check how many days I had left to my passport to expire. Then on the flight they didn't treat me good  on the flight. They brought me pork and didn't respect that I couldn't eat it. Then when I got to Germany they didn't allow me to exit the airlines and brought me to the police station and kept me there for 7 - 8 hours. Then I had to buy my flight back  even though I was supposed to get the flight back for free. I want a refund and get my $841 back.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines to Bali The check in system at Changi was all system based. We did it by our self and was hassle free. Even though we reached 3 hours prior to our flight, me and my wife could not get seats together. May be the seats were already taken beforehand/online. The flight experience was excellent and cabin crew were very helpful and polite. The 2 hours 40 minutes flight was perfect and smooth.
label: positive

text: Amazing experience Had been on a business trip and would say had an amazing experience . The customer service is the key differentiation when compared to other airline . They have a excellent service attitude and customer focus .
label: positive

text: Did not meet expectations The service was matter of fact. Warmth and friendliness was missing. The food was average. It had cauliflower salad and a cauliflower curry! Too much rice and too little curry.
label: neutral

text:
Just ok Have travelled business with Singapore a few times and the service was exceptional. This time my family flew a mixture of Premier Economy and Economy to Perth. I have to agree with other reviews you don’t get much extra with Premier economy. Having said that you did get a bit of extra seat width which is the biggest benefit. 

We paid for extra leg room for our Sons in Economy and they had great seats when flying in the A380. I think paying for extra leg room is very good value for money on these trips to Australia. However they were not at all impressed with the food offering and snacks. All very limited, unless you like Asian food, you will be disappointed. Also if you happen to be the last to be served as we were on our leg to Perth or as my Sons were on the return today to London, food choices ran out! That’s not acceptable when so much money is being paid.

Overall I’m not saying I wouldn’t fly Singapore again, but I’ll be looking at other airlines next time I fly to Australia or that part of the world before I make a decision.

As an aside, I also think Singapore IT platform needs updating and spending up. The site is clunky, slow and the app isn’t much better.

Look hard at your options before booking.
label: neutral

text:
The good and bad of business Our plane was the A350-900, fairly new and comfortable seating, but a bit tight with the leg room when trying to sleep on a long haul I felt. The food choices were good, if a little sparse for business class, and the drink selection as per usual was very good.
Found the entertainment choice not as good as it had been on other flights, must have been a quiet time at the box office.
This leads me to the age old question of what to do on a flight which has young children on it, like ours did, and who are restless to the extreme with continuous crying causing a lack of sleep for everyone. No real answer to that problem is there, as we all paid the same money to be there, it just kind of spoilt the trip for us who are light sleepers. Headphones and alcohol only go halfway to solving the problem, and the staff seemed powerless. As we landed, both children slept the sleep of innocents!
label: neutral

text: Always a smooth flight Best in the class. The aircraft, food, and crew all are always beyond par your expectations. Always a pleasure to fly Singapore Air.
label: positive

text: A380 Sydney to Singapore-very little space between the seats,otherwise nothing to complain about service,excellent. Excellent service,seats very close,no further complaints.Very pleasant stewards,accommodating,good in flight entertainment.Return trip back to Sydney better,more space,not full,same excellent service.
label: neutral

text:
Smooth transition for flights, and great care by cabin crew for restful travel Singapore Airlines works well for Economy and Business Class for long haul flights. The seats for international leg are decent for leg room. The cabin crew are also generous in ensuring passengers are well hydrated during the flights. 
On the return leg, we allowed for time to break the flights into two phases and stayed over two nights in Singapore. It doesn't costs much more to do that (for flights) and the additional cost is the accommodation in Singapore but it is worthwhile as thats gives you bonus of time in Singapore plus time to unwind in a place with same time zone, so that you are able to return to life routines and work challenges with a fresher mind and body.
label: positive

text: Great service SQ has never dropped their standand of service. From the check in counter to their cabin crew. Super friendly and polite. There's always a smile in their face. Flight itself cleaniness is super, entertainment are great. You quite a number of movies, shows that you can watch. And more importantly the seat comfortness and the spacing between the front seat n our is good. You dont feel cramped or squeezed.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Warm, helpful, good and efficient service of crews during check in and on board. The cabin is clean and refreshing. The extra leg room seat is always the best choice for economy class.
label: positive

text: Best Airline Ever! It has been one of the most pleasant flight for us! What I can say is...Seamless Experience! Everything is superb and up to Five Stars Airline's Service Standard. We would like to specially thank to Ms. Melanie Liong who were serving our row. She provided the service with full of smile and passionate throughout the whole flight although it was a late evening. Everything is impeccable! Thank you!
label: positive

text: The best! We booked the tickets back from Koh Samui to Bali with Singapore airlines and it was amazing and convenient experiences ever. Super top friendly,  attentive stewardess. The food was delicious. One of the best airlines
label: positive

text:
Flying with Singapore airlines is a must If you have to choose between a number of airlines to reach your destination and SQ is one of them, you'd be doing yourselves a favor to go with that. Travelling with Singapore airlines was truly satisfying. From the food to the service to the smiling crew to the overall comfort, everything was great, regardless it being economy.
We travelled Melbourne to Singapore and back, however on the way we continued our journey to Athens with Scoot. Now that is a different story!!! I felt like I hopped off a 5 star hotel and onto a 2 star. I think that may be for another review!!!
label: positive

text:
Skip Business Class Singapore Airlines Beds -my torso was not in line with my legs so turning on side meant you were sleeping in a zigzag position and when on the other side you could not bend your knees. This is a design fault and needs to be corrected. This is not good for anybody who has any back issues.
Loading -no flight call in lounge at Singapore that's okay but when arrival at gate on appointed time about 20 business passengers were left waiting whilst premium economy was loaded first and seats from 47 upwards economy were also loaded. All before business class. Smooth and early loading is one of the reasons I chose business class.
Suggest Etihad airlines Thai airlines or even flatbed AirAsia.
label: negative

text: Entitled Rude Passengers in Economy Seats Rude couple in Bulkhead seats fully recline entire trip, even after being asked by Singapore Air Staff to raise  - over 20 hours
label: negative

text: Great Flight during COVID Relatively fast Check Inn with Singapore Airlines Business Class at Shenzhen ISZE).  However, the health procedures take sometime (there is heath quarantine)  form to complete online.  I ask question incorrectly which results in some delay (to my frustration).   The normal passport control and security -pretty easy.  The Shenzhen International Terminals has no shops open and no restaurants.   There is only vending machines for drinks only (poor!) and even all the drinks are not there.    Board on time.  There is about 30 minute delays as passengers are still passing through health controls.   Business Class seat (lie flat is comfortable) but the enclosing dividers for cubicle makes in seat tramped.  This is shame, and only fault of this plane.  Large passengers would find this uncomfortable and the arm would be pressed in - its obviously management did not test with large passengers.  No beverage service prior to departures, but cabin crew were make coffee / tea for passengers (on case by case basis). I was never asked, but don’t like or coffee.   However, my preordered drinks (whisky & Coke) came pretty quickly.   About 20 minutes (after departure).    I chose the beef option (see below) .   Due to covid all the features will served on one tray.  The chocolate tart (with biscuit crush) was great.   Watched two goods movies.   The staff (as usual) were delightful  and introduced themselves.    Flight arrived just after sunset.  Overall a very good flight.
label: positive

text: Newark to Singapore The 18 hour non-stop flight from Newark to Singapore was a memorable experience. We had read much of the press that detailed all of the preparation recommended for the long flight. None of it turned out to be necessary for us. From the moment we boarded until our landing in Singapore the extraordinary service form the Singapore Air crew was extraordinary. Being a long flight we were able to relax, settle in and enjoy our time together. There was a screaming baby issue that disturbed our sleep for about three hours. Everything else was flawless. The timing of the meals, the sleeping hours, and the lighting all worked together to acclimate us to Singapore time. We arrived feeling rested and ready for the evenings activities. Singapore Airlines is one of the best we have ever experienced in the world.
label: positive

text: Excellent customer service The aircraft is very convenient.The service of the ground staff and inflight crew very helpful and customer oriented. One crew member called Adrian gave me a excellent service.
label: positive

text: Super service and comfort Superb service throughout the entire flight. Toilets were checked very often. Super clean. Plenty of food if you were hungry. Very comfortable.
label: positive

text: Sri Lanka Tour 2018 I really love Singapore Airlines, its crew and service. What I just dont like are the seats in the Economy in A330 since its old and worn out already. The IFE also old. Hope that Singapore Airlines will be using the B787, A350 and newer planes from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam and vice versa. Also, kindly upgrade the seats and IFE of the Airbus A330.
label: positive

text: First class flight First class from start to finish. Great staff helpful and polite at all times on  the night flight,The food was top notch and the airline crew kept offering drinks through out the flight, the takeoff and landing the best we have had for a long time.
label: positive

text:
Best in the World! I had read many reviews about Singapore prior to my trip, and was praying they would live up to all the hype. To put it simply; they did. You're welcomed on to the flight with beaming smiles and shown to your seat. The seats are very comfortable with adequate leg room even for those over 6foot. The entertainment system is fantastic, and you get to watch it on a beautifully large screen, and have the use of a console to control the screen. 

All the food provided was the best I've had on a plane, the flight attendants keep your glass topped up whenever you ask for a refill, and make sure you are well hydrated. 

Looking forward to my next trip to the East where I will definitely be flying with Singapore Airlines ,and experiencing such a comfortable and pleasant experience.
label: positive

text:
Amazing airline From beginning to end this was a great experience!
Check in was efficient and helpful.  Level of service is top notch and every employee we encountered was so friendly.  Jordon the lead flight attendant was exceptional and made my travel companion feel extra special.  Food was really good and you never go hungry or thirsty as they consistently bring additional snacks and drinks.  This is a top rated airline for a reason!!!
label: positive

text: Changing flight is impossible on a flexible fare Flight sold as having flexible flight changes (subject to availability) however there is not a single fare allocated/made available of the same fare class anytime in the subsequent 3 months.  If they don’t allocate a fare for the same fare class, then it’s hard for them to be available!  The only option is to increase the fare by AUD5000 for a change to one leg of a return flight. This is almost doubling of the fare.  Not allowed to reduce fare class .eg to premium economy or economy?  It’s hard to see how this is flexible?
label: negative

text: Aviation excellence! Traveled SYD -> SIN -> MAN with Singapore Airlines.  Service was excellent, traveled in Premium Economy, well worth the extra.  Changi airport would be the best airport I have been in anywhere in the world.
label: positive

text: Best airline I have flown with I used to be ambivalent about Singapore airlines but after flying Asiana business class, I now realise how good  Singapore airlines is. On SQ they take care of you. on Asiana, even on business class, they merely provide you with transport between 2 places other than that they don’t care about you (and I was in a group with elderly, 1 of whom can’t walk. No attempt to assist in anyway, despite us having requested a wheelchair in advance)
label: positive

text:
Always a pleasure. The flight with Singapore Airlines is always a great experience, personally I don’t enjoy flying but when you do it with them the whole experience is great, the service is first class and that makes already the experience pleasant, the check in at the airport is very efficient. 
I will recommend the Airline to everyone.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service We were stuck in traffic en route to Schiphol Airport so I rang the Singapore Passenger Service to alert them we would be late. Finally arrive at the airport to find the check in desks closed but an attendant waiting for us.We were checked in, personally escorted through priority queues in security and immigration and taken to a reserved area for seating to await boarding.We were given priority boarding and seated before any other passengers were let on. My wife was pretty stressed out but she was well comforted and looked after by SA very caring staff
label: positive

text: Many room I going with my nephew. And I found I love premium economy. Cheaper than business but with more room to spare. If you using long distance airplane this can become my recommendation
label: positive

text: Good timing  SQ is one of the best for Southeast Asia routes with very good timing.  For this trip we flew SQ 175 departed HAN at 12:35pm.  VN is cheaper but departure is too early 07:15am and 10:10am.
label: positive

text: Always a good one Been flying with this airline for quite a number of years. They always provide excellent service no matter what. Food choices, beverage choices and even ice cream selection (if being served) are good. Service is always on point. Always on time (based on my experience). The only "issue" i have is their gate assignment in Singapore to Manila segment, its always the farthest. Keep it up.
label: positive

text: Top service and excellent comfort There is really a HUGE difference between economy and premium economy! It's every penny worth. I loved the seat comfort and the staff is highly professional and very kind. Wehad some preordered food which was lovely. But we noticed that even the normal selection of food is on a very high level.
label: positive

text: Family visit to Perth with stopover in Singapore Singapore is always my first choice, the A380 has a little more room than the 7 series we flew from Singapore to Perth, the flight from London to Singapore we chose the seats near a door for leg room, glad we did, the only slight setback is people standing waiting for the loo. The food and flight staff I think are excellent, getting a drink was no trouble although I feel awkward pressing the attendant call button so did not use it, the flight between Singapore and Perth was quite tight and when the person in front put the seat back was sort of pined think next time will pay extra and see what the premium economy is like. Being a mechanical engineer the 7 series had wheel bearing noise and the wheel legs were old and very noisy under wing, showing the age of the plane and the workouts done still amazing how smooth the flight was hardly any turbulence. Saving for our next trip but won’t be next year, so my only criticism is our kris flyer points are a waste and was not automatically added to my account so really a waste unless you are a frequent flyer let’s face it if you ca afford to fly often won’t be using economy.
label: positive

text:
Virgin Australia code share partner Booked Virgin Australia but flew on Singapore Airlines plane due to code sharing.  Made it very hard to select seats.... we had 40 minutes to transfer a Changi Airport to our next flight so wanted preferred economy seats at the front of ecomony section and were prepared to pay more however due to booking Virgin were prevented doing this online.  An hour long phone conversation ensued and preferred economy seats were secured.
Booking was semi orderly but delayed... whitling our transfer time down even more.
Seats were comfy, food was typical airline food and felt like we were feed every couple of hours, wine selection could be expanded to at least include sparkling!
Entertainment selction was good.  Staff were polite.
Bonus 30kgs of luggage allowed!!!!
label: positive

text: Perfect Airline for International destinations I have always loved Singapore Airlines because if its aircraft and many other reasons. The ground Statt as well as In flights peoples are very nice.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic Business Class Great leg room with full flat bed, although on the Sydney/Singapore sector the shape of the bed was on an angle and this took some getting used to. However on the 777 from Singapore to Sydney the bed/seat was a straight configuration.
The TV screen was the largest I have seen in any Business Class.
Good selection of Asian and western food served with their great smile.
It has been awhile since I used SIA for long haul and would not hesitate to book again. They will give Etihad and Emirates a real run for your money.
label: positive

text: Spent a lot of time in the back of the plane with flight attendents as it was a long flight.  They were great... No matter what airline you fly to the far east, try to transit Chiang Airport in Singapore and allow yourself a long layover to explore Marina Bay and The Jewel at the airport itself. There are free tours from the airport but if they are full, hop on the train to Marina Bay.  Easy access and travel.
label: positive

text: Please share the meal service menu card? I have been flying Singapore Airlines for over 22 years as  regular frequent flyer. I have been at the top tier Solitaire PPS for a few years before the SQ program changed and my company changed travel policy. Needless to say I have spent many many hours on SQ at all levels of service. My 2 hour flight from Singapore to Bangkok on this day was nothing different. On time departure, a clean aircraft, good service and comfortable seats. What I have come to expect from SQ. However, I experienced something new on this flight and have not seen it again since. During meal service the cabin crew passed around a shared menu card for all of us to use across our row. How odd? The 2 meal selections were highlighted and explained with pictures. Just out of curiosity, I asked about this menu card because I had never seen it before and was told by the crew member it was only for shorter flights. I took a picture of the menu card and the crew member seemed a bit offended by that. I thought nothing more about it until after the meal service I was approached by the Flight Director and he asked me why i had taken a picture of the menu card. He made me feel as though I had committed an offence. It was a real issue with him. He made me very uncomfortable with this manner of approach in front of other passengers. I explained my reasons for taking the photo because I had never seen it before I I found it an odd thing for Singapore Airlines to do. To be honest, as I explained to the FD, this was not what I expected from a world class, award winning airline - my preferred airline. Anyway, this interest by the FD about why I had taken the photo made the menu card even more of an unusual experience. The FD provided the standard reply and that was the end of it. I am waiting to see if I am ever presented with the shared dinner menu again.
label: positive

text: 2018-19 Tour From the self serve boarding pass check-in to the baggage check-in at the desk is very easy. The cabin crew are always committed to making your flight as pleasant as possible. The food was exceptional as was the service with a smile. The Premium  Economy seating is very comfortable and the extra room is a lot more relaxing than usually is.
label: positive

text: Just for a weekend. As usual a perfect combination of time, comfort and no waste of time. Even it has lower cost air tickets, flying with Singapore Airlines is travelling with no stress. This short trip is wonderful.
label: positive

text: Travelling in a tin can Travelled on a 777-300ER. Plane was very old and shabby. When we took off my seat went horizontal which annoyed the passenger behind me. The plane looked old and weary, alot of rattles. The food was disgusting as well. Had just come off a Qatar flight in Singapore and WHAT a diiference experience - Qatar had state of the art planes, good service, plenty legroom and excellent food.Singapore Airlines need to retire their older planes - had a similar experience on their flight to Cape Town.
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines- never fails to impress We recently flew on Singapore Airlines from Auckland via Singapore to Delhi. We flew in Business Class that once again did not fail to impress. The A380 is a great plane to fly on as the layout in the Business Class cabin is spacious and modern. The lie flat bed is comfortable and I love the fact that they provide you with pillows not cushions like other carriers. Also the blanket is of a really good quality.
The meals are great with a good range of food available and the service is second to none. The staff are all so helpful and friendly. Definitely an airline that I will continue to fly with. They never seem to be the cheapest but I feel it is worth paying for the excellent service and the comfort.
label: positive

text:
A Pleasant journey through Singapore Airlines to USA Now for our 7th Trip to USA , SFO , we choose Singapore Airlines on November 18th 2022, through Travel Agents.
from Chennai to Sanfrancisco, in Economy class through Flight Numbers SQ 525 & SQ 034 .
The journey is beyond our expectations. 
Seat spacing is just sufficient for the long stretch journey & excellent care from the Air Hostess at every serving of drinks & food & guiding us to get the wheel chair arrangements at landing times through a special wrist band identification, as we are Senior citizens with Ailments.
We got very good excellent tasty vegetarian meals this time through this Flight.
We never felt any strain at any point of time.
As we are Kris Flyer members, we got preferential seats & nice treatment by the wheelchair assistance.
As we are returning through this Singapore Airlines SQ 031 for our return fight to Chennai on 5th May 2023 from SFO, 
we are eagerly waiting for a delightful journey again through Singapore Airlines.
RANGADURAI Ramanujam 
Senior Trip Advisor writer.
label: positive

text:
A shadow of their former self Firstly, the staff on the plane were fantastic and helpful. I have no complaints for them.
The complaints all come from the company itself. It used to be a luxury airline to fly with. Now they have gone the same way as British Airways and become a disappointment. 
No over-ear head phones, just little cheap buds that are difficult to hear with. The food is really cheap and bad.
Boarding happens from only the front of the plane. They let business board, then after a few minutes they let economy board walking straight passed their not so private business seats.

I highly suggest avoiding Singapore Airways now and take a cheaper flight.
label: negative

text: First time in business class - FABULOUS! This was my first time in international long haul business class, and the experience was absolutely fabulous. Check in was fast and efficient, the business class lounge had plenty of facilities that anyone would want to have. Plenty of food options (we decided to have breakfast there). Boarding was quick and easy and we had plenty of room in the seat. The seats were WIDE...:) Service on-board was first class. I love the a380 aircraft, so spacious and QUIET. They set the table for you for every meal, there was soo much delicious food, probably too much! Definitely recommend Singapore Air business class. Hope I can fly business again some time soon! Also at Heathrow, you get to use the fast customs clearance line, this is definitely a bonus as last time we arrived at Heathrow it took over 2 hours to clear customs.
label: positive

text: Flight experience par excellence Excellent journey all round.  Comfortable, clean seats.  Well presented, professional and helpful describes the air crew.  Food was better than most airline meals.  Drinks were complimentary and the choice of movies was up to date.
label: positive

text: Out of this World I have always enjoyed flying, and confess to being an absolute Aviation geek. Being an Aussie I am somewhat saddened that I cant call Qantas the best planes in the sky, tho in my opinion they are a very close second. Singapore has always had world class service and planes. Staff are super friendly and helpful and the planes are always clean and in good repair, as they should. Probably costs a little more for the privilege, but you do get more bang for your buck when it comes to in flight entertainment , meals and service.This flight did tick off one of my bucket list items, I had always wanted to fly in a A380. It was fantastic. Being as I have not flown with lots of airlines I still have an opportunity to discover even better companies. But at this stage Singapore get the nod from me,.
label: positive

text:
Amazing Experience with SQ suites class Dear SQ,

I few SQ first class suites on July 23rd from SIN-JFK and I was the only person on the First Class Suites cabin. I have flown alot of first class airlines in my life and I have never emailed any feed backs. This is the first time I am writing to SQ because the amazing service and experience I had with Singapore airlines. I will def be back flying with my family next year and I do rate singapore as my top and fav airline for their first class products.

Special Mention to these following staff who did an amazing job to make my flight memorable. 

CSS Alice Kok
LSS Charlene Tan
LS Jeff Low

I have flown JAL, Cathay, Emirates, Thai, ANA, Etiahd first class and none of them compare to the SQ suites i Flown and I felt very welcome

thank you SQ,
label: positive

text:
AUStravellers Excellent personal service and food quality.
Flight attendants have an absolutely positive attitude to customer service.
Singapore Airport Business Class lounge is currently being updated which will make the stopover even better. 

A “first” class airline.
label: positive

text:
Well pampered Somewhat, business class in SQ makes u feel pampered. However, the amenities pack is getting worse as compared to Qatar or even Thai Airways. Comparable to JAL tho’ 
The SQ business lounge is so crowded too, Guess it’s seasonal on time of flight and day. 
Is indeed a great flight on business class. Food is yummy n u can pre order .
label: positive

text: Great service great food Excellent company with great service. Friendly crew always on their toes. Making you feel welcome. Have chosen this airline for many years and never been disappointed.
label: positive

text: Horrible Very bad experience with connecting flight,after having boarding pass from Australia they left us on the airport because of the security was lazy to do their duty.they spoiled our surprise to attend my sister’s marriage and i hate that.I really never recommend the connecting flights with singhapore airlines.will never board this flight because of bad memories,i have to treasured that because of my sister’s wedding.every time i am thinking about that I really hate that.
label: negative

text: Rude Chief Stewardess My trip Sq 609 seoul to singapore on 11 Sept 2018 was quite pleasant except with behaviour and rude manner of an Indian Orange SQ uniform Chief Stewardess.Throughout the 6hrs flight she was smiling at all and when she pushes the trolley she hid the trolley into another passenger seating near me and didnt even say sorry. Surprised how she got promoted to her present rank. She should be called up.
label: neutral

text: Flight to India I was very happy with the Singapore airlines service in three sectors. These three sectors included Brisbane to Singapore, Delhi to Singapore and Singapore to Brisbane. The check-in was efficient and the lounge was quite good both sides. However the Singapore to New Delhi was not very good by most standards. I just felt the flight crew were not particularly interested. I quite like the new Singapore airlines seat configuration. I would have given this an excellent all-round except for this one sector. I've normally found in Asia to New Delhi flights can be lacking and wanting with normally older planes being used and the staff being less than caring compared to the Singapore -Brisbane and Brisbane- Singapore flights. These latter segments are exceptionally good. Interestingly there was not much vegetarian options available which is a bit new. In particular would like to commend Mr Anthony Pek Pek Siong for exceptional service as the purser. The in-flight entertainment can be a bit fiddly to manipulate and not as easy as perhaps the Emirates or Qantas  ones.
label: positive

text: Attentive and calm The range of food on offer is excellent, the service of the stewarding team is effortlessly calm and attentive - the very long trip was made pleasurable by the very good on-board entertainment system and overall an extremely positive experience - transfer in Changi was easy and seamless
label: positive

text:
Wonderful Aircraft  Amazing journey back home. The Aircraft was so smooth. Flight attendants were very nice and attentive.

Managed to capture the Sunset above Shanghai Skies.

The Premium Economy seats are extremely comfortable and good. Selection of latest movies. My family and I truly enjoyed ourselves.
label: positive

text:
I just paid 10k for a Budget airline. I’ve flown SIN to LAX return 4 tines over the past year and each time I’ve been stuck  in lines waiting to go to the remote stand. SQ if you cannot afford to pay for a aero bridge then you shouldn’t be charging so much for a flight. 

Everything seems like you are trying to save money for premium passengers. 

Not happy. See photo. Waiting 20 mins. You think that is acceptable?
label: negative

text: Efficient, friendly & professional This flight has above average legroom (81cm) with on demand entertainment and better quality meals than most I have tried. There were also power and USB outlets to charge any personal electronic device. I also found the staff to be far more professional, while still friendly and efficient. I will do my best to book with this airline as often as I can because they offer competitively priced flights as well. Personally I would rather pay the extra $100 for a comfortable all-inclusive flight. The Changi airport is also pleasant - very clean with great shops and services. A welcome respite from Dubai!
label: positive

text: one of the best one of the best airlines available. from ground service to the actual flight just could not have anything negative to comment. also to note the efficiency on the internet services and check-in on line. easy to follow and works !!!! great care for children
label: positive

text: Not what I expected Everything about this airline is great except that flying business class back to uk I expected a better sleeping experience. The leg room was cramped and the seat mattress very uncomfortable, for what we paid Business class it was poor value I was totally shattered when we arrived in Manchester
label: positive

text: Unsatisfactory customer service We nooked our flight with our credit card but we didn't carry physical card with us bcoz we have other international cards for our trip... But during checkin this manager wanted to see our physical card and when i hv shown my cards copy on phone along with other proofs he just denied to accept and asked us to pay the same amount with 100aed charges... This is absurd... They just doing this random check if this is security related it should be checked with everyone... Hopefully my husband gets the card from home on time... If else they dont even refund the flight ticket
label: negative

text: Bring on the new Business Class! The service and food were exceptional as always but the old business class seating is not comfortable. I remember when it was first introduced around 10 years ago but it has never made sense.  Crew have to set it up and undo it, it's hard and not long enough for someone of 195cm. I see that SQ are replacing it progressively with the more conventional format. This flight includes a very old plane which is quite worn so it may be one of the last to update alas.  But crew service helped to make up. So caring.
label: positive

text: Really disappointed I paid exact money to get more leg room etc for this class but it was terrible. Compared to Canadian Airlines I would never go Singapore again. Please be aware of what you pay for. The seating was old service was average.Just so disappointed.
label: negative

text:
Crew Reply Slow I took the SQ flight from Changi to Melbourne. While in the plane, I lited the icon and request for an additional immigration form. It took about half an hour to see one of the crew. 
While on my way back to Singapore. 5-6 children keep on crying all way long about 7 hours. Well, I have to understand though the sound really irritating. The on board meal I preferred which was fish was ran out. So I had to take another choice which was Nasi Briyani. I found that it was full of scallion topping and I don’t eat scallion. I am so happy that the crew made fast change to another beef noodle to me.
label: neutral

text: Will fly with them again First time flying with Singapore Airlines. They have good reviews and good flying record. Check in was easy, meals delicious and plenty of it. Getting extra drinks was not difficult. Selection of on board entertainment was good on all 4 flights that we had with them.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines? NEVER AGAIN We were excited at the prospect of flying Business Class. We departed LHR at 9.20AM and an hour later offered "Brunch". as we had breakfast in the lounge we were not ready for this "meal". About 12.30 we asked for some snacks etc and were informed there was no food available and we would get a meal an hour and a half out of Singapore.
