There was no drinks cart, no water unless we asked and no tea or coffee!!! this 13 hour flight with little drink or food, we were utterly disgusted.. For this we paid $6500 each. Never again. Be warned. The same scenario happened on the Singapore to Brisbane leg, however this trip not as long, but service or rather lack of was the same. So, best airline, i do not think so.!!!!! 
I need to add that upon return I asked for a refund of the difference between Business and Economy this refused and after much writing and eventually contacting the CEO we were given  a cashcard each of $350. no way enough compensation after paying $12,700.
label: negative

text:
Best way to fly! Again, best flight experience! Polite, friendly, helpful crew members. Clean cabin/washrooms. Yummy meal: I usually don't prefer fish, but I did not mind this one. Unique ice-cream flavour, creamy and delicious, also supporting a local ice-cream brand! Wide variety of drinks, including red/white wine! Good selection of entertainment, including some newer movies!
Would definitely fly with SIA again!
label: positive

text:
Damaged Luggage Very slow and poor customer service from Singapore airlines. i flew from Johannesburg to Bangkok on 20/05/2023. upon arrival, i notice my luggage was damaged (the bottom of my bag was broken and the wheel broke off). I immediately contacted Singapore airlines for assistance. they replied with several different emails requesting documentation and pictures which i sent. I am flying back to Johannesburg tomorrow (29/05/2023) without a bag i can use for my luggage. Ive indicated the urgency to Singapore airlines but theres absolutely no regard for this. I will definitely not be flying with Singapore airlines again because of this poor service. The disregard is unbelievable. i will also be informing my company and other companies in our network to not use Singapore airlines for any of our staff going forward. I never expected this type of service from what i thought was a reputable company

Thank you
label: negative

text:
Singapore Airlines 787-10 economy the Singapore Airlines 787-10 economy is  modern quiet comfortable aircraft with only 2 classes. Business and economy. On this trip I flew economy and the cabin is in a 3-3-3 layout 2 isle layout. Being a Gold member with an affiliate airline I was able to use the business check in and I had priority boarding.

The economy seats are designed by RECARO and have a six-way adjustable headrest with adjustable wings to provide more neck support. However teh seats themselves are a tad narrower than the same design which you will find on the A350-900 and the newer A380's.  Power sockets can also be found in-between the seats, and in the back of the seat in front of you there is also a folding table a new updated IFE system and a USB port and a cup holder for your drinks.

The aircraft a modern and the Dreamliner offers a very quiet inflight experience and Singapore Airlines as usual offer very good in flight cabin service.

I would recommend their economy product as its comfortable and clean and  it was an enjoyable experience

Singapore Airlines has switched to the earbuds instead of those crappy sounding over-ear headphones.
label: positive

text: Best airlines All is perfect. You can take this airline with confidence. For the crew in the airplane and also the personel on the ground.
label: positive

text: what a surprising trip Air hostesses were very friendly ,great service,friendly smile.food was good and flight wasn't too bumpy . a young child was sick behind me and hostesses were very professional in cleaning it up and making everyone feel comfortable.
label: positive

text: Wonderful Equipment and Great Service The A350-900 is a great plane.  Enjoyed the comfortable seats and spaciousness even for economy.  The entertainment system is one of the best I have used and the selection of content is good.  Of course, the SQ service on this flight is everything you would expect.
label: positive

text: Unprofessional staff Mr. Dharamveer Singh was amazing at service and tried best possible effects to meet my preferences. But a lady - bit healthy was not at all professional. She was using unprofessional language while Mr. Dharamveer was processing my boardpass. Jaldi kro kaldi kro , side m khara kr do , aap side m khade ho jao were the phraseology used. Totally not acceptable. More over as I got confused with the seat allocation. I tried to get clarity from her, she used inappropriate facial expression and more over was extremely rude. This is not acceptable from a reputed airlines. Not a welcoming experience.
label: negative

text: Best service and delicious food Travelled with Singapore Airlines Business class from Sydney to Bangalore return trip. Airport lounge, inflight food & beverage, service, seating etc., are all superior class. Inflight entertainment range can be better with latest offering though.
label: positive

text: Great staff on board, good food and generous drinks Staff on board were friendly, efficient and absolutely professional on all four legs of our journey. The food was very good to exceptional (inflight meals as well as oriental vego and seafood options). Very generous with drinks. Inflight entertainment was okay and better than past experience. Economy seats are getting smaller (is that possible?). We were fortunate to be surrounded by very considerate passengers who only partially inclined their seats so the longest leg (5 1/2 hours) was comfortable enough. Check in and boarding at Hanoi end was a bit chaotic. Our only complaint is the ground staff when departing Perth who didn't know the rules for carrying liquids in hand luggage and insisted we check a bag in. She was adamant that she was right and refused to check for us. We didn't hold our ground because we didn't want to hold up other passengers. We checked with Singapore later and she was wrong!
label: positive

text:
as usual.....great great Flying business on Singapore Air is a treat...Only EVA comes close when flying to Asia.
Service is the greatest feature as the staff goes out of their way to assure you of a good experience....
label: positive

text: Amazing This is a fantastic flight, everything wonderful and direct from Manchester, couldn’t be better. Check in staff good and on the plane couldn’t have been more efficient and helpful. Seats a good size and entertainment very sdvanced
label: positive

text: Most terrible flight I have flown with Singapore Airlines before and was happy with the service, but my last experience with them was most disappointing. The plain was full, except for one row where the captain was sleeping for the entire flight. My husband had a seat which appears to have added on, as it was halfway on the ile towards premium economy and his legs created a blockage/hinderance for the flight attendance walking past. He further had no screen being half in the ile. Food option ran out on each meal, with no choice for us. We were under the impression to have a direct flight to Cape Town as the booking stated, however the was a stop-over in Johannesburg, where however we were not permitted to disembark to stretch our legs or freshen up in the airport toilets. We had to remain on our seats for passport checks, unable to us the plane toilet facilities or being offered refreshment. Further a cleaning crew enter the plain for cleaning, adding to the unpleasant stop-over. It did not make sense as to why the aircraft was cleaned as no new passengers embarked during this stop-over in Johannesburg. So if you think you are having a direct flight from Singapore to Cape Town your are mistaking.
label: negative

text:
Best! Airplanes clean and comfortable.
Staff so lovely and helpful.
Staff efficient and nothing an issue.
The website for menu adjustment not so great 4/10. 
The SA app...hard going 3/10.
label: positive

text: First class service at business class prices Highly recommended, the staff are impeccably presented and understand the real meaning of quality service. All passengers are made to feel important and that their experience matter above all else. I would not fly with any other airline long haul.
label: positive

text: Comfortable seats Check in process was at a priority counter and was very speedy.  Despite the fact that our luggage had "Priority" tags, they came out about the same time as others at the other end, which was disappointing.  The food selected was good.  The cabin was at the right temperature for resting/sleeping and the seats were comfortable. Although the service was efficient and friendly enough, it was not as wonderful as advertised.
label: positive

text: As Always Singapore Airlines deliver excellent service. Checking in was easy as staff were obliging, managed to change seat allocation for the second leg with Singapore Airline Singapore to Frankfurt to extra leg room. Flight itself was pleasant. Cabin crew friendly and although I did not eat the food did look fine.
label: positive

text: Excellent service along with a comfortable flight I flew from Perth, Western Australia to London via Singapore. The flight attendants were very approachable and willing to do anything to make the flight more comfortable and enjoying. On arrival in Singapore I had what I thought was plenty of time to change to the departure terminal for the London leg only to find the 1 hour 30 mins was only just enough. As an elderly person I d0 not walk very fast so it was a tight squeeze to reach the departure terminal on time. The flight to London was comfortable, although I did have a business class seat so was able to lie down and get some sleep. Very comfortable. Only thing I can fault was Singapore airlines do not provide pyjamas, although this was overcome by bringing a very light track suit. The food was amazing as I used the “book the cook” option and ordered Lobster thermidor and a sushi bowl that was very tasty and decent sized portions.  Would use this airline again without hesitation
label: positive

text: Amazing The comfiest flight ive ever been on. Brill big screen in back of seat with alot of new movies and tv shows.
label: positive

text:
Very good Experience Really enjoyed the flight. 10h30 hours is a long time, but the friendly staff made sure I'm as comfortable as possible and they're extremely friendly. 

Awesome, good work!
label: positive

text:
Still the gold standard My first post-COVID Singapore flight and I was not disappointed.  Itinerary: SQ21 EWR-SIN, SQ138 SIN-PEN, SQ137 PEN-SIN & SQ22 SIN-EWR.  Crew aboard all the flights were wonderful:  always smiling, super efficient, willing to please, and calling me by my name.  Food service was very good, although the wine selection is not as good as it used to be.  Enjoyed the availability of hot snacks between meal times.  Extremely impressed that they could serve a full dinner during the short flight between SIN & PEN; it didn't feel rushed at all. Very good selection of movies and TV. Seat was comfortable, although the need to change the setup between seat and bed is a little awkward.  Also, the table is right where the armrest should be, so my elbow kept on popping up the table.

The only negative element was the agent at Penang airport.  Not knowledgeable, kept challenging my checking in case of wine.  Also, no longer keep fresh orchids in bathrooms (plastic on one flight, none on others).
label: positive

text: Very comfortable flight The flight was very comfortable and a very modern aircraft.  Staff are lovely, they are very polite and helpful.
label: positive

text:
The Lounge and the Flight A 6.30am arrival in the Singapore lounge in Brisbane for departure is an event in itself. However the staff were completely efficient and even suggested that on such occasions a glass of champagne was totally appropriate.
The 1am return flight was equally seamless. While 80% of passengers just wanted to sleep, the attendants were more than happy to serve a full meal and make suggestions as to courses.
It was a complete experience.
label: positive

text:
Definitely NOT the best! A big risk of time. Qatar Airways is much better!!! I was flying Singapore Airlines from San Francisco to Hyderabad via Singapore and Delhi. The service in the San Francisco to Singapore flight was okay, but I was overly bored in the 18-hour flight. I recommend not flying Singapore Airlines to India since it is a risk of time. Adding a Stopover in Hong Kong  and Delhi was very expensive for me. 18-24 hours to get to Singapore from USA, 2-10 hours of layover in Singapore, and 5 hours to India! I will never fly with Singapore Airlines to India ever again! I will hopefully only fly it to the Singapore City or somewhere in East Asia! 

I wasted an additional $1000 just to be safe from Silkair 737 MAX from Singapore to Hyderabad but my flight Ai383 got canceled again! I also hated Silkair when I went on it and it was very terrible like the last review I wrote! I felt scared in the flight! 

The next time I go to India, I will use Air India non-stop from San Francisco to Delhi to Hyderabad,

Qatar Airways was absolutely better. Last year in July I flew it from LAX to Doha to Hyderabad. It’s service was much better, it’s time was absolutely shorter. It was smoother as silk than Singapore Airlines. It’s Boeing 787 Dreamliners we’re absolutely better than Silkair 737 MAX and Singapore A350 (which everything was OK except it was a giant risk of time), I think other airlines like Air India, Emirates, Etihad, Qatar, Lufthansa, British, KLM, United, and everything else I flew are absolutely better than Singapore Airlines and Silkair!

SINGAPORE AIRLINES IS NOT NOT NOT THE BEST! 
SILKAIR IS NOT NOT NOT THE BEST REGIONAL!
label: negative

text: Great flight Great experience as usual, perfect customer service, good food, going through Changi is always amazing.
label: positive

text: Up Up and Away ! Excellent service, friendly staff, comfortable flight and there seemed to be enough leg room in economy. They had all the great movies and the staff had very nice outfits. The second leg was from Singapore to Vienna with Lufthansa...not very good.
label: positive

text:
Bad experience - beware if you have dietary needs had previously flown with Singapore Airlines and had a positive experience, so I booked again. I have been extremely (!!!) disappointed. 

I do not recommend flying Singapore Airlines if you have any dietary intolerances, requirements or allergies. Before flying: (1) I requested a gluten intolerant meal; (2) I contacted Singapore Airlines through the app; and (3) I also checked that I was all sorted for gluten free upon checking in at Sydney Airport. 

Despite the staff member at the airport providing confirmation, the staff on the second flight (from Singapore to Paris) told me that they had no gluten intolerant meal for me onboard or any record of the request. I then went 13 hours without any substantial food, as I had only brought muesli bars with me (between the initial flight of 8 hours and then a 13 hour layover, I couldn’t bring much else). The stewards offered me a vegetarian meal as an alternative, but this had barley etc (so not suitable). 

The crew onboard and at the airport were both very nice, so that is the only plus I would give to Singapore Airlines. I felt like they were pleasant and tried to make the experience better. However, when contacting Singapore Airlines via phone some weeks before to enquire about re-routing my flight, I had to wait on hold for quite a long time when I just wanted confirmation as to whether I could change the flight at all. It turns out that they have to manually calculate re-routing the flights, which is fair - however, I kept just asking for them to confirm whether it could be done and couldn’t seem to get a simple answer. 

In my subjective opinion, I felt that the seats were more uncomfortable than other similar airlines. The gentleman in front of me on the second flight put his seat right back, so the steward assisted me to find a temporary new seat which was kind of him. Again, the staff at check-in and onboard were lovely and the only plus I would give to the airline. 

I have since contacted Singapore Airlines about the experience and got a very generic short email noting their  sincere apologies and a query about whether I needed to select gluten free on the flight back. I replied in more detail, and have since received a reply addressed to somebody completely different (definitely not me - a completely different surname) saying that they already booked a gluten intolerant meal for my inbound flight (which is contrary to their previous email). 

I would never personally book with Singapore Airlines again and am absolutely dreading the flight back.
label: negative

text: Our travel to Japan via Singapore were more enjoyable due to SIA We were expecting such high level of service as we heard for much about Singapore Airlines from our son who is working in Singapore and booked the tickets at high value for money.Unlike Korean air during Narita to Pusan & back the Indian Non Vegetarian foods were very satisfying.
label: positive

text: Top rated Singapore Airlines Journeyed from Changi to Chennai. Service from cabin crews were impeccable. Food and beverages were excellent.
label: positive

text: Purely Excellent Caught this flight to SIN, my first international flight after 2 years due to COVID-19. Check in was smooth and efficient. The seat was good and full with amenities. They are introducing new concept of Regional flight meal which is a box of hot food which is acceptable for a 2 hours flight.
label: positive

text:
Thank you Erynne I want to acknowledge the excellent customer service provides by Erynne
 I had booked a week in Phuket with my daughter and had prebooked exit row seats as she is very tall
When I checked in online our exit row seats for the first leg had not gone through and there were none available 
Very stressed and called customer service and spoke to Erynne who called me back after five pm to say he’d been able to change our seats to an exit row
Really appreciate his assistance as not only is my daughter very tall but she’s a nurse at children’s hospital who is actually on night shift tonight so will come home in the morning shower then hit the airport 
Thanks Erynne
label: positive

text: Great service The first time we flew with Singapore Airlines and definitely not the last time! The cabin crew were so helpful and very quick with service. Will definitely fly with them again!
label: positive

text: Once again a very good experience on Singapore Airlines I last wrote about Singapore Airlines in July 2017. The good experience continues. I am happy to note this consistency. The 2017 travel was for my company work, this one (today) was on my own. While they are still good but I could not see anything great. The aircraft was good and new. Food was good too.
label: positive

text: Average Well there is not much to complain apart from the fact that the whisky they serve is red label. Also the attitude of the stewards was a little lackluster while traveling back to Kolkata from singapore. I asked for a non-veg meal and I was told I will have to wait till everyone else is served to get it since I was listed as veg. ( not sure who did it ) Everything else is at par with Emirates. Also did not understand what is the use of distributing menu with so many pages full of options when they server just two kind , veg and non veg.
label: neutral

text: MABUHAY PHILIPPINES  20 years travelling PHILIPPINES with SINGAPORE AIRLINES 💕💕💕 STILL THE BEST AIRLINES for us.. Foods are delicioso, CREWS are very nice, kinds. Amazing aircraft. It's like a home for me😉.. More power Singapore Airlines!! More Power Captains and Crews!! The Best among the Rest😘
label: positive

text:
what an awful experience! total of 3 toilets for whole business class passengers which was full (over 100) for a 15 hours flight! The 2  stars that I gave were for the safety and flight attendants ( which I thought they were great!).  The lounge at the airport was a chaos!  felt so much like in the night market with loads of people and insufficient seats!  My friend is about 6'2" in height, after they turned down the "bed", he could barely fit into it.  If there was another choice of airline, I wouldn't hesitate to try it.  We miss the old Boeing aircraft.  This Airbus really had us hated it!

By the way, try to call customer service, put on hold for over 10 minutes, I lost patience and hung up!
label: negative

text: Refuse to compensate for delayed baggage All three of our suitcases were left I. Singapore for two days and they refuse to pay compensation for the clothes we had to purchase!  We’re non resident to Australia
label: negative

text:
Excellent service Travelled to Melbourne, VA, with Singapore Airlines and also from Perth, WA, to London, Heathrow. 
ALL the flights were in good time (if not a little early!) 

Choice of meals on board was good and stewards were very attentive, constantly handing round water or soft drinks.
Seats comfortable and reasonably spacious, unless you are very large or tall you should be fine. Good  choice of in-flight entertainment. 

We had no problems with the connecting flight in Singapore, although on the return journey we only had about 40 minutes to get any duty free, use the loo and transfer to another terminal - kept us on our toes!

Definately would be happy to use this airline again
label: positive

text: SOMEWHAT DISAPPOINTED We reserved seating in Business 9 months before our holiday travelling out from Heathrow to Singapore and return from Penang to Singapore the Singapore to Heathrow, We were given our reserved seating outward to Singapore. The check-in documents confirmed our reserved seating for return journey. Two weeks later at Penang airport we were allocated seating separate from each other. Our reserved seating had been given to two other passengers on our holiday tour who had not reserved seating. Again on our flight from Singapore to Heathrow our reserved seating was given to the same two passengers and we were given seats at the back by the toilets ???? However we must praise the cabin crew. Nothing was too much trouble for them. They were wonderful.
label: neutral

text: great airline first time flying with singapore airlines and cant speak highly enough of the service ....seats comfortable,service fabulous ...enjoyed everything about this flight and will definitely use this airline again ...
label: positive

text: Welcoming staff Very happy to fly again with Singapore airlines staff very friendly and helpful. Seat configuration we picked very good as well. Food could improve a little bit bit aren’t all airline foods generally the same with a couple of exceptions. No delays and problems as usual very happy.
label: positive

text: Great airline Plane was old and dated but couldn't fault anything else. From ease of check in to meals and cabin staff everything was excellent
label: positive

text:
how about singapore sling and movies Singapore airlines is the best!
its not about the facilities but the service! the crew so helpful, talented,and give amazing hospitality.
in my experience this is the best airlines i ever travel with. and don't forget to try Singapore sling to accompany your relaxing time.
label: positive

text: Freezing We love this airline but some flight you are ignored ,the flight over Singapore Slings and smiles all round.__The trip back 11pm out of Singapore lights out and no love we were sitting in row 64 and experienced the coldest ever journey .my partner asked for an extra blanket 3 times and nothing came she put on extra clothing and tried to sleep but shivered all the way back to Adelaide. lucky for us back home it was 6C so we warmed up a little on arrival -disappointing service from a usually good airline,not happy Jan.
label: neutral

text: Always a good standard of service With Singapore you can always expect a good standard of efficiency and service. On one or two flights the planes have seemed a bit older and tired and I wonder if Singapore Airlines stand up the rankings as much as they used to.
label: positive

text: Limited Perrier Water in Business Class Poor use of Data Analytics among siloed departments. They know that I ONLY drink Perrier Water, nothing else and CONSISTENTLY run out. Was told Supplies stocks 6 bottles to share among the almost 50 passengers and you have to RESERVE bottles AS SOON AS YOU BOARD in order not to run out. Must be the most EXPENSIVE Perrier Water in the world. Unacceptable and shocking. Was told that you have to INFORM the SIA local rep EACH time you make a trip - e.g. TO and FROM (on a return journey) Poor example of no JOINED UP thinking / silos/ poor use of customer data. You ALSO have to fill in Emergency details - TO AND FROM (as if you change SPOUSES to and from your trip). Singapore is aiming to be a Smart City - the flagship airline needs to keep up. Cabin crew are very nice - it is a SYSTEMS - SUPPLY Chain issue
label: positive

text: Indeed a great way to fly! When travelling to Singapore, my choice airline has always been Singapore Airlines. She has never disappointed me. Boarding makes me feel 'at home again'. Service is excellent. Patient air hostesses. Good quality food, extra chilli on demand and of course Singapore Sling to sip while cruising the first hours! Indeed 'A great way to fly' as their slogan has always been! Keep up the good works!
label: positive

text: A380 - Extra room and good service Flight from Singapore to Sydney was a much more comfortable flight in Premium Economy on the A380. Extra leg room was fantastic and the service was good. Additional premium economy service ‘Book the Cook’ was great as it allows you to select and book a menu item meal for your flight.
label: positive

text: Singapore air Singapore Airline  airlines remains ahead with Service, safety and technology for passengers.  I would love and recommend to fly Singapore Air in future.
label: positive

text: really good really good but the best one was the cleanliness. it was so good that i even asked a man that i did not know how many stars was it rated u should fly it.
label: positive

text: SQ standards are slipping While the staff are great the aircraft are not being cleaned very well. Just look inside the seat pocket and you’ll find old boarding passes, tooth picks and all sorts of other things. While I like SQ they need to make sure their aircraft are cleaned better
label: neutral

text: "A GREAT WAY TO FLY" Its my first time to travel through airplane and with this singapore airlines i feel comfortable and their flight attendant are very accommodating and they provide a good service when it comes to their passengers. I cant wait to fly again through Singapore airlines someday!
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flying We hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines for several years due to a run of bad experiences with them.
It didn't start off well this time either when our chosen seats pre-flight disappeared due to the introduction of a brand new plane. We received an advisory email but the new seats were not extra leg room and also down the back of the plane. To choose new seats cost us an extra $200+. Not good!
However, on the day of departure the check-in was smooth and the counter staff member very polite, efficient and obliging.
Boarding was smooth and hassle-free and the cabin staff bright, helpful, full of smiles and efficient.
This set the tone for the entire flight.
The seats were comfortable (something lacking when we last flew with them). The entertainment options were great, food and drink delivery super efficient and the meals tasty, plentiful and hot.
Singapore actually measured up very well against Emirates and we will put them to the test again when next we fly overseas.  Well done Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text:
Premium economy not quite as expected  Premium Economy on the long flights and economy th two short.
We have been flying Singapore Airlines in normal economy before and been very impressed. Maybe we therefore expected too much? Our reference for Premium Economy is Virgin Atlantic.

In general it was ok, but not more.

    The seats were ok.
    The service was ok, but not more.
    The food was standard 'flight-food'.

My wife very often gets a 'cold' after long flights. This did not happen this time, even if the flights were very long, 12-13 hrs. Maybe that is the result of the cabinenvironment of the Airbus A350.
label: positive

text: Outstanding customer service!!! Singapore Airlines certainly know how to do customer service and I felt looked after from start to finish. Hot towels, snacks and decent food made this one of my more memorable flights of recent years and is now an airline I will definitely use again and recommend to friends.  Singapore Airlines well done on a great job!!!
label: positive

text: Not great service We where a bit disapointed with the service and food on this flight. Usually we are very impressed with them but this time they let us down.
label: neutral

text:
I'm choosing my vacation destinations to where Singapore Airlines flies to This has been the most pleasurable flying experience I've ever had. The seats were so comfortable I just put on my eye shades and slept the entire time duration of the flight, I've even missed a meal because of it. And it's all good, cause I got it back later 

Aristotle (Aris) Johannes of the Jakarta airport. He's went above and beyond on my behalf, and I can't thank him enough.
label: positive

text: From the engineers on the ground to the pilots and crew I get a sense of a highly competent airlinentt I enjoy flying Singapore Airlines as firstly I feel 'secure' and following from that I quickly relax on the plane and quietly enjoy the food and entertainment on offer.  We fly annually to Singapore and whilst I enviously look at Premium Economy and Business Class seats I feel that we get a good deal in Economy.
label: positive

text: LHR to sing economy I am 5ft 11, l had 13 hrs of discomfort guy in front reclined so had 12 inches from my eyes to the entertainment screen so l had to recline, l am not fat, table tray touching my stomach, food average at best, wow 1 inch of red wine in plastic cup, can't say a good experience
label: negative

text: Easy Peesee Arrived LAX on Mar. 18, 2020 on Singapore Flt. # 38. Flight ran on-time perhaps 3/4 full. Boarding in Singapore and on-board service mostly normal. Several scanning stations throughout airport, otherwise, ordinary experience. As far as arrivals at LAX Bradley Terminal. My experience was stress free. In fact due to reduced flight activity the terminal was quiet. My transfer from plane through Customs & Immigrations and baggage collection to the curb was probably the fastest I've ever experienced: (less than 15-minutes) As far as I could see using Global Entry Americans were not being scanned, although, there was healthcare personel on-duty. Did not see what they were doing with non-Americans. The reports of 8-9 hour lines at East coast airports did not occur at LAX.
label: positive

text: Amazing service The service provided by Singapore airlines was superior to any other airline I have flown with and this includes many of the other international carriers.
label: positive

text: Excellent, as usual A very good flight, as usual. We had checked our baggage through from Manila, and it arrived fine. I particularly liked the at-gate security checking.
label: positive

text:
They are simply the best in the world in their premium cabins. Flew business class Syd to Sin and first class Sin to Syd.
As is often the way there was not a big difference between the 2 TBH even though I had a A380 "suite" -  its still just a bed!
Both flights had a similar bar but in 1st I did try the famous lobster thermidore and can confirm its excellent.
The difference with SIA is their incredible cabin staff.  If you need drinks they are there.  If you want quiet they know and are not there.  It may sound simple but its something rare and totally beyond the comprehension of other long haul airlines such as Qantas.  They know they are good and their default action is attentiveness unless you so desire.  Amazing.  Silver Kris Lounge was very crowded which is perhaps a good thing to see that they are getting busy again.  GO SIA!!
label: positive

text: Good flight Good service, nice food, nice crew. Only issue was seat in front tilted back and encroached on my space and there was nothing I could do about it on a long flight.
label: positive

text:
Still the best Singapore Airline is still the best airline, although not quite as good as a year ago..
Using Premium Economy provides a much easier overall flight experience, from priority check-in and baggage handling, to slightly extra personal space in the seat (which makes all the difference) and priority meal service.On this particular flight we found the cabin crew service very slightly disjointed and it struck us the cabin crew had not yet melded into a top team.
However, overall the experience was that Singapore Airlines still provides a relaxing flight so sit back and enjoy!
label: positive

text:
Disgusting after service I’m appalled by the lack of customer service to my complaint on Safety and medical problems.
I took the time to write to Singapore Airlines on July 6th 2019, plus several follow up e-mails. I believe I gave ample information, so a speedy investigation could be carried out. Today is August 23rd 2019, and I’ve only received correspondence from Singapore Airlines which informs me that my complaint has been forward to Public Affairs. This is now approximately 30 plus working days Singapore has had my complaint and not even sent an e-mail asking if I’m fully recovered. Therefore I’m just bewildered and amazed how this airline operates.
label: negative

text:
ALWAYS my first choice! Having lived and traveled in Singapore and other Asian countries, I've done a lot of flying. Though our first-ever Singapore Airlines experience 40+ years ago wasn't great (too much free alcohol to a soccer team on board!), I've never again been in any disappointed with SIA. If the airfare is no more than $100 more to fly Singapore Airlines, I'll willingly pay the difference.

The cabin crew is invariably friendly and polite. Very courteous. They don't talk down to you, but rather kneel to be looking up at you if they stop to visit a bit. 

As airline seats go, the SIA seats are pretty decent. Blankets and pillows add to the comfort. And cleanliness of the aisles and bathrooms is as good as airlines get.

Airline food certainly isn't restaurant food, but it is as good as I've ever had onboard. Whether I request Asian vegetarian or Indian vegetarian, the Singaporeans know how to cook it.

And the prize at the end of the journey is the beauty of Changi Airport and the enchantment of Singapore as a whole.
label: positive

text:
Perfect Service The flight started with an uncomplicated check in and a good service on board. 
The food was delicious and the entertainment excellent. The economy seats are pretty comfortable. The flight with the A 380 is very quiet. We also enjoyed our stay at Changi Airport in Singapore. Summarized I can only recommend this flight.
label: positive

text:
good experience with Singapore Airline I had good experience during my business trip with SQ. the staffs were friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed with the foods specially the dessert. 
SQ provides in flight shopping with sale items.
label: positive

text:
SQ 242 Singapore Air - Always a great way to fly I've always wished fellow travellers would post menus of flights they were on so they know what to expect beforehand... I suppose here is a great way to contribute!

Singapore Airlines is always a great way to fly、no doubt about that. Of course the flight experience differs each time、depending on the crew、the menu、the entertainment etc.

I must say I really enjoyed the flight back from Sydney. The stewardess on my aisle was extra warm and friendly and recommended me (and the passenger beside me whom I don't know personally) champagne, although both of us were ordering juice or something initially. It might sound a little shallow, but service staff could just do what they are told (which would be robotic) but it takes effort to engage with their customers/passengers and suggest something. So I really appreciated that. I pre-ordered the "Book The Cook" from Singapore Airlines' website... for those who are wondering what is on the menu for SQ242 (and the corresponding flight SIN-SYD), photos are attached. Enjoy!!
label: positive

text: Avoid using Singapore airline or transit through Changi We used SQ  875 from Hong Kong to Singapore for transit  and SQ 964 from Singapore to CGK international airport in Indonesia, This is used to be the best Airlines. First of all it was delayed for 3 hours at the Hong Kong Airport with no air conditions in the mid of Summer in Hong Kong. The AC was on after the plan started to move. This delayed cause us to missed our connecting flight in Singapore. Arrive in Hong Kong again we had to wait inside the airplane for 45 minutes due to technical problems again with no air conditions. Now because of that we are booked on the next flight in which of course being 2 hours late, it is a good thing that are in side Changi Airport. The airport is not that great like people saying. Hong Kong new airport and Doha international airport is way better than Changi. I have to tell you about this airport too. Now after being 2 hours late they told us to go to Gate 69 in which we wait patiently with the other passenger and crew. Long behold on the boarding time, a staff came and spoke to the crew and the crew announced that the gate was changed to Gate 29. That is a 40 mins walked with no official announcement. By the way at Gate 29 it will still say SQ  964 and the official airport announcement  board is still on Gate 69. This is the worst airlines experience that we had, this is way worst than Lion Air or Pakistan International Air. Singapore Airlines make these airlines looks way better. So we cancelled our return flight and only got 50% back after all of the fine, currency exchange etc even though we cancelled it 3 weeks before our returned flight. I recommended Avoid using Singapore Airlines at all cost. We changed to Cathay Air from CGK to HK and its a very nice experience with cheaper ticket price with a wonderful crew and better meal. Again Do Not use this airlines, you will regret it.
label: negative

text: Onward flight from Changi Airport to Cebu The onward flight Singapre-Philippines was cancelled, which can happen. In transit after more than 8 hours, I was offered neither accommodation nor an onward flight, despite my business booking. I had to organized and paid for everything myself. To this day, 5 months later, Singaporeair has not responded to my claim for reimbursement. No more Singaporeair. Spent a lot of money on flights, very shabby service. As long as everything works out, it's fine, money is taken. If there are problems, you don't hear anything more from the company. Never ever again.
label: negative

text: Vaping in Singapore/Changi Airport As an avid vapour I was worried about what to do once hitting Changi Airport as vaping is prohibited in Singapore.  So here is how it works.  I traveled from Auckland to Vietnam with a transit stop in Singapore for 3 hours and was panicking about my vape which was in my checked in baggage. This was not an issue but my plans had me coming back to Singapore for 3 days later in my travels - here's what I found out. While transiting you can carry your vape and use the smoking areas in the international terminals as long as you do not go through immigration.  On my return to Singapore 2 weeks later I was going through immigration/customs so you can put your vape into baggage storage BEFORE going through immigration - in terminal 2 the baggage storage is behind Prada right beside the immigration gate and there is storage in every terminal.  When I flew out I was going out of terminal 3 so I went through immigration at T2 picked up my stuff and headed over to T3 - easy peezy.  You will either need to smoke cigarettes or use patches while in Singapore - I used nicotine lozenges which were no issue at all through customs.  I was there late August 2019.  Happy vaping...
label: positive

text: simply the best Just the best always try to make first choice airline to fly with everything from booking had a bag that customs wouldnt let on no problems or extra money required just put in hold pickup at other end can only say great
label: positive

text:
Travel if you wanna know what is likely to fly with best airline in the World I would like to share my feedback on my recent & first trip With SQ. and why i choose to fly with SQ

As per business need in my current  organisation all "C" level need  to travel frequently so with our corporate travel agent i book SQ as they "Preferred" & from my other team who has ever traveled with SQ they always says It's THE BEST!

So I thought personally why not to feel it and see what’s make it best so i discovered promotion at SQ site and decided that's it’s the time where i need to experience, in-spite of  long flight i thought i will have more time to explore so I flew. So I travel from Delhi to Bangkok via Singapore and vice versa.

Amazing experience overall and what I have heard mostly "Great food" indeed it is  and it exceeded my expectations Hindu meal- Non Veg- Best food I have ever had, best in class entertainment options ( i like specially Hindi movies collection from Asain part) although SQ 401 seems  a bit outdated to me looking  at entertainment options however even though all looks good to me, in lavatory all amenities were perfectly placed majorly i have seen everything and mostly i found clean and tidy too.

SQ 978 which we boarded from Singapore to Bangkok was again perfect, cabin crew is happy to help you for everything that one need, i have to mentioned because economy class at times been treated secondary which i didnt felt while travelling with SQ.

when I was travelling from Bangkok to Singapore- SQ 975 as seat was not getting adjusted I thought it’s non recliner but flight attended tried to adjust and informed its recliner seat and i was in forward seat zone not sure name Sarifash ( maybe) offered with great smile in case I would like to shift as it was short flight I didn’t wish to move but i could feel empathy! and that's what matter.

what i love the most is Airbus 380- 800 SQ 406 while i travailed from Singapore to New Delhi, huge aircraft and i choose to be at upper Deck which was good idea.

Meals were served hot all the time and if one has order any special meal they serve first to them then anyone. They kept us servicing water/Drinks so good in case one has long flight.

Staff make sure that everyone get equal attention and they nailed it, if one starts travelling with Singapore Airlines would choose only to fly with SQ because it's The best!
label: positive

text: Seven  nighs holiday in Sentosa Singapore. Very comfortable flights boith ways.  Premieum Economy seats comfortable and ample leg room.  Flight staff excellent.  Food was typical airline food and reasonably good.
label: positive

text: Overnight Flights in Economy A long overnight flight in economy was tiring, even though the entertainment package was very wide. Like most airlines the pitch was never enough and having to move other people when nature calls is a problem. Food and drinks were fairly standard and reflected the airlines homeland.
label: positive

text:
Contradictions Return flights via Changi. A350 -900 in all sectors. Outward flight excellent in service, food and general comfort in both sectors; inward flight excellent in service and general comfort, very average in food. I would recommend this airline.
The A350 is a superior aircraft in comfort compared to B787. I particularly liked the seat recline, seat as well as back moves, thus avoiding a pet dislike,i.e. the passenger who reclines seat back so far that there is no room to get in & out.
Changi airport is extremely impressive and spotlessly clean.
label: positive

text:
Pleasant and confortable flight Very organised and efficient check in and no délais. Pleasant boarding and seat allocation. Smooth and confortable flight with good meals and good entertainment on board. 

Very helpful flight attendants and overall a good flying expérience with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: The best airline in Asia You pay for the good service !! Absolutely no complains, good food and flight attendances provide the first class service even in economy class customers. Singapore Airport is the most beautiful airport in Asia. You have no trouble checking in once you enter the airport, the airport workers will guide you all the way through security check in. If you do not mind to pay more for good service, and rather choose to pay lower cost for poor quality service, this is always our choice.
label: positive

text:
Longest flight Flew from Sydney  3pm to 830pm.  Stayed up...ate. read.  The lamb josh Rogan was excellent...my wife had salmon.  Didn't like it
Then took the 1135pm to newark. 18nhrs.  Good time to sleep.  Read. Watch movies.  I suggest download netflix series so u have what u want to watch 

Biz seats are great.  Full sleepers. I think they need better choices of food...especially before u land at 6am. Who wants dumplings or beef satay at 6am.  How about eggs. Omelets. Yougart? 

Staff is always great.
label: positive

text:
Very comfortable, well serviced flight We travelled Economy from Melbourne to Amsterdam via Singapore and return from Zurich to Melbourne in June. We found the both the check-in staff and the cabin crew very attentive and friendly, we enjoyed the food selections and the movie menu and as we are both short, leg room was ample for us. All announcements were clear and toilets were clean. The blankets were large and warm and the pillows very comfortable. We were given a small travel pack containing socks and a toothbrush 
& paste on the way over but this was not handed out on our return flight 6 weeks later. The only problem we encountered was finding our way to a different terminal in Singapore's enormous airport with very little time to do so. On our return journey this was exacerbated when the plane was late to arrive in Singapore leaving us with 10 minutes by the time we disembarked to catch our forwarding flight in the same terminal, then to find out (only because we couldn't see our flight on the board) that forwarding flight was leaving from another terminal. Our race to firstly catch the train, then run to the departure lounge totally stressed our senior bodies to the limit. When we arrived we were informed that the flight had been delayed for an hour and we were told to take a seat and settle our heart rates. Communication was extremely poor in our case and had the potential to cause a health problem.
label: positive

text: Excellent in every aspect. We have flown with Singapore Airlines for many years which in itself is an acknowledgement of their excellent service. On this recent trip we flew five legs with the airline and in all cases their service was exemplary. The cabins are always well maintained, especially the toilets where staff regularly ensure that they are clean and well stocked. We had an issue at one airport where we needed to ensure that our luggage was leaving on the same flight as ourselves; Singapore Airline staff were quickly onto the task of confirming this and once they received confirmation they sought me out even though I had committed to calling into the Departure counter to check. The other great advantage of flying with Singapore Airlines is that we land in Singapore and make use of a stopover for a few days to get ourselves back into the time zone after travelling to Europe. Going through Changi Airport is always a  pleasure rather than a chore. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: There’s a Reason for Their Reputation I’ve flown with many airlines, some with newer or refurbished planes, in economy, business, first and suites, but I’m never disappointed with Singapore Airlines. They always go above and beyond. There’s a reason for their reputation.
label: positive

text:
Wow Not too many things can be said...

Excellent service on board, always punctual,  good food and more.

The multimedia is amazing from movies to every other kind of service.
I have seen "a star is born" and "Bohemian Rapsody" just one month after the exit at the cinema in Italy...
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airlines Flew from Delhi to Singapore on the 19th of Feb in Premier Economy & returned on the 25th. 
The staff was indifferent, the food both ways was very poor & the drinks were of poor choice.  Very poor show SA
label: negative

text:
Do not fly Singapore Airlines when linked We had an absolutely horrible experience, basically stranded in Krabi told by staff to organise our own way to Phuket within 3 hours when it takes 3 hours to get there (so near impossible). There was no confirmation sent by Singapore Airlines to Scoot so our names were nonexistent on the flight. We were told by staff that nothing could be done from their end. Two and half hours sitting at the service desk, while reading signs saying it was already overbooked made us realize there was no chance we could return home to Australia as planned. Pulling our hair out and going around in circles calling every possible company (Singapore used Scoot who then used silk airlines all of which are affiliated with one another). We got to Singapore to be laughed at in transfer D and told go online at terminal C, when informed to lodge a formal complaint when we arrived at Singapore.

The communication and customer service was the worst we have experienced on an airline being travellers utilising various companies across the world, we would never use nor recommend Singapore Airlines
label: negative

text:
Spacious Refitted 777-200 but some wear & tear visible. Terminal 2 Silverkris Lounge
- Spacious and much quieter lounge than the one in Terminal 3.
- Food offering wise, quite standard nothing wow or feels a bit premium. Even the temporary Gold Lounge at T3 for economy class passengers food offering seems better: There's satay.
- I was there in between breakfast and lunch, hence the quite normal fare. 

Aircraft General Feel and Comments
- This is a refitted 777-200 aircraft with some of the older products. 
- Plus point, the seat is very spacious and in a 1-2-1 layout. For short-haul not an issue, for medium-long haul, read from some reviews that people don't like it as the seat is very hard and not very comfortable for sleeping. 
- As it is an older aircraft, plus there has been several versions of business class seats since this one, hence, some wear and tear around the seat, carpet, even shelves in toilets can be seen. 

Food & Beverage
- Very average and normal starter.
- Main course selected book the cook: Japanese char-grilled soya beef. Taste is good and but not wow. Probably will not choose again. 
- Bread feels soggy, had the garlic bread. Last flight from Sydney was warm and crisp. 

Service
- Pretty standard SQ service. Again, was good but not wow. 
- The aunties at the lounge was much nicer and friendlier. 

Economy class wasn't full too, perhaps next time should book economy since this is such a short flight.
label: positive

text: One step up Thought we’d try premium economy as the trip was a bit longer...Wow it was great well worth the extra $...more space..better seats..seemed to be more attention with service.. Crew were great,  as usual with SIA..Yep can’t wait for next trip..
label: positive

text:
Generally Good all round Checking in online and bag drop very efficient. the cabin crew were all helpful.the seats were comfortable although my husband who is tall found the foot rest prevented him getting his legs comfortable. The plane was an old A380 - If there are 2 of you  i would recommend seats at the back upstairs. 
On our return we flew in a much newer A380 which had larger touch screens and more comfortable seats.
Only down side vegetarian food not very good
label: positive

text: First time flight with Singapore Airlines, Just amazing crew First time flying with Singapore Airlines. The service onboard even though I was in economy was just first class. The crew looked amazing all through the flight. Again even though I was in economy the seating was excellent, it even has a little foot rest you can flick down with your foot. The entertainment system onboard was very good. The food was excellent, it must have been as my daughter never eats aircraft food but she enjoyed the meals on board. The crew onboard the aircraft provided an excellent service, nothing was ever too much trouble for them.
label: positive

text: Only average I usually take emirates when I fly. but decided to take Singapore airlines for once to try it out with all the great reviews. I felt that the inflight entertainment was quite limiting and difficult to navigate only a small selection of new films compared to loads of old and new alike on emirates. But I would say that I enjoyed having a full HD display. I would say that the crew were above average in the terms of service and gave a hot towel before the flight which was a bit too warm for me. The food was way to salty and had only a western and Chinese options without any curry option as I guess they assume that only people whom order a halal meal like curry.  For some reason they would not let me charge my phone during take off and landing. I feel that this airline is not worth the extra money over emirates. I feel some of the good reviews of this airline are from Singaporeans whom pledge loyalty to the national airline without trying out the competition
label: neutral

text: Disappointing After flying a few times with Singapore Economy Class I decided to splurge and try Business Class, but I was disappointed for one main reason: I remember the slogan for Singapore Airlines used to be, 'Singapore Girl, you're a great way to fly!', and this is one of the rare cases of 'truth' in advertising and one of the main selling points and points of difference for Singapore airlines. But obviously, this slogan is not very PC or woke, and is no longer used because of those reasons; but that does not mean it isn't true or effective marketing. But worse than that, the Business class cabin was staffed by way too many male flight attendants; and even worse, the 'team leader' for all the flight attendants on all Singapore Airlines fights I have experienced (business and economy) was a man! So, Singapore Airlines have gone from 'Singapore Girl, you're a great way to fly!', to way too many male flight attendants and not even a Singapore girl or woman being the the boss of the inflight cabin crew! That is extremely stupid and disappointing! For Singapore Airlines to relinquish one of the best and most truthful slogans in airline marketing history because of woke or otherwise pressure is political correctness and 'equal opportunity' gone mad! Isn't it funny that for years women strive for equal opportunity to no avail, but when whining men cry for the same it is instantly realised to the detriment of everybody, including an airline's effective marketing slogan. The vocation of flight attendant is a 'care' vocation, like a tour guide, like child care, like elderly care, men should not do it. I will avoid Singapore Airlines in the future for this very reason: 'Singapore 'Man', you're NOT a great way to fly.
label: neutral

text: Excellant service We first flew from sydney to Singapre then onto London. On the flight to Singapore we were used a 777 and the seating was very comortable with a hugh screen. Teh flight to London was on the 380 using the older but very spacious seats. The entertainment system was very good with alot of choices from films, to music. The service on board was excellant with all the personnel using your name. they were very attentaive and nothing was a problem. In relation to food we used the 'book the cook' which was excellant and had Lobster Thermidor for one meal followed by a lovely steak for the next. Would recommend using this service. The trip was well worth the extra money for such a long journey and if you book well in advnace the cost is not too high.
label: positive

text: Flight overbooked I had booked 2 tickets from Delhi to pudong airport Shanghai. But when I reached the Delhi airport, I was told by the Singapore airline staff that there were some group bookings and so the flight has been fully booked. They further requested me to cooperate if I could. Since there was not too much of emergency to reach Shanghai, I agreed to change my flight. They offered me SGD 250 per person compensation and also business class tickets for China eastern airlines to reach shanghai directly. The only issue that I faced was to wait at the airport as the flight that they offered was after 4 hours, but they sent me to the airport lounge. Therefore I had to face no issues at all and everything was super comfortable. Thank you singapore airlines for your 5 start service and your great customer service. There attitude toward the customer is highly appreciable. Thanks again
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight Great and comfortable flight (A380 we caught).  Service was great.  Recommend to catch this flight if you intend to make a stop over
label: positive

text: Best service Best service so far I have travelled with comfy seats lots leg room not enough movies on board to choose from didn’t like the breakfast as I ordered Muslim food so the gave me Sambal and rice but return flight serve dinner that was good
label: positive

text: A pleasant flight under the circumstances - no flight is great even in first class whatever the airline Although a long time in the air the seats were comfortable and food was good for airline food. I found the staff pleasant and attentive
label: positive

text:
Singapore to Sydney on "SQ 221" Singapore to Sydney on SQ221 Airbus A380-900. Flight time 7hrs 45mnts.
Flight was on time. Check in and disembarking was smooth.
Cabin was clean and had all the basic amenities for a comfortable flight. Flight crew were so welcoming and attentive. 
in flight food was decent with one main meal and a snack. The drinks menu was impressive with Singapore airline's signature cocktail.
Seats were comfortable and in fight entertainment was up to the expectations and had a decent collection of movies on board.
Had a great time flying with Singapore airlines yet again.
label: positive

text:
Just that little something extra I have always loved flying, it’s just a treat. 

Flying with Singapore airlines is always amazing, the customer service really is second to none. They really do seem to care about their passengers, dare I say, their Guests.
label: positive

text: Worst Premium Economy seat on Singapore Airlines Seat 32H in Premium Economy on Singapore Airlines A380-800 is terrible. Firstly, seats 31H and K have no luggage space at all. If the occupants of these seats are onboard before those sitting in 32H and K they use the space above row 32 which leaves no space for row 32. However, the bigger issue is that adjacent to seat 32H is a cabinet used to store various sundry items used by cabin staff. The problem with this is that cabin staff access this cabinet constantly throughout the flight and every time they do they inconvenience the occupant of seat 32H. Each time cabin staff access the cabinet they tend to stick their bottom in the face of the occupant of 32H. Further, each time they access the cabinet they make a noise locking and unlocking the doors and consistently disturbing and/or waking the occupant of seat 32H. This is extremely poor design. Also, about 2 metres in front of row 32 is an area where cabin staff congregate for no other apparent reason but to have a chat. I have travelled with Singapore Airlines around 20 times in the last 2 years and have had a good experience each time but save your money and fly Economy class or make sure you avoid seat 32H at all costs in the Singapore Airlines A380-800.
label: negative

text:
Generally a high standard In the bigger scheme of things among all airlines, it provides a high level of service and offers a good product, though not outstanding. Staff service was professional and efficient but somewhat lacking in genuineness. Service, especially on the outbound, was very rushed. For example, the pre-departure hot towel was given and taken away before I could even touch it. Cabin crew can best be described as highly efficient but perfunctory. There is a high degree of helpfulness but also kind of stern. Seating was the same kind for inbound and outbound even though they were on different types of aircraft (B787 and A350). One is lucky to get flat-bed seating on a regional flight, but the seat is just uncomfortable, too narrow, and the head “wing” gets in the way and blocks the view from the window. The 3-point seatbelt was also uncomfortable. Food on the outbound was awful, even when it’s from “book the cook”. The duck was dry and pathetic looking, and tasted like it looked. On the inbound, the fish dish was excellent and succulent. I wonder if it’s from the Bangkok kitchen rather than from the Singapore kitchen. Beverages were good, with Piper Heidsieck champagne and a very good port, though the pre-takeoff champagne was served warm. There was strangely no beverage menu -- only a food menu with wine list. For the Singapore lounges, Terminal 3 lounge is renovated and expanded, and world class. Terminal 2 lounge is dated and in need of a revamp. The main issue with the Singapore lounges is the food – only mediocre local food is served. It is a real shame that there is no Western food, or other kinds of Asian cuisine such as Japanese and Middle Eastern. Singapore is not known for tasty food or fine cuisine, and the lounge food clearly reflects this. The lounge wines were very good, however; especially the 2 kinds of white. Lounge staff were rather surly. The Bangkok lounge was good enough for its purpose of being an outstation lounge. It has enough quantity and variety of seating and adequate F & B, though there are no showers. F & B on the whole – both on board and in the lounge – was one level below that of Qatar, though Singapore has better consistency in the various other aspects. Online check-in was very smooth and painless. You need not go to a counter nor get a paper boarding pass.

Outbound:
Cabin service: 3/5
Meal: 2/5
Terminal 3 lounge in Singapore: 4/5
Terminal 2 lounge in Singapore: 3/5

Inbound:
Cabin service: 4/5
Meal: 5/5
Lounge in Bangkok: 4/5

General:
Online check-in: 5/5
Seating: 3/5
Inflight entertainment: 4/5
Inflight beverages: 4/5
label: positive

text: Flight to Singapore Timings from Bangalore are convenient, have travelled 4 times, flight's never been late and very service, average food though, but your best bet when travelling to Singapore                       ................................
label: positive

text: London to Adelaide All I can about this particular airline, is it just gets better and better every time I fly with them.  At the end of this year I will be flying back to Adelaide and this will be the 8th time I will have flown with Singapore Airlines. From the check in area from the departure airport right the way through until you collect you baggage at the arrival airport everything is like clocke and very efficent. A 5 start rating is the best we are allowed to give, Singapore Airlines certainly are at the very top of the 5 star ratings.
label: positive

text:
Bad Singapore Airlines...Bad. I just spent over an hour on the phone after spending 25 minutes online, trying to redeem our Kris flyer points for the above journey.
I was booking through Singapore airlines website but was not able to use my Kris flyer points for the flight because the last leg of the journey was with Lufthansa, even though this was done by Singapore airlines.
The lady I spoke to told me I couldn't use my 31,000 points, I would have to use them later and there was no way I could make the booking and use the points.  This went on for 45 minutes so I asked to speak to her supervisor , which took another 12 minutes of waiting and sounded remarkably like the same person.  
I asked if we could split the flights up so that we could use the points for the Singapore airlines flights, and then book our Lufthansa section separately.  She eventually agreed to this and then pointed out that our 31,000 points were worth a little over $300 and there would be a separate surcharge for each booking as we doing them through the phone and that she couldn't guarantee my husband and I would be able to sit together.  Think we will fly with Qatar!
label: negative

text: Disappointing food. On a long haul flight with a reputable airline like Singapore Airlines, we expected to enjoy most of the food on the flight. Over a 21 hour period, there were many opportunities to impress us with the food served. Singapore Airlines menu sounded tasty, elaborate even, but in reality we just didn’t enjoy much of it at all. Difficult to explain why we felt disappointed but each course just didn’t taste very good. The quality and flavour just wasn’t there. It reached a point where we gave up expecting anything decent to eat and turned down a few meals even though we were hungry. We left the plane more or less ravenous! The film choices were very poor. However, to their credit, all the stewards were lovely though, and beautifully dressed.
label: neutral

text: Excellent and impressive. Comfort both in the lounge and then on the aircraft was just wonderful. Service and food exceptional. Seats very comfortable and private. It was a night flight however we arrived in Adelaide well rested after great service and a sleep. Followed by a light  but fresh breakfast to start our day.
label: positive

text: Shocking experience Worst staff ever. Asked them why the booking change fee was fourfold the amount on the journey back to Brisbane from Europe compared to Brisbane to Europe (in the same class). They were too classy to even respond to me. Far behind the top 20 airlines.
label: negative

text: Heathrow to Sydney was bliss with Singapore Airlines! From the moment we boarded the plane we knew we'd made the right decision to fly with SA. The staff were friendly, food was good (as far as plane food goes) and the hot towels were a nice gesture. Overall i would say they are the best airline i have flown with.
label: positive

text: This is about the homeward flight only The outward journey on Singapore and silk airlines was fantastic, the homeward journey on silk was good....but then we boarded Singapore flight to Manchester. The seat pitch in economy seems small, the staff on this flight seemed extremely busy. Food was bad noodles for breakfast and dinner.
label: neutral

text:
Very Disappointed  My onwards flight to Vegas was quite good as I was given the emergency seats as I’m 6’3” in height. The meals were quite good but was disappointed by the selection of movies on the flights on the 30th of November from Colombo to Singapore and then from Singapore to San Francisco. The service also was definitely not the typical Singapore airlines standard that I have experienced in the past. The call for assistance was missed several times. 

On my return journey on the 8th of December via Los Angeles to Singapore and Colombo it was a more than 20hr light and was extremely disappointing. First I couldn’t get the emergency exit seats despite I felt that it could have been done at Narita. Further the real issue was the seat I had 42D was broken and couldn’t recline. I suffered so much due to this. It was so hard given the length of the flight. They did offer me a middle seat but thag would have made matters worse. I feel given that I had a decent amount of Krysflyer points I think they could have easily upgraded me to business class given the situation of the chair and my height. It was a terrible flight due to this and once again it wasn’t at all the typical SIA flights that I have experienced in the past. The food was also not that great and once again the service was not at all what I expected. In fact for the first time I thought that Qatar Airways service was much better compared to my last trip with them.  
The boarding process on both legs was very professional and done well.
label: negative

text: Refund related issue I wish i could give them a 0 star ..because of covid flights got canceld i called them to give me refund me they refunded me but after few days back they again charged me near about $400 dollars i send them my bank statements they guys are looking at total puchases instead of SingaporeAir
label: negative

text:
amazing experience with singapore airlines Amazing cabin crew that was attached to the economy class seats.
they went above and beyond to help me find a lost earbud.
I am extremely extremely grateful to the cabin crew for taking the time to help me on a very early christmas morning!!
thank you so so so much to the cabin crew for helping me 😊😊
label: positive

text: Only slightly better than our outward flight but not satisfying Our outward flight was alredy disappointing. So we decreased our expectations and anticipation to that business flight. Friendlyness of staff was marginally better, but service was still chaotic. E.g. I got my braekfast (simple continental with OJ, coffee, croissant) over 30' and just because I asked 3 times (e.g. OJ received when almost in Zürich...). And my wife beside me had have breakfast a long time ago when I begann to receive tablecloth already (recommendation to Singapore Airline: Emirates is capable to serve couples simutaniously even when served from separate corridor). I still had my issue with to less space for laying (feet on the left of my seat in front of me, only laying on one side possible - call it croissant-position). But this flight shocked me mostly du to condition of furniture. Shaky stuff, jammed seat and even missing furniture parts!! And that in the "new A380 setting" Pretty bad condition for "new"
label: neutral

text:
Brilliant Staff & Airline Spoke to girls in Brisbane they were brilliant Charlotte & Georgie catered to all our requirements we needed to have a return flight from Brisbane/London, however we were cruising from Singapore to London. Another company we have been with for many years wanted to book 2 one way flights.Singapore made it return without the Singapore to London leg with a substantial saving to us.They booked us on extra legroom to Singapore then Premium Economy home.
We could not fault their service. The staff on board each flight were also fantastic nothing was too hard. Overall a brilliant trip.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic My Wife and I travelled to Melbourne via Singapore and then return, but with a two night stopover in Singapore.
The Cabin crew were fantastic, very efficient, very friendly and helpful. The food on board was very good and we were regularly asked if anything else was required, when appropriate. An excellent experience.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing for SQ Flew Premium Economy fm FCO to MEL via SIN. Flight No’s : SQ365 A350-900, SQ217 A380. 
Overall SQ Prem Y class is okay but that’s reflective of SQ pricing which is quite reasonable of this quality airline. Basically the extra $ you pay for is just for the bigger seat. The service is very much still Economy. SQ is known for its excellent cabin crew and service levels in all classes , however this was not evident in premium economy cabin on either flights. Believe Economy crew were responsible for Premium Economy cabin and as Economy was quite busy the premium cabin felt “forgotten about “. Food & drinks was very much Economy class, except in FCO they served a complimentary champagne after take off (but only one glass per pax, when I asked for another glass the crew simply forgot it and when enquiring about it with meal service , they said they could not serve it now only at take off?!) 
Curtains couldn’t be drawn as premium cabin uses Economy bathrooms so again gave it a more Economy feel than premium. 
Overall - good price for bigger seat , but don’t expect famous SQ service levels everyone talks about. If you want the big seat with all the bells and whistles - fly CX or QF (but note the price increase)!
My advice to SQ - appoint dedicated cabin crew to Premium Economy cabin will surely improve the service and feel of this class.
label: neutral

text: Stepping onto an SQ flight is already halfway home! Taking an SQ flight after being away from home for 6 weeks, stepping onto the flight is already halfway home. Being greatly with enthusiasm right at the door and experiencing excellent service throughout. It is all in the attitude of the crew team!
label: positive

text:
Confusing and misleading website As a KrisFlyer Member and loyal customer booking flights online used to be a breeze.
Not anymore. On the first page you choose the flight to your destination at the advertised prize then on the second page book your return only to find out that your booking class is no more available and one is forced to pay considerably more. To make matters worse you have to pay extra for a reserved seat, pay some more for a "forward seat" and baggage allowance for the return leg might differ too. All very confusing and misleading.
Overall the website resembles more and more a "el cheapo" budget airline.
Service on board has been cut too - no more snacks and refreshments before the main meal, asking for water results in a sip out out of plastic cup - what about a 500ml water bottle available in Thailand for 20 cents.
It seems obvious that the bean counters are now in charge at headquarters
label: negative

text:
Customer service I have travelled with many reputable airlines, but with my many trips with Singapore Airlines, they are still the best. Their customer care service is so great, made passengers travel so comfortable and relaxing.

The staff treated the passengers as if they are friends, and they are great with kids too. The service on the ground and in the air are superb, attentive and informative. Great service!
label: positive

text:
got well and truly stuffed by this airline i guess i expected better, noticed on flightradar24 the flight was already down as delayed ( 5pm flight saw the delayed at 10am that morning)  i had a 75 minute change over at Changi. when i approach the staff they had already had options for me to go either via Perth or melbourne chose via melbourne , originally i had paid extra money for a exit row seat on the aisle only to be dumped at the back of the plane on a window ( no mention from them to reimburse for the paid good seat) get to melbourne go to Qantas to checkin , sorry we cannot help you they have not ticketed the booking we cannot help go upstairs and fine the Admin room, after half an hour they put me on a virgin flight. 
 A few things that upset me most i asked for a print out from Chiang Mai staff for the Qantas booking ( yes yes thats all you need) i get to the transfer station at Changi yes yes all fine  all booked just check in at Qantas in melbourne . Why did no one pick up the error , nothing worse than being stuff around and after a Sh..t trip i am told nothing confirmed sort it out yourself !!
why did they not attempt to fixed the delayed service when at 8 hours prior they knew it was going to be late ex Singapore to Chaing mai. i know i was travelling in cattle class but did not expect such pathetic service from the no,2 airline.
label: negative

text: Top Airline This is the best airline I have traveled with, not that I have used all airlines, but I have sampled a fair amount. The food was very tasty as I love oriental cuisine and a good choice. There is plenty of leg room and a great variety of films, TV and music available. The boarding and alighting was very quick as well and the on-board staff are very helpful and friendly. I would certainly use Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Thoughtful Air Crew Service from Singapore Airlines I was coughing quite a bit on board flight from Beijing to SG as I had been caught in the rain in Beijing the night before the flight.  Without me asking, the leading stewardess came to offer me some lozenges to sooth the throat after knowing I had a throat issue.  Prompt and apt action, thoughtful and caring.
label: positive

text:
2h self transfer enough? Hi! 
i only have 2h to do my self transfer at Singapore airlines and I'm nervous that it is not enough time to make my self transfer. Do anyone have experience om how long time it can take approx. I am flying in 7 days and would love if someone helped me with this question. Is it enough time? and should i worry?? 

Thanks!
label: positive

text: Wonderful flights We flew Manchester to Singapore for a 3 day stopover then Singapore to Sydney. Came back same way without stopover in Singapore. Couldn’t fault airline. On time, comfortable and they never stop feeding you! We took up offer to bid for upgrade to premium economy, which we were successful for Singapore to Manchester flight. Wouldn’t do it again. Very little difference to being in economy. We had booked ( and paid for ) extra leg room in economy and this would have been a better option if you can get it.
label: positive

text: Unacceptable treatment  My husband and I had selected seats together on our return flight from HK. We were informed by email that there was a change in carrier and our seats were changed separating us. We tried to make changes immediately on the system and the changes were accepted. However, on the actual day when we checked in at the airport express we were told that our seats has been reverted to separate seats.    Reasons given change in carrier and flight is full.  One would have thought that such a renown brand like Singapore Airlines would have the resource to apply data analytics to understand its passengers profile such that passengers travelling together will not inadvertently be separated due to a change in carrier. This was really an unacceptable treatment and disappointing experience.
label: neutral

text: Really good experience on board We took a morning flight out of Manila to Singapore in November on board their B787. We have to say that the experience was a lot better than their B777s. The economy seats were comfortable and had sufficient legroom. The IFE screens were wide and responsive. The flight attendants were very professional and friendly. The meals were delicious. It was a very pleasant morning flight.
label: positive

text: The best flying experience I've ever had My wife and I were very well looked after by our cabin crew including CS Faruku and Mok Kai Yee who catered for our every need. The lobster thermidor was the best in flight meal I have ever eaten and other airlines should look at how Singapore Airlines organise their catering.
label: positive

text:
Ok but no ‘Wow’ experience We flew by SIA because it enabled us to fly to Tokyo and depart from Osaka. And it was a direct flight which we preferred. The experience was average where staff were courteous and polite. Food wise was average too. We did not experience any ‘wow’ moments e.g., additional  ice creams being served as we heard from other people’s experience.
