My entertainment system didn’t work on the flight back even after the air stewardess helped to reset the system. It was a boring flight back for me. The Singapore local special meal (fried bee noon) was a disgrace as It didn’t taste nice at all.
 Nonetheless, the flight was smooth and landing was great. We probably had higher expectations from this airline because it was SIA and the fare was not cheap. We were also surprised to have to pay extra for seat selection prior to check in (similar to budget airline)
label: neutral

text: Great service We traveled with disabled companion and they were terrific with wheel chair. Personal escort all the way. food on board wonderful. Faultless.
label: positive

text: Awesome experience So had booked premium economy with Air NZ to Singapore return but changes to flights meant we swapped to Singapore on the way back. We were happy with that to compare premium economy as this was our first time on this class. Arrived in Singapore Changi at our gate lounge and were surprised we had to scan our boarding passes to get into the gate. Ours would not scan and we were told to wait to one side while it was sorted. There had been a storm in Singapore which had caused delays (our flight on Silk Air from Phuket had been delayed an hour due to this) so our plane was changed to a Dreamliner which has the full two stories. There was quite a delay with the ticketing but we finally got our boarding passes to find we had been upgraded to business class. Well we were through that boarding lounge and onto the plane like a rat up a drain pipe...! We were blown away by the service and the comfort. The seats are huge, your foot rest too comfy and the lie flat bed was awesome. We both loved the food and especially the little things like the table cloths etc. the staff were wonderful and it was the best end to a great holiday.
label: positive

text: GREAT WORLD AIRLINES Though it was short flight of SIN-KUL, but definitely crew has approach of world airlines.  extremely professional crew and aircraft very well equipped.
label: positive

text: Extra baggage costs- Over the top A recent flight in business class with my wife and myself to Bangkok Thailand. A Melbourne check in they charge A$37 per kilo with no extra allowance even for business class! 15 kilos over which I thought would be at least a 5 kilo reduction! No way !! To add more pain the baggage arrived 28 hours later 🥵🥵Which 3 emails had been sent , no reply until the fourth & still awaiting a conclusion of the damage golf club 🤬🤬
label: negative

text: Good experience Enjoy the trip very much with good service by the crew team. Except food need to be improved. The brocoli is over cooked and some burnt.
label: positive

text: Worst airline Worst airline ever. Poor customer service. Delayed flights . We paid extra money for less stay over and end up staying 15 hours at airport.
label: negative

text: Amazing airline best in the world have travelled with many airlines in my time and I must say Singapore Airlines was amazing out standing service from the moment we check in we were treated like vip would definitely recommend premium economy it was amazing seats were so much better then economy more comfortably and actually got some sleep which was good, all the staff were very friendly all through the flight always had a smile and nothing was never too much for there staff, can't wait to travel with them again such amazing airline
label: positive

text:
No Stars if it was an option Four flights - Brisbane to Singapore to Phuket and return.  Absolutely dreadful experience.  Still have PTSD from the final flight!  Firstly, the food trays in economy are not to be messed with.  They sit so low on the seat in front that when you open them out they sit on your stomach at an angle that allows the food/drinks to slide off.  Also no complimentary packs as was once the case.  I was looking forward to those little slippers they used to give you – nada - but that's ok because the seat in front of you is so close that to bend down to put them on you more than likely would give yourself concussion when your head hits said seat.  It also felt like they had managed to squeeze in another four rows of seats at the expense of comfort and ease for passengers. 

Food on all flights was inedible but the final flight's food (departed Singapore around 12.45 am) was non-existent - nothing was offered except water and juice until approximately 7 am when baked beans and an egg was served.  Who serves baked beans to a plane load of passengers? The toilets are busy enough without the added fibre of a baked bean meal.  Can't complain about the service because there was nothing to serve.  I really felt like I was flying with some sort of budget airline instead of one that I paid quite a bit of money for.  Singapore Airlines once had a fantastic reputation and I was looking forward to flying with them.  I certainly won't be flying with them again.  It’s obviously all about the bottom dollar now and not flying experience for passengers.
label: negative

text: Cape town to Bali First time on Singapore airline I must say it was a great experience flying with Singapore Airlines and Silk Air, excellent service the flight attendants,  food service and overall customer service was superb. Extremely comfortable, could not fault Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text:
Love Singapore Air Business Class! Where do I start? Loved every minute of the experience:
- Paid for with only 65,000 Velocity points + tax (an absolute bargain)
- Access to Kris Silver lounge: free food, drinks, comfortable seating, charging stations, Wifi, tarmac views
- Priority boarding

The flight:
- comfortable seat that allows you to recline or convert to a bed (with comfortable mattress, blanket and pillow). Plenty of leg room
- Entertainment system has a wide variety of movies, TV shows, etc
- Very friendly staff
- Lots of good-quality food and drinks.
- Lots of storage compartments
- Amenities such as water, eye shade, charging ports & slippers provided
- Direct aisle access

Only complaint I have is that the flight felt too quick

Would definitely fly SQ Business Class again.
label: positive

text: Excellent from Singapore Airlines Great flight on the new Airbus 380, very smooth and comfortable. Service is slick with a very efficient crew who make you feel welcome. On Board entertainment is good with a wide selection of entertainment to help pass the time away. Food is good and comprehensive enough to ensure you don't go either hungry or thirsty. Choice for both Asian or European dishes being served. Plenty of luggage allowance with options to pre book you seat should you wish to. All in all Singapore airlines are good and come recommended.
label: positive

text: Asian flight In the past I already have nice experience with Singapore but this time I cannot say that all was OK. Air condizion specially in the flight from Singapore to Taipei was to strong we were in a freezer and the plane you can see that is old, the seat are comfortable but is time to change, specially if I compare this with the flight from and to Zurigo were the plane was a modern A380 fantastic one! In the way back from Singapore to Zurich at the moment of the breakfast surprise for the last 4 row the menu was finish incredible, the hostess told us if you will we have some muffin, the staff was really friendly nothing to say but I cannot accept something like this from a company that normally is on the top of the flight company! I hope in the future flights to have no issu.
label: neutral

text: Holiday TIME Best flight went all way with this airline good Food well looked after could eat drink anytime when got to Singapore we had bit of wait for the plane they made sure we got money for food and tour loved it
label: positive

text:
Singapore airline Good service at the airplane, and amazing airport have many things to do.
It is a destination it self
label: positive

text:
delicious food and right on schedule I have the pleasure to experience their economy promo return flight to tokyo before at nov 2018 and it is very convienent. 
so at this time i am joining their hospitalty again and have the opportunity to taste their delicious food and right on schedule (at least they try because of the heavy traffic for departure from Jakarta Airport).
label: positive

text:
Looking for the reference? You found it! Also the flight back (SQ336): I was really looking forward to this flight and yes, indeed, this is still better than all other business class flights then I flew before:
- Extremely nice and efficient stewardesses (I forgive it that one forgot an order which was immediately corrected when I asked it again)
- The full flat bed is different and really flat - by pulling manually the backrest dawn in the other way instead of overflowing the seat. A lot of space, so flat that on the first flight I had some backspin but on the flight back with 400 mg ibuprofen I never slept better in a plane!
- Those small things like a pass for fast track at CdG; ...
- Excellent orange juice and champagne; the wine choice was a bit below my expectations; excellent food
label: positive

text:
Impressive economy service We flew Heathrow/Singapore/Bali 22nd June and back again 7th July. A family of 4

All 4 flights departed and arrived as scheduled. The seats were comfortable, service excellent and food pretty good.

Would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: Calmly caring and professional Despite small faults I can find with the stow away table that gets stuck and the breakfast pancake that was an overly-sweet soft blob, I emerge from this long flight feeling cared-for and calm.  How great is the service of the lovely ladies of Singapore Airlines!  They look me in the eye, speak clearly and calmly, even when reminding me to stow my footrest for take-off, promptly remove used cups etc and seem to be there whenever I need them.  What an asset they are!  While their premium economy seats are not the best I’ve had, the service and the ride on Singapore Air is the best.
label: positive

text: Just ok We were flying to copenhagen from melbourne on a singapore airlines 777-333 er,premium economy last year we flew jal prem econ which was fabulous, when we got onto this one the seats were larger than econ, just , when the seat in front was laid back it took up some of our room , on jal it didn,t ,the staff were ok but the food was not that interesting, had a couple of beers, it was not that better than econ. Considering the price , wont bother again,,,
label: neutral

text: Reputable airline that lives up to expectations Excellent customer service on board. Flight crew is always friendly and approachable. We had a small problem with one of the headphone jacks and they worked tirelessly to get it fixed for us. The flight crew was also very attentive to notice if you needed a refill or trash to be cleared. They’re definitely my go-to if you’re looking for a full service flight. =)
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines continues to be outstanding. Singapore Airlines continues to be the best airline. The boarding arrangements are seamless and efficient. The plane itself is always clean. The staff are very helpful and professional. The food is a better standard than most airlines. Flights are often early and even when late are not unduly late. Check in process is easy. Always my first choice in international air travel.
label: positive

text:
Beautiful Airline Really enjoyed the service I had from Singapore Airlines. Great food. Very good speaking flight attendants that always wore a smile. 

Seat was pretty comfortable for a 8 hour flight. 
Great media/entertainment platform. 

All round great experience! 👍🏻
label: positive

text: Always a class expreience Great service, comfortable seats, good food - a very relaxing and enjoyable experience. This is one leg of a four leg return journey from Auckland New Zealand to Frankfurt over Singapore - all business class and all with Singapore Airlines. All flights were excellent as was the service and comfort
label: positive

text: EXCELLENT💯 Singapore airlines is amazing !! The service was excellent and the food was great ! The small monitor has updated movies and song so you can watch it when you are bored ! Overall 10/10👍🏻
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines, an amazing exceptional airline. I have travelled with this airline over the last 10 years and recommend them as an airline that genuinely defines customer service. My last trip was no exception where every attention to detail was given. The staff are impeccably dressed, polite, and care about their customers. Would I recommend this airline, absolutely and in my humble opinion is this best in the world. Well done Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text:
I just don’t get it. What am I missing?  World’s best airline? Not by a very long shot!! I quit flying SQ’s economy products years ago while living in Singapore. It was so often terrible, notably dirty. Most recently I ventured back into their business class to discover their new fit out. I honestly didn’t think I could dislike a plane seat more than their old fold down leather seats which became lumpy and rancid smelling, but alas, at least you had space to stretch while the seat was in its bed configuration. 

The new seat is a regular slide down seat BUT it’s extremely hard and excruciatingly uncomfortable to sleep on. It’s like laying on a wood floor with less than an inch of fabric to provide comfort. Bring back the smelly old leather seats I say! Although on my return flight I got that old fit out on an A380 and it was still stinking like the back of on old man’s car.

A note on cabin crew: I find the so-called SQ girls (and boys) to be extremely insincere and unhelpful. Even in business class, they are slow to respond and barely articulate. The fake and uncomfortable grimacing is upsetting. The Singapore girl on my aisle was trying hurry me into menu choices I didn’t want because she visibly couldn’t be bothered. Worse still, she couldn’t pronounce any of the words correctly, which was ridiculous. Not a matter of accent, but a complete lack of interest. 

Generally speaking, Singapore Airlines is just so tacky. From the ugly old uniforms to the lounges, to the inflight music and the menus, which look like they were typeset in the 1980s using your neighbour’s word processor. Just awful.
label: negative

text: I am home Had been a while since my last SQ flight. The new A340 900 was just a dream. I did have a great seat with 48a. But the service is what sets them apart. The calmness, without fuss type service relaxes body and mind. Food ok, not to rave about it. I flight entertainment was very good with great screen etc. seat comfort very good. Loved it
label: positive

text:
Pray your luggage is not lost We arrived in Chiang Mai two days ago. Two out of 3 bags missing. Lodge claim, hear nothing more for two days. Tracing is all website says. 
Try to contact Singapore, go through all details 3 times, get sent to another site but then booted out because final destination of booking was not their flight. It was Scoot their sister airline, the only one that flies to Chiang Mai. 
Ring Singapore lost and found as instructed and after half hour wait get told to leave message except then told too many messages cannot accept more. 
All this from a supposedly good airline. Ha ha.
In meantime I am here with nothing except what I wore on the plane!
label: negative

text: Long-haul flight. Singapore to London HR Very smart staff and good service, though food offers were a little sparse and I was hungry a lot of the flight! Considerable damage to wheels of one of our suitcase. Flights on time. At least they didn't leave our luggage at Singapore as on our outbound flight.
label: positive

text:
Not the quality or Service I expect Having Flown Singapore Air many times before, the service standard appears to have fallen. This was experienced on all of four flights. Whilst entertainment was good the main quality wasnt there,

Provisions have reduced in quality and what you get.
Food has dropped in standard and they didnt have the choice many people wanted on all of four flights. They need to learn what meals are popular, it isn't hard, but this seems to be cost-saving they are doing.

The people who pay extra for legroom at the front like me seem to get worst deal being served last, with cold food and no choices.
The food is no longer great, a continental breakfast was six bits of chopped fruit (4 apple) a dry roll and muffin - Thats it.  No cheese, ham, yogurt, cereal,  etc.

They dont come round as often with drinks and snacks on the long flights.

I will be choosing another airline next time.
label: neutral

text: Great company Flew to New Zealand via Singapore,  the flight attendants were fantastic, the food provided was also good, overnight stay in Singapore on the way out, plus collection from the airport, book in staff at the airport were also most helpful on the way back we stayed 3 days in Singapore, I would be more than happy to fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Service Plus I first flew with SQ in 1975 and their service has not changed.In my view they are still the best airline in the world to fly with. Their service to Wellington NZ is no exception.So for all you Kiwis and Aussies crossing the Tasman get on board and enjoy the marvellous airline.
label: positive

text:
What happened to the meals??? We flew 11 hours and only 2 meals were served (at the start and end). We asked about the middle meal/snack and they said it was coming. It need did. No explanation.
Very disappointing.
label: neutral

text: Great Airline I love flying with Singapore airlines one of my favourite. The Flight attendants are elegant and classy and handle themselves with poise. They are efficient and help as quickly as possible when needed. Just wish there was more leg room but I feel thats an issue with all airclafts.
label: positive

text:
POOR, VERY POOR. Poor , very  POOR.
How the HELL do Singapore airlines receive the NO 1 Accolade in airlines. I sat in aile 59 , and rexpereiced BACK PAIN,  that I have never expereinced before. i reported to the Air Host, Male . who was not interested, and spoke to the Air Hostess , Lady, who took down my particulars. I requested a better fitting seat, but was rebuffed. That alone was only the start, the food was AWFUL.. Sorry singapore airlines, you are POOR.
Fly at your PERIL.
Kind regards,
Norman Russell
label: negative

text:
Okay flight , UGH CHECK IN!!  I don’t get it. 

Singapore airlines has some of the nicest inflight entertainment, new fleet of airlines, slightly above average aircrew and okay seats. Why do they have to make the check in experience so horrible ! They have implemented self check in for the past 1.5 years. It’s horrible. The seats are at a higher cost then other airlines. Yet, we have to bend or backs to load our luggage on the conveyor belt, print our tickets. It’s super UGH! A skeleton crew of 5 staff helps you with the check in queries. 

So the message is this, if you take economy or premium economy everything less business or first class be prepare to be treated like a peon! 

By the way the call Centre is horribly outsourced. So god luck if you are calling in to check anything via the phone. Some times the online help doesn’t have the info, yet this is implemented. 

Recommendation don’t fly out of Singapore airport and expect it to be a pleasant experience via Singapore airlines . It’s horrid!  

In pain!
label: neutral

text: Amazing service We flew delhi to Melbourne and back in SIAans had a very comfortable flight. Staff was super courteous and Singapore an amazing airport to transit
label: positive

text: First time in Premium Economy First time we have travelled with Singapore Airline.  We booked Premium Economy seats and they were  excellent.  We had the exit seats which means that no one can put their seats back so we had heaps of room.  You have to pay extra for these seats might I add.  We thought the airline was very good, would travel with them again.  Service and food were very  good.
label: positive

text: Good value and friendly service We recently travelled for leisure with two kids under 4. The flight was unexpectedly pleasant. Service was good and the cabin crew took extra effort to make our 8 month old comfortable. If you’re travelling by economy, there’s no other choice but Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text:
great time ex canberra late evening arriving into singapore early morning with many options on connecting flights booked direct with singapore airlines ,easy seat and meal selections ,received emails when seat change due to change in aircraft type changed on leg singapore to phuket return  
those living in southern nsw and south coast now have a great connect thru canberra international airport
label: positive

text: Flying to China Fantastic service. Flight was delayed out of Shanghai and time was made up in the air so no one missed the connecting flight to adelaidr. Professional service and arrived early into adelaide
label: positive

text:
Excellent Service It is always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines as they really provide an excellent in-flight environment and you can expect their staff to give you the excellent services.
I have nothing to complain about this airline, but would be expect new surprises given by them in their future upgrade.
label: positive

text: Excellent service SQ 38 Excellent service SQ 38 Sin-LAX direct flight from Singapore to Los Angeles after dormant for a long time. Very good meal, especially can have pre order before flight with a lot of choice
label: positive

text:
Excellent - Parfait - The best A perfect flight.
The service is wonderful, you have place for your legs.
You can walk easily in the corridor.
Food is very correct, water a lot during the flight or as you like, apple, cake ... all along the flight.
I know now why they are number One. I agree completely with this situation. The best company.
label: positive

text: Flight singapore  airlines The staff were lovely and helpful, the food was hot and good for airline food, liked that we had asian choice. Movie choice was great with lots of new releases, the 8 hr flight flew by (haha)
label: positive

text:
SIA -Still Ahead of the Competition I was flying SIA after 3 years (last being to London in Nov 2016). I first flew SIA over 40 years ago & over the years the "product offered " was always good. About 5 years ago SIA slipped (like in 2016) but now seems to have " regained the CUTTING EDGE"!

This is the first time I flew by SIA- A 350-900 Aircraft.(Earlier I had flown this plane on Qatar Airways, Lufthansa, China Airlines Taipei etc & I can say SIA configuration was the best & most comfortable !

The Service standards are very high & consistent with a great product ! The hot towel when flight takes off is a welcome relief after a " rush through length airports" when switching flights.

The food (mine is always AVML -Indian) has always been consistent & of a good standard & further drinks & cocktails offered are plenty. Entertainment system is now second to only Emirates & Qatar Airways !

Cleanliness, passenger to toilet ratio is alway top class & on this plane there were 6 toilets for 263 passengers (about 44 passengers per toilet).

Take off , Landings , Announcements were good & SIA Cabin Crew are " Strict " in enforcing safety standards -unlike Western & North American Carriers.

Overall a Great Product -which has been consistent from inception !
label: positive

text: Who you choose to fly with is important The airline you choose to fly with is important on any holiday. Singapore Airlines are one of my favorites. Their cabin service is second to none and the quality of their planes is outstanding. Singapore Airlines are not one of the cheapest but they are one of the best. Always start and finish your holiday on a good note and to do that select a reputable airline that will safely get you to and from your destination in comfort and style.
label: positive

text: Always Fly Singapore Airlines When going overseas always fly Singapore Airlines, excellent service food quality is good and good serves even in economy. From check in staff to cabin crew are friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text: The only way to fly is Singapore Airlines I recently had the pleasure of flying Business class with Singapore Airlines, the service from start to finish was amazing. On time, comfortable and the food on the plane is 5 star. The lounge at Singapore has the best facilities. Really look forward to flying with Singapore again.
label: positive

text:
all ways reliable singapore airlines all ways look after you ,from the time you book to the time you leav the aircraft
we had a delay from davao to singapore and missed our connection they put us in the crown plaza hotel for the night thank you singapore airlines
label: positive

text:
Lifetime experience in suites Well what can I say, Ticking off an item on my bucket list I decided to book 2 legs in First Class with Singapore Airlines and it was an experience that lived up to more than I expected.

Having flown many a time with Singapore in Economy Class, I knew that there was a reason why it is considered to be one of the best airlines in the world.

On this occasion, all the perks that come with flying 1st Class as well as the unbelievable attention given by the staff, was an amazing experience.
label: positive

text: Very good service I Cannot fault the service but I would not pay the extra for premium economy. I like to lean against the window to try and get some sleep but in Premium economy the seats are too far away from the wall of the plane. The seats were leather and I was slipping down in the seat so I found it a bit uncomfortable. Returned on normal economy and found it easier to sleep. I would definitely fly with them again the food and the service was very good.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service, you must try their cocktail Singapore Slinge World class airline, Asian hospitality. The best part is they serve most of the cousins. Depending on the flight, the leg room may vary. Enough food and beverages served together with lot for entertainment.
label: positive

text:
Very Comfortable Flight Everyone had recommended us Singapore Airlines for our trip to Australia so we went ahead and booked it. On board we found seats very comfortable and staff very cooperative. Food was good and enough quantity. 

Planes on Delhi-Singapore leg for new but even Melbourne leg was good enough.

Flights were on time.
label: positive

text:
OK but. The JAL lounge in Osaka was not terrific. The service on the flight was very good but the food was very average. Nice wines though.

The seats were oddly configured and the entertainment system was really old. Could only get a list of movies that were part through and had to scroll through each one. I’ve seen anything like it.

I checked to see if this might be its last flight before being handed back and see that they started handing them back the 10 year old ones in Nov 2017. This one is overdue.

I had been wanting to fly Singapore Airlines for years, but I was never going to the right places. We made a slight detour to do it this year. The plane was an hour late so we missed the SQ flight to Bali and had to stay overnight. They were at the gate with boarding passes for the early flight next day with Silk Air and Crown Plaza tickets, but it made a less than great experience annoying.
label: positive

text:
Excellent service Check-in, both online and at the airport was very easy and efficient.
Cabin crew had excellent attitude. Attentive, friendly and efficient.
The food tasted very good.
Pretty good leg room in economy class, comfortable seat, very clean cabin and toilets.
Very Good variety of inflight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Long haul EWR to SIN and back The 18.5 hour flight was less gruelling than I expected.  I had such anxieties about the duration that I was bound to be pleasantly surprised.  Many years ago (when I was 'Solitaire' and living in Singapore) I traveled in business class.  The Premium Economy trip I took this time was good value for money ($2000 round trip including a stop in Hanoi), in my opinion.  I would do this again.
label: positive

text:
Excellent service and friendly crew We flew with singapore airlines with our 2 years old daughter in 19th February 2020 to Osaka. The moment we have boarded the flight, the crew greeted us warmly and they even know our daughter’s name by calling out her name! 
The crew came and have a small chat with us and our daughter too. They even asked how was our rest and meal.
When they were serving breakfast before arriving into Osaka, our daughter was sleeping, the steward even offered to keep her child meal in the warming cabinet until she wakes up for her breakfast! 
Kudos to the crew!
label: positive

text:
Wonderful service and food! I flew on different airlines but Singapore Airlines were the best!
The food was excellent!  Service was amazing!
I heard that Emirates are the best but I don't think so because I flew in February using Emirates as well.
They were not as good as Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
Singapore Airline is the best We love Singapore Airline. Every year we travel to Europe to visit our parents and family members. 
90% of the time we use Singapore airline and we never had problem with the airline. Sometimes we travel for business and Singapore airline is always first on the list, we use other companies if they have better connections for that particular trip, but trying to use Singapore airline as much as possible.
They are the best and no-one  come close to standards of Singapore airline, in my opinion.
I love crew, food, entertainment, with them time flies and I wish I can always afford business class, which is not the case, but I am trying hard to do so.
Cheers Singapore airline and keep up with a good work, looking forward to travel with you next year.
label: positive

text: Excellent flying experience Wonderful experience. The crew members were very humble and jovial. They are always take care of your comfort. The flight wan neat and clean and the food quality was just awesome.
label: positive

text:
One of the best. This airline looks after passengers so well. I am prone to having Syncopal episodes when I fly and I get anxious. 
I thought it wise to mention this at check in. Right from the word go, I felt so comfortable about my flight. Having flown Singapore before, even without my issue, I put them at the top of the list for service and care.
label: positive

text:
The flight was really pleasant and the crew was friendly as usual The onboard experience on Singapore Airlines was good no doubt, they need to improve the ground service and their lounge are not that great. Not much of choice of programmes on the inflight cinema or music. 

Krisflyer not good as it cost more money to redeem flights or redeem using their duty free. I would not recommend membership as the blackout dates are so much that you need to use most of your miles to fly economy class and also pay fees and charges when redeeming and I found the cheap tickets to work out better than redemption.
label: positive

text: Excellent long-haul and regional business class Singapore Airlines offered an excellent business class product on both the medium-haul and short-haul legs of my trip from Brisbane to Yangon via Singapore. Brisbane to Singapore 8 hr flight was on their new Airbus A350-900, which offer an excellent all-aisle business class seat (at first I has my doubts about the new seat, which looks very wide but short, but actually its length is comparable to other latest generation seats, while affording much more lateral space, great choice!). Singapore to Yangon was on A330-300 with the regional business class seat (former medium-haul seat), which albeit without 180º recline still becomes fully flat and is very comfortable for the 2.5 hr flight. In both legs the flight crew was extremely attentive, and the Terminal 3 KrisSilver business lounge in Singapore is very good, even if it would be nicer if it had views to the outside of the airport (also, showers in the lounge start to feel a bit tired, and are smaller than the product in other more recently renewed lounges). The food options seemed a bit bland, and I was surprised that no amenity kit was offered even for the 8 hour flight (there were amenities, but they did not come in a kit), but in any case, Singapore Airlines continues to offer an excellent business class travel experience.
label: positive

text: Great Airline Whenever we fly, we will only fly with Singapore Airlines and another of the major carriers.  Their service is great, planes are comfortable, staff are friendly and will definitely continue to use their service.
label: positive

text: Impressive My first time flew with sq963 cgk-sin (A350) sq638 sin-nrt (B787-10) sq639 hnd-sin (b777) sq958 sin-cgk (B777) honestly from my heart, this is my best flying experience. From jakarta to tokyo, back to jakarta, a very pleasant journey in the sky, thankyou singapore airlines. Economy meal is not bad. Surprisingly great. I enjoyed many meals on the trip, but if i have to pick one favorite, it was my dinner in economy class from jakarta cgk to changi. Seats are just ok, but the excellent service, i must say, theyre worth my money.
label: positive

text: Rude and arrogant stewardess I flew from Inchon Seoul to Singapore on the 11 Sept SQ609.Checked in very smooth and immigration brisk. But upon boarding the flight found and encountered an Orange clad uniformed Stewardess was very rude and un friendly. A very reluctant smile and greetings. While serving drinks and meals she wasnt happy at all. Even upon finishing serving, she just dragged the trolly and hid into a lady seated near me and without even saying sorry and dashed off. Surprised how she climbed up to this very senior position. How do you expect her juniors to behave. Honestly i think she should be pulled and cautioned. Its a disgrace to SIA indeed.
label: neutral

text: Great Service The flight from Manchester to Singaporeand then to Perth was excellent, the cabin crew were attentive and friendly the food was superb. Will fly with singapore airlines again.
label: positive

text: My favourite airline I've taken many long haul flights from Sydney to Europe via Singapore. The service is fantastic. My favourite airline by far.
label: positive

text: Top Trip Always a joy to travel with Singapore Airlines. The food is good and the attendants are always friendly and attentive. Our return trip will be equally as good. Not our first time with Singapore airlines and it definitely won't be our last.
label: positive

text: Great service by Singapore Airlines Thank you to Singapore Airlines for great flights from Brisbane to Shanghai (transit Singapore) on 31 August and from Beijing to Brisbane (transit Singapore) on 12/ 13 September. Good service from hostesses. Toilets clean at all times. Food okay.
label: positive

text:
Pampered by great service, tasty food choices We took SQ478 from Singapore to Johannesburg on Business Class. The seat was more than roomy, & was definitely comfortable. The handheld set was easy to figure out, so were the seat settings. The restroom was always clean, the toilet paper neatly folded even at 3AM. I've been on many other airlines & the restrooms were not always as well maintained as the ones on this flight. Supplies were always present even on the last hour of the flight. 

The menu had food for different cultures- oriental or western. Food was nicely prepared, & it was a treat to our taste buds. The staff also offered us snacks & hot beverages as we watched movies in the wee hours of the night. It was easy to catch the flight attendant's attention, so I never had to use the call light for assistance. Service was prompt, timely & always given with a smile even at 3 AM. I, too, have worked overnight shifts in the past & to serve with a smile is no easy feat. I requested the flight attendant to make my bed or convert it back to a seat, & she promptly obliged. The flight attendants as a group made us, the customers, feel pampered. 

Entertainment was diversified with so many movies available, as well as TV shows & games. They also had movies in Chinese, Hindi, & other languages. 

The flight left on time & arrived on time. Our luggage was handled fairly well with no dented suitcases. 

I recommend Singapore Airlines. I'd fly with them again whether it's a 12-hour flight or just a 3-hour one. After getting pampered by their flight attendants for hours, one doesn't feel like getting off. Truly the world's best.
label: positive

text:
Very Disappointing First Class Experience The lounge was disappointing and felt untidy and the food on offer was ok. Boarding was disjointed with me being handed off between three different crew members. The suite was nice but the leather felt dirty. The staff were far too over the top and this did not feel genuine but rather subservient. Feel that other airlines do much better at genuine customer service. SQ needs to review their uniforms as the women’s tops and skirts all looked way too tight and that style is now rather dated. The men’s suits all looked modern in comparison. The Lalique toiletries were lovely. The menu selection was vast and the best part of the entire flight. 
One of my bags was badly damaged. It was brand new and I inadvertently had two photos to prove tgat at the airport the bag was not damaged. I had NOTHING BUT ISSUES with SQ. They insisted I claim this on my travel insurance despite proof that the damage was caused buy them/an agent acting for them. I had staff members be incredibly rude and even lie to me. I have never had such horrific treatment. 
I’d never spend this amount of money with SQ again. In fact, I’ll never fly with them again. SQ staff are substandard.
label: negative

text:
Standards Dropping - A Mixed Experience Note: This review includes SQ47 (Economy) and SQ422 (which was in Business)

SQ used to be my home airline, and I used to really enjoy flying with them. I was looking forward to experiencing them after the pandemic, and I was left with mixed feelings, being disappointed after the first, and impressed after the second?

My first flight from Vancouver to Singapore, I was waitlisted for an upgrade. However, this caused a problem with my ticket, resulting in about a 30 minute check in process. Additionally, the check-in staff requested my OCI (an Indian overseas citizenship), despite my second flight being on a separate ticket made from a different mileage account, and the check-in staff only checking the bag through to Singapore, as they apparently couldn't see my onward booking. They tried to avoid this question, and while I suspect it was so they could charge us extra in Singapore, since the baggage allowance is different for flights from Singapore to India, I won't make any assumptions.

My initial reaction to the seat was that it definitely felt smaller than the older A350 seats (since I believe these are the same ones used on the 787 with a narrower cabin). I was seated in an extra legroom seat for this flight (48K), which I recommend if you're flying on the A350. It has a window, great legroom, and if you're relatively small, you can also get out into the aisle without disturbing your seatmates.

I have to say, the entertainment system aboard SQ is great. Additionally, as KF members, we had access to unlimited free wifi throughout the flight, which worked great, and which was surprisingly fast. I ended up using it the whole flight. 

The food on this flight was substandard. The first meal was fine, a bit on the small side, but I was OK with it. The second meal, however, was very low quality, and dry. Considering there were only 2 major meal services, I expected something more substantial, and with SQ being named "Best Airline in the World", I definitely expected more. Attached with this review is  a picture of a similar meal served on my Emirates flight a few weeks later. 

However, what really disappointed me was the service. One of the crew members working my section was very friendly and warm. However, I witnessed poor service from the other crew members. The other crew seemed to be a bit hostile. When I went to get snacks from the aft galley, the crew members were extremely unfriendly, and seemed quite annoyed when I asked what options were available. Also saw 2 crew on the other side of the cabin screaming at a passenger who went to use the washroom before takeoff (which is completely understandable lol, so I didn't think much of it), but throughout the flight, they seemed to be unfriendly, and later screamed at a passenger seated near me who asked a question about the special assistance they needed disembarking, which is unacceptable behavior. 

Crew are extremely important to any experience, and growing up, I remember the friendly service from crew, and the care they treated children with aboard flights, which really built a strong image of SQ for me. However, I never saw that for the children seated behind me from the majority of the cabin crew, and to me, this shows either a drop in standard, or a lack of training. I have experienced friendlier cabin crew aboard budget airlines like Swoop, which certainly doesn't charge the same as SQ. I've seen poor service on SQ (particularly on flights to the US, including in business class), but this was worse than what I've seen before, and I really hope this is not caused by lack of crew rest, as I noticed the crew working most of the flight.

In Singapore, I have to say Changi cannot be beaten. It was still a very smooth experience, and brought back many childhood memories, not having changed much in 4 years imo. I had access to the lounge on my second flight, and I have to say the new KrisFlyer lounge is great. Good selection of food, and lots of seating.
 
SQs medium haul business is smaller than their LH product, but is still very comfortable. I wish they modified their 787 seats to take advantage of the wider cabin on the A350, in business and economy. The bed is comfortable, and the seat is well designed overall. It's good to see this kind of product on medium haul/short haul flights.

The food on this flight was excellent. Had Laksa from the Book the Cook menu, and it was easily one of the best inflight meals I've had. The service on this flight was very different, much friendlier, and very attentive. All the crew went above and beyond on this flight. Although service standards are higher in business class, I do think the service definitely exceeded what I have experienced in business before. I wish these crew were deployed on the longer flights.

Overall, after the pandemic, I'm left with mixed feelings about the airline. The first flight was very disappointing, nowhere near what my experience with them has been before. However, my second flight was great (although it was in business). This experience has definitely put me off flying SQ, and given my experience with EK this summer, I would definitely fly to India next time using the 3 big gulf carriers over SQ. I hope SQ really takes their service and catering more seriously, as I have been seeing other people complain about dropping standards too.
label: neutral

text:
Appalling. Singapore airlines lost all our luggage and will not respond to our claim.
We ave been trying endlessly to get in touch with someone but every phone call seems like a phone call to a Telco sales person and is absolutely useless. 
Shocking experience and do not recommend Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines was always great, what has happened since covid What was so hard was change in flights times at airport where the change was so close to next flight, most of passengers on our previous flight from Copenhagen to Singapore were like us, had to run to get to the gate, go through customs and the lines were so long, all passengers called during the line up. Because of the big rush belongings were left behind my husbands good hat, people had moved it and we missed it (we wrote to Singapore Airlines about this) the worst thing was our Grandson's Epi Pen for his peanut allergy was left on the plane. My daughter had to again run back to the plane to get the epi-pen.  On the flight there was no record of our grandson's peanut allergy, we had requested no peanuts in the food, no one knew of this, the travel agent was given the information and gave it to Singapore Airlines. Our daughter had a seat on a long flight which would not recline on way Singapore to Copenhagen staff tried to pull it apart,  no luck, this is not so good in economy class. We did try to upgrade with our travel agent, for on way home only the cost of the seats escalated to 5 times more than what it was at Sydney airport and there were only 2 seats left. We were disillusioned. When we arrived in Sydney airport our luggage did not, due to the close times we had to get onto the plane nobody believed the luggage would make it, this was to be true. This is not to complain about Singapore Airlines but to please improve these things. It was quite stressful for all of the passengers to have such short periods with the flight changes to get on next plane. Of course the plane waited as there were so many passengers who had to get on the planes....but it was just too much to deal with.  Prior to this we had travelled with Singapore Airlines with no problem, what has happened.?
label: neutral

text: Great airline Really enjoyed our flight. The crew was friendly and they served us very quickly. The entertainment system is great, lots of great movies and series. Food was okay. Flight went smooth and we arrived right on schedule
label: positive

text:
WOW!!!! I recently accompanied my husband to Singapore( again!) where he stopped on his was to Australia  for business.

He very kindly decided to spoil me by flying me in the Suites of this amazing Airline! 

I thought that the impeccable service, very comfortable bed  in luxurious surroundings, lovely food  were out of this world - they even brought my husband a “birthday cake” with fairy lights( to replace a candle ) at 4 am Singapore time  just before we landed!

That was until we climbed on the plane to come back to London! We were on the A380 with the new Suites ! 

We were met ( as we were on the way out ) by the head steward who greet us by name and offered to carry our hand luggage . The staff were all very friendly and welcoming and showed us to our seats 1F and 2F which turned out to be the size of a room with the beds dividing it ! We each had a huge arm chair that could swivel almost 360degrees! When we asked for the beds to be made -it turned into a very comfortable double bed ! 
The bathrooms were also very large and with only 6 passengers in Suites there was never a queue! One of the bathrooms even had a dressing table ! 

Needless to say the service was superb ( as it was on the first flight ) Jasmine, Edward, Louisa and Daniel made us feel like we were the only people on the plane - thank you for making it so special 

It is not a cheap way to fly but  well worth doing in you want to do something special !

THANK YOU AGAIN Singapore Airlines for another FABULOUS flight!
label: positive

text:
Still a superb airline Another pleasant flight. I know it been tough for Singapore Economy but their airline still gives the best service and customer care. A few cut backs have been made but non that impact too much.
When on this years flight a passenger was taken I’ll, the staff dealt with the matter swiftly and deftly. Fortunately the passenger recovered but was constantly monitored for the rest of the flight.  Nice to know your in safe hands.
label: positive

text:
Quality I have flown with Singapore airlines many times and they've been consistently good to I always try to book with them. Their economy cabins are roomy and comfortable, excellent customer service, on board entertainment is great, I always fly just with a carry on and there is always enough room in the overhead cabins. The food is great except once they gave me the vegetarian meal containing dairy and I don't eat dairy - I only noticed when I read the ingredients on a muffin. This could have been a bad experience for someone else with a severe dairy allergy. 

During another flight I was seated next to an elderly couple who were ceoliac and requested gluten free meals but their requests didn't come through for some reason. There were no gluten free meals on the flight but the Singapore team member put together some meals for them that looked better than whatever anyone else had, it was great they could accommodate for them so quickly.
label: positive

text: Flight to California, USA No doubt it’s Premium Economy but there don’t seem to be a big difference between Economy and Premium Economy. Such a vast difference from the SQ flight I took some 10 years back. Back then the seats were comfortable and the seat divider could be lifted up. So, if the seat beside you was vacant you could lift the seat divider, stretch out and at least catch a few hours of shut eye during the 15-17 hours of flight! Now, Premium Economy means you get seats that are a tad stiff though SQ is kind enough to give just a little more leg room. The quality of the meals have also gone down. Since I’m a vegetarian I opted for a Jain meal on my flight to LAX and a Chinese Oriental Vegetarian (COV) meal on my flight back. The Jain meal was somewhat acceptable and it did come piping hot! Now, the COV was a real disaster! It was white rice just warm, some vegi and a side dish (no idea what that was!) and a small bun of bread with butter provided (they used to give jam but have scrapped it!) There was no gravy or soup of any kind so I guess we are required to eat plain white rice with stir fry mixed green vegi! It was a dismal enough picture but I ate what I could since I had opted for it! Now, the service - some of the air stewardesses wear plastic smiles on their faces throughout the flight since for them it was just a line of duty, nothing more! With their impeccable appearances and heavy enough make up they do look a little like Barbie dolls! But to be honest in this bucket of bad apples there were one or two flight stewards/stewardess who were warm and easy to talk to. One kind steward lend me his personal usb cable to charge my iphone! So I guess SQ does not deserve anything lower than 6 on the scale! The toilets were acceptable though I feel SQ can do a bit more to prevent theft! I simply don’t understand why people think it is alright to take away the soap bottle! Oh yes, the liquid hand soap was missing in one toilet and when I queried a flight steward about it he said it was stolen! Now, the entertainment - the movies available were pathetic, especially for the Indian passengers! I had expected to see some of the latest movies but was deeply disappointed! Finally, I saw what was available and an old English classic - Seven Brides for Seven Brothers just to pass time! One good thing was there were USB slots to facilitate mobile phone charging and free Wi-Fi. Finally, a kudos to the pilots for safely bringing us to LA and back home. The flight at times seems to be a little bumpy which I guess is natural as we do have to bow down to Mother Nature! So, the seat belts sign came on and off frequently. Overall, I guess it was an acceptable flight, both ways but next time I may want to try other reputable airlines too just to compare notes! 🤔
label: neutral

text: Efficiency is the difference  I was so pleasantly surprised with SQ468 from Singapore to Colombo. This was a great start to my summer vacation. The aircraft was unfortunately showing its age though, however, the crew were extremely professional and courteous. The biggest highlight of the flight was the food which tasted great. The fish buriyani tasted authentic and was very palatable! Arrived on time but luggage took ages to come due to a mess up with the ground handling, which is not ideal if you’re jet lagged and tired at midnight after flying for 14+ hours from Australia
label: positive

text:
Felt looked after This was our first time flying with Singapore Airlines.
The service and the friendliness of staff was excellent.
Very attentive care that made the long flight better.
Singapore Airlines is now my first choice for international flights.
We have since flown with them three times and the excellent
 service continued.
label: positive

text: Ok to Singapore, but great to Hong Kong. Traveling to Singpore, was ok, but from Singapore to Hong Kong the Flight was Great. We felt that the seats to Singapore were a bit too well used. Premium to Hong Kong, was a hell of a lot better. Everything said new.
label: positive

text: Our Big Concern. We booked & paid for flights for 11 people, 6 adults & 5 children on 26th Feb 2019. Christchurch, Singapore, Singapore, Bangkok, & return Koh Samui, Singapore, Singapore, Christchurch. Through Travel Agent FCM. ( A special one off family holiday) All flights were confirmed, and paid for (no special deals). Then on 22 Dec 2019. Singapore Airlines bumped 2 flights off the return flight Koh Samui, Singapore, Singapore, Christchurch. If I had not had issues trying to log my bookings with Kris Flyer I would have been up queer street. I contacted the travel agent, who then made further enquiries, only to discover those two flights had been cancelled by Singapore Airlines. Result:- Two of us had to come home via Bangkok Air to Singapore, then Singapore air to Christchurch, a day earlier than planned. We have been unable to claim the extra day's accommodation(owing to insurance excess). Singapore air has not apologised, nor did they offer any upgrade, nor compensation of any sort. We have not heard a whisper from them... Poor form Singapore Air. To make matters worse, it is impossible to contact them in person. The Travel agent was the meat in the sandwich & she did a wonderful job. We may have been sitting at the airport in Christchurch with the ground staff saying 'Sorry madam you have no return tickets, you are not leaving the country'...!!!  Make absolutely sure your tickets are for real is my advise. Double Check.
label: negative

text:
Comfy and good food choice Well, it's a good flight, the landing is good, good service but they could improve it. One thing that caught my attention is how they're too hurry to serve you. One of the flight attendant even spilled some tea on my jeans because he's too hurry. A bit hot, but I didn't quite mind it. 

Oh yeah, on the flight from SIN to ICN (I've a transfer in SIN) the air con was too cold (probably because it's autumn night) but It's still too damn cold. And my in flight entertainment system was broken so they have to reboot the whole system. Which is still okay, because I slept while waiting for the system to reboot.
label: positive

text: The Best Airlines We had gone in December 2011, to New Zealand and it was one of the best experiences we had in Singapore airlines. The cabin crew was so modest and caring that they arranged for a vegan meal which was not on their menu. Also if you travel to Australia or NZ on Singapore airlines, make sure you have stop gap of more than 5 hours so that you get to visit Singapore in transit without doing the immigration check at Changi.
label: positive

text: Fly in the super jumbo Took the SQ423 flight from mumbai to singapore. It is one of the flights on the airbus A380 superjumbo. I selected the seat on the upper tier in the middle part of the aircraft. This is usually the area with less turbulence. Seat comfort is good, food and beverage service very good. In flight entertainment is good. Checkin and boarding is smooth. Highly recommend taking this flight if leaving from mumbai for singapore.
label: positive

text: "Quality Airline" Travelling economy to Delhi was a pleasure due to the friendly staff and cabin crew. Food was great and a good choice of movies helped the time pass quickly. I hate long distance flying but the aircraft was comfortable with plenty of leg room. I would definitely recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Best Business Class Service  From start to finish this was travel made easy. Service was excellent, modern aircraft, in flight entertainment was excellent and the staff were attentive and very welcoming. I can’t wait to travel with Singapore Airlines again
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline This is first time I took Singapore Airline, which was well organized. For boarding the airline divided people into several groups. This avoided crowded stiuation.
label: positive

text:
Ahead of the pack Singapore Airlines have consistently provided warm customer service. The customer base is catching on and their popularity are keeping them busy. For the past few yeasr between south-east asia and europe i've been using their economy class service. On my next vacation, i'm going to try their business class product to Europe and premium economy class to south-east asia or flights under 10hrs.

Their airport hub also makes this airline one of the best places to have a nice stop over too.
label: positive

text: Nice touches  We recently flew Wellington to Melbourne and found the experience pretty good. They have some nice touches including hot towels and a printed menu for the forthcoming meal. Previous to the flight I had enquired about gluten free meals which they happily accommodated. On the off chance I also enquired about making one of them vegetarian and suddenly it was a huge deal requiring medical certificates and 2 weeks notice and the certificate would have to be sent to them which was a little odd I felt. I had specified it was just an enquiry so a simple yes or no would have sufficed. On the flight the attendants were polite however it was freezing cold and many passengers were asking for a blanket. Not sure why the necessity to have it SO cold that it was uncomfortable. Overall a good flight.
label: positive

text: Best flight with 3 small kids This was our first time flying Singapore Airlines and we loved it. From price to booking to requesting children’s meals everything prior to flying was seamless. Check in and bag drop was quick and easy.  Nothing was too much trouble for the flight attendants. Special shoutout to Winston!  The entertainment system is great and so much food!This is now our first choice airline.
label: positive

text: The whole flight was great. I normally fly with Singapore Airlines but for some reason my agent booked me with Virgin. It's amazing how many points I would have as a frequent flyer but I am so slack I don't have a frequent flyer membership. All that aside, the main reason to enjoy a flight is the food and the service. As usual, the food was so so but the young lady who looked was nothing short of fantastic. She was a complete testament to herself and the training she has received. All the crew on the flight were very good but this young lady stood out.I did ask her for name and the contact in the Airline who I convey my gratitude. The names of the staff that she gave me were,Joe, Shanti, Hakeem Irwin Joanna and Wai Ling. I think that the paricular young lady was Wai Ling. Great stuff. I did not give a good score for the legroom as I am very tall and refuse to pay for extra as I believe that paying extra for a seat in cattle class is a complete rip off.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines What a delightful airline.  We have never flown Silk Air previously.  They were efficient, punctual and delightful
label: positive

text: Comfortable, great entertainment, good food, friendly and efficient service. Comfortable, great entertainment, good food, friendly and efficient service. Their boarding technique is fast and efficient.  Favourite airline!
label: positive

text:
Excellent Experience Experience was very good. Flight was on time. In flight services and crew was very helpful. Food was good and crew was very friendly and approachable. 
Overall very happy with the flight.
label: positive

text: Cramped on Airbus A350 Disappointed that our favourite airline, Singapore, has configured this aircraft with the worst economy class seating I have experienced.   I am an average sized person, 184cm and 100 kg, and found a centre seat in a middle row of three extremely cramped and uncomfortable for a 9- hour flight.   Five stars for service; one star if possible for comfort.
label: positive

text: overheated cabin The service in Economy is less than average - my wife was gluten free so got a one size fits all meal that assumes lactose and sugar intolerant. Some of it was extremely unattractive.
label: neutral

text: Don’t buy Premium Economy for the food Departure from Singapore for Melbourne was on time, however boarding was chaotic.  Premium Economy seat was more comfortable, wider and apparently with a greater incline and leg room.  I had traveled all of the previous night with a 7:45am boarding in Singapore and the only option on board was a continental breakfast; 5 cubes of fruit, a small burnt croissant but a very nice muffin, inadequate!  For lunch I chose oriental style pork: tasteless pork with a very thick sauce, well-seasoned rice and steamed unseasoned vegetables.   The sauce (being kind) was so thick it could not be incorporated with any other element of the dish; it was a separate unpleasant gelatinous ‘entity’.
label: neutral

text:
Good but not amazing anymore I traveled on Singapore Airlines' business-class on Dec 25th 2019 after almost 16 years. The service is excellent but the food quality has degraded for sure. Western options like pasta are non-existent and Indian options are extremely spicy and harsh on your stomach especially when you travel. There were always one or two curries from the main dish that my entire family could not handle due to strong and pungent spices. The various types of breads are extremely greasy. Bathrooms are kept reasonably clean at all times and the staff is always eager to please. It makes up for the food and awkward seats in the business class wherein you have to sleep diagonally to rest your feet. Also, the mattress is builtin and exceptionally firm/hard making it less comfortable. Furthermore, in order to be environmentally friendly, they have stopped giving the complimentary vanity pouch/toiletries. 

Lastly, I was very disappointed by the ground staff that does the second screening for America bound travelers. I am a US Citizen with a TSA pre which means, I never need extra check in the US and yet the security person kept harassing me and finally asked me to dump my 4-ounce, half-used Burt-Bees powder which is ridiculous. Under the name of security, airline security staff is behaving like brain dead slaves. When will airlines petition to stop this madness under the name of security? Their businesses are getting killed and the profits are marginalized because people are apprehensive to travel.
label: positive

text: I never been impressed with Singapore airlines service or attitude of their staff. Qantas is  far superior. I have flown Singapore Airlines several times but I have found the service of Qantas and Virgin Atlantic far superior in every way.
label: negative

text:
Book to fly Singapore Air but ended up on Scoot We intentionally booked Singapore Airlines, cos we wanted to avoid the hazzles of flying with  no frill budget airlines. So we booked our flights on the Singapore Air website and was looking forward to enjoying their famous cabin services.
How disappointed were we, when we found that, on the Mel to Singapore leg, we were actually flying SCOOT and having a no frill, budget flight experience instead! So, I would advise travellers to check their booking with Singapore Air carefully. You can find yourself on a budget Scoot flight.
label: negative

text:
DO NOT TRANSIT VIA SINGAPORE OR USE SINGAPORE AIRLINES I booked a flight from Jakarta to Darwin, I knew I had a long transit in Singapore (over 10hours) 

I looked online after booking and saw that I could access the lounge and pay a fee to get more comfort in the terminal 3. Well... we never made it to Terminal 3. Singapore Airlines 'forgot' to mention that no passengers have access to the terminal while transiting but only a WAITING ROOM, I would have look at another option if I knew in advance, it wasn't mentioned anywhere (time of booking or confirmation) I am pregnant and I felt very uncomfortable during my transit, also it was very DIRTY in the waiting room, during the 10 hours I never saw any staff cleaning around, go figure during a pandemic .... I felt UNSAFE, not looked after, this experience put me off SINGAPORE AIRLINES and I already told few friends that are about to travel to avoid at all cost this company.. What a joke !
label: negative

text: Comfort in Premium Economy Singapore Airlines' premium economy seats are comfortable and spacious. The cabin service is excellent and the food selection and quality was the best I have had on an airline for a long time.
label: positive

text: Holiday here we come Flight left on time and arrived 15 minutes ahead of schedule. Bit disappointed with breakfast (6.30 am flight), perhaps we'll look at different options on the way home. The plane was spotless and the cabin crew to SIA's high standards.
label: positive

text:
SINGAPORE GIRL WHAT A GREAT WAY TO FLY Sydney to Singapore was a Boeing 777. I will not review this part of the trip, except to say it was great as usual.

The Singapore to Rome flight was on an Airbus A350. This was my first experience of this type of aircraft and I was much impressed. It was comfortable and spacious even in Economy. My son is over 6 feet tall and he found it comfortable. WELL DONE SINGAPORE AIRLINES. The seats felt a little thin in the padding, but were comfortable and with a bit of a walk around occasionally did not fatigue you at all. The entertainment system as always was varied and easy to use. Headphones I would suggest you take your own, particularly on a long haul flight. Service was excellent as always. What more can I say.
label: positive

text:
Downstairs economy in A380 was not comfortable at all I have flown Singapore Airlines a number of times and never had such an uncomfortable flight.  The last time I flew on their A380 I sat in economy upstairs but I think they have since reconfigured and there is no upstairs economy anymore.

The seat legroom was really constrained and my sleep uncomfortable (it felt like the seat was also perhaps narrower than other planes?)  Aside from that, the bathrooms were kept clean, the crew was efficient and the Hindu meal delicious.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines have lost the plot SQ left a message on my phone yesterday asking me to ring them. I rang and got a recorded message to say that they had changed my Singapore to Darwin flight to an earlier time. Waited two hours holding for customer service, then gave up. Emailed, no reply. Contacted them through Facebook Messenger and was told they would ring me today, they didn’t. Rang and waited another hour on hold to then speak to a really rude agent. He said my flight to Darwin had been changed as original flight had been cancelled. I pointed out that my first and second flights now overlapped so that was absurd. He said that my third flight from Darwin to Alice Springs was also cancelled so he would put me on hold to ask what to do. I suggested it might be helpful to first find out what I wanted. He said he couldn’t do that! I said I had worked out alternative flights that I would like to be re-routed to. He said he couldn’t do anything without advice. I was then put on hold for a further ten minutes. He then came back and said he recommended that I just cancel the flights and my hotels. I said I am not cancelling my holiday, there are other airlines. I reminded him of the legal obligation to re-route my flights, said I would be complaining and asked his name. He refused to tell me and said the conversation was being recorded. I said that was good as SQ would be able to hear him refusing to offer me alternative flights. He then decided he could offer a re-route after all. I am a Krisflyer member and cannot believe how poor the SQ service has become. I will stick with Emirates in future.
label: negative

text: Expectations met Friendly and helpful staff made this trip trouble free - quick and easy boarding, assistance available when required.
label: positive

text: Great airline Overall the flight was great, service and food was great.  Easy transfers in Singapore to get connecting flight.
label: positive

text: Disappointing service Loved to fly Singapore airline, cabin crew service constantly outstanding. However, arrived Singapore and realised left something in the plane and known the plane is sealed until next day becsuse we arrived in the midnight. Staff were hopeless, pushed us away from T3 to T1 then to D counter. The item we left behind is not an item that is easily pick up and we believed it will only be pick up when the cleaner cleans the plane. We reported to you and we expected you to give an afford to find it, not to let us know you forgot about it. Very disappointed.
label: negative

text:
Disabled friendly airline and very communicative supporting office staffs We travelled as a family of five on 25th of June. Our little daughter is disabled and need extra arrangement prior the trip date. I sent email to the office staff to let them now my daughter's medical condition .I got the reply within 24 hours from their local and Singapore office staff to advise what to do so that I would had a smoothest flight.
With clear information do and dont from the staff as well as good communication we had, indeed our trip was smooth and no problem at all. 
Checking staff at Heathrow airport, I forget her name, she is very nice lady and helpful . She greeted us with broad smile and helped us with clear information and direction on how to get to the departure gate as the location was quite walk distance from the check in counter.
Upon entering the aircraft, all crews members greeted us with warm hospitality  and one of them arranged and made sure my daughter's buggy kept safely in their luggage storage  .

Overall we enjoyed the long haul of 14 hours flight ( 2 hours transit in Changi Airport Singapore). The crews were excellent. The journey were smooth as velvety cake in my mouth !
Will travel again with Singapore airlines, for sure.
label: positive

text: Seats are so close that socially difficult!! We recently traveled by SQ from Singapore to Delhi.This was in economy class by Boeing 787-10.Inside the cabin looked refurbished. To get more passengers in the cabin they have placed the seats are so close to one another that it is difficult not to touch the next passenger even with slightest movement.If you travelling with your family sitting next to you,you are OK; if not and the passenger is more than average size......
label: neutral

text:
excellent hospitality and customer service Smart hostess serving passengers with real smile gives staying at own home
sometimes male attendance forget customers request to offer like water for thirsty etc.,
label: neutral

text:
LOST BAGS, EVEN THOUGH WE FLEW ON THE SAME PLANE FOR BOTH FLIGHTS Arrived at Bangkok airport after transitioning at Singapore airport. We got off the plane at Singapore to then get back on the same plane to go to Bangkok.
When we arrived at Bangkok we were greeted by someone holding up a sign with our name on it.
They then informed us that our bags were back in Bangkok.
We were told that the bags were on the next flight which would arrive at 7pm. We had to leave airport around 7pm due to a paid pickup waiting.
We were told that the bags would be delivered to the hotel.
They finally arrived at the hotel at 11.30 pm.
This meant we were awake for 24 hours , and tired.
Firstly, how can you lose a bag which should have stayed on the plane, and secondly, why did it take so long to be delivered to the hotel?
There were other travellers from Adelaide on the same flight who had this happen.
Not a great look and start to a long awaited holiday.
label: negative

text: The best The best flight,well present aeroplane, friendly staf,nice and very enjoyable flight. 1 of my favourite airplane to travel specially safety issue. Since 96 always a pleasure to flight with singapore airlines.
label: positive

text:
Not as good as Qantas or Air New Zealand Since Qantas or Air NZ do not have a great network and code shares may not offer premium economy, then this airline provides a reasonable but not equal alternative.Pretty annoyed that changes to flights was not conveyed to me beforehand and so had to make alternative hotel arrangements at my cost - not theirs. Check-in and aircrew service faultless. Cabin configuration does not provide exclusive toilets or even conveniently located toilets and so you need to pass through economy to access them.
Krisworld entertainment adequate but not great, nevertheless found enough to keep me entertained during the hours that I was not sleeping. Krisworld system is easy to navigate.
Food presentation same as and part of economy service and not up-scaled and seperate as per Qantas and Air New Zealand premium economy.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable The Singapore Air Premium Economy is a great example for others to follow. Excellent leg room (which is most important) and quality entertainment system and great service from the ladies
label: positive

text: An experience with the Grand-children My husband and I took our daughter, her husband and their 3 kids - our beautiful grand children to Singapore for a holiday.  Our grands were thrilled to be on the flight - so excited. They wanted to do so much in so little time on the plane, but I guess because of the time factor, they watched movies and a couple of them just nodded off to sleep.  It was a good flight.  The flight attendants and service was really nice, but I did not particularly enjoy the food this time around??  I have flown Singapore Airlines many times before and I have had no issues at all.  Maybe it was a one off thing :-)
label: positive

text:
Great seats and service, food can be better This was on the A350 plane, the seats are spacious and can be folded over to make proper lie-flat beds. Try to take the first row as it gives you a lot more leg room and hence you can really down flat without needing to curl your legs.  

Both meals on the flight were served in nice cutlery and they set the table up for you - but the food was quite disappointing. The beef was rock hard so I couldn’t finish it. When they asked me what’s wrong with the food, I told them but they didn’t have extras/ better food, so they just apologised and cleared. No service recovery apart from an apology.
label: neutral

text: Fabulous trip The price alone was a highlight, having searched for a while for a good Xmas flight, I managed to score this Premium Seat for less than all the competitors economy seats. Also being on an Airbus 350-900 the seat configuration was very generous. As seems to be the norm these days Singapore attendants are among the very best, they surpass any domestic attendants by a long way.  Good food choices, ample leg room, and easy disembarkation.
label: positive

text: So back home from Auckland So our first flight ever with a A380. We had seats on the upper-deck. Nice spacious cabin. Great luggage bins. Legroom was less than in the A350-900 from Amsterdam. Staff was again very friendly, a lot of drinking services.
label: positive

text:
Just the best airline! We were on the double decked A380 so the seats were extra comfortable and there was more space than the other smaller planes we had travelled on with Singapore Airlines on this trip.
The check-in was quick and efficient and so were the on board staff. Great service and good food. Water brought round and snacks in the galley.
Very good in-flight entertainment selection.
label: positive

text:
Surprised to see such a poor service .I flew from Melbourne to Kathmandu in october.from Melbourne the service is okay ishhh.the drama starts from Singapore to Kathmandu flight vice versa.they don't have a proper blanket for my 3 years old daughter.when i asked for it they brought newborn blanket which was a joke.they didn't bring it to me I had to fight for it .what a shame.
Forget about infotainment.kids food was such lame.
Not going to fly again with them.
label: negative

text:
Singapore airlines broken 2 times in one trip To whom it may concerns,

I flew with Singapore Airlines from 0814-0821 between BKK and SG. I can't believe in just one week Singapore Airline broke my luggage twice. Honestly I am still in shock. 
 Singapore airline is globally renouned for its first-class service and during this trip I bought business class specifically just to experience it but got so disappointed in the end,

On 14-08-2022, I flew with SQ707 from Bangkok to Singapore for business. I landed just to found my luggage lost one wheel and its cover cracked in several places. I filed a complaint and the reference number is SINSQ52193. Since I don't have a usable luggage I had to be stuck in the same hotel for your staff to pick it up, fix and return it. I requested my luggage to be fixed at RIMOWA only but your staff said they can only ask their vendor to fix it. Since I only had one week in SG I said yes and they fixed & returned my luggage on 19-08-2022. The fixed wheel is different from the other three wheels and it looks a bit weird but I can live with it. 

I thought it's over, but On 22-08-2022, I flew back with SQ710 from Singapore to Bangkok. I landed and again found my luggage got crippled (one wheel hang loose to the case and it's not even the same one from last time). What's worse, the fixed wheel again got loose and a few more cracks was spotted on the cover. I had to file a complaint again and this time the reference number is BKKSQ37495.

I attached all the damage photos for your reference. I also checked with RIMOWA China team and they replied it cannot be properly fixed. Even it does it's costly and  I can only use it for a quite short time. I will check with RIMOWA store in Thailand again. 

At last, I have to say this is my worst flight ever. It's time-consuming, exhaustive and I have to re-schedule my plan since I don't have a usable luggage，and I have to buy a new suitcase to continue my trip. It ruined my trip completely and I really hope you guys can look into this and give me a solution. I‘ve try to sent 3 complain letters and instagrams ,NOBODY REPLY AND NOBODY CARES!THAT'S SO FUNNY AS A WORLD-WIDE 5STARS AIRLINES !!!
label: negative

text: Cramped I have flown with Singapore Airlines before and find the leg room to be very small. I am not tall but I still felt cramped. Eating a meal was ridiculous... could not eat normally.. had to bring the dish to me. I will avoid flying with this airline again
label: negative

text: Schoolies Trip As always wonderful service from the crew of Singapore Airways. We had a first time flyer with us and they checked in often to see how she was doing. Only downside was of course the asshat(s) who insist on dropping their chairs back in economy ( honestly pay business and stop annoying everyone) as soon as the plane levels out. Ended up with some bruising on tummy as the guy in front of me dropped his chair back while my tray was still down. Besides that amazing service.
label: positive

text:
