Great service. Singapore is a very good airline.
The plane was extremely clean, the cabin crew pleasant and efficient and the food and drink of a high standard.
Overall, a pleasant and comfortable flight.
label: positive

text: AFRICA 2018 Modern planes great cabin crew. Second leg Singapore to Melbourne an older plane not so good. Overall a good round trip
label: positive

text:
Below the expectations - Flight attendants were mostly grim and sullen, except few.
- Contrary to their image, aircraft was extremely old with an unsatisfactory and old fashioned In-Flight Entertainment system.
- Flight attendants were just trying to push us to drink tea or coffee. They didn't give information about other drink options. We tried to find out other alcoholic or non-alcoholic drinks.
- Lots of check-in mistakes. For example, they gave apart seat for my 5 years old boy. Thanks to smart airport c/in personnel they found a way to fix it.

In short, if you have a long flight re-think other opportunities.
label: negative

text:
Worst airline in the sky. Horrible customer service We bought our tickets for the holiday of a lifetime. Heading to London directly from Canberra you beauty no travelling to Sydney to fly internationally. I have flown Qatar before and was originally going to fly them but had seen ads saying how amazing Singapore was. This soon proved to be a mistake. 

We boarded our flight from Canberra to Singapore and that went fine, the plane was a little out of date and lacking modern touches. There were no personal AC vents to make you more comfortable which was annoying but ok. 

We arrived in Singapore following the flight and waiting to board our A380 SQ308 to London. We boarded without incident and located our seat for the very long flight to London. About 3-hours into the flight my wife and I had become comfortable enough to try and sleep. I slowly dozed off and initially dreamed I was caught in a summer shower as I was hot yet was being rained upon. I opened my eyes and to my horror saw an unidentified liquid running out from the light fitting directly into my crotch. Due to their being a man sleeping and my wife it took a few seconds to get out of my chair. After I had got out of the chair the water continued to stream and stream. I asked to be moved as I couldn’t sit on a wet chair under Niagara Falls. I was moved to a set of four seats with my wife with no where to lean against (the main reason I asked for an outer aisle window seat. It was at this point that I asked staff for further assistance with dry clothes. This was denied and I was offered a blanket to cover up and paper towels. I asked several more times for some dry pants from one of the upper classes as I knew they get them. This was repeatedly denied. After telling staff I could not possibly sit for a further 13 hours with wet pants. Several members of staff arrived again seeming to not know how to handle the situation. I again asked for pants which was finally granted after 5-15 minutes post waterfall. 

No member of staff was able to explain what the liquid was that had leaked out of the roof or how it came to be in my lap. I made contact with the airline on arrival and my complaint appears to have been brushed off. I was merely offered a lousy $100 gift card in lieu of an upgrade or partial refund of my flight. I was also told the liquid was water from the AC even though no AC appeared to be overhead. I was also denied access to the engineers report and my request for a review of my complaint fell on deaf ears. 

Apart from the flight home that I have already paid for I will never use the airline again, buyer beware of the cheap airfares.
label: negative

text: Long haul flight One of the best services on economy.It was a tiresome flight first from Colombo-Singapore,Then after a 3 hours transit again on a Singapore flight to Shanghai.We were travelling for a summer camp.As we were students we were looking for the cheapest flight available in internet during mid July.To our surprise we found this flight from Singapore airlines,the best airline in the world. This flight and the return flight  to Colombo proved us why Singapore airlines is unbeatable from the rest!!!! Hoping to travel soon in Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text:
Glad we upgraded This is one journey which involved two flights with Singapore airlines - a smaller plane Airbus 350 for the shorter leg from Brisbane to Singapore  then Airbus 380 for Singapore to Heathrow. Unfortunately the larger plane was older and less comfortable with the old fashioned handset to control the entertainment. We upgraded to Premium Economy mostly due to legroom but the second leg was quite empty and many customers in economy had a whole row of seats so could lie down. 

The food in both legs was poor quality - toasted sandwich and soggy noodles. We had unsuccessfully tried to do "Book the Cook" - people who had got served first and ensured their choice. Drinks are not offered as often or generously as on other airlines - they do come round with cups of water and juice but  no welcome glass of fizz when you board and no specific drinks service so no gin and tonic then wine with dinner unless you actually ask for it. I asked for a diet coke and the stewardess poured half a glass from a can but didn't give me the rest of the can. 

Unsurprisingly the entertainment has a high proportion of Asian films so unlike other long haul carriers very few current films - so I caught up on some box sets (eg Chenobyl) but there's a wide music choice including some relaxation/sleep promotion. I found the cabin temperature varied a lot - one leg was very cold but the second leg was uncomfortably warm and stuffy (perhaps to send us to sleep) and it was quite noisy - we've been spoiled by Dreamliners which are far quieter.The amenity pack has socks, eyemask and a toothbrush. 

It was quite turbulent so we had to stay seated with seatbelt on a lot, so trying to get to the toilet was difficult as sometimes people had been queuing and hen had to sit down before using the facilities. 

Staff are charming and polite  but not overly friendly or chatty - it's quite a subservient approach. The safety briefing is lovely though as  it incorporates a beautifully filmed travelogue about Singapore. From what others have told me Emirates is a better carrier for Australia but we chose Singapore Airlines as we preferred Singapore to Dubai for a stopover
label: neutral

text: Girls travel I knew that they are the number one airline in the world, but now I really know why. The best service i had from all the airlines I’ve travel before. I’ve  travel all over the world, sometimes businesses and even first class, the service of the economy class on Singapore airlines is better than some business I’ve traveled before. The food was delicious. I usually never eat on planes, I tried to eat before I board, but it was a 14 hours flight, so I had to eat, and was very good. The flight attendants are so polite and very helpful. I highly recommend to fly with them. Can’t wait for my next trip.
label: positive

text: Holiday to England The most amazing airline! Comfortable seats, DELICIOUS food!! But the entertainment system wasn’t very good, barely any shows mainly game shows. But otherwise definitely worth the time spent. Amazing destinations too all around the world!! Definitely 10/10
label: positive

text: Singapore to Hanoi on SQ176 We managed to get a very good deal on SQ to fly to Hanoi in July (probably because this is the hottest month of the year and therefore the least popular time). Operated on an A330 with a 2-4-2 config in economy. Despite it being low season the flight was completely full - I didn't see any empty seats. Some issues with the entertainment system randomly stopping during the movies I watched, but otherwise no issues on this flight. Inflight meal was decent. And of course it was nice to be back on SQ after so many recent flights on budget airlines. Flight arrived on time.
label: neutral

text:
Utter waste of time Am currently stuck in the plane from CGK to SIN. Flight was supposed to depart at 210pm but was delayed to 3pm due to bad weather in Singapore. What??? If we had flown, could the skies not have cleared by the time we reached Singapore which is 1.5 hours away? By the time 3pm came, was informed that it be (maybe) another 1.5 hours before we can take off. As I said, we could have touched down at Changi by the time we even get to fly now.

Would definitely not recommend SQ because of this in my mind, unnecessary delay.
label: negative

text: The Best Flight Experience We've Ever Had! This was absolutely the most wonderful flight experience we've ever had:  We were treated to hot towels at the beginning and end of the flight, we were served delicious meals and snacks, and the flight attendants were extremely attentive and friendly.  This airline exhibited a level of customer service that is lacking in most other airlines, and it was done for an airfare that was quite reasonable.  We would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again, and would highly recommend it.
label: positive

text: a cut above All four legs of this  journey to Bangkok and back went smoothly. The plane left and arrived on time, and  the service was friendly and efficient. The food was as good as economy airline food can get, and the inflight entertainment was great. The seats weren't bad, and the overall experience of economy long distance travel was good. I would recommend Singapore Airlines to anyone.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Business Class Auckland to Singapore was the first of three sectors, second was Singapore to Barcelona, third was Frankfurt to Singapore.   The seating was spacious, private and comfortable with ample storage for small items.   There was a good selection of movies and TV programmes.   The flight attendants were friendly and helpful and the customer service was excellent as always.   Their business class is hard to beat.
label: positive

text: Cramped Seating Cramped seating and the trays are not removed till one almost reaches the destination. The food, service etc. is very good. The Boarding process needs to be streamlined as the groups announced is not really checked nor segregated. One who waits has to wait for a long time
label: neutral

text: excxellent service Friendly and attentive staff on flight from UK to USA.  Adequate legroom; upgraded to bulk-head seats on return flight as companion is tall, which was nice.  Real metal cutlery, but still a faff trying to eat out of plastic trays.  When will airlines give us deli sandwiches and yogurts instead?  All in all very impressed, particularly as we have experience some dire transatlantic flights, in terms of service and legroon
label: positive

text: Best Airline in the World Singapore Airlines are still the best airline in the world.  I decided to go with another airline late last year and regretted that decision.  Singapore Airlines are above standard in service and are excellent.
label: positive

text:
Great service and amenities My long haul flight with Singapore Airlines was very pleasant. I had a stop over at Changi before heading to Brisbane. I love the fact that if you have a long stop over, you can avail a tour around Singapore in the airport.

I had no trouble checking in and boarding. They also gave each passenger an amenities pouch.

My only complaint was that the food was a bit bland, but overall it was a pleasant experience.
label: positive

text: Holiday Stopped over in Singapore on route to Australia. Brilliant service, food and facilities on board .Good choice of films. Just brilliant all round
label: positive

text: Adelaide?Singapore for F1 Grand Prix Absolutely first class service. Great Cabin Crew.  Nothing was too much trouble,  and they make a beaut Singapore Sling
label: positive

text:
Sydney to Singapore 27TH august 2018 Sydney to Singapore 27th August 2018.
Seat:56H
Into the tunnel, we ventured that would take us to our plane. Because we required the assistance of walking sticks we were first.

Soon as we approached and could see the doors of the plane, we were welcomed by three sincere smiling faces.

We entered the plane. My wife and I hobbling along with our walking sticks, following the flight attendant to our seat.

"Take your time please, no rush" we were told as we found our seat.

Not just words, because their careful actions showed they did care. They wanted us to enjoy the experience flying with them.

We did feel very special and calm and soon we were at our seats.

The flight attendance crew worked as one. They made sure we did not need any help putting up our luggage. We knew and felt very comfortable to ask for assistance any time we required it.

The other passengers too began slowly entering the plane. There was no rush everyone knew they would be taken care of. They soon with assistance, when required, put their luggage up for the flight.

The flight attendants were always within easy reach. They ensured everybody was comfortable and not requiring any assistance.

The flight attendance appeared to read each other minds. Just a nod and they would split into three and serving hot white fluffy towels. A wonderful way to prepare us for our flight. Just as efficient as they were given to us, they whisked them away with the same efficiency.

It was unbelievable the flight attendants knew when they were required.

Wine! for those interested. Juices, coffee, tea and even water to help us feel even more comfortable with the flight in front of us.

Food, glorious food. Prepared in a professional manner. The taste, better than most first class restaurants.

The passengers sit peacefully, enjoying the gentle hum of the aircraft, or watched a movie.that was situated at the back of each seat.

It is so peaceful and relaxing some passengers go to sleep, covered in the blanket provided to all the passengers.

The hours ticking away, most not noticing.

The flight attendance shows no sign of tiredness or boredom. They continue their watch over their passengers, like a hen looking after her newly hatched chickens.

If your eyes meet theirs, they smile, stop to see if you need anything, and ten continue their endless walk up and down the isles of the plane.

Another warm while the fluffy towel is provided, so we can prepare, to go to our new destination.

A final message from the pilot thanking us for not causing problems and hoped we had enjoyed all the crew staff hard work, for our short time together.

The plane comes to a halt. The passengers slowly find their luggage and line up to face the outside world.

LSS Sandy
FS Astin
FSS Zoe
share with us a final smile and the hope to see each other again soon.
I believe I could see a tear of sadness on the corner of their eyes.

We slowly walked away, saying goodbye to the plane as well, who had taken us safely to our new destiny.

Graeme McLeod.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service We had a wonderful experience with Singapore Airlines - Kuala Lumpur to Seoul (Boeing 787) and Seoul to Kuala Lumpur (Boeing 777). The flight attendants were professional, friendly and responsive to requests. They go round serving water throughout the night flight. The seat legroom, inflight entertainment and food were also excellent. Singapore Airlines economy class is one of the best. We will definitely fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text:
Wonderful service After reading some negative reviews I was concerned about flying but I certainly should NOT have been. The service was second to none. The staff were very professional  but o friendly and nothing was too much trouble. ?the beds were comfy, there was plenty of room and the entertainment choice was wide and varied with recently released films for February 2023 available.
Would highly recommend this company
label: positive

text:
Great Flight, Great Crews, Great Service Our flight from Heathrow to Brisbane was via Singapore, with just a 70 minute layover in Singapore to get from one aircraft to the other.  The purpose of this flight was to visit friends prior in Currumbin prior to commencing back to back cruises ou of Sydney t the Gold Coast, Great Barrier reef and also New Zealand.  The flight was to be the commencement of a holiday of a lifetime to also encompass part of our 40th Wedding Anniversary.

From the very moment we set foot on the aircraft we were made to feel at home.  Nothing was too much trouble for the crew.  Who even surprised my wife with an anniversary cake and two Singapore Airlines teddy bears as a memento of our flight and anniversary.  The food was excellent on both flights.

Our UK return flight, 35 days later were also with Singapore Airlines and again their service was excellent.  Although we flew economy, we did not feel like second class citizens.  The only downside to the whole experience was that our return flight from Singapore to Heathrow was on a slightly smaller aircarft than the others we had been on and hence shorter leg room, other than that we have no hesitation in recommending this airline and will not hesitate to use them in the future
label: positive

text:
Worse business class seats ever Singapore Airlines use to be my favorite. Not any more. We took a 17 hour flight from LAX to SIN.  I was looking forward to a  restful flight and and sleep. Did not happen. The seat had to be manually flipped by a flight attendant.   It is the flat but you would have to be less 5feet to be able to stretch out. Otherwise you had to curl in a fetal position. 

The service was good but not great. 

We flew a few weeks earlier on Turkish from Istanbul to LA. That was much better.
label: negative

text: Quality all the way Although were were in economy, we were made to feel first class passengers by the cabin crew. We had heard about the quality service beforehand having not flown with Singapore Airlines before and we were not disappointed.  We are seasoned travellers, but I can honestly say the cabin crew and the Singapore airlines brand was the best ever.
label: positive

text: Business class Singapore flight The business class attendants and service was excellent. The attendant was always there to make sure I was comfortable and needing nothing. The flight was very nice and smooth. Unfortunately the seats in this class do my recline to a full laying position and thus the rest one can get is between deep sleep to trying to find a better position to sleep. Other than the 3/4 reclining seat, the aircraft was beautiful. Singapore airlines is a cut above the rest.
label: positive

text: Disappointed This was our first long haul flight of this length, due to this we felt we would use a larger carrier as we thought we would get a better service. Our plane from London to Singapore was a 777 which should have been great, having read the website and seen all the lovely pictures our expectations were high, even in economy there were claims of ample room, great food and service, this was far from what we had for 13 hours, cramped seats in a very dated airplane, poor food and cabin staff that were hiding behind curtains for most of the trip, our connecting flight was NZ Airlines and on a 787, the plane,food and staff were far better than the last. The plus side was how they dealt with a late departure and getting everyone on their connecting flight, this was done exceptionally well and hats off to the staff at Singapore Airport who were positioned everywhere to spot passengers and get them to the right gate. If you can afford it go better than economy.
label: neutral

text: Long haul non stop to New York Was on the new SQ 22 flight to New York for holiday. Was told happen to be the 3rd of flight since SQ restart non stop to NY. Premium economy was just right for the 19 hours non stop flight. Ticket was a little pricey compare to economy but then the comfort of seat and space make it up. Meals was not that fantastice  as would have expected a little more choices. Incidentally took SQ 21 on return three weeks later. Overall good experience.
label: positive

text:
Not worth the premium price We flew premium economy from Singapore to Frankfurt on A380. We were looking forward to it as we were flying premium economy on SQ for the first time and had high expectations since the aircraft was the new A380.

To be upfront, the leg room was pretty generous, def better than economy class. There were also numerous usb charging points at our seats and below the inflight entertainment screen. There were also plenty of storage spaces for water bottles and nick-nacks.

Now to the less impressive points:

Premium economy passengers shared the same restrooms as economy passengers, and we had to walk to the back of the next economy section to get to the restrooms. It was a further walk for us compared to economy passengers.

The overnighter kit was very ordinary, just socks and toothbrush, nothing fancy.

While there was a lot of leg room, the seat wasnt very comfy for me, even though I reclined my seat to the max it could go, and had the reclining leg rest up. It left me with a bad backache.

The inflight entertainment selection was poor. The titles were old and selection was not enough. The screen was not touchscreen as well, surprising for A380.

We had 1 more selection for mains compared to economy but the food was forgettable, except for the ice cream.

Either go business class or stick to economy. The additional price to pay for premium economy isnt well worth it.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable and entertaining Great movie selection, food okay - some meals better than others. Wider seats in economy which is a plus. Would be good to get updated screens :)
label: positive

text:
Everything seems perfect Singapore airlines has a 7 star hospitality service, I flew from dubai to Singapore for 7.5 hours but never felt bored. 
# The cabin crew so polite, friendly and listening what I need. 
#You will not feel bore on board as they provide you with nice movies, music, TV channel, books, news. 
#And the foods are amazing, the tastes is five star taste.

Even though ticket that I bought little bit expensive as it is peak season right now but it is worth of it.

Check in experience so easy and fast.

But for upgrades to next class still little bit expensive. 

Overall recommended specially for long flight.
label: positive

text: Flying with Service From the entry to the airport to the exit of the destination airport, everything went smoothly and with attention to detail. It left me rested on arrival and ready for action!
label: positive

text: Best business class Service impeccable food fabulous with a good selection. Comfortable seating and the lay down bed great for sleeping.
label: positive

text: Dereliction of Duty...the worse airline Singapore  We tried to get out of South Korea and bring our flight forward with Singapore airlines SQ218 as we had information that we could not transit through Singapore and Australia were enforcing self isolation 5th March. I wrote to Singapore airlines on 13th March and received no reply...no response, no responsibility.  Never to fly with this airline again, they have materially affected our business.
label: negative

text: Of any economy flight, this has to be the best! London to Singapore on a Tuesday and economy was 30% empty...so my wife and I each had a row of three seats... the crew weren't rushed and had lots of time to serve and chat! A real pleasure!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines, you’re a great way to fly! As always, Singapore Airlines delivers warm and friendly service. As it was the Lunar New Year, a festive dish was included into the menu. Nice touch.
label: positive

text: Singapore to London Heathrow Airbus A380 We have flown with Singapore airlines a few times now. They are usually very good but this was probably the least enjoyable flight experience we have had. Our flight was delayed for three hours, to wait for a connecting flight. The first passengers knew of this was when those using the Singapore Airlines app were notified. At first, the ground staff were unable to confirm whether the information on the app was correct as the airport screens were still showing the original departure information. Communication between the airline and the waiting passengers was very poor. The airline staff seemed confused about what was happening. It took a couple of hours to arrange hot drinks and snacks for the waiting passengers. Most of the time was made up in the air so arrival at Heathrow was only about an hour late. Usually Singapore airlines are very good but this experience has changed my opinion a little.
label: positive

text:
Very enjoyable flight, great food and service We flew overnight to Milan in one of Singapore Airlines newer jets and it’s clear why they were nominated as best airline in the world.  The food was terrific.  We order low fat meals because not only do you get them first, they never run out and they are better for you.  As always the cabin service was friendly and not intimidating like Qantas or BA and you could find a stewardess when you needed one.  Check in and baggage drop off is simple and there are plenty of machines in Perth.  The flights were without incident, comfortable all the way with good landings.

The most impressive new feature in economy class is the infotainment system, which has an impressive flight tracking module.

Can recommend this airline to anyone
label: positive

text: What’s not to like with Singapore Airlines: nota damned thing! Just made the trip from Adelaide to Shanghai via Singapore. What a breathe of fresh air after some long hauls with other carriers including our national carrier! The food left the others way behind. A chicken and mushroom pie for a morning snack followed by a glass of wine then lunch of atlantic salmon and potato salad  as an entree followed by steamed fish and risotto, topped of by MaggieBeers salted caramel icecream. Beat that Qantas!
label: positive

text: Overcharged! Poor customer service. Disappointing... CHECK  your charges! Was supposed to be charged X amount and ended being charged extra $140 AUD. I emailed SIA to credit the difference but after 2 months of emails and investigation of the problem, they said it is my bank's fault. I contacted my bank and they replied within one day to say that it is indeed SIA putting through the extra charges. I emailed the reply from my bank to SIA  and SIA has stopped replying. I am so disappointed. Why is it so hard to get good customer service these days? My bank has advised me to initiate a dispute in the transaction and initiate a chargeback but this was not the desired outcome i wanted. Customers are just not looked after anymore these days. So disappointed and appalled at SIA customer service!
label: negative

text: great experience friendly flight attendants, comfortable seating and plenty of room, great food, great film selection, would definitely fly again.
label: positive

text: Food remains bad and labs smell terrible There was a strong stench coming from the lavatory the moment I boarded the aircraft. The food did taste good. Vegetables were overcooked until they are yellowish and meats are too salty! Bread was cold. How did Cathay Pacific manage to serve such warm buns that are slightly crispy outside and moist inside? Can SIA offer the same?
label: neutral

text: Highly recommended! Great airline, though I never was offered a drink and my friends meals were delayed for quite a long time, I would recommend this airline to everyone. Very polite and caring air hostesses, super pilot! We flew from Changi airport on December 8th at 10:30 pm and landed in Colombo at 11:30 pm (2.5 hours ahead of SG) smooth landing. Travelled with my kids, it went better than I expected.
label: positive

text: A compliment to Kylie Pang I took the flight from Singapore to Danang, SQ 174 on 5th May. Unfortunately my luggage was over weight. And I was confused how to pay the fee. A friend and I were going around in the airport to ask but the ground Crew at Singapore didn’t give us any clear instructions. After that I went to row 4 counter 12, the service staff named Kylie Pang  was very helpful. She guided us carefully what I need to do with my luggage and then she decided to waive all of our 15kg luggage extra after she known that I just get stuck with other ground crew. Thanks to Kylie for her good service.
label: positive

text:
Very bad service SQ 215 
Waited long for the food when I had a chance I was told that the one I wished to have was no longer available 
Unprofessional cabin crew blamed the supplier 
Unprofessional cabin chief offered the left over from business class 
Felt insulted 
No official apology from him
Worst example of customer service 
Food in this sector is becoming a joke 
The original SQ has gone
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Very comfortable seat, on board entertaining very good, cabin crew first class. we also flew Silk Air to Phuket which was also a great trip
label: positive

text:
Asking for seat changes Don't be afraid to ask for a seat change on Singapore Air. Somehow I ended up with a window seat (I'm an aisle girl) and I asked nicely - waited and voila - one was available. 
With a smile. Great stewardship.
label: positive

text: Premium coach to southeast asia, business class back We flew premium coach(think US domestic first class)to Singapore which was a substantial upgrade from coach. But we upgraded to Business class going home. This was a life changing experience. The first leg is 13 hours to Manchester, England. Silver service dining, and then flat bed sleeping for 7 hours, then silver service dining. The crew reminded me of the old days of flying when it was romantic to fly. First rate service. Yes it is spendy to fly business class, but for me, on this type of fly, it is worth every penny.
label: positive

text: The worst experience I am complaining regarding your staff's promise me before I check in manila airport fight SQ 915 on 14 jan 2020. My flight from manila to singapore was delayed for 6 hours I understand that for some circumstances it happened. But before I check in, your staff  assures me that they will provide me hotel at singapore coz I'll be waiting my next flight # SQ 494 for the next 23 hours. They give me assurance that they will provide hotel . But it's so embarrasing I expected for nothing, only  provide 45sg dollars for a meal. Don't promise anything  if you can't provide. 23 hours our eyes widely opened, we are human provide a decent place to stay. Notes in same booking I have  damaged case has been raised and the reference number is MMNLSQ1952.thanks Singapore airlines ever never I fly with you again.
label: negative

text:
Underwhelmed I’ve always had the highest regard for SQ inflight service but my most recent flight was so disappointing.

Flew SQ232 SYD–SIN, March 31st, Seats 16D&F, Business Class on the new A380.

It started out well…Check in Staff and Ground Manager at Sydney Airport were super congenial.

We were warmly welcomed at the Air New Zealand Lounge - super-fast wifi and amazing Anzac biscuits.

First impressions of the seat were great – lovely seat design touches, duvet and pillows.

Then it went downhill fast.

• Stewardess told me that the aircraft was three business class passengers overbooked. Crew all seemed flustered throughout the flight. 

• Husband’s seat didn’t come equipped with headphones. No problem as he had his own. Stewardess nevertheless apologized and said that she had no time to check the left side of the plane (only the right) as they were pressed for time with boarding passengers. Not good.

• Drink of sparkling water was served in a small whisky glass without napkin. Again, stewardess mentioned that the usual tall glass was on order and not available for this flight. Napkin was presented long after drink was consumed.

• Husband’s ‘Book The Cook’ pre-order of Seafood Thermidor was completely inedible. My Thai Green Curry was not much better. 

• My tray table could not be ejected halfway through the flight. After the horrible meal I didn’t intend to eat anymore anyway.

• Bathrooms reeked

• Fruit was served without plate, cutlery and napkins. Yup, I was expected to bite into the fruit with my hands.

• Seat looked good but don’t try to get some sleep with the ridiculous angled footwell. Unless you’re booked into the much-prized bulkhead seats, all other Biz passengers have to lie diagonally to fit their feet into the footwell of the seat in front of them. I heard many passengers remark what a stupid design this was and I whole-hearted agreed with them. Won’t avoid these seats like the plague from now on!

Finally the piece de resistance! 

The PPS passenger in 16A could not right his seat after it was deployed in bed mode. The Crew, after a good 45 mins or so of attempting to fix the bed, finally relocated the passenger. In the meanwhile, he was left hovering in the aisle the whole time! Shocking!

Just when we thought the debacle was over, a Cabin Manager (there were two on this flight) managed to fix the seat. After which, he took it upon himself to train groups of the inflight crew, three at a time no less, on how to manipulate the seat... Oblivious to the fact that the Crew meanwhile were blocking up the aisle and that passengers could not access the lavatories at the back of the cabin (there were none in front for Business passengers)! After a good half hour at least, my husband had enough of the bodies intruding into his personal space. He asked a Leading Stewardess if this was a safety issue  – if not, shouldn’t training be done after the passengers deplaned and not while the flight was in service? Promptly the Crew scattered. No apologies given. My fellow passengers were shaking their heads in disbelief!

Pity to see how the standards of SIA service has fallen. One would have expected the Senior Crew at best, to have more polish and common sense.
label: negative

text: Absolutely love this airline First time i flew with them and was pleasantly surprised. Spacious seats, delicious food and very friendly hostesses. They serve food/snacks throughout the night and the hostesses were working right through. Toilets were cleaned throughout the duration of the flight a d no messy toilets the next morning
label: positive

text:
Lost luggage Lombok airport Recently used Singapore airlines, unfortunately flight from UK to Singapore was running 45 minutes late, we just made our onward flight from Singapore to Lombok. Service at Singapore was excellent.
Our bags did not make the onward flight.
These things happen, however the service we then had was terrible, the customer service rep at Lombok was useless, we landed , were then informed that our cases were not on the flight, told we would get them three days later, ABI the service rep filled out the paperwork. Turns out he did not fill in the forms correctly, he did not give us a tracking number, he did not make copies, so waste of time as forms that were filled out he gave to us.
We then used Singapore airlines online/live chat to try and find out where our luggage was. They were very unresponsive as they did not have a lost luggage tracking number, I thought they could enter our luggage label number. 
Told me to go back to the airport, since this was nearly a two hour trip I declined.
ABi did not answer my texts to my Satisfaction, when cases did arrive at 1030 he said he had to Finnish his shift at 15.00 before sending them on.
When he did send them on we had to pay for boat to bring cases over to island we were staying on, then pay the local taxi to bring them from the boat to the villa.
This could have been way more professional.
Filing in form correctly so we had a valid code we could chase up.
Singapore airlines being more helpful 
I don’t think we should have to pay to get our luggage delivered 
And just any type of communication with the airline/airport service rep, instead of ignoring the vast majority of my texts, NEVER answered the phone.
Can’t wait to discuss this in person on my way back through Singapore
label: negative

text: Always a Pleasure It is hard to look forward to a 20+ hour flight, but Singapore Airlines makes this possible.  The attention to detail for even Economy passengers makes every trip a pleasure.  Hot towels, menus, entertainment galore helps one to forget they are on an aircraft.  The attendants are beyond gracious and constantly appear to offer water, drinks and snacks.  I am so excited to try the nonstop flight from Newark to Singapore next month.
label: positive

text: Immaculate Best airlines business experience ever , all experience has no fault , from greetings to comfort to staff to overall services and choice , privacy and comfort it’s just no fault from far my favourite airlines
label: positive

text: Family Vacation Everything I head of Singapore Airlines from LAX to Tokyo was correct. Their lounges were very disappointing both here in Los Angeles & Tokyo. In business class the service was okay nothing outstanding. The flight attendants were nice just like other airlines.
label: neutral

text:
First Time Singapore Air... ...but not our last time because we found the whole experience to be excellent from check in, boarding and in flight service. The plane was comfortable and food ok for economy.
Great flight staff on all for legs of our journey.
label: positive

text: Not the best by far! I have no idea why Singapore Airlines is so well rated. I flew them 10 years ago and found it pleasant, this time HORRIBLE. Same as I flew before, but now worn and dirty, gross inedible food and an unfortunate delay in getting us to the airport in time for our flight caused us to pay an extra $2000 to fly with this airline. Be aware, they have a $500 missed flight fee. So even if we would have been able to take a cheaper flight to out our destination bc of our unforseen delay, we would have to pay $1000 just to catch the flight back we already paid for. Just think about that for a second, because it could happen to you. So we ended up rebooking on another flight with them for over $2000 dollars. Choose another airline.
label: negative

text: One of the best I have flow with I really cannot fault the service Singapore Airlines provides for their customers. Checking in was simple and efficient and with a constant smile on the faces of the whole crew. The meal selection was varied and extremely tasty which catered for all. There were plenty of drinks available along with snacks. Even after a 10 hour flight the crew had a smile and a bon voyage to all passengers. We really look forward to the return leg.
label: positive

text: Fantastic service and food from Melbourne to London We have flown to Europe a few times and we have found Singapore Economy to be better then the other airlines.  The airline stewards are really lovely, the food is nice and a stopover in Singapore airport is much easier than other airports.  We really appreciated how they make snacks including fruit, sandwiches and muffins available at any time and come around all the time with water or juice.   Booking into the lounge at Singapore airport or going for a massage is a good way to pass the couple of hours you have at Singapore Airport.
label: positive

text: Ratnesh Pore I had heard alot about the service of Singapore Airline, so I booked my flight to Hongkong with them. This was my biggest mistake. Dubai - Singapore flight was delay and I missed my connecting flight to Hongkong. As it was Airline mistake, they booked me on the next flight departing to Hongkong after 5 hours. The staff at Singapore Airport arrival was not much helpful, they gave me SGD 15 meal voucher and asked me to wait in the public waiting area. With my bad experience I can just suggest people to think twice they book Singapore Airline flight. My 4 days leisure trip was cut down to 3 days because of Singapore Airline.🙁😥
label: negative

text: Couples Always fly sinapore airways  we left perth no delays ever always fly threw night less stop over and arrive morning food good great movies  get front seats or back rows and great service  booked for xmas there ajoining flights are just as good  they give you newspapers to read and food on even there 2hour flights been to hong kong ,cambodia chaing mai bangkok vietnam  all with  singapore airlines the best
label: positive

text: Always the best  Life would be wonderful if every flight we took was in business class on Singapore.  Frankly they do everything brilliantly.  Huge seats. Easy conversion to lay flat beds. Excellent video/movie choices.  Lovely staff and very good food. Perfection in travel
label: positive

text: Best service, great food Fantastic flight in Business Class, seats recline to a full bed, lots of up to date movies, and great food, could not fault anything.
label: positive

text: Top airline. A return customer Years so we went to the Maldives with Singapore airline and now we are travel I g go Australia with then. It was and still is a great service. Try to get extra legroom seats in economy and you will have an even better trip. Food is ok. The drinks and snacks on request are excellent. Iceoykd always recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Destroyed luggage My Briggs & Riley large suitcase was completely broken on the top and bottom. I have flown on 20 different airlines in the last 2 years with this lifetime-warranty bag, so they must have dropped it from the plane down to the tarmac or the like (as I once saw baggage handlers do on a different flight) or something equally damaging.  Infuriating.
label: negative

text:
Plane and staff great but food terrible When you first walk on, even though plane is a little older, still looks impressive.  Very spacious business class seating, plenty of storage and can lay flat, although slightly odd layout of bed and a little hard.

Staff fantastic, very helpful and friendly.  But food was awful, at least what we had for breakfast was almost inedible except obvious things like bread and pastries.  Not sure I’d use them again unless it was the long haul and got a good price.
label: positive

text:
KRISFLYER-PIONTS-WORST EXPERIANCE they have frozen my points and cancelled flights i had on hold
it has been 3 months and 20 calls later with no result

in summary ,don't fly Singapore airlines they have the worst customer service I 
have experienced in my life
label: negative

text:
Awesome company to fly with This airline is amazing. They do everything they can to make you happy during your flight.
Our plane was very spacious compared to some planes in  other airlines we flew in the past.
The food was very delicious. They even served ice cream.
We had two meals and both were awesome.
The airplane was new and had a ton of movies preloaded.
I’d highly recommend this company to fly with especially if your flight is long.
label: positive

text: Would look forward to fly with Singapore Airlines Smooth check in at Mumbai and on our return journey at Singapore as well. Cabin was clean and refreshing. Crew were courteous and helpful. Meals were tasty. It took rather long to serve meals from Mumbai flight but on our return journey meals service was  prompt.
label: positive

text: Always Feeling Safe & Secure I have flown 8 sectors over the past 6 weeks with Singapore Airlines. The airline's service is always reliable, well disciplined, and comfortable with a feeling of good safety and security for passengers.
label: positive

text: Comfort of flying I always choose an aisle seat. Singapore airlines staff are always so accommodating and very attentive and polite. WAter is being issued regularly without having to ask.  The Singapore airport is simply amazing. Long stop overs are made easier. The airport so comfortable and clean.
label: positive

text:
Fantastic  We flew with Singapore airlines from Phuket- Singapore and then from Singapore-Bali. This is our first ever time flying with them but would def fly with them again.

The planes are nice, big and clean. The seats as a good size too so you are not squashed together like some airlines. The service was impeccable all the way through. The air stewardesses were friendly, helpful and always smiling.

I ordered a Hindu vegetarian meal and the kids had a children’s meal. They were amazing too. The meals were so tasty one of the best food ever,  like it’s been made for a restaurant nothing like the other airline food we usually eat. 

Can’t wait to fly with them again soon.
label: positive

text: Hokkaido Vacation Went on family vacation in Hokkado this year. On time and smooth flight. In flight service is friendly but meal is not hot and tasty.
label: neutral

text: Continued quality Consistent high quality in all this airline offers and delivers.  Outstanding cleanliness, hot towels offered before take off even in economy, friendly service.   Singapore is always a preferred airline due to its reliability.
label: positive

text:
Worst service Me and my family travelled from Perth to Tokyo on January for 3 weeks holiday . First of all flight delayed for a hour because of the stupid reason that engineer had called in sick . When reaching Tokyo exhausted because of the chasing next flight at Singapore , my luggage was left behind at Singapore. Thankfully Japanese luggage handling team deals very professionally and deliver my luggage next day. 
On the way back to Perth , we told the lady at Singapore airlines check in time that please make sure our luggage will be arrive at time . She even added the priority tag . Flight was ok to Singapore . Flight attendants were looks very rush for everything and a very slow service . After that we arrive at Singapore and went to catch the next flight . Again the flight was delayed , flight attendants were agin rushed for everything and service was way too slow . And not forget to mentioned but the planes from both Perth to Tokyo and Tokyo to Perth was quite dirty and dusty. We can see they don’t clean the seat pockets as we find the used tissues and plastics were not cleaned . When we arrived at Perth , same story happens again , one of our luggage missing . We talked to the (Dnata) baggage handling desk lady and her respond was so rude. She said we can’t track your luggage so we don’t know anything . We are here just for customer service . Very very unprofessional and very loudly screaming to the customer . She keep
Saying she don’t know so please don’t ask anymore , once we got your luggage we will deliver to your house. 
Overall very unpleasant and stressful flight . We are loyal customer of Singapore airlines for past 10-12 years but now their service is very big question mark. I hope they will be better in future .
label: negative

text: Flying can be so annoying I have found this airline to be the most comfortable. personal TV with more leg space. Ozzy planes seem to be so crampt. The service on Singapore airlines is unbeatable. I feel every flying country should take a lesson from Asain hospiality.
label: positive

text:
OMG.. FLIGHTS FROM HELL!! So reassured that Singapore Airlines ranks among the top three airlines and having flown on their competitors, Eithiad and Emirates, thought everything would be good! NOT SO!! I took no less than 4 different flights, on my trip of a lifetime, to Australia in December and each flight was appalling for various reasons!
Food... indescribable... take yr worst Chinese takeaway and scrape it off the floor! Woken at strange times for what might be breakfast or whatever.. indistinguishable from the disgusting food served... only nice moment was being served a crispy red apple at "Whatever o clock". 
Cramped with my feet around my elbows and hostile seat companions on all trips! I am 5ft 10ins told I should pay extra for space!
Curt air hostesses, too much trouble to have coffee or tea after meal as not being on a special diet was only served nearly 2 hours after the special diets.. trays whipped away as within 1/2 hour of landing (My outward trip)! 
I could go on.. this was a trip of a lifetime for me.. a nurse.. it cost a hell of a lot of money and when faced with a return trip from Australia to UK just wanted to cry!!
NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!
..
label: negative

text:
Phenomenal service is an understatement! Phenomenon service is an understatement to this airline.
I have taken many trips with many different airlines over part decades but Singapore airlines definitely give me a different perspective what an airline or airline services should be.
They are very attentive, attention to details and very professional. On this trip, we took some of our trips with business class and some with economy. Both class provided exceptional services.
One of my meals, from Singapore back to Newark, steak with oxtails and vegetables was one of my most delicious meals to remember. Man oh man, it was one of the best meals I have ever had on air.  I usually have low regards for foods on air due to the atmospheric and pressure charges and taste buds changes but they managed make one of the most delicious steak that I have ever tasted in my entire life.  By the way, I'm a steal lover. They executed my steak dish to almost perfection. The steak was medium, my favorite. The shredded oxtails was tasty, tendered and melt in your mouth. The veggies were perfectly cooked.  One of the gentlemen gave me two different glasses of wines afterwards,n per my request, and they were great also. I gave my honest compliment to the gentleman who served my wines  and he brought the chef over to thank my compliment.  What a service!  I regret I didn't take the picture of my steak plate. 🤦‍♂️
Highly recommend anyone to use Singapore airlines.
Great job Singapore airlines and the team behind the food services. I have heard so much about you over the years but this was the first time I witnessed it. Better than I expected.
Keep up a great work.
label: positive

text:
FROM FIRST TO WORST!!!! Makes a Greyhound bus seem comfitable!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If this is voted the BEST Airline then Aviation is in a lot of trouble!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
First customer service HONESTLY the worst I have ever experienced.They somehow mangled to combine Ignorance and Arrogance  both by phone and e mails
Meals were severed HOT but uneatable . Boarding was a cattle call with Stupid little signs held up by a person under 4 feet 9 inches no one could see him.

Just about every international carrier I have flown with in the past is better then this airline!!!!

The only difference they have is their Stewardesses have uniforms that fit.
WORST INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT I EVER HAD TO INDURE
label: negative

text: No Complain Glorious, one of the nicest flights I have been on. Leg room was a tiny bit lacking but seats were comfortable. Staff were all courteous and helpful.
label: positive

text:
First ride on an A380. Flying to London on a A380 for the first time. Economy class Seats 44B/C were a little more roomy than expected although once the person in front of me put their seat back I was cramped up for 11 hours.
The food was as one would expect on a long hall flight however the flight crew (Candi, Wan, Shu Ying, Ayan, Farah, Jenny & Aaron) were all very hospitable and helpful.
Thanks for making our flight bearable.
label: positive

text:
Long flight Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines for long distance flights. The planes are usually on time and the cabin crew are always friendly and helpful. This is definately a value for trip. 

I have tried cheaper airlines, only to find that their service was bad, the food was inediible and the plane was late.
label: positive

text: SQ Meal Vegetarian/Vegan meals MUST DEFINITELY be improved!  Vegetarian option - very miserable , mostly boiled vegetable.  Can do better with many people going for vegetarian/vegan.  SIA status should move to another level in providing appetising food for vegetarians.  Had vegan option in Japan flight in 2018.  Was amazing! - specialised meal with vegan chocolate cake!!
label: neutral

text: destination vietnam Great Service, good flight, relaxing chairs specially for long flight, enjoyable meals and drinks and good in house entertainment
label: positive

text: flight long haul good  trip no complaints, would use again.noise level from engine's quite low asked and got a window seat.
label: positive

text:
9 years of flying with Singapore Airlines We have an annual trip to Perth Australia and having in the early years tried other Airlines, we now only use Singapore Airlines.
The seating in Economy is very generous and comfortable even after 12 hours. The plane is always kept tidy and clean thanks to the deligence of the cabin crew.
The food is good with a selection of European and Asian dishes and of course you can choose a dietary need when booking your flight.
Wine, beer and spirits is offered as well as soft drinks. This year we did notice that they were not quite so generous as previously. We felt this was a sign of Singapore’s financial situation, never the less if you asked for more it was given without hesitation.
Water and juice is regularly bought around to keep you hydrated, which is very important.
Checking in process is efficient and as with all of the Singapore Airlines staff are pleasant and helpful.
For parents with babies the cabin crew do what they can to help make things easier. Staggered meal times so you both get a hot meal and the heating of bottle or food pouches or jars.
The toilet facilities on the plane are spacious and well supplied and maintained.
The in flight entertainment is the best that I have come across. Plenty of new release films as well as the old goodies.
The music selection I felt was not so good as before, it seemed more limited. One thing that I felt was missing was audio books. These have been deleted from the package.
The price structure of Singapore Airlines is good, they are in line with Emirates but cheaper than Virgin, BA and Quantus.
label: positive

text: Singapore airport personnel asked me to THROW my 1 KILO JAR OF HONEY!!!  I was in a connecting flight from Dubai to Manila with a 4-hour layover in Singapore. The jar of honey has been in my carry-on suitcase since my departure from Dubai to Singapore. However, the Changi Airport personnel asked me to JUNK the same jar of honey in the trash can upon boarding going to Manila as "they don't allow liquids" in the carry-on even after explaining to them that IT WAS ALLOWED BY THE SAME AIRLINE from Dubai. I was just pouring money down the drain! It was extremely disappointing!
label: negative

text:
Don’t ever pay to pre-book your seats  I am currently in Bali due to return back to the Uk tomorrow. This was a special holiday for my husbands 50th birthday and a present for my daughters 21st. The flights were booked in August last year with Lufthansa on a code share with Singapore from Frankfurt to Singapore and then back from Singapore to Munich. I had heard fantastic reviews on Singapore Airlines and as we usually travel with Emirates I decided to do these flights to enhance the experience a little. In April I rang Singapore Airlines to enquire about pre-booking our seats. I have a bad neck and back so always find it a little easier on long haul having the window to lean against. I paid an extra £100 for window seats both out & return. The seats were showing on the app and I received an email confirmation with the seat numbers but when I went to check in the seats had changed outbound, luckily the allocated seats were still up front but the return had disappeared. I have spent the last 2 weeks emailing them to sort these seats out. It is now the day before we leave and we have been given seats 62DEG which are the last row on the plane (A350-900) which on seat guru are classed as bad seats and limited recline next to the galley and toilets. I must have sent about 20 emails, had around 15 live chats and the response i have finally had this afternoon is ‘there is nothing we can do’ speak to check in tomorrow. I’m disgusted with how they treat their customers and as a result of this will never fly with them again. They just don’t seem interested when something goes wrong. 
I can’t fault the service on board or the planes but the customer service behind the scenes is shocking.
label: neutral

text: Great comfortable flight Just as we entered the aircraft, we collected our ear pieces for the inflight entertainment. I did not see a copy of my favourite newspaper and asked the stewardess at the door. She mentioned that because it was a midnight flight and most people would have read the papers by then and the next day's papers were not out yet. After takeoff, I was pleasantly surprised when the stewardess came to me with a copy of the newspaper I had asked about. She even addressed me by my name. What an amazing effort! In fact I had forgotten about it because I was busy filling out the landing form, deciding what to choose for my meal, deciding what movies to watch, etc. What the stewardess did made such a good impression on me. Way to go, Singapore Airlines!!!
label: positive

text: Wonderful and great flying experience with Singapore Airlines! I've always had a wonderful and great flying experience with Singapore Airlines.  Legroom are more than good enough, though haven't purchased one.  Very comfortable seating and excellent flright entertainment, from latest to blockbuster.  FAs are of great help with smile and courteous at all times.  Check in and boarding are perfect and advantage being a star alliance member.
label: positive

text: helpful staff i forgot to reserve a child meal for my little one.  the ground crew at the hk airport was very helpful, try to get one for me and even reserve one for my child for our return flight.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - typically awesome Recently flew Milan to Singapore within Singapore Airlines and ( as expected) everything ran like clockwork with exemplary service throughout and excellent cabin service. ( how do they serve such good meals, so hot, in the sky after 5 hours??) we left exactly on time and arrived exactly on time. Highly recommended!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Excellent service from the crew. On-board entertainment caters for almost all languages and updated list of movies
label: positive

text: Dissapointing food and service What a shame, New Years Eve flying from Singapore to Brisbane.We have never had such awful food and mediocre service from Singapore Airlines - usually our favourite.
label: negative

text: Not that great The food was horrid. What was said and what was brought out was totally different this was on the return leg to Melbourne especially when I booked the Cook. There were not enough toilets. Being in Premium Economy in SIA does not make any difference might as well save the money and go on economy.For being World class airline I'm sorry it was a disappointment.
label: negative

text: Great service I am really impressed with Singapore Airlines high and consistent level of service. The flight attendants where very professional, and they where always looking after our wellbeing. Will definitely use their service again.
label: positive

text:
Horrible experience I am extremely dissappointed of Singapore airlines, the flight we planned to take just took off secretly without calling the passengers to board! Simply not acceptable and I think it is not qualified to be an operating airline company.

Because of Singapore's Covid-19 entry ban just one day before our flight, Singapore airline decides to NOT let any of the non-Singaporean passengers to board. There're several layers of unacceptable mistakes: 1. while booking, passengers are not informed of possible travel bans 2. after booking, Singapore airline does not send notification messages to remind passengers of the travel ban in action 3. right at the airport at the gate, Singapore airline just BLOCK the entire boarding area and secretly let allowed passengers to board - without informing all the other non-Singaporean passengers, and let us all wait until the plane takes off. The most ridiculous part is, we even approach the ground staff asking when we are allowed to board, and the staff simply asked us to wait. After the scheduled take-off time the staff just left the boarding gate and left all the remaining passengers wait for nothing, without a single announcement or apology.

Have no more words to say, Singapore airline's attitude to their customers are simply unacceptable and I do not think it is qualified as an airline company.
label: negative

text: Best Airline Our preference for flying is Singapore Airlines because their service, efficiency, being on time, care, friendly ground and cabin crew, new aircrafts and the comforts.
label: positive

text:
Very good airline but rated the world’s best??? We flew two long legs and two short legs with SQ. Overall all flights were good. All the basics were well done from check in to boarding and during the flight. Staff were polite and friendly. Food was average. There was little to complain about. However was anything a standout? No. Do other airlines like Cathay, Qantas etc do just as good a job? Yes.

So, I would recommend SQ but I wouldn’t say it’s the best airline in the world which is what it was rated in the last two years.
label: positive

text: TREMENDOUS! First time travelling with Singapore and I was absolutely blown away by the professionalism of all staff and smoothness of service. Absolutely understand why they are the best airline. Food given is all delicious and choice of entertainment incredible
label: positive

text: Singapore airline is moving towards a budget line I flew Singapore Airlines after a while and soon realised the star rated airline is moving towards a budget airline. Their world class service levels have come down significantly. The time to load the aircraft, cabin service, food and beverage services were notably lower. However I must mention the two aircrafts I flew A350  and  B787 had very smooth ride, had less noise and cabin space was much better. My expectation was a world class service once they had and now they SA is pretty much in par with Malaysian, SriLankan airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Dreamliner Flew on Singapore’s new Dreamliner. 
Loads of cabin space, the seats are bigger and offer loads more legroom. The entertainment system is fantastic, you can even stop watching a film , add it to your list and continue watching where you stopped it on another plane or at a later date. 
Food and staff perfect as always.
label: positive

text: Best flight attendants ever Initial flight from Brisbane to Singapore was great. Food good, flight comfortable and on time. Flight attendants attentative. But return trip showed how wonderful the staff were. Fell ill in the middle of the night, and headed for the rear toilets. Collapsed on the floor and vomited. Not from their food I might add, as I had not eaten due to not feeling great. The staff were AMAZING. Took exceptional care of me. Could not thank them enough. And continued to check on me long after I had returned to my seat, and the next morning.
label: positive

text: SIA a good airline Very comfortable seating in Premium Economy class, food and drinks at par with business class. Worth the money paid for
label: positive

text: Much Improved On such a short flight the service was great. Food was tasty and a glass of wine with it hit the mark. Much better than the previous flight into Singapore.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines only So-So Flew in early October to visit a resort in the Maldives. Booked premo economy but on a whim upgraded to Business at the check-in counter. No complaints at all. Staff efficient and friendly, nothing too much trouble. Great seating and audio visual choices. Food very good and quality wines served.
label: positive

text: Uncomfortable seats I chose centre  isle seats because of ease getting out, but I felt squashed, hard to sleep and seats were uncomfortable after a few hours. Disapppointed.
label: neutral

text:
One of the best airlines The service was really good on both flights. The luggage policy is very user friendly. Would fly with them again.
The meals could be a little bit approved, but the main course was always tasty and you could get drinks every time you want.
label: positive

text:
Awesome Singapore service I flew IAH/Manchester/Singapore/Denpasar and the reverse home. Business class flights on SIN were wonderful as usual.  Staff impeccable, and food sublime. Only a couple of issues... the lay flat seats were terribly hard.  I had to use my blanket as additional padding. When you are paying so much to lay flat it should be comfortable!

Also, the DPS to SIN flight was sub business class, glorified economy as it lacked privacy and ALL bags had to be put above as they had no storage for take off and landing.  Not what I expected/paid for.

Bus Class no longer gets amenities package other than sox and eye mask.  I suppose having generic toothbrushes/paste, shared lotion, etc in plane bathrooms saves money.  Ear plugs would be nice to have back as well.

For the cost Wifi should be included.

On a positive note, when SIN was delayed an hour out of singapore waiting for late passengers I was worried about making my connection in IAH.  The first leg staff were changed to different staff out of Manchester, so I had to revoice my concerns before leaving "stopover" in England.  Surpisingly there was a Singapore airline representative available as soon as I deplaned in IAH to help me whisk through baggage/customs.  I was greatly appreciative.
label: positive

text:
It is true - a great way to fly This was the first time we have flown with Singapore Airlines and it won't be the last. Their service is legendary and it is quite obvious why. From the moment we checked in until the time we got off our flight, we had excellent service from the ground staff and the flight attendants.
I was looking forward to flying on an A380 and I was not disappointed. The plane itself is so quiet even when all engines are on full power. The business class seats are so wide that my wife and I could actually sit together in one seat. There is so much room when the seat is laid flat to make a bed that unless you are exceptionally tall, there is ample room.
We Booked the Cook before we left and the food was exactly what we ordered. Excellent food and beverages all the way from Sydney to Singapore.

The flight attendants certainly know how to look after passengers. Quite outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble. We have flown with Ethiad, Air New Zealand and Qantas in business class and Singapore Airlines is certainly as good as all three.
 We have no qualms about flying with them again.
label: positive

text:
Still the best but need improvement Had taken many Singapore airlines flights before and especially long haul flights. In flight services and entertainments are good as always but this one flight had the tray table not working properly. Need to be in tip top condition to stay ahead.

Other than this everything is good. Always on time. Cabin crews are attentive and helpful. In flight meals are good. Has good connectivity and the lounge in Singapore is good.
label: positive

text: One of the best Airlines to fly with. Great flight, very helpful and courteous crew. The plane was clean and offered good entertainment services as well. Food was good, could have been better but still among the best you can get in flight (economy class).
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines is a travelling delight One of the most customer friendly airlines with lots of comfort. The food options are very good including for vegetarians and the crew are very hospitable
label: positive

text:
Wonderful Service They are the best in the world. I travel on all different airlines and have been in search to find my perfect airline. Finally my journey ends with Singapore Airline. I am now only going to be flying on SQ for the rest of my life 
Besides complimenting on all your staff who I encountered throughout my different SQ flights that I took, I have to mention the flight crew  (Lisa NG, Alla, Michelle Tan & JJ) on my flight to Singapore from Frankfurt. My small earbuds fell into the gap between my seats and the effort that was put to find them was extraordinary and finally they could find it. Then I was missing a small pouch with all all cables which I could not locate. Even after the flight crew came and searched it could not be found. I had given up; thinking that i must have lost it the last lounge I visited. Later after about an hour,  NG again came and asked me if she could help and figure out where i could have left it. Then I realized that it was tucked into the dark corner below the SG headphones. This is what I call customer service. Perhaps the best in the world. I wish Singapore Airlines all the best and wish them success. I am now your b
label: positive

text:
Big disappointment! Not the airline it used to be ,very unfortunate.. We use to fly Singapore airline regularly ...normally service and approach was OK .
This time total opposite  From Frankfurt to Singapore the aeroplane was   not clean ;
carpet etc ,but we tried to ignore and fall a sleep .However the second half of our trip
was even a bigger disappointment. We were simply told :if we are asking for Dinner there wont be breakfast for us .....??????If we choose breakfast it wont be served dinner ????? For a very reputable airline paying $15000.00 very unusual.Nil 
beverages. What is happening :administration is going wrong ????
label: negative

text:
A pleasant trip In general, we are not fans of airline food, even on business class. 
On this particular trip, the lamb curry with dal was delicious; lamb was soft and overall the food was not oily.
Small bottles of wine served would be prefered compared to cups of wine that the service staff pour for you.
label: positive

text: Nice flights.. Singapore airlines flights are superb. No motion sickness. As u donot feel any movement.Food should me somewhat much better. Veg Food is ok ok. But other services n best.
label: positive

text:
Delays outbound  On a recent trip with a small group travelling to The UK we were met at Melbourne airport with the news of a delay of 1 hour.
This delay then extended to 2..5 hours.   This meant we would miss connecting in Singapore with the redt of our group and our connecting flight.    After speaking with ground staff, they explained that the optiond wete splitting our group over the next two connecting flights or all on the same flight the next day.  This would cause significant logistic problems connecting with our UK tour.  When pushing staff in Melbourne further they explained it would be up to the staff in Singapore to make those decisions. 
Meal vouchers were given for everyone in Melbourne. 
We eventually got underway and upon arrival in Singapore we fojnd the connecting flight had been held for us.
Unfortunately when taxing out a passenger took ill. Being a medical professional I assisted and the decision was made to offload the passenger.  We finaly got jnderway 3 and a half hours late.  The rest of the flight was uneventful. 
Well done to Singapore Airlines for everything they did to minimise the disruption , however Very little eas said to me for assisting the crew with the sick passenger,  we do take a lot of responsibility on ourselves when reaching out to give a hand.
label: neutral

text:
Mediocre SQ service I have always been proud of my national carrier and would try and book an SQ flight for my holidays to experience their exceptional service. 

My friend and I were due to fly back from Tokyo to Singapore and an Airbus A380. I was excited for the flight as my experience with the A380 had been pleasant so far.

Throughout the flight, I made a few observations that I felt were uncharacteristic of the SQ experience I knew:

1. The personal touch of the cabin crew was lacking.
While the crew in charge of my section executed their responsibilities professionally, I felt that they could have been smiled a little more. 

The stewardesses requesting for the passangers to bring their seat upright for meal services or asking the passengers for their choice of meal, did so with a poker face in a tone that felt more like an order than a request. 

During the beverages service, I made a request for a cup of Apple juice. As the stewardess did not have it on hand, she told me that she would get back to me. I guess she was busy with other requests and she never got back to me after that.

I understand that I am nitpicking and that the crew may be tired or on a tight schedule. However, as a supporter of SQ, I hope that they can maintain the level of standards passangers worldwide have grown accustomed to. A simple smile along with a “please” and “thank you” can go a long way in making a flight more pleasant. 

2. The interior of the cabin looked dated.
The first thing I noticed when I sat down was how the tray tables seemed a little yellow and old on the underside. The headrest also looked like it had not been cleaned in awhile. 

On the plus side, my companion thourghly enjoyed his lunch of cold Japanese noodles served with chicken. 

I sincerely hope this is a one-off experience that does not reflect the current level of service standards within Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text:
Davao on a B737-8 MAX Lounge : SilverKris Lounge
Very disappointing. A lounge at Changi which provides access to every Star Alliance Business Class passenger , is bound to get overcrowded. Despite the multi-million dollar 'renovation' , the seating plan was not carefully considered. We were lucky enough to "grab" a sofa in a silent corner of the lounge , but we could see everyone who came after us struggling to find even a basic seat.

Boarding : The biggest flaw at SIN ( and CMB / KUL / etc. ) is their security check policy , which happens right at the boarding gate. This forces everyone to proceed to the gate atleast an hour in advance , and get locked up in a small glass enclosure until boarding. P.s.- No priority lanes for security.

Seat / Layout :
The Business Class cabin on board this 737-8 MAX has 10 LIE-FLAT seats arranged in 3 rows as 2-2 , 1-1 & 2-2. Very comfortable indeed. Seat controls worked perfectly fine.

Service : Very professional & courteous crew.

Food & Beverage : Used the 'Book The Cook' service.  'Lobster Thermidor' was great. Loved the 'Boon Tong Kee Chicken Rice' as well.

Arrival : Luggage did arrive on a 'Priority' basis.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline - highly recommend Excellent service - good food and choice of drinks, cocktails, wine, soft drinks. Very attentive and extremely polite flight attendants. Flights on time, easy, hassle free check in.
label: positive

text:
Comfortable flight  Flew last SQ flight out from BKK on a Sat night with an approximately 60% capacity.

Food was good. Younger daughter completed her child meal.

Plane was a new 787, PTV and USB ports worked well. 

Cabin crew appears to be robotic. Hardly any smiles. Reminded me of travelling with budget airlines.
label: neutral

text: Treated like. Royalty Even when travelling in economy your treated like first class here, from the time you step aboard until you leave the crew go out of there way to look after you attending to all your needs.The food and service is outstanding so I hate to think how good it must be up the front of the plane.
label: positive

text: One of the best airlines. I am a big fan of Singapore Airlines and have never been disappointed. Their service is efficient, friendly, courteous and timely.  I have flown many times to and from SFO and will select their airline
label: positive

text:
Very didsapointed Delayed luggage 
Flew in Christmas Eve 
To be told only one of our 4 bags arrived 
Assured that they would be on the 2am next flight and delivered 7am the next morning 
(Was clearly a lie to send us away) 
All the Christmas presents in them 
Contact number provided nobody would answer I tried probably 50x 
We told the kids we were assured they would come 
Long story short 
3 days later we received a call saying they were on the flight that day and would be delivered that afternoon 
So we lost 3 days of our holiday waiting around for our bags couldn’t go out 
No compensation at all offered 
So I emailed asking to be refunded for the almost $600 we had to spend on emergency things 
We were offered only after complaining $300 
I refused and demanded a full compensation they then gave me a full refund plus $200 duty free for our trouble 
From my perspective 
We paid $3,000 
For our tickets 
(I could have flown to Europe for that much!! ) 
I expect a better service for the cost of our tickets additionaly I expect more than $200 for loosing 3 days of our holiday and ruining Christmas for the kids 
This was the first and last time I will use SingaporeAir 
I will go back to NZ airlines whom we have flown with many times without incident
label: negative

text: My trip to Brisbane. Excellent Service. Very friendly staff.They really take care of you. Excellent food. If I am to fly again It will be Singapore Air Lines.
label: positive

text: Nice & Polite Crew Their crew is nice & polite but the service is not enough on a 19 hour flight you need food too. The food was not great. Their quality & quantity has deteriorated in the past 10 years of my flying experience with them. But the crew has definitely been good and the service is 10/10.
label: positive

text:
Unparalleled comfort and outstanding service Traveled with a 3 year old toddler, grateful to the crew for taking care of all our needs and making this flight as stressless as possible for the little one. 

Food on the flight was superb and entertainment selection was really more than what you could ask for.

I also liked how the crew makes effort in remembering passengers names which adds on that personal touch to their service. Looking forward to flying with Singapore Airlines again!
label: positive

text:
LHR to Singapore and return Departure lounge clean, prompt loading and plenty of room for luggage. In-flight food was above average. Return flight was on a very new aircraft, very nice. 
Flight attendants very good, plenty of snacks available and refreshments.
label: positive

text:
Excellent On time departure, (almost) on time arrival, friendly service, comfortable and spotlessly clean, Singapore Airlines get my vote, along with MAS, for international flights ex Adelaide.

They have managed to maintain a high level of excellence for the many years since I first flew with them.  From check-in to arrival, nothing to complain about.

Would happily recommend and travel with the any time.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Airline My husband & I flew from Sydney to Singapore on the 23rd September & flew back to Sydney on the 30th September, both flights were fantastic, check in went really smoothly as did luggage pick up, I have never had the privilege of flying anything other than economy However I felt like I was flying 1st class, the service was efficient & friendly, the movie, food & drink selection was great, we loved our flights with Singapore Airlines 🤗
label: positive

text: Great flight service and entertainment Service on this airline route was impeccable - from the use of the ANA lounge and food offered, through to the in-flight meal and entertainment. Bizarrely for a flight taking off at 9am in the morning, and travelling to a time zone that was only 1 hour difference, most people travelled with their shades down - although the cabin lights never went off.
