Some people choosing to sleep, but the main meal is served about 3 hours from takeoff around “midday” origin time, but did notice the captain was a little overzealous on the seatbelt sign - not sure if this was due to anticipated turbulence (wasn’t much) or just a way of controlling the masses. When it’s on for this long and no turbulence people ignore it - and Singapore airlines probably need to keep a close eye on this.
label: positive

text:
Sq217 A380 upper deck Upper deck seats are 2, 4, 2
 Extremely comfortable.  Service is great. Food was tasty and enough to fill you up. Try and get a window seat. You will get extra space there is a about a 30cm gap between the edge of the seat and the window where there is a storage unit.
label: positive

text:
Flight Singapore to Barcelona Economy Class Long flight which we were prepared for, leg room was just marginal, as we are not tall people. Service was very good. Refreshments & meal very good.
Wouldnt like to travel any longer than this flight time.
label: positive

text: Best airlines Best service! We only fly Singapore Aurlines and highly recommend it! The staff is the best always helpful and attentive! On time and great routes.
label: positive

text:
When You need to Arrive in Mint Condition International flights from two hours up can be a drag if one is squeezed between coach/economy seats.
At times, it may be an unavailable asile and sometimes your luck will hinge on the next passenger, including the one in front.
Premium Econimy on SQ offers great relief and comfort in all areas.
And yes, the comfort, the greetings, the entertainment on board, the food and the welcoming hot towels add to the value for a price that won’t hurt so much.
label: positive

text:
I wish I could fly Singapore 🇸🇬 Airlines everywhere!!! What service!!!!! From the time we checked in until we disembarked in Singapore 🇸🇬 17 hours later, we were treated like royalty. Two meals were served during this flight ✈️. The first meal was fabulous. I had a seafood appetizer, a noodle 🍜 entree and chocolate 🍫. I had a lovely French Bordeaux with the second.
Our flight attendant,Valenie , was a doll. I asked her what I should see in Singapore. Later in the flight ✈️ she handed me a delightful little notebook with a few suggestions in it. It came in handy during the trip too.
I can’t wait to fly Singapore Airlines again!!
label: positive

text: Amazing Business Class experience It was simply a wonderful experience to fly in business class. Singapore Airlines is indeed on top. It was very impressive from the amazing crew, the meals they served and the seat itself. Wish I could fly business again with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: service in the air is very perfect first flew with singapore airlines and immediately fell in love. good aircraft and amazing cabin crew service. I got a special assistant because I flew myself carrying 1 baby aged 6 months and 1 child aged 4 years. it was amazing for me to feel service in the air that I had never received before. every time the cabin crew came to ask if everything was okay or maybe there was something I needed. they were really smart, friendly and beautiful so my son wanted to be like a cabin crew singapore airlines. ask for the same clothes and ask to be dressed like they even just want to ride singapore airlines. That's because when the plane was going to land in Singapore, my two children cried. while I was carrying a baby, there was a cabin crew coming to calm down my daughter with earplugs. then came the cabin of another crew carrying candy and feeding my child. then came the cabin crew again carrying cookies. and finally there was another cabin crew carrying some pillows and putting them on my child's back. I can't remember all of their names but what is clear is that they are very extraordinary. thanks singapore girls for that amazing service😍😍😍😍
label: positive

text:
Best airline Service is exceptional, above and beyond. We even received a cute honeymoon cake with all staff congratulating us. 
Meals are always nice, we always pre order, plus plenty of wine.
label: positive

text: Excellent service, nice staff and good quality of facilities Excellent service, nice staff and good quality of facilities.  the seat has reasonable space and the multimedia entertainments. The flight attendants are friendly, helpful and professional.  Also, the uniforms are excellent!!
label: positive

text: Comfortable Flight I would thoroughly recommend Singapore Airlines. We flew in the forward cabin. I like the way sections were divided. It was quiet and roomy. The service was fantastic right down to the toilets being freshe d very regularly. Much better than other airlines we have used to fly to Singapore.
label: positive

text: Best of the Best We've always flown with SQ. Without a doubt, the best out there. Proud to be Singaporean! The brand clearly represents its quality of service along with its flights attendants who are very professional.
label: positive

text:
Do not waste your money with SQ flights. Use other airlines! I usually fly SQ so that I can collect miles. I’m a PPS but since a while it’s impossible to redeem any ticket with your points. Not a chance. 
So what’s the point to spend more money with SQ when Qatar airway and Emirates are cheaper and have excellent services? 
Before the reason was the award tickets now it’s difficult to find a reason. Worst flyer program and most expensive for no benefit. Not worthy!
label: negative

text: Superb Thank you Maxine, Cindy, Fahrin, Rachel, Darren and Kim for making this long flight such a pleasant experience.
label: positive

text:
impeccable service SingaporeAir gives you impeccable service with excellent meals and faultless service. Recommended One of our best long distance flights. Could . Nothing to complain about,
I've been flying premium economy between Singapore to Beijing (5-6 hours) quite a few times, and I am very pleased with the comfort level . The seats are much wider, more legroom, noise-cancelling headset and bottle of water provided immediately on the flight. from the economy cabin,
label: positive

text: In flight service was great, food was pretty good, leg room a little tight for tall husband. The A380 was quiet but the economy seats left my husband a little cramped. The in flight service was efficient, I am gluten free and dairy free and I was provided with plenty of food. Coming home from Singapore to Sydney we upgraded to premium economy, it was fabulous. Much bigger leather seats, lots of leg room, I could move around easily to ease an injured leg and the seats recline a little further than economy. If you can afford the upgrade, do it.
label: positive

text: We had a great experience on Singapore Airlines in Coach This was our first time flying on Singapore Airlines.  I can understand why they are consistently called the best airline in the world.  We traveled in coach.  The seat was comfortable and had enough legroom and I am tall.  The food served in coach was quite good.  You can actually choose your entree a day or two before your flight.  Everything was a good experience.  We would definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Simply the best. If I have a problem with Singapore Airlines its that it has made it harder to retain your Gold Membership by reducing the points I travel by fifty percent. I was close to retaining my membership so I e-mailed Krisflyer but they never returned me message, so bad luck, what a shame.
label: positive

text: First experience with Singapore Airlines This was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines. I usually fly premium economy on my regular visits to New Zealand but on this occasion I chose to fly economy. I was happy with my aisle seats and there was enough leg room (although being only 5ft tall that's never really an issue). The food was average in my opinion. In-flight entertainment was good with plenty of choices of films, radio and TV shows. The cabin crew were very attentive and extremely well turned out - the ladies looked so elegant and the men looked very distinguished (other airlines should take their example). My other disappointment was that the booking class I flew didn't qualify for any airpoints under the Star Alliance scheme so sadly I didn't earn any from the thousands of miles I flew to and from  NZ.
label: positive

text:
Disappointing Service, Food and Ambience The service was bad. One forgot my orange juice, food came reallly slow (and it was also very chaotic), the air stewardess forgot to serve the man on my left until later, ran out of food choices (told my sister they had no more chicken left but then later appeared with more for the passengers in front..??), one of the air stewards was rather rude, the  food tasted bad (compared ti other airlines like Finnair or Swiss Air which is good!!) and the air stewardesses/stewards did not even ask the person in front to put their seats upright so that I can actually eat (until I ask them). 

The flight from Singapore to Beijing was also bad. Encountered the same bad service as stated above. So both flights there and back were unpleasant. My family felt the same way. 

Just saying that I don't think I will ever pay a premium price just to sit SQ airline ever again. Very disappointed in the service because SQ used to be so good but now I feel like the standard has dropped significantly. I would say that it no longer belongs to the top few airlines in the world.
label: negative

text: Bad Food Boarding was on time and the flight was pretty full. Good movies and seat comfort was okay but the food was terrible, tasteless breakfast with no salt or pepper to season anything. Yuck.
label: neutral

text: Excellent experience on a long flight This was a very pleasant experience.  The long flight was timely.  The aircraft was very comfortable - a nearly new Airbus A350, with adequate space in economy class and good quality seating.  Hospitality of this airline (SQ) is legendary and this flight certainly lived up to the reputed standard.  Entertainment offered a very wide range of choice.  I have a return visit to IAH next year and SQ would be my airline of choice.
label: positive

text: Blessed with the best service! As I also work for a airline when reviewing other airlines I look for everything I would expect from my own service. This was the first time I flew with Singapore Airlines and Ill tell you now it wont be the last. From the moment we stepped on the aircraft we were greeted and made to feel welcome. My son who is 9 was asked his name, given a special kids pack and was told he would be lucky enough to get his food given to him first and asked what he would like. We were given a hot towel and menus all before we took off. Before the service started my son received his meal and drinks and always greeted with his name which was a neat bonus that they always remembered. Everything was awesome, movie selection, pillow and blanket, food with a nice warm bread roll and customer service was great. The crew were well groomed and from hello to goodbye Singapore Airlines was just amazing. Well done! Great first experience and I definetly recommended.
label: positive

text: Reliable and comfortable Having flown SA before we were looking forward to it again. We flew on SA as part of a codeshare on a Swiss Airlines tickets. I thing that Singapore Airlines have the largest pods of any business class airline we’ve flown. Plenty of nooks and crannies to store your stuff and to stet h out. Food was great, staff attentive. Happy to fly SA at any time.
label: positive

text:
Predatory Itinerary Changes Singapore airlines changed our flight at the beginning of our honeymoon trip to the same itinerary exactly one day later, which caused our quarantine hotel reservation to be invalid. Our trip to Indonesia requires a strict quarantine procedure, and a multi-night stay in a non-refundable quarantine hotel. The new itinerary prevents us from being able to begin our stay at the quarantine hotel on the correct day, and invalidates our entire prepaid, non-refundable package.

I have now been on the phone a total of 4 hours and 45 minutes trying to resolve this situation, the first 3 hours of which I was on hold, and the representative has given me two options. I can either get a refund and rebook a much more expensive flight, or pay an additional $400 dollars per person to be moved to our original flight (the same original itinerary). 

A more appropriate and fair resolution would have been to waive the additional fee and restore our original itinerary, which is still available.

This is clearly a predatory business practice designed to extract more money out of customers who fly economy, and is extremely dishonest. I would recommend not booking Singapore Airlines for any future travel.

Zero stars.
label: negative

text:
Wouldn't fly again SQ36 Let me begin by saying I'm a frequent Star Alliance traveler and that one of the best airlines in my opinion is Singapore Airlines.

Flight SQ36 in one of the longest flights to take.  The plane doesn't feature Economy Class, but Premium Economy.

This particular day, as always according to flight attendant, the plane was fully booked so the feeling of being in Premium Economy  dissapeared as soon as entering the plane. It was like flying in a normal Economy Class.

Odors in the cabin were disgusting at sometimes even the flight attendants tried to keep everything in good shape.  One of the toilets wasn't working so restrooms were pretty crowded too. 

Food was good, entertainment onboard was boring, and seats uncomfortable.  As it is Premium Economy armrests are fixed giving you no room to move, even the next seat is available.

The full cabin gives the sensation of a normal economy class.  Check well price before buying, it may be better to fly via Tokyo or Seoul, at least you will be sure that cabin will be fresh for the second leg of your trip, plus changing planes allow you to walk and stretch.
label: positive

text: Safe and pleasant flight If you have to fly and don't like flying then Singapore Airlines is safe and pleasant.  The food was delicious and there were heaps of good movies to watch to while away the time.  Flight attendants were friendly and helpful and provided water or juice on a regular basis.
label: positive

text:
Best flight in the last three years Online Check in, baggage drop, check in at Airport , boarding very easy and in time. 
Very friendly cabin staff. Meals very o.k. not very tasty. water and other softdrinks were constantly served during nighttime. On board entertainment was very good. 
Seats very comfortable. Cabin was clean.
label: positive

text: Safe comfortable flight with friendly personal service My husband and I were tired and needed a good rest on this flight to Italy. The service team made us feel very welcome, did everything they could to ensure a comfortable ride. My husband had a good night’s sleep and despite my medical issues, I could rest well on this flight: at no time did I feel frustrated nor uncared for. Through it all, my personal Space was respected and I sensed that others who needed peace and quiet to sleep through the entire flight, were well served too.
label: positive

text: Superb airline Excellent customer service from boarding to exiting the aircraft. I hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines for some time, but they will be my first choice from now on. I chose to fly overnight, and was lucky enough to get three seats together to myself. I was able to lie down and slept most of the flight, waking up in time for breakfast. The food was nice enough, I never have high expectations so as not to be disappointed. I recommend joing the rewards program Krissflyer for SIA if you intend flying frequently.
label: positive

text:
Another excellent experience Flew business class as the return leg of our Russia - Europe holiday.  As usual, service was friendly and impeccable.  Most meals had been pre-ordered via Book the Cook and generally very tasty although the standard offerings also looked wonderful.  We choose Book the Cook as my wife has dietary requirements which are harder to meet with the standard offerings and are not given as a meal choice despite the very wide range of meal types offered by Singapore.  On previous flights her diet has been catered to after making specific requests to Singapore Airlines via e-mail but this was not necessary using Book the Cook.
We booked our seats very early and so were able to select bulkhead seats in the second (rear) cabin which have the full width foot recess.
Surprisingly on this flight I didn't find any of the large selection of movies that particularly appealed (I had already seen all those that did), but this is obviously a personal thing.
label: positive

text: First choice We often fly between Adelaide and Bangkok and always prefer Singapore Airlines. Have flown with Qantas, Emirates, Malaysia and Jetstar and have always been disappointed in comparison. Singapore have the most direct Adelaide via Singapore to Bangkok and return flights with only one hour stop overs. Singapore provide very good food and drinks and the best service. Basically everything by Singapore is better than the other airlines we've flown with. We only recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text:
SQ is THE BEST!! This airline is the best in the World!  Clean planes, good food, and outstanding service.

The biggest problem with Singapore Airlines is they spoil you!  You will never be satisfied on any other airline again.
label: positive

text: Good service & comfortable Great flight: new plane, quiet, smooth flying even through light tuberulance: best PE seats, recline the seat goes down & back - hardly disturbs person behind, has all modern ports for iPad etc, provided noise reducing headsets which were great, kept well hydrated, food pleasant to eat.
label: positive

text: Disappointed with Singapore air In economy, Planes were old, seat belts would not release unless jerked. Service mediocre, forget to offer drinks when special meal ordered. Inflight meal not appetising. Successfully bid for premium economy upgrade on Singapore to Sydney sector. Seats more comfortable as wider, recline more and had thigh support. Premium economy seats above wheels so noisy on take off and landing. Headphones provide so could use to block noise. Screens larger. Meals again mediocre.
label: neutral

text: Disappointing service I wanted to reschedule my return from Singapore to Delhi. But the website did not give clear instructions. I was forced to cancel. I got zero refund.  They will lose a loyal customer.
label: negative

text: Has to be one of the best airlines out there Pre-covid, my family and I used to travel back and forth from Perth to Johannesburg on a direct flight operated by South African Airways with a duration of around 11 hrs. Since a lot of flight paths are no longer being serviced one of the few options of travelling this route is to fly from Perth to Singapore (flight duration ~ 5 hrs), enjoy a 3 hour layover in the stunning Changi airport, and then fly from Singapore to Johannesburg (flight duration ~ 11 hrs). We travelled this route for the first time in Feb 2022 and I can honestly say it was such an enjoyable experience flying on Singapore Airlines. I have travelled on South African Airways, Air New Zealand, Air Asia, Qantas (as well as a few domestic only operated airlines) and none of them compare to the service offered on Singapore Airlines. Staff (from check-in to in-flight) are SO lovely and are happy to cater to your every need. Food is 10/10, especially since we pre-book Muslim meals and are usually quite underwhelmed on other airlines but Singapore Airlines meals was SOOOOO GOOD!  In-flight entertainment was also a plus and seats were comfortable and reclined quite a bit (yes even in economy!). Although the trip is longer without a direct flight, I am more than happy to book Singapore Airlines again and again. Overall, experience was 11/10. THANK YOU SINGAPORE AIRLINES FOR YOUR AMAZING SERVICE AND HOSPITALITY!
label: positive

text:
Jakarta to Singapore Flight The flight was late arriving but in the end departed pretty close to the due time. Only a 1 hour 50 flight so not a major but did have a connection to make.

Asked on board re what gate and terminal we were arriving at as needed to get to T3 for next flight and was told you will have to wait and see not sure. Plane may not go without you one never knows. Thought this was not the best of answers really. I might also point out I am an Elite flyer with Star Alliance airlines and this made no difference at all. If fact they never even made mention of it. 
Flight was average but okay and again on landing asked if we could get off quickly and was told no you wait as we don't do that and sorry if you miss your flight.  The fact then many people pushed past me and a person travelling with me I felt was pretty poor from the airline.
Overall i have to say no what I would expect from this airline.
We did also have a medical situation on the flight and I have to say the crew all looked very panicked and not really fully in control of things thankfully it was not to much of a major.
label: neutral

text:
Flight befitting Kings & Queens We haven't flown Singapore Airlines for a few years & following our recent flight, we have really missed them.  We recognise the quality of service they offer.
Staff service was fantastic.  Really friendly & attentive.
In flight entertainment was amazing, especially compared to other airline that fly out of Australia.
Food was great.  Very tasty & fresh.
Plenty of legroom in economy.
Can't wait to fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Amazing flight! It was my first visit on this airline and I just love it! Comfy seats, good collection of movies, good food on board, special care for the kids, nice and well behaved Stewardess, on time departure and landing, everything is good.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines I fly to Singapore every year and also use their associated airline SilkAir for any onward flights needed. I always book directly with the airline and early booking produces very good prices. The aircraft are always well presented both in cleanliness, facilities and aircrew. In my view there is no better airline to take if you want a direct flight to Singapore. I always feel I have had  the best possible experience that any airline can give on long haul
label: positive

text: Indeed a Great Way to Fly We flew by SQ because we wanted on time departure and arrival to our destination compared to budget airlines which most of time delay due to no reasons. We unable to afford the delays as we are only going to be in Bangkok for 6 days. As usual, SQ service is always good. Cabin is clean. Flight was smooth. Indeed a Great Way to Fly.
label: positive

text: Good flight and friendly staff Our 12 hours flight went smoothly, comfortable seats and hostesses were nice and friendly. We got two meals (bigger would have been better) and in between people were grabbing snacks from the kitchen by themselves, so there were none left quite soon.
label: positive

text: Flight, food, service were all good but inflight entertainment wasn't Overall experience was not bad.  Flight was on time and arrived early in Singapore. Service was good although I didn't manage to get my dish selection because it was too popular. The only annoying thing for me was the inflight entertainment. The movies that I watched were lagging so badly that I restarted them a few times but was still bad. The air stewardess told me that it was because the aircraft was a little old.
label: positive

text: Honeymoon A great flight!! Staff were amazing and even arranged a cake and champagne for us to help celebrate our honeymoon!!
label: positive

text:
Best way to get to india from southeast asia When checking in at terminal 3 in Singapore First class or suites has a separate check in entrance which has its own dedicated immigration clearance. 

When your flying suites or first you get access to a lounge exclusively for first class passengers and not priority card holders. 

This area is called the private room. Great sit down dining experience followed by the most relaxing sofas and chairs with a clear view of the aircrafts parked at the gates below. 

Once on board the aircraft you have the most spacious suites in the market on the worlds largest aircraft the A380. 

From the best wine and champagnes to fresh caviar served on board they really take care if their first class passengers. 

For a vegetarian that doesn’t drink I usually just drink water throughout the flight. The service staff really aims to please. 

Truly the best way to fly to india from anywhere in Southeast Asia.
label: positive

text:
1st flight on SQ's new A350-900 Pros-

1) Very new product and finishes didn't look cheap

2) Middle rows had their overhead luggage storage removed so the whole cabin looked alot more spacious

3) There was ample space to get from the aisle to the seat unlike my previous flight on the 787 Dreamliner (there was a bit of a squeeze because of the way the hard shells of the seats are designed). 

4) Great service as always

5) Free 30mb of data for business class passengers

Cons -

1) List of movies seem to have decreased in the Krisworld entertainment system.
label: positive

text: All in all , it’s ok Safe, on schedule, very helpful , helped me with wheelchair as I have a bad knee & unable to walk the full distance of both the airports
label: positive

text:
Amazing service and great seat I just flight from Munich to Singapore in business class on the New cabin 
The service as expected was just amazing. The air hostesses attitude was excellent at all time .
The seat can be transformed into a flat. bed with quite good space . Since I was seating on a window seat the privacy was total as it’s like small individual cabin .
I will use Singapore airlines in near future for sure . TV selection and movies is great although just few languages are available.
label: positive

text:
Still the best Still the best. Lots of room, good food, top service. Not sure what plane it was but the entertainment is much easier to operate than in the past. Will never go back to budget airlines.
I do however wish airlines would issue face masks to all passengers. The lady next door to me coughed almost all the way & was spreading her germs all over the place.
label: positive

text:
Great airline. Good pricing for a full service airline. Great service, great plane, great pricing.
We chose Singapore as we got excellent pricing for our flights from Brisbane to Istanbul with return flights booked from Amsterdam back to Brisbane.
We weren't sure what to expect as when we started our travels, Covid 19 was just emerging.
Check in was easy, very friendly service. I was particularly looking forward to experiencing the new A350's Singapore are servicing Brisbane with.
I wasn't disappointed, what an excellent airplane.
Due to Covid, the plane was very empty so we were able to have 2 rows of 3 seats to ourselves. We were able to spread out and have a great sleep on this leg.
The staff on board are excellent and friendly. The seating was good, good room for a 175cm cm male.
Food was excellent.
The flight was smooth, no issues.
label: positive

text:
Long, long, but okay Return flights from Brisbane to Singapore/Singapore to London were as expected in economy. I always book aisle seats as I am tall and have long legs. The two shorter trips (BNE-SIN and back) were uncomfortable because of the legroom, but the longer legs (ha!) were better. Food acceptable, staff attentive and helpful.
I moved seats at one stage as the next door passenger was 'manspreading' and I couldn't even plug in the headset. When I moved I reclined the seat and was treated to a spray by the woman behind me. No, she wasn't eating, it was dark and the lights were dimmed!
label: neutral

text: Going on holiday As usual Singapore Airlines service was flawless, from check-in to baggage claim. We had great seats in the exit row. My least favourite thing was the food. It could definitely be better.
label: positive

text:
Good But Not Great My partner and I are just back from a trip to Koh Samui, Thailand. We had flights from Perth to Singapore then Singapore to Samui and returned the same way... all booked through Singapore Airlines. However, the Singapore-Samui-Singapore legs were on Silk Air, a subsidiary of Singapore Airlines.

Our experience with Singapore Airlines was very good. Booking tickets excellent. At the airport was excellent... luggage sent from departure to arrival points no problem... and aircraft crew were awesome as usual. 

The reason we give 4/5 and not 5/5 is this... we flew Perth-Singapore-Perth legs on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner and this was our first time on these aircraft... and quite frankly these aircraft are nothing special.... in fact having no control over airflow from above your own head is poor... from Perth to Singapore the air conditioning was cold... but having a blanket was good.... But!! on the Singapore to Perth leg the cabin was stuffy and extremely warm which made us uncomfortable and my partner became unwell, having to ask for cold towels to cool down.

Also, between Perth and Singapore on Singapore Airlines there are no options for Premium Economy which is disappointing.

I really like Singapore Airlines but based on this I would definitely consider other airlines now.
label: positive

text:
SIN SFO SIN during pandemic Had to fly to SFO during covid.

I changed my tickets three times, SIA was very accommodating, though charge some fees.

Changi airport: almost empty, quick check in, star alliance gold lounged closed, given access to Silverkris lounge. No buffet, make to order food served at table. Excellent service.

SFO-SIN: flight was delayed my 70min, was notified personally. We were about 20 people on board. Served 2 hot meals with all drink choices available. Snacks rounds were not done for covid safety, but snacks n drinks were kept at service area for self service.
Toilet was very very clean, and was cleaned after every single use.

SFO-SIN: empty airport, lounge closed, so given 25 USD/person to buy food drink at a Japanese restaurant near boarding gate. Only 6 passengers in the whole aircraft. Again served 2 hot meals and plenty of snacks offered. Before landing, crew in charge, mr Victor Lim offered a bag full of snacks water to take to our quarantine hotel.

SIA is very reliable and provides BEST service even during the tough pandemic period.
Well done SIA
label: positive

text:
Should have been an A380 ! We do love to fly with Singapore Airlines and have never had an issue at any level - always very professional all the way and Changi  is our favourite big airport.  
We booked the tickets for a trip from Melbourne to Koh Samui about 7 months in advance as a party of 6, flying Mel - Sin, and then Silk Air from Sin- USM.The first leg was on an A380 and seats were booked so were all together. About 6 weeks out we were informed that the aircraft was now a 777 and seats were allocated randomly to say the least. I know that it is the perjorative of the Airline to make changes without notice but it was pretty annoying given there was no apology or explanation.  Anyways, it was still a good flight- but still  a little like booking a Merc and being given a Skoda or even worst - Parma Regret. Would it stop us flying SA again ? Absolutely not !
label: positive

text:
Decreasing Experience Have flown Singapore every year for more than 25 years to visit my folks in Oz and to travel onward to our chosen holiday destinations. Over the past few years we have noticed a slow, but sure reduction in the quality of the overall experience. 

For the main part, I guess attempts to cut costs and increase shareholder value are at the root of the problems, with every aspect of the customer experience being trimmed back to maximise profits. Quality of In-flight refreshments and meals are probably the most noticeable, with less food and drink being made available during long haul flights. 

Meals now consist of a small fruit starter, a main course and a bread roll. A desert generally consists of a small tub of ice cream (circa 100g), with no other option if you don't like ice cream. On our long-haul segment, there were 3 main course items listed on the menu, with only 2 available; when we enquired, the third item was not exhausted, it was just not available on the flight.

Additions such as salt and pepper, dressings, cheese and crackers are now non existent. The portions and quality of the main courses are also smaller and lesser, respectively. 

The trolley bar service has also been slashed. Where once you would as for a red or white wine you would be given a small plastic bottle from a selection laid out in the menu, now you receive a half of a plastic glass of either red or white, of no particular sweetness or dryness. It is also clear that the cabin staff are doing all they can to reduce opportunities for you to request a second round, or top up. Probably the hardest thing to swallow (non pun etc.) is the fact that if you wish to have a tea or coffee after your meal, then it appears that you are actually asking for additional drinks (the cabin crew now ask if you want tea or coffee at the start of the meal when they are doing the bar service). The whole bar experience makes leaves you feeling "economised" and plays on your conscience when asking for anything outside of the norm.

There are many other areas that have been impacted that could be mentioned, but they are far more subtle. Key amongst them though are a reduction in the level of staffing on long haul flights, which has a knock on effect on the attention and service levels being given by the cabin staff. The Singapore Girl of yesteryear is no longer to be seen, instead replaced with a hurried young man/woman who is primarily focused on getting service completed ASAP.

Whilst my review may be considered a little subjective, I would point out one thing; year on year Singapore Airlines have raised there fares for my standard LHR-PER-LHR trip. This time around we paid GBP 1799 each for economy seats. This is no small amount of money, it is not a "low-cost" option nor is it a cheap fare for a non top-tier airline. It is a significant amount of money to invest to observe ever diminishing standards. 

It's such a shame to see SIA going this way and it will be a hard lesson learned for the organisation. The levels of service available from other airlines (such as Emirates & Cathay) are ever increasing, representing much improved value for money and an excellent customer experience. Going forward I will certainly be giving other options a go prior to remaining blindly loyal on the basis of past glories.
label: neutral

text: My faourite way to get to Singapore and beyond Once again I had safe, clean, comfortable and happy flights to and from Singapore with my favourite International airline.  There are many other carriers in my part of the world, but I almost always choose Singapore Airlines. Qantas is my only second choice. Flying with Singapore Airlines is a great experience and is a relaxing way to start and finish a trip away from home.
label: positive

text:
Loved every minute ! From checking experience  to disembarking, everything was what i hopeed for.

Upon entering the plane the friendly stafff greeted our kids by name and got them toys straight away.

Got treated like royalty. 

Makes it hard to fly with someone else. !

Enjoy your travels, highly reccomend.
label: positive

text:
Excellent, comfortable fight with great onboard staff experience flight itself was great with captain regularly giving us updates which was cool.
all personal requests attended to promptly and efficiently by staff
staff made effort to speak to passengers throughout and saw to their comfort
personally, I had a good rapport with staff who also gave me very good advice about where to visit in Singapore and great food places - tried some of them and was excellent.
great advertising for Singapore and a job well done by the airline crew
label: positive

text: Great flight  Recently flew Brisbane to Hanoi - Ho Chi Minh to Brisbane on Singapore airlines. The flight, service, food etc were all very good but on the way over my checked luggage was smashed in. I purchased a new suitcase for the return trip and it was smashed in also. Not at all happy with the baggage handling. They weren’t weak cheap cases either.
label: neutral

text: Good flight The range of inflight entertainment was very good but the hardware (channel control and screen) could be better. My seafood meal was not tasty: fish was not fresh. I liked the sockets for charging mobile phone. Also like the magazines that could be downloaded onto my SQ app prior to flight. Staff were friendly and attentive. Leg room was adequate. Ventilation was reasonable. Toilet was clean too and amenities were available.
label: positive

text:
Good flight Good flight. The seats were comfortable and we had enough leg room.  It is just annoying when the people in front put there seats back and then watch the entertainment, it seems a case of" I can so I will".
The food was good except the breakfast but overall good choice.
We would use Singapore airlines again, the cabin crew were very nice and efficient and the flight overall wasn't too bad for such a long time.
label: positive

text: Outdated Entertainment Screen The entertainment tv screen on Boeing flight SQ630 was truly dated & awful. No touch screen, outdated operations, limited movie choices  etc etc. I’m surprised SIA has not upgraded this item. This must not allow to happen especially on a SIA flight. If possible do not opt to take this flight/plane.
label: negative

text:
Excellent food and service The staff onboard are brilliant. The food served is very good too and when it is ordered in advance you are served first. The aircraft is very clean.
The check-in was smooth without any queuing. Our baggage allowance was enormous so we were able to pack the kitchen sink!!!
label: positive

text: Insane waiting time and response for call services on Singapore air lines Recently I wanted to make a redemption booking for whole family, but their online services dont support that well yet. In Singapore and call them and went through all, said charging 15USD extra per passanger and will call you back tomorrow, wasted 2.5 hours on call with no result. Tried to feedback and get a call back numerous times, but no success yet. Auto reply says, come back in 15 business days, 3 weeks, crazy huh!!!! Their service like this is never expected.
label: neutral

text:
From five star to zero Having been a loyal customer for 20 years and a loyal business traveller for 10, I have always found the airport and flight experience to be good.
Between 2000 and 2005, I had to make use of the London and Singapore ticket offices, which I can only describe as being hopeless at best.
During a check-in in 2005 in NZ, I was asked by the check-in supervisor what my opinion was of the airline, so I indicated the excellent airport & flight experience and said it was completely let down by the ticket offices. The supervisor gave me a business card and asked me to email direct going forward.
So from 2005 to the end of March 2020, all was well.
In March 2020, all the staff were let go, which meant a return to using London & Singapore. This is an even bigger disaster than it was back in 2000-2005.
Despite having cancelled $20,000 worth of tickets, they have been completely unhelpful. They won't re-book anything without additional $3000+ per ticket (even though this is illegal in some of my countries of origin).
Just goes to show loyalty doesn't mean anything in Singapore Airlines land...
label: negative

text:
Frustrating flight It was on the A 380. It was abnormally dirty when we board the plane was smelly and looks not arranged. Magazines in the seat pocket was old and torn off , plane was very hot and we keep asking for temperature control and they said ok because we just came out of the hanger .
Food was terrible no taste and no much choice . In between there was no enough things to entertain the passengers in 10 hours flight so poor . Stewards are angry and slow in response
label: negative

text: Superb crew Sin/Maa flight on 16Sep operated by Excellent crew. All crew members were excellent and friendly and helpful. Suggest to passengers please board and put you bag in the over head compartment fast so as not to delay other passengers
label: positive

text: A fantastic airline in many ways. Was flying SIA for the first time after flying Qatar Airways for more than 12 years.  The service, the food and beverages and choice of connectibg flights was just top notch.  Better than Qatar Atrways in all areas where I was a regular business traveller.
label: positive

text: Excellent - best airline in the world Excellent service, especially when travelling with (young) children. Good menu choices, extra leg room on premium economy and recline in seats, on top of an extendable leg rest. Great in-flight entertainment and very helpful cabin crew.  Would love to try business class next!
label: positive

text: Cool experience  On Summer holiday, I went on a trip form Hong Kong to Singapore on an A220 , the seats are not that great but the staff is extremely friendly and helpful also the in-flight entertainment has a lot of choices, overall the flight itself is pretty good and I would definitely recommend it.
label: positive

text: Smooth flight! Long flight at 2355 hrs! One can sleep most of the journey! Nearly 13 hours! Good meals are served on flight! Flight staffs are v friendly and nice! I enjoyed both the dinner & breakfast on board! SQ always serves the best meals! Good entertaining on board too! You can watch a few newly released movies too! I had a pleasant journey!
label: positive

text: Great trip Great trip, full plane but the service was excellent and the crew very friendly. The food was good as well.
label: positive

text: Wonderful crews and good service It is always comfortable to fly with Singapore Airline. Everything is predictable with the service and food.
label: positive

text:
It gets old... I have been taking Singapore Airlines every time I go to India, over the years I have noticed the degradation of service... It used to be outstanding to the point that you’ll run out of good things to say but based on my recent flight, the magic is gone. Maybe because they get used to the praises that they became complacent. Or maybe, change of management?

The flight crews became transactional, the fleets from MNL to SIN and SIN to MAA need updating, the seats and entertainment system needs to be cleaned and sanitized.

I am hoping that this airline revives its glory.

For now, I am neutral if I will continue taking this flight or shift airline.
label: neutral

text: One has to be better than all the rest Singapore Airlines knows how to put it together from "Book the Cook" to great onboard service and a very clean and comfortable plane. The cabin crew are great and you feel the flight crew are always in control. The AV is great with up to date movies etc. Check in is always a breeze with decent baggage allowances,
label: positive

text: Where were friendliness and smiles on board? It was the worst on board experience I have had with Singapore Airlines for the past several years I flew this route.  I missed the smiles and friendliness I enjoyed on board the previous flights.
label: negative

text: I try to avoid any other airline Excellent service, the cabin crew are always very attentive and courteous, I would not use another airline by choice for this long haul flight.
label: positive

text: No refunding of accommodation due to missing of the connection flight In the beginning of January 2018 I flew from Jacksonville to Frankfurt via JFK airport in N.Y. The first flight operated by a partner airline had a 7 hours delay, so that I missed the connection flight from N.Y. to Frankfurt. As landed in JFK airport no representative of Singapore Airlines (SA) was available at the airport. Next flight was 24 hours later. Alone I had to organize my overnight stay in New York in a hotel. After submitting all documents to SA immediately after my return to Germany, it took for SA 7 months to decide on this case. Finally, they rejected my request to refund accommodation costs in N.Y. city arguing that the delay of the first flight was due to bad weather conditions. This is a very poor performance of Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Excellent service Singapore Airlines offers excellent service, reasonably good food and a good range of entertainment options. Cabin staff are friendly and helpful but I have major issues with their website which is hard to navigate and not always up to date. I usually end up phoning them and have more success that way.
label: positive

text: knowing you are in good hand is the most important SQ now is not like SQ when I was young but at least food and courtesy is still well maintained. Cabin looks tired as well as the seat, some toilets struggle to show its shine. Overall, safety and punctuality is the most important especially for business traveler
label: positive

text: Not as expected  I was looking forward to flying with Singapore airlines. Boarding was ok and the plane was older but clean. The seats were good but expected a bit more padding on the seats given the price. Legroom however was good. I had a special meal which was served an hour before everyone else which was ok. The flight itself was quite turbulent. Some of the flight attendants were polite but others were not. They did offer frequent drinks and kept us hydrated. Why do they insist the window blinds be kept down nearly the whole flight its beyond me. Arrived on time. The experience was good but did expect more from them given they were the best voted airline. Hoping my return journey will be better
label: neutral

text:
Excellent flight As always this was an excellent flight without any issues. Service was excellent with friendly staff. Very comfy flight with good movie selections.
Will fly again.
label: positive

text: There is a reson this airline is the best In these frantic days this flight was a beacon of calm and tranquility. Singapore Airlines service, both on the ground and in the air, exceeded expectations. Simply , it was great.
label: positive

text: Amazing flight It was the best flight ever!!! The air hostesses were very sweet smiley and beautiful! The food was excellent!!!!
label: positive

text: Usual high standard Second time I’ve flown with Singapore airlines and is always my preferred airline when travelling to Australia. Meals served were edible,  plenty of refreshments available and as always attentive staff. Can not fault Singapore’s airlines, wish I could afford to go business class 😃 the only comment I have is that when you have paid and selected your seat if you want to change then you have to pay again, so I would select your seat just prior to travelling.
label: positive

text: Holiday First time I've travelled with Singapore Airlines. From check in everything was to a very high standard. Flight attendants were very helpful and professional. Food excellent and plenty of choice. Came round throughout the long flight with drinks and snacks. Entertainment was excellent plenty of choice. Would recommend the airline. Would travel with them again.
label: positive

text:
Best Airline Recently travelled from Australia to Sri Lanka with a stop over in Singapore. Could not fault the airline service. Staff were friendly. Food was great. Nice to be greeted with a warm face cloth upon boarding. Toilets were always kept clean. Seats are comfortable and great selection of movies. 
Only thing I would say is that I thought the airline would provide antibacterial wipes etc or hand sanitiser due to recent outbreak and this was not supplied.
label: positive

text:
Very bad, disappointed Respected Faculty, I am Bincy, writing this  to file a complaint regarding a cancellation of the connection flight of Singapore airlines and the irresponsible service from Singapore airlines airport staff members at Singapore .My parents 67 yr old Dad as 63 yr old Mom travelled from Brisbane airport in Singapore airlines  SQ236 yesterday at 14.45 hrs and arrived at Singapore airport at 20.25hrs yesterday late evening. Then only they were informed that the connection flight SQ 536 which was booked and  confirmed, has got cancelled and they have to wait until next day night. This was not informed to us in any form of communication. 
And secondly, though my parents are very older with so many health issues, (my parents are Diabetic also, taking insulin and my parents have high blood pressure, taking medications)but they had to wait in airport in a chair without any support for 24 hours without any food especially when they are from a non English speaking background. The mental stress and physical discomforts for 24 hours they were gone through are unimaginable and we cannot express it to the full extent. They didn't get any emotional or physical support from staffs at Singapore airport.They didn't arrange any room to rest or any proper lounge and not even any food for 24 hours (my parents were not prepared to stay at airport for more than 4 hours as  we booked the tickets with least transit time at Singapore airport)
We had a trust in the services of Singapore airlines, and so we booked the flight for our parents with much confidence. 
We booked the tickets through an agency Sanjo travels in India but we got the confirmation that Singapore airlines didn't inform the agency as well. So it's completely the mistake from Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: It felt like 1st class even in economy Plenty of leg room. Very attentive staff. The food was the best airline food i have ever tasted. I am Vegetarian and the food was tasty and spicy and imaginative. More movies to choose from and plenty of drinks both alcholic and  and non alcholic .
label: positive

text: Excellent airline and lovely staff A lovely airline,the staff made our long journey more tolerable,always pleasant and with a smile. Would always recommend them.food was good and the Singapore slings went down a treat.
label: positive
